10455.description: Patient Care Volunteer: provide compassionate companionship and emotional support for Hospice patients and their families. Music Therapy Volunteer: Use your voice or musical talent to heal and comfort. Pet Therapy Volunteer: Your team of you and your dog will make \"therapy\" visits with our Hospice patients. Art Therapy Volunteer: Use your drawing, painting, sculpting, graphic arts skills to engage Hospice patients or provide legacies for family members. Alternative Therapy Volunteer: Use your special passion and skill to support Hospice patients and their families: Massage Therapy Accupuncture Reiki / Energy Therapy Yoga / Meditation Aroma & Sound Therapy Office / Administrative Volunteer: assist in the day-to-day administrative tasks of a manged care Hospice operation Bereavement Volunteer: assist surviving family with loss and grief issues. End of Life Support for Veterans: \"Veteran-centric\" end-of-life support. CCH is a Level Three participant in the Hospice-Veterans Partnership and We Honor Veterans Program. Comprehensive training and supervision provided for all Volunteer positions.
10455.title: Find your compassionate calling-we all have it; we just need to develop it more!

10455.description: BronxConnect is an Alternative-to-Incarceration Program for juveniles between 11 t to 18 years of age. We are seeking Mentors that will work with our youth both 1 to 1 and in group settings. The youth ranges from all grades between Middle School and High School. Mentors will work onsite at 432 East 149th Street Bronx, Ny 1055 and help our youth build social, interpersonal skills and muchmore. Duties Include: Working individually with 1 to 3 youth at a time, Committing to a time and day to arrive for our Mentor sessions (at least 2 hours a week) that add up to one year long commitment of mentorship, Document daily intreventions, Maintain record of attandance.
10455.title: Mentors wanted!

10454.description: Volunteer with Behind the Book (www.behindthebook.org), a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to love reading. Through our innovative programs, accomplished authors lead workshops in high-needs classrooms, where they guide students in creating their own writing and art projects based on the theme of the author's book. No experience or training is necessary to work with pre-K-12 students. As a writing, research or art coach, you'll engage and encourage their progress on a project. This workshop needs your support at an elementary school in Mott Haven: Program IC12MB-C Tuesday, March 14th, 2017 3 consecutive classes: 9:00 - 10:00 AM; 10:00 - 11:00 AM & 1:50 - 2:50 PM (Please choose one or more time slots) Writing Coach Three classes of 12th graders read Watched by Marina Budhos , a novel that examines what it means to grow up in the age of surveillance. The author will discuss the book’s themes and ideas, as well as her writing and revision process. With writing coaches’ support, students will revise and polish their first drafts of an essay inspired by the book. For details about other Behind the Book programs around the city, visit http://www.behindthebook.org/current-volunteer-opportunities/ To join our team and receive announcements of new volunteer opportunities, please complete our brief questionnaire at http://www.behindthebook.org/join-us/volunteer/
10454.title: Inspire Bronx public school students to love reading

10454.description: We have several projects in need of volunteers, each focusing on either, (1) online/ social media marketing, (2) donor outreach/ management, (3) partnership/ sponsorship building, or (4) public relations. Depending on your unique skill sets and project assignment, you may be responsible for: following up with community contacts in order to help build business-to-business relationships; creating captivating images or writing persuasive, fact-based articles for our quarterly newsletter; establshing a YouTube channel that strengthens our cyber presence. Bring your passion, talents and creativity to Every Day is a Miracle, and let's forward the fight against hunger together! Please send your resume to Maria Estrada, Executive Director at mestrada@edmnyc.org
10454.title: Communications Associate-give poverty a voice, a face, a story

10454.description: Through this position, volunteer(s) handle fundamental aspects of our financial record keeping processes, including but not limited to maintaining ledger entries, preparing financial statements, assisting with budget preparations/ reports, and assisting with 1099's and annual tax filings.
10454.title: Accounting/ Bookkeeping Volunteer needed

10454.description: On November 5th, 2015, Every Day is a Miracle will celebrate FILL THE PLATE--our annual gala to end hunger and eradicate poverty. Funds raised will benefit hunger-relief/ anti-poverty programs in the community. We are looking for volunteers to join our Event Committee and help us reach out to prospective sponsors, businesses, and donors for the gala. This is a great opportunity to gain real world experience with business relations, communications, marketing, fundraising, and event management. You must be able to exercise professionalism, be comfortable speaking with individuals in the corporate world, have a great phone presence, and be able to manage your time wisely when working on specific tasks. The hours are EXTREMELY flexible, however, we ask that you be reliable and commit to whatever schedule we agree upon. Join the team and let's start making a difference today!
10454.title: Development Intern—Help End Poverty

10454.description: Join New York Common Pantry's program Nourish in it's fight to end hunger in the senior community! Nourish is funded by New York State Department of Health for the Commodity Supplemental Food Program (CSFP). We have volunteer opportunities available Monday-Friday from 9:00am-5:00pm and Wednesday from 8:00am-5:00pm. We can accommodate your schedule. Volunteers will help to provide free supplemental grocery packages for low-income seniors by participating in the following activities: * Greeting guests and asking them to fill out the sign-in sheet, so we can make sure we are seeing people in the order that they came * Calling participants to remind them about when they can come in to pick up their package * Assembling grocery packages based on a set menu * Restocking food pantry * Administrative tasks * Volunteers must be able to lift at least 30 pounds Please help us continue to provide healthy groceries to low income seniors in the Bronx!
10454.title: Nourish Volunteer

10454.description: We are looking for bright, passionate professionals who are willing to volunteer their time and energy ending hunger and making a difference in the local multi cultural community. Individuals should be creative, open to new ideas, be a team player and have a strong work ethic. As this nonprofit is 100% volunteer based, everyone on the Steering Committee have busy day jobs but are still able to dedicate themselves to running this organization. Ideally, we want people who is experienced with grant writing and fundraising. The organization is undertaking an impressive campaign to expand its services, partnerships, and presence to have a larger impact on the community. This is a fantastic opportunity to gain a wealth of experience in multiple aspects of research, external relations and fundraising. Your position and role will be assisting with the following duties: Conduct research on existing and prospective prospects; Write and edit letters of inquiry, grant proposals and reports, program summaries, and other funding correspondence. Work with Donor Database Coordinator and Lead Researcher to find new grant opportunities and funders. Track institutional giving patterns and funding deadlines. Ensure donors are appropriately thanked and acknowledged This position provides a stipend and may lead to paid part-time or consultant position by end of the year Length of term: One year minimum commitment with weekly time commitment to be discussed. Qualifications: Bachelor of Arts Degree Outstanding writing and editing skills. Must demonstrate creativity and passion in their writing. Must have the ability to glean information from previous proposals to meet specific funder requirements. Ability to work quickly and produce a polished piece of work requiring little editing. Exceptional organizational and time management skills. Strong interpersonal skills.
10454.title: GRANT WRITER NEEDED

10454.description: The Latinas On the Verge of Excellence - L.O.V.E. Mentoring Program would like to invite university female students to serve as mentors in our 2016 L.O.V.E. Mentoring Programs. The L.O.V.E. Mentoring Program aims to enhance academic performance and high school graduation rates among young Latinas by providing them with the support of positive role models. Mentoring sessions concentrate on developing study skills, enabling college access, and facilitating self-empowerment activities. This year we will be offering the exciting opportunity to mentor a student from public high schools throughout New York. Mentors will meet with mentees on schools' campuses weekly. A semester commitment (February - June) is required of mentors who wish to participate in these school-based programs.
10454.title: L.O.V.E. Volunteer Mentor
10454.org: LATINAS ON THE VERGE OF EXCELLENCE LOVE INC

10454.description: About Mercy Center : Mercy Center is a \"haven\" in Mott Haven, a community center offering programs and services that empower women and their families to reach their full potential and become agents of change for healthy family living and economic independence. We promote an improved quality of life by addressing the needs of the whole person in a community of respect, hospitality, and non-violence. Who we're looking for : Proficient English speakers with good working knowledge of English grammar and language use. Experienced teachers with good interpersonal skills who enjoy working in diverse linguistic and cultural settings. Passionate teachers looking to empower immigrant communities through English language education. Applicants with teaching experience required. Responsibilities: Help second language learners improve their English conversation skills through communicative language teaching (CLT) approach. Implement and adapt lesson plans from a standards-based curriculum. Report to the Director of Adult Education and Workforce Development. Classes Offered : Tuesdays - Fridays: 9:00 am - 11:45 am Mondays - Thursdays: 6:30 pm - 9:00 pm Commitment : 2 days per week / 3 hours per day (day or evening) Day or evening classes available Benefits : In-house training, mentoring, networking, & other professional development opportunities provided. To Apply: Please send resume and cover letter to Director of Adult Education & Workforce Development, Judit Criado Fiuza: jcf@mercycenterbronx.org For More Info: Please visit our website www.mercycenterbronx.org Main Office: 377 E. 145th St. Bronx, NY 10454 2nd Site: 332 E. 149th St., 8th Flr. Bronx, NY 10451
10454.title: ESL Teacher (Volunteer)

10459.description: Due to the high demand of Spanish interpretations and translations for Tax assistance program we need a volunteer Spanish translator. This position is open for all Spanish speakers with a proven profiency in English as well as Spanish. We are looking for a HS or College student that has done accounting to help our tax preparers translate to our spanish clients. We also welcome professionals willing to volunteer their time anyway possible. If you can only provide two hours out of four on a Saturday, we will accept it. We prefer four but will accept your situation. We especially welcome a spouse of a person with a Green card or work permit that is looking for work to stay busy. Duties: Provide interpreting services for tax preparers Perform duties in a professional manner Qualifications: Must demonstrate fluency in English and Spanish languages Professional demeanor and appearance Must be punctual, responsible, and have a reliable means of transportation Must be 16 years of age or older
10459.title: Spanish Translator

10459.description: We are looking for an Event coordinator(s) to help organize and execute our organization's outdoor event on April 29th. We are open to two people sharing this role, if need be but would prefer one person. We would prefer a person certified in the planning industry but are open to an individual with unofficial experience planning events. We would especially welcome a spouse of a person with a Green card or work permit that is looking for work to stay busy as it is close to our mission as an organization. Duties and Responsibilities The following are the event planner’s job duties and responsibilities: Preparing the event Working with the event budget Developing the event theme Selecting the décor to be used at the event Arranging the event décor, tents, tables and chairs Making transportation arrangements Recruting vendors for the event Managing and supervising contractors, caterers and other staff Effectively arranging the décor Ensuring the event meets all health, safety and building standards Liaising with the client to ensure that the event is successful Skills and Specifications For an event planner to be able to perform his/her duties effectively, certain skills are required. The following are some of the important event planner skills and specifications: Works well under pressure Excellent communication skills, both written and oral Excellent management and organization skills Should be passionate about event planning A team player with excellent negotiation skills Deadline oriented with good attention to detail Ability to speak French and/or Spanish preferred Education and Qualifications A degree or working on a degree in event management is adequate for this position. Public relations, marketing and project management skills are also important. As said before, unofficial event planning experience (like an event for your church/mosque) will also be considered.
10459.title: Event Planner

10459.description: We are looking for a volunteer Bilingual Citizenship teacher that can dedicate 2 hours on Fridays from 2 to 4pm (Can be changed to 2:30-4:30 or 3-5) Our organization is located in the South Bronx and we serve a large community of immigrants. Many of our clients seek to prepare for their upcoming Citizenship exam and interview. Our class was created to assist those students with preparing them for the 100 questions for the citizenship exam and the oral interview portion of the test. Students also learn about American culture and history and enhance their abilities to read, write, and speak English. Qualifications required: Speaks English and Spanish fluently Has worked in a small or large group setting Has some knowledge of American history Is comfortable with creating and/or enhancing new or current curriculum Has some familiarlity or can quickly learn about the Citizenship process. This person must be reliable and follows the schedule agreed upon at the time of volunteering. Someone that has experience with preparing documents for the citizenship test would be a plus. We are looking for a volunteer that will be dependable and able to teach every Friday (excluding holidays) for each 6 week session (two in total): February 24th to March 31st, 2017 April 21st to May 26th, 2017 (Off for April 14th) We ofcourse are happy to have someone that will be willing to work longterm as a volunteer teacher but atleast expect 2 sessions covered each volunteer term. We provide groceries twice a month to the volunteer teacher as a thank you.
10459.title: Bilingual Citizenship Exam Prep Teacher
10459.org: The HopeLine Resource Center for Community Development

10459.description: We are looking a volunteer Citizenship teacher that can dedicate 2 hours on Fridays from 2 to 4pm Our organization is located in the South Bronx and we serve a large community of immigrants. Many of our clients seek to prepare for their upcoming Citizenship exam and interview. Our class was created to assist those students with preparing them for the 100 questions for the citizenship exam and the oral portion of the test. Students also learn about American culture and history and enhance their abilities to read, write, and speak English. We are looking for someone that has worked in a small group setting before. Preferrably speaks 2 or more languages, has the ability to create and/or follow a curriculum, prepare and grade student work. This person must be reliable and follows the schedule agreed upon at the time of volunteering. Someone that has experience with preparing documents for the citizenship test would be a plus. We are looking for a volunteer that will be dependable and able to teach every Friday (excluding holidays) for each 6 week session (two in total): February 24th to March 31st, 2017 April 21st to May 26th, 2017 (Off for April 14th) We ofcourse are happy to have someone that will be willing to work longterm as a volunteer teacher but atleast expect 2 sessions covered each term. We provide groceries twice a month to the volunteer teacher as a thank you.
10459.title: Bilingual Civics Teacher
10459.org: The HopeLine Resource Center for Community Development

10459.description: Duties of an outreach coordinator An outreach coordinator is responsible in organizing various outreach events which includes sales, marketing and planning on activities in order to promote services and receive donations. They create activities so as to supplement the staffing needs and attain community members that are involve with the mission of an organization. Duties also include training, recruiting and managing outreach volunteers. There are some organizations that recruit many volunteers for special events. Specific job may include advertising, screening and recruiting volunteers, providing training and orientation for volunteers, providing support, tracking performance of volunteers and keeping exact record of volunteer activities. Daily duties include contacting volunteers regarding their availability, scheduling meetings, receiving feedbacks on volunteer’s experiences, recognizing efforts of volunteers with thank you letters or awards and responding to the inquiries of their volunteers. The coordinator should work closely with some other departments within their organization in order to make sure that the needs of the volunteers are met.
10459.title: Community Outreach Coordinator

10458.description: The New York Public Library is in need of enthusiastic, friendly volunteers to staff library card sign-up tables during the period from January 8th through March3rd. Volunteers will ideally work three, 2-3 hour shifts over the course of the month, providing information on and answering questions about library cards, encouraging people to sign up, and handling their paperwork. Training will be provided and schedules are flexible. There will be day, evening and weekend opportunities. The Library is looking to staff tables at events and in high-traffic areas near four specific branches: Bronx Library Center and Jerome Park in the Bronx, and New Amsterdam and Kips Bay in Manhattan. All are near public transportation. Public libraries are great equalizers, offering opportunity, information, and education to all New Yorkers. This campaign aims to raise awareness of the free programs and services that libraries provide, and encourage as many New Yorkers as possible to get cards and access the full range of those services.
10458.title: Library Card Sign-Up Volunteers Needed

10458.description: WeThrive is an entrepreneurial mentoring program that pairs college students with middle school students at local schools nearby. Youth participants will create ventures of their own and earn real revenues. Currently, we are looking for Fordham University students, who are passionate about social change and entrepreneurship, to mentor youths at a local middle school. Business experience is not required. To learn more about us visit: http://teamwethrive.org/
10458.title: Fordham University Students Mentor Youths

10458.description: Protect our environment and the special world in which we live. Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New York citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Together we can protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. Want to know more? Please join our weekly Introductory Conference Call. The next one is on Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. It is a live call, about an hour long, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. Please register for the call at this link so that we can follow up with you: https://citizensclimatelobby.org/join-weekly-intro-call/ We look forward to working with you!
10458.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Bronx NY

10458.description: To encourage people to develop healthier eating habits and to participate in fun and free activities in the community, fostering cooperation and trust. There is also the opportunity of the community participating in recruiting for Bronx community participants in the Fresh Air Fund .
10458.title: Spanish Bilingual Canvasser in the Bronx

10458.description: Seniors in nursing facilities tend to have few visitors, but with a few hours of your time, you can provide the social interaction that is important to keeping their spirits soaring. There are a variety of projects with seniors such as knitting, gardening, and even teaching basic computer skills. Just a few hours of your time can help brighten up a senior’s week. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
10458.title: Seniors Projects with New York Cares in the Bronx

10458.description: Volunteers on New York Cares' Hunger projects do more than just serve a meal -- they provide a warm smile, friendly conversation, and the reassurance that someone cares. These projects serve hundreds of men, women, and children at homeless shelters, churches, and senior centers each day. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.

10458.description: On New York Cares' Health and Wellness projects, volunteers bring much-needed companionship to long-term hospital residents and individuals living with devastating illnesses, such as HIV/AIDS. Sports and fitness projects keep children healthy and active, arts and culture projects help them discover their creativity, and recreational outings expose them to the unique activities and culture of New York City. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at http://www.newyorkcares.org.

Our volunteers provide a little extra care and attention to the physically disabled, who often face limited recreational activities and educational opportunities. On New York Cares' Adult Education projects, volunteers help capable but struggling New Yorkers, many of whom are transitioning out of homelessness, build a brighter future for themselves and their families. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. 07849.description: The Gruenert Center is a daytime vocational / activity center for adults with developmental and intellectual disabilities. Volunteers are utilized in assisting the staff and clients in all aspects of the day from contract work, ceramics, art, to lunch and social time. A great place to volunteer! Volunteers are welcome Monday -Friday between 10:00am and 3:00pm. Volunteers make their own schedules.
07849.title: Perfect for daytime volunteering!

07740.description: BGCM! (Because God Chose Me!) Community Center & Sportsplex, is a 501c3 nonprofit academic, arts & athletic center for youth & families founded on Christian principles, and is dedicated to instilling in each member that they have been specifically chosen by God to do magnificent things! We specialize in improving the self esteem of youth and families in suburban as well as underrepresented and underprivileged communities, while promoting integrity and stewardship, and offering youth an innovative opportunity to train, excel, and compete academically, artistically, and athletically. We are seeking SUPER FANTASTIC enthusiastic Girls Who Code (GWC) Instructors. High school students are encouraged to apply as Assistantants and can earn volunteer hour credit. This is a FREE program offered to girls (and open to boys) in grades 6-12. Successful instructors may come from a variety of backgrounds, including industry and academia. Girls Who Code welcomes male instructors. Visit bgcme.org/girls-who-code.html for exact class dates. Visit girlswhocode.org to learn more about GWC. Instructors will lead Girls Who Code classes through the curriculum every week. Instructors must be comfortable implementing and explaining basic programming concepts such as variables, loops, conditionals, and functions; Computer Science degree preferred but not required. Benefits of working with BGCM: Gain professional work experience. Gain experience at a unique social entrepreneurship that has a global impact. Work in a positive, well-balanced environment. Collaborate within a positive team atmosphere. Why Volunteer? Work directly to close the gender gap for computer science education for girls nationwide Expose girls in underserved areas to a comprehensive and unique computer science education Interact with some of the largest tech companies and leaders in the industry Develop leadership skills and positively impact and give back to your community Empower and equip 1 million girls by 2020 with the skills they need to pursue careers in STEM Requirements ALL APPLICANTS MUST EMAIL A RESUME AND COVER LETTER TO BGCME.ORG TO BE CONSIDERED. NO EXCEPTIONS. Candidates MUST also visit www.bgcme.org to learn more about our organization in preparation for a possible interview this week. Enrollment in a Certificate, Associates, Bachelors or Graduate Degree Program in computer science or equivalent, preferred but not required. College credit can be arranged. Employment in a technology related field preferred but not required. Candidate MUST work proficiently with a great level of autonomy. Must have outstanding organization and communication skills, both verbal and written. Must have a passion for youth and a heart to serve; committed to learning alongside your students. Must be independent, open-minded, enthusiastic, adaptable, and must be able to work in a team environment, independently, and with a great deal of autonomy. Must welcome new challenges, come up with fresh ideas and future focus, and be able to work in a fast paced environment in a deadline-oriented environment. Must be available 2-4 hours for GWC classes, which includes prep and travel time. Prior teaching or tutoring experience preferred, but not required. Candidate will need to take and pass the GWC 2016 Clubs Facilitator Technical Assessment and Background Check. Qualifications Proficient in back-end programming language, intermediate knowledge of data structures and algorithms The most successful volunteer instructors have had some type of teaching experience or experience working with youth, such as teaching assistants, camp counselors, or tutors (but not required). Ideal candidates include (but are not limited to): Current or former software developers; Current undergraduate or graduate computer science major or minors Responsibilities Meet the estimated minimum time commitment of 2-4 hours per week from February - May 2017 Host regular club sessions; Tue/Thur from 6:30-8:30. Travel to club site to instruct classes Submit completed student projects and code to Girls Who Code Prepare short fun games for each class. Fulfill communication and reporting requirements in accordance with BGCM and Girls Who Code Club standards. Possibly work with BGCM and Girls Who Code staff to organize activities that expose girls to the tech world, including field trips to tech companies and bringing in guest speakers
07740.title: IMMEDIATE NEED: Girls Who Code Instructors - Starts Feb 9th - Long Branch (2 days/week)

07740.description: The Nonprofit Management Intern will assist the Executive Director in all aspects of nonprofit management including but not limited to strategic planning, revenue generation, public relations, event planning, and fundraising. Business management Actively engage MOCEANS’ volunteers, board members, event committees, alumni, partnering organizations, and funders Support Board of Directors, as needed Track progress and measure successes that can be effectively communicated to the board, funders, and other stakeholders Analytics and reporting Compile all data and necessary reports to comply with State and Federal guidelines Track donor and community engagement in company database, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail Maintain and update company information resource files as a complete, organized and usable database of members, donors, funders, and other community stakeholders Capacity-building Execute strategic business planning processes for program expansion Research prospective donors and funding sources, building strong community partnerships Expand revenue-generating and fundraising activities to support existing program operations and regional expansion Plan and support fundraising events, as needed Qualifications Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Public Administration, or similar Advanced computer skills including typing, Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Apps Ability to relate effectively with the public, fellow staff, and members in a professional manner Excellent verbal, written, and organizational skills Proficiency using at least one social media channel preferred
07740.title: Nonprofit Management Intern - Spring 2017
07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

07740.description: Outreach and recruitment Proactively partner with marketing team to promote MOCEANS’ programs and services within the community Work with the marketing team to plan and execute fundraising and informational events Partner with the social media team to design and implement social media strategy Initiate speaking engagements and presentations to community organizations, schools, volunteer groups and others as necessary Analytics and reporting Compile all data and necessary reports to comply with State and Federal guidelines Track donor and community engagement in company database, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail Maintain and update company information resource files as a complete, organized and usable database of members, donors, funders, and other community stakeholders Development Research prospective donors and funding sources Develop program proposals for submission to grantors Identify and develop new revenue streams that are consistent with MOCEANS’ mission and strategic plan Qualifications Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Public Administration, or similar Advanced computer skills including typing, Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Apps Ability to relate effectively with the public, fellow staff, and members in a professional manner Excellent verbal, written, and organizational skills Proficiency using at least one social media channel preferred

07740.description: Assist the Director of Independent Living in his role which includes: assisting persons with disabilities to receive appropriate services, developing connections with community organizations and service providers, and providing the five core services services to consumers in the assigned area Direct work with consumers Conduct intake and assessments of consumers seeking services through MOCEANS CIL Work with the consumer to provide the five core services: information & referral, peer support, independent living skills training, individual and systems advocacy, and transition support services Follow ­up with past consumers, as needed Outreach and recruitment Initiate speaking engagements and presentations to community organizations, schools, volunteer groups and others as necessary for recruitment purposes Proactively partner with marketing team to promote MOCEANS’ programs and services within the community Analytics and reporting Compile all data and necessary reports to comply with State and Federal guidelines Track and document consumer progress and success in our database system, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail Maintain and update the information resource files as a complete, organized and usable database of disability­related services and organizations General Support Cross­train with other staff members as appropriate and time­ permitting Qualifications Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Public Administration, or similar Advanced computer skills including typing, Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Apps Ability to relate effectively with the public, fellow staff, and members in a professional manner Excellent verbal, written, and organizational skills Proficiency using at least one social media channel preferred
07740.title: Independent Living Specialist Intern - Spring 2017
07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

07740.description: MAJOR OBJECTIVE The environmental maintenance coordinator will be responsible for maintaining the cleanliness of the MOCEANS’ office area to ensure a clean and safe workplace. QUALIFICATIONS Capability to perform basic cleaning and environmental maintenance Perform basic management of cleaning supplies RESPONSIBILITIES Keep the MOCEANS office area in an orderly and good condition. Clean building floors by sweeping, mopping, scrubbing, or vacuuming them. Gather and empty trash. Service, clean, and supply restrooms. Clean and polish furniture and fixtures. Clean windows, glass partitions, and mirrors, using soapy water or other cleaners, sponges, and squeegees. Dust furniture, walls, machines, and equipment. Steam-clean or shampoo carpets. Notify staff of any issues that require building superintendent intervention, including the presence of pests, water damage, or other safety concerns. ORIENTATION/TRAINING MOCEANS will provide both online and in-person training. Orientation will occur on the first day of volunteer hours and will last approximately one hour. On-going training and support will be provided as needed. TIME AND PLACE The environmental maintenance coordinator will perform maintenance responsibilities weekly, bi-weekly or monthly for the time needed to maintain the office area in a clean and orderly condition. COMMITMENT This position requires a minimum commitment of 6 months and offers a flexible schedule. ON-THE-JOB SUPERVISION Erica Hill, Resource Development and Outreach BENEFITS Volunteers are highly valued members of the MOCEANS team and contribute to making a significant difference in MOCEANS’ ability to serve our community. MOCEANS will provide reference letters for all volunteers who successfully complete a placement.
07740.title: Environmental Maintenance Coordinator
07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

07740.description: QUALIFICATIONS Excellent organizational, written and verbal skills Detail oriented and committed to meeting deadlines Ability to relate effectively with the public, fellow employees, and consumers in an appropriately professional manner Ability to adapt to shifting priorities and manage multiple deadlines Ability to problem-solve in a fast paced work environment Advanced computer skills including typing, Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Apps Bilingual in Spanish a plus Ability to strictly adhere to confidentiality policies RESPONSIBILITIES Handle incoming phone calls and written correspondence, providing prompt responses and forwarding to appropriate staff member where necessary Perform general clerical duties including photocopying, fax and mailing Handle requests for information and data and follow up with appropriate staff member Assist with volunteer and outreach coordination as required Update social media sites, as directed Update consumer records in database and ensure all hard files are accurate and up-to-date ORIENTATION/TRAINING MOCEANS will provide both online and in-person training. Orientation will occur on the first day of volunteer hours and will last approximately one hour. On-going training and support will be provided as needed. TIME AND PLACE The volunteer administrative assistant will work at the Long Branch office during normal business hours, unless otherwise agreed. COMMITMENT This position requires a minimum commitment of 6 months and a set schedule. ON-THE-JOB SUPERVISION As assigned upon acceptance into program. BENEFITS This position provides valuable experience for business management, communications, and/or marketing students and anyone with a passion for protecting the rights of people with disability. Volunteers are highly valued members of the MOCEANS team and contribute to making a significant difference in MOCEANS' ability to serve our community. MOCEANS will provide reference letters for all volunteers who successfully complete a placement MOCEANS is EEOC compliant and we strongly encourage people with disabilities to apply. MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc. We are a private 501c3 nonprofit promoting the civil rights and inclusion of all people with disabilities since 1989. Our mission is to support choice, promote public awareness and barrier-free access in the community while advancing the independent living philosophy in the lives of all people with disabilities. For more information, visit http://www.moceanscil.org or our Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/MoceansCIL

07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

07740.description: House Parent Adult (18 years or older and out of high school) who volunteers during the Monday through Friday 5 p.m. to 9 p.m. evening shift or on holidays to help provide 24-hour coverage. A Houseparent acts as a relief manager during non-business hours. Because there is a moderate amount of training, those interested in house parenting must commit to a minimum of three evenings a month for six months. Some responsibilities include answering phones, registering families, providing tours and supervising other volunteers. Office Volunteer / Phone Greeter Assist with event/appeal mailings, record keeping, data entry, answering phones and other tasks on a weekly basis. Mondays 1 pm to 5 pm Thursdays 9 am to 1 pm Fridays 9 am to 1 pm Project Coordinator Oversee the organization and management of specific special projects.

07740.description: Volunteer Job Description ONLINE ADVOCATE 15 minutes per day minimum 1 year minimum commitment MAJOR OBJECTIVE The volunteer online community advocate will work within social media sites and our website to promote MOCEANS and our mission by actively engaging community members and sharing news, information, and resources related to the Center. QUALIFICATIONS Effective social media writing which includes summary, evaluation and analysis Experience and/or interest in promoting the human and civil rights of people with disabilities Have one or more personal social media accounts that is used regularly Have access to the internet daily Intermediate to advanced skills using one or more social media channels to interact with others online RESPONSIBILITIES Be a positive and informed spokesperson for all people with disabilities Become part of online communities, share information, and expand networks Closely monitor MOCEANS’ social media and website activity, promptly sharing any updates on multiple social media channels Share your point of view in a way that is open, positive, and enthusiastic Consistently promote MOCEANS CIL and its mission serving as a champion of our cause ORIENTATION/TRAINING MOCEANS will provide both online and in-person training. Orientation will occur on the first day of volunteer hours and will last approximately one hour. On-going training and support will be provided as needed. TIME AND PLACE The volunteer online advocate will work no less than 15 minutes daily. This is a virtual position with a flexible schedule. COMMITMENT This position requires a minimum commitment of 1 year and offers a flexible schedule. ON-THE-JOB SUPERVISION Erica Hill, Resource Development and Outreach ( erica.hill@moceanscil.org ) BENEFITS This position provides valuable experience for social media marketing students and anyone with a passion for protecting the rights of people with disability. Volunteers are highly valued members of the MOCEANS team and contribute to making a significant difference in MOCEANS’ ability to serve our community. QUALIFICATIONS Live and/or work in Monmouth or Ocean County, NJ Detail oriented and committed to meeting deadlines Works well independently and as part of a team Excellent interpersonal and verbal communication skills Experience and/or interest in promoting the human and civil rights of people with disabilities RESPONSIBILITIES Cultivate and maintain new partnerships with local businesses, libraries, public housing leaders, community centers, and other organizations to increase awareness of MOCEANS’ mission and services Place brochures and other informational materials in relevant locations such as schools, churches, and doctors’ offices Assist with volunteer and outreach coordination as required Be a positive and informed spokesperson for all people with disabilities Consistently promote MOCEANS CIL and its mission serving as a champion of our cause ORIENTATION/TRAINING MOCEANS will provide both online and in-person training. Orientation will occur on the first day of volunteer hours and will last approximately one hour. On-going training and support will be provided as needed. Your pet will need to be a certified pet therapy animal. You and your pet will bring joy and love to the lives of our patients and will receive so much love and joy in return!
07747.title: Share your pet's unconditional love with hospice patients!

11385.description: WE NEED THE HELP OF RELIABLE, DEDICATED, CARING PEOPLE TO HELP MAKE EVERYONE'S EXPERIENCES AT EXTREME KIDS & CREW THE BEST IT CAN BE. WE’RE ALWAYS LOOKING TO CONNECT WITH ENERGETIC, COMPASSIONATE PEOPLE. At Extreme Kids & Crew we believe that play is a powerful medium for learning, expression, and growth. Volunteers facilitate this important work by creatively engaging participants in child-led interactions that bubble up organically through openness and a genuine enthusiasm in the child's interests and ideas. Interested volunteers should be ready to get down on the floor and build castles, join in on an expedition to the moon, or just play peek-a-boo for an hour. A willingness to get silly is a must! TO APPLY: If you are interested in this opportunity, please fill out an application by following this link: http://goo.gl/forms/puXt3atBGt(link is external) If you have any questions, please email Diana Baron-Moore at dianabaronmoore@extremekidsandcrew.org
11385.title: Friday Play Partner

06830.description: Fund Development Involved with strategic initiatives and innovative planning. Committee assists the board and all of the other committees with developing strategy for partnership and fundraising. It is responsible for the organization's strategic partership and fundraising direction. They create processes including development of short term and long term strategic plan with measurable goals and time targets and competencies. They develop and open relationships with other organizations for profit, non profit and government. They are the outreach strategists. They identify opportunities for community involvement, and bring potential partners together. Skills Required: Fundraising Grant requesting Leadership Organization Business Management Foundation of Hope is an organization that is completely volunteer based, and grant funded. We are seeking more people to be part of our team. There is no minimum time commitment, but we do ask that you be relatively consistent. There are opportunities to work virtually, but if you are able to commit part of your time to attending our Board meetings, events and bi-weekly meetings that would be great too. As a volunteer-based organization, we depend on grants and donations to fund our operations, and we are always looking for volunteers to help our causes and to support our various activities. If you have experience in fields such as Marketing, Finance, Auditing, Grant writing, Web development, Fundraising, or simply interested in helping us carrying out our mission, let us know. Experience is helpful, but not essential. We are seeking a volunteer to become a part of our team. We are a 501(c)3 organization and volunteer hours with us can count for community service or experience at your school and work. This is a great place for people of any age, physical capability, and background. Please volunteer today!
06830.title: Fund Development

06830.description: We have many events through out the year in various Locations in lower fairfield county. Our ambassador committee is a group of experienced members dedicated to helping the community. Ambassadors serve as extensions of our staff. They participate in organizing events, working registration tables, Silent action tables, and they are prepare the atmosphere for philanthropy. They publicly are a representation of what Foundation of Hope (FoH) represents. Hence, they are very important representatives for our organization. Provide insight and expertise and support FoH awareness campaigns as needed. FYI Foundation of Hope is an organization that is completely volunteer based, and grant funded. We are seeking more people to be part of our team. There is no minimum time commitment, but we do ask that you be relatively consistent. There are opportunities to work virtually, but if you are able to commit part of your time to attending our Board meetings, events and bi-weekly meetings that would be great too. As a volunteer-based organization, we depend on grants and donations to fund our operations, and we are always looking for volunteers to help our causes and to support our various activities. If you have experience in fields such as Marketing, Finance, Auditing, Grant writing, Web development, Fundraising, or simply interested in helping us carrying out our mission, let us know. Experience is helpful, but not essential. We are seeking a volunteer to become a part of our team. We are a 501(c)3 organization and volunteer hours with us can count for community service or experience at your school and work. This is a great place for people of any age, physical capability, and background. Please volunteer today!
06830.title: Ambassador

06830.description: Family Centers' Early Care and Education program is seeking volunteers who can assist in the classroom with children ages 3-5 years old. Volunteer sessions are available Monday through Friday in the morning between 8:30 a.m. - 12:30 p.m. or in the afternoon between 2:45 p.m. - 5:45 p.m. at one of two locations in Greenwich: The Grauer Preschool (40 Arch Street) or The Gateway Preschool (2 Chapel Street). All volunteers will be supervised by licensed early childhood education teachers, and will help facilitate activities and learning experiences for children between the ages of 3 and 5 years old. Interested volunteers should have some experience working with young children, and/or experience in an early childhood setting. All volunteers are required to come in for a personal interview and to complete an application. Volunteers must meet the minimum age requirement to volunteer (15), and those volunteers over the age of 18 must submit to a background check. Family Centers' Early Childhood Education Program is accredited by the NAEYC.
06830.title: Early Care and Education Classroom Assistants

06830.description: Greenwich Head Start and Family Centers' School Readiness Program (located at Armstrong Court in Greenwich) seeks dedicated volunteers to work in our classrooms with children ages 3 & 4 years old. Volunteers should enjoy being around young children in a preschool classroom setting and should be comfortable talking and listening to children with the ability to \"get down on their level\" both physically and mentally. Volunteers should enjoy books and stories that are age appropriate and also have the ability to \"ad-lib\", enhance stories and ask questions as they go. The goal of this volunteer position is NOT to teach young children to read, but to inspire good feelings about reading and books and to increase interest in reading and books both inside and outside the classroom. This volunteer position is very flexible and can take place either in the morning (between 9:30-12:00) or in the afternoon (between 3:30-5:30). The minimum age to volunteer is 15, and those volunteers over the age of 18 are required to complete a background check. All volunteers are asked to schedule a personal interview.
06830.title: Head Start/School Readiness Reading Volunteers

06830.description: Mega Blocks, Duplos, and Legos (o my!): Greenwich Head Start and Family Centers' School Readiness Program (located at Armstrong Court in Greenwich is always looking to expand our collection!! These materials are an excellent way for our children to develop fine motor skills and create mini-figure stories and scenes which inspire so much language! Dramatic Play: We are always looking for gently used dress up materials (skirts, lacy gloves, sports gear, heals and loafers, purses and wallets) to encourage the children to explore the different characters and roles in their lives. Loose Parts: We are looking for large tires to add to our back playground. These versatile materials can be used for climbing, jumping, stacking, creating an obstacle course* *Please note that loose parts materials must be able to be delivered directly to Armstrong Court Family Centers’ Site Manger will work directly with the donor regarding delivery of items
06830.title: Materials Drive for Greenwich Head Start/School Readiness Program

06830.description: Greenwich Head Start and Family Centers' School Readiness Program (located at Armstrong Court in Greenwich) are interested in afternoon volunteers (3:30 PM - 5:00 PM) to lead special group activities. Activities may include: dance, yoga, art, reading, introduction to sports, musical instruments, cooking and science. Volunteers would create and implement three to four mini classes (20 - 30 minutes in length) and visit each of our four classrooms. Throughout the day our children have opportunities to explore learning areas, but this volunteer opportunity could lead a teacher-direct/more focused activity. Our teaching staff would support the volunteer and partake in the class with the volunteer leader. Family Centers’ Site Manger will work with the volunteer details regarding space and supplies needed to make the visit a success. The minimum age to volunteer is 15, and those volunteers over the age of 18 are required to complete a background check. All volunteers are asked to schedule a personal interview.
06830.title: Preschool Recreational Activity Leader

06830.description: FamilyFIRST is a new collaboration between Family Centers and the Greenwich YMCA. This fall a number of students are enrolled and are committed to the program five days a week with a goal of closing the achievement gap by providing supportive services to them and their families. We are seeking High School Tutors to assist both K-5 students, as well as middle school age students who are attending this program. Tutors will provide academic support in math and reading for students on an as needed basis. Instruction and activities are designed expressly to promote subject mastery, develop grade-level competencies and to teach study skills. Tutoring shifts are available Monday through Friday from 3:30-4:30pm and is hosted at two locations: the YMCA located at 50 E. Putnam Avenue, and S t. Roch Church located at 10 St. Roch Avenue.
06830.title: FamilyFIRST Tutors

06830.description: Family Centers' Early Care and Education program provides full-day/full-year care, and offers the highest quality education and development opportunities for young children ages six-weeks to five years. At Family Centers, we accept each young child as a unique and valuable individual and group member, honoring and respecting family language and cultures. Our curriculum, goals and objectives guide our staff's ongoing assessment of children's progress, while facilitating each child's individual growth and language acquisition and cognitive, social-emotional, physical and creative domains . We are seeking a volunteer(s) to provide reception coverage in the program as assigned, assist in the administrative office by performing clerical duties including but not limited to: filing, answering the phone, completing assigned program specific paperwork. Office assistants will also tend to deliveries and visitors, represent the program positively in the community, and support their site manager with data entry (experience with Shine, Evolve and Teaching Strategies Gold). The hours for this position are flexible between 7am-6pm Monday through Friday. Volunteer shifts will be scheduled in blocks of 4-5 hours. The position is based in one of three locations in Greenwich: The Gateway School (2 Chapel Street), The Warburg Early Childhood Center (22 Bridge Street), or Armstrong Court Preschools (Armstrong Court).
06830.title: Program Receptionist/Office Assistant: Early Care & Education

06830.description: With over 45 trained volunteer facilitators, the Den for Grieving Kids provides vital services to families in lower Fairfield County creating a safe environment for children, teens, parents and caregivers to discuss their bereavement issues. On-going supervision and instruction help the facilitators develop their capacity to be a helpful presence to the bereaved. We offer two types of facilitator positions: the nights of service facilitator and the school based group facilitator. Nights of service facilitators are asked to commit to either a Monday or Wednesday evening schedule (meeting twice a month from 6:00-9:00pm). The evening consists of a pre and post meeting between facilitators and staff to both prepare and debrief about the interaction with participants. If interested, please reach out to Jennifer Flatow to receive the 2016-2017 Den calendar. School based group facilitators commit to a weekly schedule of about one hour onsite at their assigned school, with some preparation time required outside of the school visit. Currently there are Den groups taking place in 18 schools in the greater Greenwich/Stamford area. The time for this position varies slightly from week to week so students do not consistently miss the same class. If interested, please reach out to Jennifer Flatow to see a list of current school based group locations. The Den hosts an annual training for new and returning volunteers each fall. If you are interested in becoming a facilitator, please reach out to Jennifer Flatow, to inquire about becoming a Den Facilitator and receive the 2016-2017 Den calendar.
06830.title: Den Facilitators / Den for Grieving Kids

06830.description: The Greenwich Department of Health is actively seeking to recruit both medical and non-medical public health volunteers in the community to assist during public health emergencies and related health programs. The Medical Reserve Corps program focuses on registering volunteers to staff mass dispensing clinics (e.g., dispensing antibiotics or vaccines) and to respond to threats ranging from pandemic influenza, bioterrorist attacks to severe storms such as super-storm Sandy. However, the MRC could be activated for a wide range of support services needed in the community, such as health fairs and seasonal influenza clinics
06830.title: Greenwich MRC Volunteer

07465.title: Paint Day Care, Straighten Basements Presidents' Weekend

07465.description: Please have or obtain current infant/child/adult cpr/aed and 1st aid, and NJ cari. You will need new fingerprint registration. Please help with children any time during the week in licensed child care preschool and after school. Thank you.
07465.title: Child Care worker

07465.description: Need boiler fixed. Need faucet put in sink. Boiler because people are cold. Sink because much water is being wasted.
07465.title: Plumber Needed NOW!

07465.description: Please lend your much-appreciated expertise for a one-day project as soon as possible! We need new footings for two damaged porch support pillars in Wanaque. We also want a pad poured for children tricycling at our day care in West Milford. Thank you.
07465.title: Mason / Contractor

07465.description: Transitional housing and services facilities, including licensed day care, preschool, and after school programs, serving homeless/battered/survivors women and children with a range of needs. We need New Jersey licensed preschool educators in Wanaque and in West Milford, New Jersey for our resident and nonresident clients as well as for neighborhood families. We can provide you with housing, food, clothing, and support groups - please do inquire about any particulars that are of interest to you. Thank you.
07465.title: NJ Licensed Preschool Teachers

07465.description: Create Puppetista - type puppets with child and adult survivors of domestic violence / homelessness. Collect materials, be open to wide range of responses.
07465.title: Puppet making Peacemaking

07465.description: We need electrical repairs and upgrades in Wanaque and West Milford. Thank you.
07465.title: NJ Licensed Electrician

07465.description: Take photos in West Milford of items to sell online to raise funds for this organization. See sosdv.org.
07465.title: Take Digital Photos and Post Online

07465.description: Frame in doors. Build window boxes. Projects with children.
07465.title: Carpentry

07465.description: We always need repairs, maintenance, upkeep, sorting, research, and other assistance in northern New Jersey. We also always need people to help us get supplies donated . 24/7. See sosdv.org.
07465.title: Simple Labor, Ideas

07465.description: Attorneys to work with women who have orders of protection and need further legal remedies especially help with custody cases - in New Jersey and other jurisdictions.
07465.title: Family Law Attorney / Lawyer

07465.description: 3-person crews to paint one or more rooms in one 3-4 hour period 3 to 30 people See sosdv.org
07465.title: One Day - Group - Paint Emergency Residence

07465.description: Hi. We need closets built, storage spaces framed in, doors framed in, outdoor staircase risers, flower boxes built, other upgrades.
07465.title: Creative Basic Carpentry

07465.description: If you have a little or a lot of time you will be appreciated. You could help on-site with gardens, repairs, workshops, child care, teaching. You could do things on your own such as staffing a table at a public event, doing research, artwork, computer input. If you have any ideas or credits to fulfill, be in touch. See sosdv.org.
07465.title: Many Opportunities

10580.description: We are lookingfor a male to team up with our Founder Pasquale Falco as he picks up food donations from various stores throughout southern westcester and delivers food to various food pantries and shelters in the area. The volunteer must be able to lift heavy boxes. We would like someone with a heart for helping others and making a difference in combating the problem of hunger in our area Great for teenagers too! Sundays 9-12
10580.title: Food Rescuer and pantry assistant
10580.org: Bread of Life Food Pantry (Giving Tree Global, Inc)

10580.description: We are lookingfor a man to team up with our Founder Pasquale Falco as he picks up food donations from various stores throughout southern westcester and delivers food to various food pantries and shelters in the area. The volunteer must be able to lift heavy boxes. We would like someone with a heart for helping others and making a difference in combating the problem of hunger in our area We are looking for help on Tuesdays and Fridays from 9-1
10580.title: Food Rescuer
10580.org: Bread of Life Food Pantry (Giving Tree Global, Inc)

10583.description: Immediate openings: Volunteer with the Greenburgh Nature Center to assist in curriculum development, staffing, and assessment of our new \"Explore, Discover, Connect\", a unique nature immersion program for kindergartners utilizing the many varied ecosystems and outdoor learning opportunities on our 33 acre nature preserve. Volunteers will be required to attend 1 day of orientation and training during the week of September 19 - 23 (to be scheduled). Regular hours will be a combination of Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays from 12 noon to 4 pm starting September 27 through December 22, 2016, with possible extension into Spring. Volunteer candidates can be students of early childhood/elementary education or related fields, with a strong interest in nature-based learning. Volunteers will collaborate directly with Greenburgh Nature Center naturalist educators who consider it part of our mission to support the academic and career goals of our volunteers.
10583.title: Nature-Based Early Childhood Teacher’s Assistant

10583.description: Greenburgh Nature Center is currently looking for adult volunteers to assist with animal care and engaging public visitors in our live animal museum! Weekday availability (Mon-Thurs) a must! There are morning (9-1pm) AND afternoon (1-4:30pm) shifts open. Morning volunteers help to clean cages and tanks and provide fresh water for our indoor collection of small reptiles, amphibians, mammals, and birds. Once the nature center opens to the public, morning and afternoon volunteers present these animals to visitors to see up close and touch. As well as inform them about our animal collection. Willingness to work with ALL of our animals, including our invertebrates, snakes, and lizards is not necessary but certainly a plus! On site training is provided.
10583.title: Weekday -Adult Animal Care and Museum Docent

10601.description: An AARP Tax-Aide Counselor provides free income tax form preparation and answers tax questions for low- and moderate-income taxpayers two or more days a week during the February to April tax filing season. You will be required to attend January training sessions on the tax code and tax software and to complete and pass the IRS take-home exam. Volunteers need to apply by early October in order to be scheduled for training. Familiarity with tax preparation software is a must for counseling, although administrative positions are available without that requirement. This is a great opportunity to help low-to-middle-income and older taxpayers in your community. To learn more about volunteering with AARP Tax-Aide check out our website: http://www.aarp.org/money/taxaide/
10601.title: AARP Tax-Aide Counselor

08540.description: Life Choice Hospice is seeking pet therapy volunteers. You and your pet are invited to attend the next orientation in Willingboro. Contact us for dates and times. We will provide FREE training as a volunteer for you along with a free TB test. Your pet will need a pet therapy certification. You and your pet will bring joy and love to the lives of patients and will receive so much love and joy in return!.
08540.title: Bring smiles to hospice patients - share your pet's unconditional love!

07511.description: Volunteers with Passaic Valley Hospice visit our terminally ill patients in their homes throughout northern New Jersey. Our goal is to support patients physically, emotionally and spiritually, and their families, so those in their final months can live as fully and comfortably as possible and finish their journey with dignity and peace. Volunteers provide companionship for patients and families, and help with respite for caregivers. There are also needs for assistance with office work and making bereavement phone calls. Training is provided with continuing coaching available.
07511.title: Hospice Volunteers

10801.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 2-4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
10801.title: New Rochelle, NY: Autism Volunteer

10801.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
10801.title: New Rochelle>>>Advice Counselor

07044.description: Spectrum360 challenges expectations for children, adolescents, and adults across the full spectrum of autism and related disabilities through innovative special education, employment supports, and community-building. We have evolved over the last 50 plus years in part because of the passion and commitment of our Board of Directors. As the organization continues to progress and extend our programs to offer increased options to the individuals we serve we are looking to continue to grow our Board. We do not define individuals by their disabilities. Using evidence-based approaches, we push the boundaries of traditional programs and services, helping each person we serve to discover unique talents, develop self-worth, and maximize opportunities for independence, self-direction, citizenship, and community integration. We are seeking individuals to join our Board of Directors who have the passion to help us in fulfilling our mission. Desired qualities and abilities of a prospective board member include: Conducts business as a Board Trustee with the highest degree of integrity and confidentiality. Upholds high ethical/professional standards. Has a commitment to and serve as an advocate for Spectrum360 and the individuals we serve. Has a passion to introduce others to the mission of Spectrum360. Possess the ability to bring their own talents and the talents of others to benefit the Board of Directors. Has influence and/or affluence to provide financial support to Spectrum360. Displays a willingness to address the challenges facing Spectrum360 with creative and innovative solutions. Demonstrates a positive problem-solving approach. Follows through and ensures expectations are met. Has the ability to motivate others. Conducts oneself in a professional and positive manner and shows respect to others. Is a team player. Is enthusiastic. Listens actively and promotes straightforward, open communication. We expect the following commitment to being a Spectrum360 board member: Willingness to commit to a minimum of 6 hours monthly to the work of the organization. Attend board orientation, a minimum of 4 of 6 board meetings annually, and assigned committee meetings. Attend fundraising and other events throughout the year. Serve a three-year term with the opportunity to continue additional terms. In the words of a Board Member, \"Being part of Spectrum360 is inspiring on many levels. The students and clients are infectious as their unique abilities, challenges and triumphs make you see things like never before, and you want more of it. The staff and their choice to serve others with such a passion and commitment is amazing. And then there are the members of the Board who with their various talents, intellect, and huge hearts, do whatever they can to continue to move the organization forward.\" To learn more about our organization, visit Spectrum360.org. If you are interested in becoming a part of this amazing journey and the opportunities at the Board and Committee levels, please contact Diane Berry dberry@spectrum360.org.
07044.title: Join our Board!
07044.org: SPECTRUM 360 A NEW JERSEY NONPROFIT CORPORATION

07044.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 2-4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
07044.title: Verona, NJ: Autism Volunteer

07044.description: Care at Home New Jersey helps socially isolated, homebound seniors. As part of our program, we give our clients free, easy to use computers that they can use to stay connected with family and friends through email and Skype. We send volunteers to spend time with these seniors, to keep them company, and also to help and encourage them to use the computer we have given them. We want them to get comfortable reaching out to family and friends through the computer. The computer is specially designed for seniors and is easy to navigate. Volunteer hours are flexible and are arranged between the volunteer and the client, but we do like to have a minimum regular once a week commitment for an hour or two. Initially we do a short training to aquaint the volunteer with the computer, which is very easy to use.
07044.title: Visit with homebound Seniors

07045.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Grace Healthcare Services welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexology, music, imagery and touch therapies such as Reiki, massage, therapeutic touch and healing hands. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide certified/trained pets who visit with patients. These animals provide loving memories for some and give unconditional love helping our patients feel connected to a larger world. Administrative Volunteers provide help to the staff in our Edison office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, huggable dolls/bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Junior Volunteers consist of groups such as girl/boy scouts or young people who wish to honor our patients by making holiday cards, posters, wall hangings and memory books. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families and friends of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. Hospice training classes are required for Companionship and Complementary Volunteers. They are free of charge and offered on an ongoing basis. Grace Healthcare Services serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, contact our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Gracehcs.com!
07045.title: Become a Hospice Volunteer!

07046.description: Be a mentor. Change a life. There are many ways to help! Bring the magic of mentoring to a child, age 5-18, from Morris, Bergen, Passaic and Sussex counties (N.J.), by becoming a Big Brother or Big Sister. Mentors meet with their Little Brothers or Little Sisters for 2-3 hours weekly. Find out how you can change a life!
07046.title: Be a mentor
07046.org: Big Brothers Big Sisters of Morris, Bergen & Passaic, Inc.

07046.description: The Community Companions Program (CCP) provides one-to-one companionship and assistance in daily living to people with mental illnesses. The companion visits the client at least once a week, for a minimum of three months, participating in mutually agreeable activities. Together they find new social groups, learn about community resources, and share in a supportive friendship. Volunteers will receive training, which will include an orientation to mental illness and mental health, an overview of community resources and practice in successful communication skills. Upon completion of training, volunteers will have the opportunity to share skills and interests with someone who needs social support as a supplement to mental health services. Please call Marissa Ferrito 973-334-3496 ext. 113 for more information.
07046.title: Community Companion Program
07046.org: Mental Health Association of Morris County (MHAMC)

07046.description: The Mental Health Players, sponsored by MHAMC, are accepting volunteer applications. The Players are a group of volunteers who use improvisational role plays to portray real life situations. The players perform for various groups including schools, civic organizations, businesses, and church groups. Players come from all walks of life to help educate the community about mental health issues. The Players deal with a broad range of issues. These include mental health, substance abuse, peer pressure, aging, and other social issues. The performance usually lasts an hour and includes 3 role plays. To become a volunteer or to gather additional information, please call Tracy Cappiccille at 973-334-3496, ext. 112.
07046.title: Mental Health Players (MHP)
07046.org: Mental Health Association of Morris County (MHAMC)

07047.description: Homeside Hospice is looking for volunteers to provide Music Therapy to our patients in assisted living and in nursing homes in Hudson County. If you are a Music Therapist, you can provide a loving experience for patients in lifes final journey. As a volunteer you will provide essential, quality of life services to patients. Your efforts will provide the sort of care and help that a loving friend provides and help insure that the Hospice promise is fulfilled. Music Therapy Students Welcome!
07047.title: Music Therapy Volunteers needed in Hudson County
