The Walkathon Coordinator is a part time volunteer position that involves a commitment of a few hours a week. You must be willing to join us at our monthly committee meetings at the Milltown Public Library at 10am on the Second Saturday of the Month. The Walkathon Coordinator will oversee and be the point of contact for our Walkathon. Responsibilities: The Walkathon Coordinator will oversee and be the point of contact for our Walkathon. He or she will have the following responsibilities: Effectively run and be the point of contact for our Walkathon Set up all the activities at our Walkathon Oversee the registration of our teams Coordinate all logistics including EMS, Police and the location Be in direct communication with senior leadership of our organization Obtain sponsorships from various business and organizations Answer and respond to questions that people have about our walkathon Essential functions/working conditions: Must be able to meet deadlines and adjust to changing priorities Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing Ability to connect with others and develop relationships Committed to the mission of serving young adults with disabilities Ability to perform several tasks concurrently Strong time management and organizational skills Ability to maintain detailed records and confidential information About the Disability Allies: The purpose of the Disability Allies is to plan team building activities that connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. At our events we pair each individual up with a mentor. The job of the mentor is to help the participants with their social skills and insure that everyone interacts with each other. Our events are open to any young adult that has a disability, knows someone with a disability or is supportive of people with disabilities. Please visit www.disabilityallies.com to learn more. Disability Allies Anti-Discrimination statement: Disability Allies shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, political affiliation, gender identification or expression, or military status in any of its activities of operations. These activities include, but are not limited to, hiring and firing of staff, selection of volunteers, and selection of vendors and provision of services.
08837.title: Walkathon Coordinator

08837.description: Catholic Charities Connections Program is actively recruiting volunteers to work as mentors with children ages 5-17. Mentors offer support, guidance, and education as a youth goes through a difficult time, faces new challenges or opportunities, or takes on an important task. A mentor is a person who is willing to share their life-long expertise to provide support to the youth. Mentors can play an important role as the youth develops mentally and emotionally to help a youth understand their goals and personal needs. Mentors must be a minimum of 18 years of age. Prospective mentors will undergo an intensive screening process consisting of: application and informal autobiography, personal interview, reference checks, criminal background check, driving record check and program orientation. The program serves youth in Middlesex County. Mentoring is the process of sharing personal knowledge and skills with a young person.
08837.title: Adult Mentor

08837.description: Assist survivors of sexual violence through our 24-hour hotline, accompaniment to forensic examinations, and support through the legal process at local police stations and court. No experience is necessary for this opportunity however a 50 Hour Confidential Sexual Violence Advocate Training is required and provided by our center. Must be 18 or older and have reliable transportation. Daytime, evening, weekends and holiday availability needed.Bilingual indviduals are encouraged to apply.
08837.title: Confidential Sexual Violence Advocate

08831.description: Are You a caring person looking for a meaningful experience? Do You think you can provide companionship for a patient, such as reading, journaling, playing cards, sharing hobbies, and providing caregiver relief for family members? Do You have a special skill that can be used to provide comfort such as Pet Therapist, Massage Therapist, Beautician, or do you play a musical instrument? Kindred Hospice provides specialized healthcare that allows patients with life-limiting illnesses to live out their days as fully and as comfortably as possible. Volunteer work is flexible and based on your availability. We are grateful for as much time as you can give! Free screening and training is provided. Please contact Elaine Carlsen, Volunteer Coordinator at Elaine.Carlsen@gentiva.com or call 888-556-8880.
08831.title: Friendly Visitor Needed, Monroe Twp area

08831.description: Marketplace in Jamesburg is a great opportunity for volunteers to impact the lives of families in the community. The Deacon’s Food Cupboard provides food allotments that include perishable and non-perishable items, to over 80 families every month. Volunteers are needed to help distribute food to families in need. Help fight hunger today! NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
08831.title: Marketplace in Jamesburg

08831.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
08831.title: Monroe Township>>>Advice Counselor

11365.description: Protect our environment and the special world in which we live. Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New York citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Together we can protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. Want to know more? Please join our weekly Introductory Conference Call. The next one is on Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. It is a live call, about an hour long, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. Please register for the call at this link so that we can follow up with you: https://citizensclimatelobby.org/join-weekly-intro-call/ We look forward to working with you!
11365.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Queens NY

11365.description: You can make a difference! Come join our team and provide haircuts for people living with an advanced illness within your Queens community. Volunteers will receive a 5 hour training program regarding the basics of Hospice care. To apply online go to our website at hospicecarenetwork.org or you may call 616-224-6416 for more information. Hospice Care Network is a certified not-for-profit hospice organization. Our staff and volunteers provide compassionate end-of-life care to over 500 patients daily in Queens, Nassau and Suffolk.
11365.title: Give a haircut...become a Hospice Volunteer!

11365.description: Come join our team as we provide friendly visits, run errands, notarize documents, and provide respite to our Hospice patients and their families in your community. A 16 hour training is provided various times throughout the year. Here at Hospice Care Network we embrace a vision of bringing dignity to end of life care and have been serving families and patients of all ages in Queens, Nassau and Suffolk counties since 1988. Please check out our website at www.hospicecarenetwork.org .
11365.title: Community Patient Support Volunteer

10162.description: Simply by using your vehicle you can save animals - Volunteer your time to transport animals along what is called a \"Rescue Relay Transport\". Each week there are hundreds of animal rescue transports taking place where animals are moved from high-kill shelters to no-kill shelters and rescue organizations, as well as foster homes and adopters. It's easy for you to get involved and help save more animals simply by driving a leg in this relay. How it works: 1. Sign-up on Doobert.com or use the Facebook plug-in (search for \" Doobert Rescue\" on Facebook) and specify the days you're available, the distance you're willing to drive, and then sit back and we'll do the rest. 2. When an animal rescue organization posts a transport request, the system will automatically search to see if it matches your profile (if you're available and within the distance) and then it automatically sends you an e-mail. 3. Then you simply click on the leg that you can cover and everyone else will see that you've signed up for that leg. 4. You'll get communications from the transport coordinator and, once the transport is a \"go\", you simply drive to the meeting place, load up the animals, and drive them to the next meeting place to hand them off to the next volunteer. You'll get plenty of doggy kisses and thank you's along the way as the animals know you are there to help them. There are videos on www.doobert.com that walk you through the process and give you tips and tricks on how to do transport. It's simple - and we need volunteers across the country, so share with your friends and help save an animal today!
10162.title: Drive a leg – Save a life! - New York, NY

10162.description: Loaning an animal your couch can save their life! - Every 16 seconds an animal is euthanized simply due to overpopulation. Shelters do not have unlimited space and unfortunately have to make room. Rescue groups do not have the facilities and rely on fosters to help. Simply by agreeing to foster you can save an animal’s life. ARF’s German Shepherd Rescue is partnering with Doobert.com, the leading online forum for animal rescues, animal shelters and volunteers, to help get more foster homes for rescue animals. How it works: 1. Sign up on Doobert.com or use the Facebook plug-in (search for \"Doobert Rescue\" on Facebook) and build your foster profile for how you can help foster animals. You get to pick the type, duration and tell potential shelters and rescues about your situation. It’s up to you what information you share. 2. We allow approved animal welfare organizations (Shelters and Rescues) to search for volunteers like you, based upon distance and your foster profile. They can see the information you’ve shared and reach out to you if there is a match. 3. You’ll be contacted by them directly and can determine if you are able to help that particular organization with fostering either overnight, short-term or longer-term. It’s up to you whether you help when you’re contacted. You'll get plenty of doggy and kitty kisses and thank you's along the way as the animals know you are there to help them. And there are many more ways to help volunteer to save animals on Doobert.com. It's simple and we need volunteers across the country - so share with your friends, family, and co-workers and help save an animal today!
10162.title: Let me crash on your couch… please? - New York, NY

10162.description: Pilots to the Rescue is seeking active and inactive pilots to help save animals. Even if you lost your medical, are not able to be PIC, or just can't afford to fly regularly, we need pilots to help coordinate animal rescue transport flights for other pilots that are transporting animals. Did you know that every 16 seconds in the U.S. an animal is euthanized due to overpopulation? Animal Rescues and Shelters do their best to move the animals to safety but need volunteers to transport the animals to their forever homes. Pilots to the Rescue is partnering with Doobert.com to manage these transport requests to get the animals where they need to go. For longer distances it’s more ideal to have pilots involved, but to plan these requests you need to have a working knowledge of General Aviation airports, how weight & balance works, and how to incorporate volunteer pilots’ needs into the transport request. You don’t even have to leave your home. All you need is a computer and a phone and we’ll train you how to do it. How it works: Let us know you can help by responding to this post! We’ll send you information to get up to speed on being a volunteer pilot, or training videos to be a coordinator. If you're interested in being a coordinator we'll get you connected with a Rescue or Shelter to plan the transports. That’s it! And we’ll be here to support you all along the way. It's simple and we always need more volunteers (drivers, pilots, photographers, fosters, etc.) across the country, so share with your friends, family and co-workers and help us save an animal today!
10162.title: Punch holes in the sky & save animals! - Pilots Wanted! - New York, NY

10162.description: We need animal rescue transport coordinators to help organize rescue transports. So whether you are retired, not able to travel, or just looking for a way to save animals, we need you! Did you know that every 16 seconds in the U.S. an animal is euthanized due to overpopulation? Animal Rescues and Shelters do their best to move the animals around but need volunteers to transport the animals to their forever homes. Rescues and Shelters use Doobert.com to create their transport requests to get the animals where they need to go, but we need volunteer transport coordinators to help set up and manage the trip. You don’t even have to leave your home. All you need is a computer and a phone and we’ll train you how to do it. How it works: Let us know you can help by responding to this post! We’ll connect you with one of our experienced transport coordinator volunteers to set up time to get you trained on the Doobert.com system. When there’s a transport request, we’ll connect you with the requesting organization to help them effectively plan and manage their transport. That’s it! And we’ll be here to support you all along the way. It's simple and we always need more volunteers (drivers, pilots, photographers, fosters, etc.) across the country, so share with your friends, family and co-workers and help us save an animal today!
10162.title: Do you have a computer and a phone?  You can save animals! - New York, NY

10162.description: We need pilots to help coordinate animal rescue transport flights for other pilots that are transporting animals. So whether you are a current pilot, retired pilot or you lost your medical, we still need you! Did you know that every 16 seconds in the U.S. an animal is euthanized due to overpopulation? Animal Rescues and Shelters do their best to move the animals around but need volunteers to transport the animals to their forever homes. Rescues and Shelters use Doobert.com to create their transport requests to get the animals where they need to go. For longer distances, it’s more ideal to have pilots involved but to plan these requests you need to have a working knowledge of General Aviation airports, how weight & balance works, and how to incorporate volunteer pilots’ needs into the transport request. You don’t even have to leave your home. All you need is a computer and a phone and we’ll train you how to do it. How it works: Let us know you can help by responding to this post! We’ll connect you with one of our experienced transport coordinator volunteers to set up time to get you trained on the Doobert.com system. When there’s a transport flight request we’ll connect you with the requesting organization to help them effectively plan and manage their flight. That’s it! And we’ll be here to support you all along the way. It's simple and we always need more volunteers (drivers, pilots, photographers, fosters, etc.) across the country, so share with your friends, family and co-workers and help us save an animal today!
10162.title: Are you a pilot?  Then you can save animals! - New York, NY

10562.description: Desperate for Diapers Open Door Family Medical Centers serves hundreds of low income babies and toddlers. Keeping babies in clean diapers is a critical health need. These hardworking families struggling to make ends meet have tough choices when it comes to utilizing their funds. Please help us keep our babies and toddlers dry and healthy. How? Host a diaper drive - we need all sizes Make a personal donation of diapers Make a monetary donation specifying the diaper drive We need size 1 especially! For more information please contact Alicia Ward, Volunteer Coordinator, Open Door: Email: award@odfmc.org Phone: 914-502-1468 Let's leave no baby wet behind!
10562.title: Desperate for Diapers
10562.org: Open Door Family Medical Centers Inc

10562.description: Literacy Champion: Book Donation Manger Open Door Family Medical Centers participates in a national reading program, Reach Out and Read. The mission is to better prepare preschool children living in poverty to enter kindergarten by getting them excited about reading and educating their parent about the importance of reading aloud to their child. Book donation manager. We receive many book donations and need one or two people to: Sort the books when they come in Box by books type such as board books for toddlers, easy picture books, picture books, Step-into-Reading, easy chapter books & older chapter books. Occasionally pick up books drives from our health centers or other locations in Westchester. The book storage is located at Ossining Open Door. The other health centers are located in Sleepy Hollow, Port Chester, Mt. Kisco and Brewster. Books for our Brewster location can be delivered there or left at our Port Chester site for a staff member to bring. Notes: This would be a great volunteer position for two or three friends to take on! You need to be in good physical condition. The book storage is in the basement, so would not be great for someone with many allergies. Volunteer would need to use their own vehicle. Book sorting and drop offs would be your choice of day(s) Monday - Thursday, between 9:30am - 5:00pm Application Requirements: Complete an online Volunteer Application and if accepted, part 2 of the online Volunteer Application. All volunteers 18 years and older will have a background check performed by Open Door Medical requirements: Provide documentation of a physical exam and PPD Test (TB) not older than 12 months Provide an immunization record or documentation of blood work for titer levels Provide documentation of the seasonal flu vaccine Sign a Hepatitis B form Have two reference forms completed and submitted directly to Open Door Complete an online volunteer orientation. Complete an online safety post-test and a volunteer orientation post-test. Sign a Volunteer Service Agreement and Pledge of Confidentiality. Volunteers agree to serve a minimum of 20 hours in a 12 month period. Please contact Alicia Ward, Open Door Volunteer Coordinator with any questions: award@odfmc.org / 914-502-1468
10562.title: Literacy Champion: Book Donation Managers
10562.org: Open Door Family Medical Centers Inc

10562.description: Open Door needs 1-2 volunteers to read with preschool children and work on coloring sheets while their mother participates in a parenting class. The parent will be nearby. We will provide training in bringing a book to life for the children and how to be interactive with the story. Volunteers need to enjoy working with young children. Goals: To provide an environment to allow the mother to participate in the parenting program To encourage children to enjoy books and reading, to better prepare them to become Kindergarten Ready. This is part of our Reach Out and Read Program, a national literacy program. Coloring sheets often have targeted messages such as nutrition, wellness and self-esteem. Time: Thursdays: 1:00pm - 2:00pm Location: Ossining Open Door, 165 Main Street, Ossining, NY Call: Alicia Ward, Volunteer Coordinator for more information: 914-502-1468 Requirements to volunteer: Application Background check 2 References Medical information PPD test and Flu vaccine (free of charge from Open Door if needed) Volunteer Orientation
10562.title: Reading Volunteer for Preschool Children
10562.org: Open Door Family Medical Centers Inc

10562.description: Children who grow up with books from an early age are more prepared for kindergarten and do better in school. Please donate chubby board books for toddlers and children's picture books for preschool children! Open Door Family Medical Centers' Reach Out and Read program brings literacy to our young patients right in our waiting areas. The goal of the program is to work with children from 6 months old to 5 years old to help them be comfortable and excited about books and help them be better prepared to enter kindergarten and for life. The program is gear towards children living in poverty who have less access to have books in their home. Our reading volunteers help the children can select a book to take home each time they are at Open Door. We are in continual need chubby board books for our young patients. Please consider hosting a book drive to collect books four our youngest little patients. Contact Alicia Ward at award@odfmc.org. We have a 'How To' pamphlet if needed. Our volunteer readers program uses gently used books to read aloud with the children and help the family select a books to take home to promote reading at home. Our doctor's program uses new developmentally appropriate books during well visit from ages 6 months to 5 eyars old. Our Reach Out and Read program is part of the National Reach Out and Read program.
10562.title: Toddler Board Book Drive - We really need your help!
10562.org: Open Door Family Medical Centers Inc

10566.description: Looking for volunteers to assist with group activities or individual visits on a regular basis. Read to the visually impaired, play a board game, give a hand massage or manicure or take someone outside to smell the roses. Or teach a group how to paint, play poker, discuss current events or learn a new type of exercise.
10566.title: Make a seniors day - volunteer you time.

10566.description: Make a difference, foster innovation, and be a part of the small business and entrepreneurial boom in New York State -- volunteer with Business Mentor NY! Mentors connect with small businesses for one-on-one guidance in a range of business issues- from lending general business guidance to specialized technical advice. Business Mentor NY is designed to allow volunteers to use their skills efficiently, with maximum impact, and is also extremely flexible - you set the schedule and the expectations with your mentee. Meanwhile, our support staff is by your side every step of the way to help you succeed as a mentor. Business Mentor NY is an exciting opportunity to not only utilize your core skills to help small businesses but also drive your own professional development, hone leadership skills, and expand your skill set!
10566.title: Use your professional skills to help entrepreneurs grow!

10566.description: Looking for high school, college or other volunteers capable of tutoring students in various subjects and/or helping them with SAT prep, ACT prep, completing college applications, financial aid application FAFSA forms, as well as applications for grants and scholarships.
10566.title: Give disadvantaged bright children a Smart Start by guiding them in their quest to go to college.

07701.description: As Monmouth County’s first soup kitchen and pantry, Lunch Break freely provides life's basic necessities - food, clothing and fellowship to the community. Their mission is to alleviate hunger and lead those they serve to self-sufficiency and healthier lifestyles. They serve everyone, with compassion and dignity. Volunteers are needed to serve a meal to community members in need. The volunteers should wear jeans and sneakers. Please refrain from wearing jewelry and bringing pocketbooks. Lunch Break requires that volunteers provide additional information in order to volunteer at this opportunity. Please follow the link and provide the information requested. Volunteers who do not fill out the information requested and click submit, will not be permitted to volunteer. Link Here NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07701.title: Hunger Helpers in Red Bank

07410.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07410.title: Companionship Volunteer for Hospice

07410.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07410.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07410.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07410.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07410.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation. And mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some well needed smiles.
07410.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice

07410.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07410.title: Hospice Volunteer

07410.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
07410.title: Bergen>>>Advice Counselor

07410.description: Assist a teenage boy to build healthy relationships and develop independence while encouraging specific talents, hobbies and/or vocational interests. Our mentors are responsible, caring, adult figures with whom these teenagers can build a bridge of trust. The difference you can make in the life of a child is extraordinary.
07410.title: Male Mentors for Teenage Males in Foster Care
07410.org: Children's Aid and Family Services, Inc.

11530.description: Life's WORC is a non-profit Agency based in Garden City that provides services to disabled individuals. We are seeking a volunteer to assist in one of a few teams in our Garden City office (Franklin Avenue). If you are interested in assisting us with filing, organizing, reception, data entry and scanning 4 - 8 hrs per week (any combination of one or two days) then please apply! We need your assistance!
11530.title: Administrative Assistance Needed!

07009.description: Description Use what you have learned in the classroom to help improve the quality of life for hospice patients. Utilize free time to be compassionate and genuine in order to reduce terminally ill patients’ loneliness and isolation. Please help us keep our patients happy and comfortable as they reach the end of their life due to a variety of health conditions including: cancer, Alzheimer’s, etc. How can you benefit by being a volunteer? Build your resume: Volunteer experience shows proof of motivation, commitment, initiative, dependability, and flexibility Develop interpersonal skills Increase meaning and purpose in your life Experience significant opportunities for growth and development Responsibilities of Companion volunteers: Contribute to our patients' quality of life Attend to Patients' Needs Communicate with Nurses by keeping them Up to Date about each Patient visited Maintain Patients' Confidentiality Travel and Visit patients in facilities in an area near you Read to them, give hand massage, assist in life review or memory building We offer you: FREE TB test and MMR Titer Extremely flexible assignments (anytime you can give is greatly appreciated) Convenient Orientation and FREE training and that fits your schedule Receive Internship Credit (if applicable-unpaid)
07009.title: Great Opportunity for Healthcare Students

07002.description: Assist therapists with variety of non-therapeutic duties. Acts as an opportunity for volunteers to observe actual therapy treatment sessions. Excellent area for volunteers looking to explore potential career choice in therapy related fields. Responsibilities include organizing/straightening closets/shelves in treatment rooms. Clean/returns toys to proper locations. Assists therapists with set-up/clean-up of activities. Performs necessary office/clerical tasks including copying, filing and organizational tasks. Assists therapist with engaging patients in play activities.

07003.description: Reports to: Young Athletes program Coach Time Commitment & Training: This individual must be able to commit to the full duration of the event as scheduled. If unable to commit, please do not select this position. General Description Assist the Program Director in maintaining the flow and integrity of Young Athlete Program. Orientation will be provided on-site day of the event. Duties & Responsibilities Possible positions include: Serve as a Young Athlete escort through the various sport/motor stations Check in athletes and/or volunteers Work specifically with a sport/motor station as directed by Program Director Skills & Qualifications Excellent verbal communication is a must, as well as ensuring professional and friendly service, including the ability to multitask and respond quickly to changes in schedules and plans. Physical Requirements The usual and customary methods of performing the job's functions require the following physical demands: occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling. Generally the job requires 70% walking, 25% standing, and 5% sitting. Must be able to stand and walk the majority of the volunteer shift. Questions regarding this position should be directed to: Amy Simmons | Volunteer Director | volunteer@sonj.org
07003.title: Special Olympics New Jersey- Young Athlete Program Bloomfield

07003.description: Be a Literacy Volunteer Share the Gift of Reading, Writing, and Speaking English Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties (LVA), is a non-profit organization dedicated to helping adults improve their ability to speak, read, and write English. As an LVA volunteer, you can help people achieve a more rewarding life through weekly tutoring in reading, writing, and speaking English. We have a long list of students waiting for help. Our students are comprised both of English speakers who need help becoming proficient at reading and writing, and speakers of other languages who need help learning English. The first step to becoming an LVA tutor is to register for one of Tutor-Training Workshops. Please visit our website at www.lvaep.org or call 973-566-6200, ext 217 for more details. \"Literacy is a bridge from misery to hope.\" Kofi Annan
07003.title: Share Your Gift of Literacy
07003.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

07003.description: Give the Gift of Literacy to adults seeking to learn how to read and write English. LVA is currently accepting applications from adult volunteers from the community to serve on our Board of Trustees. Board members are responsible for setting the Goals and Policies of the organization, developing the Annual Plan, approving and monitoring the Annual Budget, hiring and evaluating the Executive Director, and for overseeing the management of the organization. This adult literacy organization has been serving the Essex County and now also the Passaic County communities since the 1980’s. It trains volunteer adults to tutor other adults in Basic Literacy and English as a Second Language. Our students realize remarkable personal achievements, like Andrea, named Literacy New Jersey's 2015 \"Student of the Year;\" Barry, an Army reservist who served in Iraq and Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, and won the first-place prize for fiction writing in the 2016 New Jersey Association for Lifelong Learning Adult Learner Writing Contest; and Barry, Fernanda and Beralia, our other writing contest winners. Our efforts have been recognized by organizations like Literacy New Jersey, which named LVA Essex & Passaic Counties the \"Outstanding Affiliate\" of 2015. If you would be interested in working with and helping this dynamic, established organization to continue to grow and serve our multicultural community, please complete the \"Prospective Board Member Profile\" @ http://www.lvaep.org/forms.html and email it to Board Development Committee at srice@lvaep.org. The Board usually meets bimonthly, September through June, on Monday evenings at the East Orange Public Library in Essex County. Prior board experience would be beneficial but not required. Most important is your desire to help us share the gift of literacy with all adults seeking to acquire or improve their English language skills to attain their own personal, educational, and career goals.
07003.title: Serve as Board of Trustees with LVA, Essex & Passaic Counties, NJ
07003.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

07003.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 2-4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
07003.title: Bloomfield, NJ: Autism Volunteer

07005.title: Hospice Volunteer

07005.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 2-4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. Thank you for your time!
07005.title: Montville, NJ: Autism Volunteer

11355.description: The Friendly Visitor Program matches homebound seniors with volunteers in the community who make weekly visits in the seniors’ homes. Friendly visiting helps relieve the senior’s social isolation and is an enriching opportunity for the volunteer to develop a meaningful friendship. Seniors and the volunteer can take part in fun activities like playing card games, discussing current events, sharing stories, learning/teaching new skills, and celebrating special days in the lives of the seniors. Your time and companionship as a friendly visitor is invaluable! We ask for a minimum commitment of six months of weekly hour-long visits. Matches are based on your availability and geographic location. Volunteers must be 18 years or older. Interview, training, references, and background check are required.
11355.title: Friendly Visiting

11355.description: Partners-In-Art: partnering with neighborhood wellness facilities seeking to serve a greater good, incorporating purposeful visual arts for patients and facility staff as a way to offer a creative experience in an untraditional environment. Creative compassion is the underlying theme, and as a Teaching Artist, you would work sometime one-on-one, or with a small group, for 60-90 mins, sharing your creative skillset(s) for a positive takeway for the adult(s). This program would be once a week at the wellness facility. You will be a TAHP Inc volunteer, but you would be required to complete an informational packet for the facility, as well as a medical form. A TB screening is also required. This is a unique initiative that will bring positivity to people often overlooked by the creative community. We welcome you to help us give them a new perspective at this facility.
11355.title: Partners In Art - Painting and/or Multi-media Teaching Artist!

11355.description: Join the NYC Compost Project team to learn how composted food scraps nourish the soil to grow healthy food in NYC. Tasks vary by event, but may include composting, sifting, weeding, harvesting, or planting activities. Space is limited and pre-registration is required. Compost sifting days mainly take place Friday mornings from 9:30 - 11:30. Preference is given to those who can commit to multiple weeks throughout the season. Small groups are welcome to apply!
11355.title: NYC Compost Project

11355.description: Job Description: As a member of the committee, you are responsible for helping to plan and prepare for The Bridge to Life’s annual gala (scheduled for April 2017) and other events Solicit in-kind sponsorships and auction items Plan and execute logistics of the event Event marketing and promotions Work with the President and Director of Development to identify prospects and relationships Work as an event volunteer the day of an contribute to the event’s overall success Required Skills, Interests or Education: Must be supportive of the mission of The Bridge to Life, a pro-life pregnancy resource center Enthusiasm for planning a charity event Attend meetings Attend event as a volunteer or paying guest Beneficial Skills, Interests or Education: Event planning and execution experience Experience with running a gala-type event Experience working with charities and volunteers Experience fundraising, obtaining corporate sponsorships or soliciting auction items and prizes
11355.title: Special Events Planning Committee Member

11355.description: The Bridge to Life seeks a development assistant volunteer who is enthusiastic and self-motivated. This person will assist with maintaining our donor database, production/editing of newsletters and grant writing. We prefer someone who is bilingual and familiar with Queens and/or Manhattan. The position reports to our Director of Development & Communications, who primarily works in our Flushing office. Hours are flexible and can include Saturday mornings. To apply, please send an email to development@thebridgetolife.org with a resume and a brief description of why you are interested in volunteering. Please note \"Development Assistant/Grant Writer\" in your email’s subject line.
11355.title: Development Assistant/Grant Writer

11355.description: The Bridge to Life seeks a graphics design volunteer to assist with the following: 1) Creation of a quarterly newsletter template 2) Development of brochures and flyers 3) Re-designing our logo 4) Updating our web site You will need your own graphic design software for this position. The position reports to our Director of Development & Communications, who primarily works in our Flushing office. Hours will vary and can include Saturday mornings. To apply, please send an email to thebridgetolife@verizon.net with a resume and a brief description of why you are interested in volunteering. Please note \"Graphic Designer\" in your email’s subject line.
11355.title: Graphics Design Volunteer

11355.description: The Bridge to Life is looking for someone to assist with managing our social media pages (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Tumblr, Pinterest and MailChimp). This is a great opportunity for a college student who is interested in learning more about nonprofits. While our schedule is flexible, we prefer a volunteer who can regularly visit our Flushing office between 11:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. on Wednesdays. Email thebridgetolife@verizon.net with a resume and brief description of why you are interested in volunteering. Please note \"Social Media Volunteer\" in the subject line of your email.
11355.title: Social Media Volunteer

11691.description: Purpose Provide companionship and create a bond with a homebound older adult through weekly visits. Friendly Visiting is a meaningful way to reach isolated seniors and to increase their engagement with the wider community. Requirements Visit a senior for 1 hour a week in their home 6 month commitment required Live in or nearby to Far Rockaway Interest in brightening the life of a senior! Skills Patience Good listening skills Reliable Experience with seniors is helpful but not required Other Flexible scheduling with a minimum commitment of one hour during a weekday. Ongoing opportunity for a required 6-month commitment Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11691.title: Friendly Visitor with Seniors - Far Rockaway

11691.description: Purpose Lead a weekly class to increase seniors’ knowledge of computers and internet applications. Most participants are at a beginner's level. Responsibilities Create weekly lessons for a small group of seniors with varied computer abilities Guide seniors step by step through Microsoft office, navigating the internet and composing emails Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Additional tasks may include assistance with cell phones and iPads Skills Have a good general knowledge of computer operations including internet applications and Microsoft Office Experience working with seniors is helpful, but not required Patience Strong communication skills Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week (Monday or Wednesday afternoons) Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11691.title: Computer Coach (Russian/English bilingual) - JASA Brookdale Village Senior Center

11691.description: Purpose Regular exercise is an essential part of a healthy lifestyle. Lead a weekly walking class for seniors to help keep them in top shape. Responsibilities Lead a group of seniors in a weekly walking-in-place class Create exercise routines suitable for varied physical abilities Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills Exercise certification Experience leading seniors in exercises Experience with group exercise classes Knowledge of several light exercise techniques Comfortable leading a group of varying skill levels Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11691.title: Walking Group Leader - JASA Brookdale Village Senior Center

11691.description: Purpose Assist with clerical and administrative tasks at JASA's Roy Reuther Senior Center Responsibilities Answer phones and greet clients warmly Assist in filing duties Prepare food and tables for lunch Assist with serving lunch Perform data entry on computer Create flyers on computer about upcoming senior center events Hang up flyers around the building Operate office machines, such as photocopiers and computers Assist with setting up chairs for exercise class Additional volunteer duties as assigned Skills Handle confidential files securely Ability to work independently and as part of a team Strong written and verbal communication skills Good organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks Friendly personality Flexibility to perform a variety of tasks on a given day Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week during business hours Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11691.title: Administrative Volunteer - JASA Roy Reuther Senior Center

07675.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07675.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07675.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07675.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07675.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation. And mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some well needed smiles.
07675.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice

07675.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07675.title: Hospice Volunteer

07675.description: Be \"on call\" for office clerical projects including, but not limited to, mailings, newsletter preparation, information packets. Provide assistance at fundraising events throughout the year.
07675.title: "On Call" Volunteer

07675.description: Volunteers are needed to attend activities/events with developmentally disabled residents who make specific preapproved requests.
07675.title: Special Request Volunteer

07675.description: Individuals are needed to visit residents at ourGlen Rock, Westwoood, Norwood, Northvale, Paramus, River Vale and Closter facilities. Visits will include socialization activities including games , computer activities, arts and crafts etc. for adults with developmental disabilities.
07675.title: Friendly Visitor

07675.description: Individuals are needed to assist clients with computer learning activities, games, arts and crafts, music , and other learning activities.
07675.title: Recreation Activity Assistant

07079.description: The NJ ARCH and KinKonnect programs of Children's Aid and Family Services, located in South Orange, NJ, is seeking an administrative volunteer to assist with clerical tasks, such as copying, organizing, and assisting with the Resource Library. Knowledge of Microsoft Office and website development a plus!
07079.title: Support Adoption Services - Administrative Support!
07079.org: Children's Aid and Family Services, Inc.

07078.description: New Eyes empowers children and adults in the United States and overseas with the improved vision they need to pursue a better quality of life for themselves, their families and their communities. New Eyes recycles donated glasses for distribution worldwide. Volunteers are needed to sort and test donated eyeglasses in to various categories, e.g. single vision, bifocal, readers. Skill Category- Groups with intellectual and developmental disabilities are not eligible to participate during this set time as the work is extremely detailed. If you are a group with intellectual and/or developmental disabilities, please contact Sally, sgolding@new-eyes.org, at New Eyes directly to set up your own volunteer times. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07078.title: Donation Sorting in Short Hills

07078.description: New Eyes for the Needy seeks to empower children and adults in the United States and overseas with the improved vision they need to pursue a better quality of life. New Eyes collects and redistributes used glasses for the those in need overseas. Bring your group to our Short Hills, NJ location on a Tuesday, Wednesday or Thursday from 12-2pm. Groups (4-8 people) will use lensometers to read prescriptions or sort/pack donated eyeglasses for distribution in developing countries. This is a rewarding opportunity for companies or groups to team-build and give back to the community.
07078.title: Volunteer as a group at New Eyes for the Needy!

07078.description: New Eyes for the Needy seeks to empower children and adults in the United States and overseas with the improved vision they need to pursue a better quality of life. New Eyes collects and redistributes used glasses for the those in need overseas. We are looking for volunteers to sort and classify donated glasses anytime on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday or Thursday mornings, 9:00am-12. Training will be provided. New Eyes is a small non-profit that offers a warm and fun atmosphere. Volunteers are the heart of our organization. Please contact us with any questions. We encourage volunteers to come for a tour and orientation at our facility to see if New Eyes is right for you!
07078.title: Eyeglasses Sorting

11040.description: Gift SHop Volunteers assist customers with merchandise, answer questions, ring sales on register as requested, restock merchandise as needed and keep shop neat and clean.
11040.title: Gift Shop Volunteer
11040.org: Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care

11040.description: Parker Jewish Institute’s Comprehensive Community Hospice has been providing highly specialized care to terminally ill patients since 1997 that welcomes volunteers of all ages and backgrounds. Hospice volunteers are a special group of people that use their time and talents to enrich the quality of life for our patients and their families as the end of life approaches. Hospice volunteers enhance the quality of life and help reduce the burden for family caregivers by providing support, assistance, in patient’s homes, in nursing homes, and assisted living facilities. To be a volunteer, there is no special requirement other than a sincere desire to help people and the ability to listen. The most important thing you can do is be there for patients to reassure them they are not alone. It is not an easy undertaking, but it can enrich your life well as patients and families. Hospice volunteers can commit to as little or as much time as they wish. Some volunteers provide several hours of service each week while others commit to a few hours each month. Serving as valued members of the hospice team, for just a few hours of your time you can make a significant impact on the lives of patients and their loved ones. There are many opportunities to share your time and talents as a volunteer and support patients, their loved ones dealing with end of life. Opportunities include: Hospice Doulas Bereavement/Grief Patient Friendly Visits Legacy Projects Administrative Support Community Education Help Recruiting Other Volunteers Note: We ask that those who have recently lost a loved one wait a year before becoming a hospice volunteer. You are welcome to participate in our bereavement programs during this time. All hospice volunteers receive extensive training. Depending the type of volunteering, training is can range from 6-18 hours. All volunteers must complete our new volunteer orientation. Those volunteers who choose to work directly with hospice patients or their loved ones must complete additional hospice specialized training.
11040.title: Hospice Volunteers Needed in Queens, NY
11040.org: Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care

11040.description: Answer phones, and take messages Greet people at window Filing documents in alphabetical order and numerical order, keep files and documents organized . Assists in making copies and scanning documents. Assists in any mailings. Able to locate files, when needed.
11040.title: Clerical Volunteer for Pharmacy Department
11040.org: Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care

11040.description: Do you want to give back to our SENIORS? Now here is an opportunity for you to be part of the AmeriCorps caregiving respite program called Willing Hearts, Helpful Hands! To qualify, you will need to: * offer respite and support services to the elderly population * volunteer 1 0-12 hours per week in your community. You will receive in return a: * monthly transportation allowance of $125.00 per month. * qualify for an educational award of $1527.78. Spaces are limited in this program. To find out how you can be a hero, contact us today at 718-289-2100 ext. 4296.
11040.title: Get Paid to Be a Hero!
11040.org: Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care

11040.description: Willing Hearts, Helpful Hands community service program of the Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation that recruits and trains volunteers to step in for the family caregivers of someone with Alzheimer’s disease and dementia. Whether you are a friend or a family member, caring for an older adult can be a challenge. There times when caregivers need a break from caregiving. Volunteers converse with their senior, reminisce, read to them, play cards/games, do puzzles, listen to music, etc. Whether you provide companionship, assist in chores, provide telephone or shopping assistance, or offer your own very special talent, you’ll be one of today’s true heroes. The Willing Hearts, Helpful Hands program is designed to allow caregivers the time, personal space and freedom that is essential for healthy living. Plus, eligible volunteers can receive a stipend to help cover travel costs. Be a hero! Volunteer today!
11040.title: Be a Hero - Provide Assistance to the Elderly
11040.org: Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care

11040.description: Make a difference in a senior's life. Willing Hearts, Helpful Hands is a volunteer-based program which aims to help seniors and their families dealing with Alzheimer's disease or other dementias. We are looking for dedicated volunteers to provide companionship through friendly visits, shopping assistance, check-in calls, and more. We match volunteers to families living on Long Island who could use a 'helpful hand.' Email or call today if you're interested in this unique opportunity to make a difference!
11040.title: Friendly Visitors Needed for Seniors! Be a Hero, Help a Senior in Your Neighborhood
11040.org: Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care

07075.description: Become a volunteer driver at EZ Ride today. You supply the time, we supply the auto and the gas, so there’s no cost to you and plenty of benefits! For as little as four hours a week, you can make a big difference in peoples’ lives. The effort isn't much: A welcome smile and a quick ride to a Doctor’s office or grocery store is what is typically assigned to our volunteers. You’ll be driving seniors who can no longer drive, and community neighbors without cars - people who are grateful for your service and value the personal connection to you. In exchange for a few hours a week, EZ Ride offers you: An easy avenue to fulfill your desire in making a difference in your community Free defensive driving course which, upon completion, may lower the cost of your personal auto insurance A free Ride for every four hours of volunteer service. You could bank your hours for a full calendar year, or transfer your rides to others Please contact Kinga Skora at 201-939-4242ext 131 or kskora@ezride.org
07075.title: Volunteer Driver

07075.description: We are inviting Volunteers to sign up and drive seniors in your community For many people, especially the elderly, lack of transportation keeps them from accessing necessary resources and services. By becoming part of our Senior Transportation Program, you can make a difference and help those less fortunate to get around. If you drive, like people and want something meaningful to do, consider providing rides for seniors in your community. We provide the car, gas and insurance Flexible Schedules with no long-term commitment Opportunity to serve Seniors in your own community Free Defensive Driving Program which may help lower your own car insurance Join our Winning Team - You can make a difference. Let us show you how. Call Kinga Skora at (201)939-4242 or email kskora@ezride.org Life’s is a journey. Make it an EZ Ride.
07075.title: Be a Volunteer Driver

07073.description: The CF Sports Challenge is a mini Olmpic-style competition where teams of ten participate in a series of fun, athletic events on the field at MetLife stadium. We need volunteers to assist with set-up, check-in, leading teams from one activity to the next, handing out t-shirts & water, clean-up, etc. Any questions please call Melissa 973-656-9200
07073.title: CF Sports Challenge at MetLife Stadium
07073.org: Cystic Fibrosis Foundation Greater New Jersey

07073.description: Volunteers Needed for various areas including but not limited to: Directional Water Stations 5K Run Cheerleaders Breakdown of event (apx 11am-1230pm only) Tshirt stations After-party celebration Set-up of materials if needed etc. Please click THIS LINK to sign-up via Google Docs: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScrD_B7N-z1MsDy1Fu5UE2bu5LFlgJjWu_U4ZwpcbOhUxv7qw/viewform?c=0&w=1

07073.description: Photography volunteers needed! This year's theme is SUPERSTARS, so we are recreating the stardom world and need \"papparazi\" to be present throughout the event. Would love to work with local schools or photography classes who need experience or service hours in the field. We welcome individuals or companies as well who want to volunteer their time with us. You can fill out the Google Docs form as well to sign up as a volunteer & select \"Photography\" from the options: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScrD_B7N-z1MsDy1Fu5UE2bu5LFlgJjWu_U4ZwpcbOhUxv7qw/viewform?c=0&w=1
07073.title: Photographer Volunteers for Annual Walk/5K Run Event

07981.description: Pet therapy is proven to provide therapeutic effects and elicit positive emotions. This is a fun and popular project that is great for your whole family. If you enjoy showing off your pet and spending time with others, then Pet Therapy in Hanover is the project for you. If you own a pet and know your animal can bring joy to everyone, please bring them along to make friends with the residents. Although, pets DO NOT have to be \"certified\", all pets must have proof of an up to date rabies vaccination. Please bring a copy of this certificate to keep on file. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07981.title: Pet Therapy in Hanover

07981.description: Games Galore and More is a team of volunteers who assist the staff of a long-term care senior facility with fun activities while engaging residents in meaningful and friendly conversation, board and card games and reading to the residents. This is a wonderful opportunity to brighten the life of someone who may normally not have the opportunity to connect with others outside of their families and the organization's staff. This is the perfect project for individuals, families, friends and loved ones. Volunteer today and let the games begin! You are welcome to bring you own games or use the Wii gaming system to play the following games: Family Game Night Sports Resort Party Also, calling all musicians who would like to perform informally for the residents. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07981.title: Games Galore and More in Hanover

11710.description: Help others and make a real difference! Long Island Crisis Center (Bellmore, NY) is seeking volunteers for its 24/7 Crisis Intervention & Suicide Prevention hotlines. All you need to start is the desire to help and time to give. You do not need any previous experience. LICC provides a free, comprehensive training program to all volunteers. For more information, please visit our website at longislandcrisiscenter.org/get-involved To schedule your volunteer interview, please call our business line at 516-826-0244 ABOUT LONG ISLAND CRISIS CENTER Long Island Crisis Center provides 24/7, free, high quality, confidential and non-judgmental programs and services to support and empower Long Islanders at critical times in their lives. These include our 24/7 hotlines, our community education workshops, and our Pride for Youth LGBTQ programs.
11710.title: Make a Difference As a Crisis Hotline Volunteer

11714.description: Accepting/Returning phone calls & emails from donors *Providing list of on-going In-Kind Needs when requested by donor *Arranging drop off of donations *Sorting, Storing, Distributing In-Kind donations *Throwing out used/poor condition donations
11714.title: In-Kind Donations

11714.description: Volunteers at the shelter are needed help out in a variety of ways which vary based on individual talents, interests and needs of the program. Anyone volunteering is at the shelter expected to keep the location confidential. Services include but are not limited to: Answer the phone and door. Interaction with clients. Organize and replenish the clothing closet. Outreach for and pickup clothing donations. Food shop and run other errands for the house. Cover for the House Manager when out on break Attending to the daily needs of the clients. Clean, organize and inventory the playroom. Perform other functions as determined between a volunteer and the Coordinator. Hours are 11AM - 3PM. Volunteers will report to the House Coordinator. More than one volunteer may be needed to cover the Monday through Saturday shifts.
11714.title: Shelter Home Volunteer

11714.description: THE TERRY FUND IS LOOKING FOR INDIVIDUALS TO HELP IN OUR WAREHOUSE, OFFICE AND AT PUBLIC EVENTS. WE NEED DRIVERS WHO CAN PICK UP AND DROP OFF NEEDED EMERGENCY GEAR TO FIRST RESPONDERS IN THE NEW YORK METRO AREA. WE NEED YOUNG ADULTS WHO WOULD LIKE TO HELP WITH THE WAREHOUSE AND GIVING OUT GEAR AND EQUIPMENT TO NEEDY FIRST RESPONDERS. WE SEEK VOLUNTEERS WHO CAN DONATE 4 TO 8 HOURS PER MONTH AT OUR BETHPAGE LOCATION OR WHO CAN HELP ON OUR TRAVEL TEAM WHEN WE DO SHOWS ON LONG ISLAND AND ACROSS THE REGION. WE ONLY WANT THOSE WHO KNOW HOW TO HAVE FUN AND KEEP IT LITE. WE LOOK FOR ADMINISTRATIVE HELP IN OUR OFFICE DURING THE DAY OR HELP WITH THE BUILDING INVENTORY ON WEEKENDS. IF YOU HAVE ALWAYS WANTED TO BE INVOLVED WITH THE EMERGENCY SERVICES AND WANT TO HELP GREAT FOLKS CONTACT US AT 631-846-2742 OR AMTUCKER @TERRYFUND.ORG THANK YOU
11714.title: VOULUNTEERS NEEDED TO HELP THOSE WHO HELP OUR COMMUNITIES

11714.description: Volunteers provide oversite of the Child Waiting Room while family members receive agency services. Typically children between the ages of 2 and teen years may be waiting for about an hours while their parent is in a session. Oversight may include reading to smaller children, assisting school age children with homework, playing games and attending to specific needs.
11714.title: Child Waiting Room

11714.description: Volunteers represent The Safe Center at health and/or information fairs located throughout Nassau County to provide information on programs and services, as well as information on domestic violence, child abuse and neglect, dating violence, sexual assault and elder abuse. Volunteers work with the agency's Education Department to advance the cause against family violence through awareness and education.
11714.title: Community Outreach

11714.description: Volunteers Needed to Work with Victims of Rape, Sexual Assault and/or Domestic Violence The Safe Center LI (TSCLI) provides resources for victims of rape, sexual assault and/or domestic violence at all the Nassau County Hospitals. TSCLI connects victims to advocates through the SAFER Program (Survivors Advocate For Emergency Response). This program makes it possible for trained volunteers to provide support and advocacy for victims in hospitals. TSCLI is looking for volunteers to be on-call and respond to the hospitals in Nassau County for victims of rape, sexual assault and/or domestic violence. Intense training is required and will be provided by TSCLI. For more information on becoming a SAFER volunteer please call 516-465-4700 and ask for the Education Department.
11714.title: Hospital Advocacy (SAFER Volunteer: Survivors Advocate for Emergency Response)

11714.description: THE TERRY FUND IS A ALL VOLUNTEER FORCE OF INDIVIDUALS WHO SEEK VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST AT TRADE SHOWS AND FESTIVALS, DRIVE OUR TRUCKS IN PARADES AND ASSIST WITH OUR SURPLUS GEAR PROGRAM WHICH BRINGS NEEDED FIRE SERVICE GEAR AND EQUIPMENT TO RURAL AND NEEDY DEPARTMENTS. WE ARE LOOKING FOR INDIVIDUALS INTERESTED IN WORKING WITH THE EMERGENCY SERVICES COMMUNITY WHO CAN DONATE 4 TO 8 HOURS PER MONTH. WE HAVE A JOB FOR EVERYONE FROM WORKING IN OUR OFFICE OR WAREHOUSE, DRIVING AND PICKING UP GEAR TO WORKING SHOWS AND EVENTS WE ATTEND. WE TRY TO MAKE IT FUN AND NOT WORK AND YOU MEET SOME OF THE BEST FOLKS IN THE WORLD FROM THE FIRST RESPONDER COMMUNITY. WE KEEP IT FUN AND YOU MEET SOME GREAT PEOPLE. WWW.TERRFUND.ORG 631-846-2742 OR EMAIL amtucker@TERRYFUND.ORG
11714.title: HELP US TO HELP THOSE WHO SERVE OUR COMMUNITIES

10065.description: Learning Leaders is looking for BookTalk Volunteers to serve in NYC public schools on the Upper East Side. Volunteers would be responsible for reading chapter books throughout the year and faciliating a book discussion with students in grades 3-5. BookTalk volunteers meet once a week for the entire school year and work with small groups to discuss some of the central themes of the book. Volunteers will be helping to lead a book club at these schools. These opportunities take place during lunch time on various days. We have placements available at various school on the Upper East Side. Please contact us to learn more about this opportunity. Training begins in October.
10065.title: BookTalk Volunteer

10065.description: Help your community to stop food waste and fight hunger by bringing excess food to homeless shelters. You will be taking bags of excess food, which would have been thrown out by the restaurant, to the nearest homeless shelter. This is a great opportunity to gain community service experience while helping others at the same time!!!! Please sign up for events directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10065.title: Stop Food Waste & Help Feed The Hungry!

10065.description: Help your community to stop food waste and fight hunger by bringing excess food to homeless shelters.
