10065.description: The City Tutors is seeking an individual who will support the communications unit of The City Tutors. Note: Much of the work can be done virtually with some visits to campus. Goals: promote The City Tutors brand, allowing us to reach more prospective tutors and partners profile current and past City Tutors to help build stronger ties between tutors develop original content that grows our social media audience educate on and promote issues that we are tackling through our programs We are seeking someone who is in NYC to Write stories about CT that will be featured on our Facebook and website Create a newsletter covering events from summer and the fall semester Interview tutors for a \"Spotlight on a Tutor\" series Collaborate with our nascent Hunter chapter as they develop coherent marketing strategies Promote our partnerships with different educational sites Update website, and run our Twitter feed
10065.title: Marketing/Communications Intern

10065.description: The City Tutors (CT) is working with College Now to support students in their Saturday Human Biology course. We are currently looking for two embedded tutors to support two sections of this course. This is a great opportunity for a student studying science education or interested in tutoring science. In this role, you would work collaboratively with an instructor to improve students’ performance, while being supported and guided by an experienced academic support professional. As a tutor for the biology course in College Now, you would commit to three hours on Saturday, broken down as the last two hours of the 9-1:20PM course with the possibility of an extra hour after class. You would identify and support students who are struggling, participate during the lecture to support the class on the whole, and provide feedback to the instructor regarding students' concerns and difficulties that can lead to changes in future lessons. You might also design assignments, identify/track students who are struggling and create for them differentiated instruction. CT's embedded tutoring program has been successful in helping students gain access to support that they otherwise could not receive given their limited availability to be on campus Saturdays. Having a tutor in the class early in the semester will allow us to push to reduce withdrawals and student failure rates. Your work would not only help the class, but help us improve this model so that we can expand it across all the courses within College Now, and across departments where appropriate as well. To apply, you must: have received an A- or A in introduction to biology have a GPA at or above 3.2, or have completed a degree in biology/other natural sciences submit biweekly reports, and meet through Google Hangout/in person with the director on a biweekly basis. be willing to complete 10 hours of College Reading and Learning Aligned (CRLA) training. Training days will be determined based on your schedule and that of the Tutor Training Coordinators.
10065.title: Saturday Biology Classroom Tutor for College Now

10065.description: The City Tutors seeks an individual who could come in once or twice a week for 5-7 hours to assist tutors with their professional development. This opportunity should be of particular interest to individuals desiring to enter career counseling, human resources or social work as a profession. Job Description: Assist tutors with resume and cover letter development, applications for scholarships/fellowships/graduate programs, personal statements, interviewing preparation Work closely with a licensed social work to create professional action plans for tutors. Maintain accurate case notes at all times Schedule appointments Occasionally participate in new tutor training classes and other events as supporting staff
10065.title: Professional Development Coach

10065.description: Become a chapter leader at your campus, creating a program that supports your campus and the local community. Leave a lasting imprint on your campus and take advantage of the resources and support CT will provide.
10065.title: Start Your Own Chapter of The City Tutors!

10065.description: Every year, hundreds of students visit the MVHMG to learn about the history of New York City. Volunteer educators facilitate our classes that are developmentally appropriate for each age group and allow children to learn about social history during the 1820s and 30s, a time of important changes and growth for the city. Topics include immigration, urbanization, industrialization, diversity, and changing technology. While we provide training, we ask that educators have previous experience working with children. MVHMG volunteers need to be dependable, flexible, and have a sense of humor. They should be able to stand for periods of time and be able to walk up stairs. After training, volunteers need to teach at least three days a month for at least a year. Volunteers need email and internet access. Benefits: Training in interactive, informal teaching skills; complimentary admission to many NYC museums via Museum ID card; museum shop discount; and the opportunity to work with people interested in historic sites, teaching, and children's learning. The Mount Vernon Hotel Museum & Garden (MVHMG) preserves and interprets travel, leisure, work and play in diverse antebellum New York. The Museum shares and promotes historical knowledge for the education and enjoyment of the public through engaging interpretation and programs. The Museum presents its 1799 building and grounds as the Mount Vernon Hotel, which served day customers and travelers from 1826 to 1833.
10065.title: Volunteer Educator

10065.description: CT is partnered with Manhattan International High School (located at 317 East 67 th Street), which serves students who have been in the country for five or less years. CT provides volunteer Reading and Writing tutors (who are trained during the course of their tutoring) to support students in their preparation for the Regents Exam, the statewide high school exit examination. Reading and Writing tutoring takes place at the high school on Thursdays 3PM-4PM. If you are interested in becoming a reading/writing tutor, please send thenycitytutors@gmail.com your unofficial (online) transcript from all colleges and/or universities you have attended, along with your resume. If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to email thenycitytutors@gmail.com. You can visit CT’s website www.thecitytutors.com for more information.
10065.title: Reading/Writing Tutor Needed

10065.description: The City Tutors (thecitytutors.com) seeks individuals to fill key administrative positions across the organization. We are currently seeking: Professional Case Managers (should be interested or have a background in social work/professional development) Marketing Agents (outgoing and proactive!) Online Content Managers (aggregating and presenting artifacts of our work and articles/policy issues/trends relevant to our work) Original Online Content Creators (including investigative and editorial writers) Videographer (need to know Final Cut Pro, and own your own camera) Tutor Trainers Supplemental Instruction Supervisors
10065.title: Administrative position available. We will tailor to your interests and goals!

10065.description: Tutor a subject of your choosing for City College's College Now, a CUNY wide program that provides high school students the opportunity to take college classes for college credit; Black Male Initiative RAPSI (Retention, Achievement, Professionalism Success Institute), which mentors and provides tutoring for minority students at risk of dropping out; Manhattan International High School, which serves students who have been in the country for five or less years; or Pre-Law Program and Economics/Business Department at City College.
10065.title: Become a tutor for a subject of your choosing

08873.description: My name is Michelle and I am a Host Family Coordinator with AnB Education. We are a Non-Profit Organization looking for willing host families in your area. We wanted to reach out with this opportunity to host an international exchange student in your local community. Every year thousands of host families across the United States welcome International Exchange Students, AnB Education is grateful to be working with hundreds of host families across the country. An exchange student not only attends school, but becomes immersed in our world. Host families welcome a new sons, daughters, sisters and brothers from across the world. To us Host Families, you, are an essential part of helping create a better world! Through the personal relationships, language and cultural immersion we can help teach tomorrow’s leaders today. Students provide for all their own financial needs, and host families are supported with a generous monthly reimbursement. Our International students need . . . -A caring and friendly host family who is willing to provide quiet space for studying, access to TV and internet, and access to laundry facilities. - A home where English is the primary language spoken -A private bedroom (not in the basement please) and a shared or private bathroom in a safe and clean environment. -Breakfast and dinner meals with host family during the week. (The student would buy their lunch at school) and 3 meals during the weekend. (Most international students like to share meals with their American hosts every day. They benefit from speaking English in relaxed, natural situations outside of their English courses. ) http://www.anbeducation.com/become-a-host-family.html
08873.title: Host Families Needed for International High School Students

08873.description: Companion Volunteer needed for Hospice Patient. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. We're looking for a volunteer to dedicate their time during the weekend. All Modalities are welcome. Reiki / Massage Therapy Music Therapy Companionship
08873.title: Weekend Companion Volunteer Needed

08873.description: If you have a passion for cooking and enjoy seeing the fruits of your labor, then Cooking Creations in Somerset County is the project for you. Midland Adult Services (MAS) was established to provide high quality community housing, job training and placement services, as well as social and recreational experiences to support and enrich the lives of adults with special needs. Volunteers are needed to help cook, prepare and serve a meal for approximately 15 residents. Note: The goal is to educate residents with special needs how to prepare healthy and easy to make meals. Please email the Project Coordinator (Opportunity Leader) for more information. Its the Project Coordinator who sets the menu a week in advance. This project is best suited for adult volunteers. Thank you! NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
08873.title: Cooking Creations in Somerset County

08873.description: Homeside Hospice is looking for volunteers to provide Music Therapy to our patients in assisted living and in nursing homes in Somerset County. If you are a Music Therapist, you can provide a loving experience for patients in lifes final journey. As a volunteer you will provide essential, quality of life services to patients. Your efforts will provide the sort of care and help that a loving friend provides and help insure that the Hospice promise is fulfilled. Music Therapy Students Welcome!
08873.title: Music Therapy Volunteers needed in Somerset County

08873.description: Stein Hospice is dedicated to bringing professional comfort care to terminally ill patients and their families. Even after the death of a patient, our team of social workers, chaplains and volunteers support the family and caregivers during their bereavement. We are looking for a trained social worker or psychologist, social work or psychology student who is interested in volunteering to make follow up bereavement calls to grieving family members. Your concern, support and objective listening skills can help people find their way through their loss. We could also use a computer savvy person to help maintain our database of bereaved loved ones and update on a regular basis.
08873.title: Volunteer, Student or Professional, Social Work or Psychology Background Needed

08873.description: Stein Hospice provides expert comfort care at home and in facilities to patients who are in the last few months or weeks of their lives. Comfort includes supporting the patient with the things they love, whether music, flowers, art, good conversation or simple volunteer compansionship. Right now Stein Hospice is looking for pet therapy trained dog and owner teams who are willing to learn about hospice and visit our patients at home and/or in facilities. Please contact us to learn more about the good work you can do and the smiles you can bring to a homebound, bedbound or chairbound patient.
08873.title: Pet Therapy Teams Needed!  Dog loving hospice patients would love a visit from you!

08873.description: Stein Hospice cares for elderly patients who would benefit from a friendly visitor. Many seniors are most comfortable talking in the language of their youth. If you speak Yiddish or Russian please contact us for a very rewarding volunteer experience! Our patients live in nursing homes and private homes throughout Union, Middlesex, Somerset and Monmouth counties.
08873.title: Do you speak Russian or Yiddish? Bring Caring Words to A Hospice Patient

08873.description: Your role as a \"NJO Coach\" is critical to the success of our oratorical and reading literacy program. You are responsible for preparing our Orators to have confidence in themselves when speaking and writing. They learn from you skills and techniques of public speaking and reading/writing literacy and demonstrate them at competitions and community presentations. We train all our NJO Coaches. Responsibilities: Meet with students on a weekly basis to train them on developing public speaking and literacy skills. Register and track students in that chapter. Prepare them for community presentations and attendance at two annual statewide competitions.
08873.title: NJO Coach

08873.description: Your role as a \"NJO Judge\" is critical to the success of our oratorical and reading literacy program. You are responsible for providing independent, unbiased critiques to our Orator students who have demonstrated to you at competition their public speaking skills. We train all our NJO Judges. Responsibilities: Provide written critiques on the performances of students' presentations at the NJO competitions. As an independent Judge trained in our program, NJO Judges attend 4 competitions a year and provide objective feedback to Coaches, Orators, and parents about the Orator's performance and grasp of oratorical skills.
08873.title: NJO Judge

08873.description: Stein Hospice is looking for caring volunteers to visit with our terminally ill patients. As a caring companion you can bring a cheerful change in a dreary day. Your visit will also help relieve stressed family members and caregivers. Bring your compassionate nature into the lives of others and make a difference!
08873.title: Are you compassionate? Become a Stein Hospice Volunteer and make a difference!

08873.description: Bereavement phone calls are made from our office to check in on husbands and wives, children and friends of our deceased hospice patients. They require tender attention and are appreciative of the calls to check in on them and see how they are during their grieving. Scripted questions will be provided to assist you. Our social worker and chaplain will help train you.
08873.title: Are you calm and compassionate? Have a good phone voice? Become a support to a bereaved person.

08873.description: Are you compassionate, a good listener, comfortable with older people? If yes, Martin and Edith Stein Hospice is looking for you. Join our team of trained volunteers, nurse case managers, social worker, chaplain and aides. Offer non-medical support to patients and their families by becoming a regular friendly visitor. We are a faith based nonprofit hospice caring for patients throughout southern Union, Middlesex, Somerset and northern Monmouth counties.
08873.title: Bring a smile to a senior!  Become a hospice companion.

08873.description: Do you want to make a difference in someone's day? Martin and Edith Stein Hospice gives loving attention and professional care to terminally ill patients. We need compassionate volunteers to offer nonmedical one-on-one visits to our patients. If you can read aloud, listen sympathetically or simply hold a hand you can bring comfort into our patients' lives. Join our caring team of nurses, aides, social worker, chaplain, doctors and other amazing volunteers and help improve the quality of life for hospice patients and their families.
08873.title: Hospice Patient Companion

08873.description: Your role as a \"NJO Coach\" is critical to the success of our oratorical and reading literacy program. You are responsible for preparing Orator students in chapter locations to have confidence at all times when speaking or writing. We train all our NJO Coaches. They learn from you the skills and techniques of public speaking and writing literacy. Responsibilities: Meet with students on a weekly basis to train them on developing public speaking and literacy skills. Register and track students at an assigned chapter. Prepare students for community presentations and attendance at two annual statewide competitions with their peers.
08873.title: Teach confidence in speaking. Become a NJO Coach

08875.description: Help us, Help our Neighbors! With the increased demand for our services in the past few years, we need your help more than ever! We have many volunteer opportunities available to suit individuals, families, and even large corporate groups. Whether you are looking to give back to your community or just have a few hours and would like to do something productive, the Franklin Food Bank has a volunteer opportunity for you. Volunteers assist with sorting, packaging, and distribution of food. Most jobs needed must be able to lift up to 15lbs and be comfortable standing during their shift. Volunteers are needed for 2-3 hours Monday-Thursday from the hours of 9am-3pm.
08875.title: Help us provide food to those in need in Franklin Township

08875.description: The Franklin Food Bank needs your help! We are currently looking for a volunteer to asssit our delivery driver Monday,Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday from the hours of 9am-3pm. If you are avaialble on one or all of these days each week and would like to help the Food Bank plesae contact us today. Volunteers for this opportunity must be able to lift 50+pounds. A valid driver's license is not required but it is preferred. Tasks/Duties -Assist driver with pick ups from various business -Assist in loading and unloading vans -Assist in stocking shelves and sorting donation
08875.title: Help our Drivers help those in need in Franklin Township

Respond to community and larger disasters, support response as a member of a regional task group OPEN TIME DAYS Local response｠- Disaster Action Team (DAT)- on call weekdays, weekends and holidays; allowances can be made to account for volunteers' work schedules.｠Three shifts a month required. Regional and state deployment - requires｠a minimum of｠one week. Deployment outside of NJ｠- requires a minimum of two weeks Regional Task Group｠- attend meetings as scheduled and work with the group as needed REQUIRED TRAINING Orientation to the American Red Cross is required. Disaster training is required, provided free of charge and is web-based and/or instructor-led in a classroom.｠ Initial basic courses include: Disaster Services: An Overview Disaster Action Team Fundamentals Shelter Fundamentals Feeding Fundamentals Casework and Recovery Planning Fundamentals Disaster Assessment Fundamentals Other courses are required for specific response roles.｠
08876.title: Respond to disasters: Disaster Responder Trainee
08876.org: American Red Cross - New Jersey Region

08876.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE Be a part of our new team forming to work on both Red Cross and non-Red Cross exercises and the evaluations of said exercises. If you want to participate on the team for creating exercise documents, conducting/controlling/evaluating exercises in our regi OPEN TIME DAYS 3-5 hours per month, plus 6-10 hours per quarter on exercises. Note some exercises may be scheduled during evenings and/or weekends. REQUIRED TRAINING Orientation to American Red Cross  Disaster Services: An Overview Disaster Services Basic Courses (Online) Fundamental Series
08876.title: Join the North Jersey Region's Disaster Exercise Team: Exercise-Evaluation Team: Trainee
08876.org: American Red Cross - New Jersey Region

08876.description: Sexual Assault Support Services (SASS) at Zufall Health - Somerville serves as Somerset County's ONLY sexual violence/rape crisis program. We provide the county's 24-hour confidential hotline, accompaniments with survivors of sexual violence to the hospital and/or prosecutor's office and/or police station, crisis intervention, information, referral, and support. Services are also available for family, significant others, and loved ones of survivors. All interested individuals, after interviewing and acceptance into the program, will need to complete a 40-hour training over the course of 3 months. THe next training will take place starting in January 2017. Once training is completed, volunteer advocates are qualified to provide assistance through hotline support and accompaniments when requested. Advocates must make a one year commitment and take at least 1 shift per quarter and a total of at least 10 shifts in one year. For more information, please contact SASS at (908) 526-2335 ext. 132, email at chowley@zufallhealth.org. Biligual Spanish/English and Male advocates are especially needed.
08876.title: Sexual Assault Support Services Advocate
08876.org: Zufall Health Center Inc.

08876.description: Volunteer: Seeking volunteers with a heart for children to help implement programs to serve abused and/or neglected children in Somserset county, New Jersey. We need all types of skills, marketing, technology, fundraising, clerical, creative thinkers. If you have a heart for children and live in Somerset county, NJ Children's Hope Initiative is the volunteer opportunity for you.
08876.title: Make a difference - Help a child
08876.org: Children's Hope Initiative

08876.description: Catholic Charities Connections Program is actively recruiting volunteers to work as mentors with children ages 5-17. Mentors offer support, guidance, and education as a youth goes through a difficult time, faces new challenges or opportunities, or takes on an important task. A mentor is a person who is willing to share their life-long expertise to provide support to the youth. Mentors can play an important role as the youth develops mentally and emotionally to help a youth understand their goals and personal needs. Mentors must be a minimum of 18 years of age. Prospective mentors will undergo an intensive screening process consisting of: application and informal autobiography, personal interview, reference checks, criminal background check, driving record check and program orientation. The program serves youth in Middlesex County. Mentoring is the process of sharing personal knowledge and skills with a young person.
08876.title: Mentoring Youth
08876.org: Catholic Charities

08879.description: Life Choice Hospice seeks volunteers in South Amboy, NJ to participate in their volunteer program. As little as 1-2 hours per week is helpful. Life Choice Hospice serves patients in assisted livings, nursing homes, or in their own homes. Volunteers will learn about hospice services, and how to provide non-medical visits to people with a life limiting illness. They will gain an understanding of the special needs of people with Alzheimer's and Dementia. Through your commitment to Life Choice Hospice, you can impact patients in extraordinary ways! What can volunteers do? Make friendly visits Provide caregiver relief and respite Complementary Therapy such as Reiki, Massage, and Pet Therapy Read Listen Share a special talent like music or art Administrative support What do we provide? An increase in your life satisfaction Free training at your convenience Free health evaluation and TB tests Free flu shots (during flu season) Ongoing educational opportunities Social activities and events
08879.title: Life Choice Hospice Seeks Volunteer Team Members in South Amboy!

08879.description: Contact us for more information on working with hospice patients close to where you live. We provide FREE volunteer training for you along with free TB and Rubella/Rubeola testing. Your pet will need to be a certified pet therapy animal. You and your pet will bring joy and love to the lives of our patients and will receive so much love and joy in return!
08879.title: Share your pet's unconditional love with hospice patients!

06854.description: We have many events through out the year in Norwalk, Stamford and Greenwich. This month, we are looking for volunteers for our Community Event. We are looking for volunteers to contribute about 1 hour a week to participate in setting up the event, performing important tasks which include registration, community outreach, amongst others. If you are located in South Norwalk or the surrounding area and are interested in this opportunity, please sign up!!
06854.title: Community Event

06854.description: Family & Children's Agency is seeking individuals to make a difference in the lives of middle school students by volunteering in FCA's ASPIRE after school program starting this September 2016. Come join a dynamic team of committed volunteers who provide guidance and homework help at FCA's program located on the campus of Norwalk Community College from 3:30 to 5:30 p.m. during the academic year. No experience is necessary and volunteers can choose to volunteer one afternoon a week, Monday through Friday for a minimum of three months (academic year preferred). Adults and high school students are eligible for volunteering. Fridays will purely be academics from 3:30 - 4:30. Program Information Family & Children’s Agency seeks to improve the lives of Norwalk’s middle school youth by enabling their successful transition into high school and increasing their ability to be productive, independent young adults. This is accomplished by providing a safe and structured community-based After School Program for students to improve academic performance, develop character, and promote healthy peer interactions and lifestyles. The program operates on the school calendar and does not offer programs during holidays and vacations. Requirements To become a volunteer in the After School Program, volunteers must complete an application and necessary background checks, including criminal, state, and Department of Children and Families checks. Volunteers must also complete an Agency orientation with Volunteer Services and a program orientation with the After School Program staff. Family & Children’s Agency expects volunteers to commit to one afternoon a week for a minimum of three months. However, volunteers are encouraged to commit for the academic year. Many volunteers have seasonal activities or commitments and time off can be arranged to accommodate these activities. Skills Needed: Positive role model Desire to work with children Patience Good judgment Dependability/consistency Cultural sensitivity/awareness Ability to maintain appropriate boundaries Clean background check Family & Children’s Agency is a leading non-profit, human service organization that is committed to increasing the social and emotional well-being of our clients. We provide strength-based, solution focused services that respond to the individual needs of children & families, youth, adults, and seniors. Last year more than 10,000 individuals of all ages and all walks of life experienced life-altering, positive changes as a result of their work with Family & Children’s Agency.
06854.title: After School Homework Helpers & Program Support Volunteers Needed!

06854.description: Volunteers Needed for the Relay For Life of Greenwich 2016-2017! Relay For Life is the American Cancer Society's signature fundraising event and is the number one fundraiser aimed at eliminating cancer in the world. Each year, four million people at over 6,000 events in 24 countries participate in this walk to fight against this disease that takes too much from too many. Relay For Life events raise critical funds that fuel the mission of the American Cancer Society, an organization that touches the lives of so many. Relay For Life events not only raise money for cancer research, but for services that focus on improving a cancer patient's quality of life as well as cancer prevention and early detection programs. The Relay of Life of Greenwich is looking for some passionate, energetic, movers and shakers to become a part of our Event Leadership Team! This team plans and executes the Relay For Life of Greenwich. Event logistics, recruiting teams to join us on the track, marketing the event, planning our cancer survivor reception, creating and facilitating event ceremonies, scheduling entertainment and activities - these are just a few of the many opportunities and responsibilities taken on by our team of dedicated volunteers aimed at eliminating cancer once and for all! It only takes a LITTLE time and a BIG heart! Being on the Event Leadership team involves... 1. Attending planning meetings once a month 2. Spreading the word about Relay 3. Encouraging people to sign-up 4. Coming up with creative ideas 5. Planning fundraisers 6. Helping with the event day-of 7. Having FUN! If you have a passion to end cancer, then please join us by filling out our Survey at http://www.relayforlifegreenwich.org/ (takes 5 mintes!) or contacting Grace Scinto at grace.scinto@cancer.org. Join us in helping create a world with more birthdays and less cancer!
06854.title: Volunteers Needed for the Relay For Life of Greenwich 2017!

06854.description: Norwalk Community Health Center is looking for members to join its development committee. Purpose Provide oversight and guidance to the Board to develop resources and philanthropic revenue that ensures Norwalk Community Health Center has the financial ability to carry out its mission. Skills, Attributes and Prerequisites Understanding of and commitment to the vision, mission and goals of Norwalk Community Health Center Willingness to make a personal annual contribution to Norwalk Community Health Center Willingness to be an ambassador for Norwalk Community Health Center in the larger community Primary Roles and Responsibilities Formulate fundraising goals and action plans, in concert with staff, to support the organization’s short and long-range goals and objectives. Recommend fundraising goals to Board for approval. Monitor and regularly report progress of development initiatives to the Board. Assist in identifying, cultivating, and soliciting prospects. Determine whether a potential donor’s interests, skills, and values match those of opportunities at Norwalk Community Health Center, and if so, consider asking them to join the Development Committee. Help plan and implement fundraising and awareness raising events.
06854.title: Development Committee Members

06854.description: Norwalk Community Health Center is seeking boards members with finance, CPA, marketing, legal, and human resources skills. Position Summary: NCHC Board members are trustees who act on behalf of NCHC’s constituents, including service recipients, funders, the government, and taxpayers. The Board of Directors has the principal responsibility for fulfillment of the organization's mission and the legal accountability for its operations. Responsibilities (including but not limited to): As a group, the Board is in charge of: Establishing a clear organizational mission Forming the strategic plan to accomplish the mission Overseeing and evaluating the plan's success Hiring a competent chief executive officer and providing adequate direction and support to that individual Ensuring financial solvency of the organization Interpreting and representing the community to the organization, and Instituting a fair system of policies and procedures for human resource management.
06854.title: Board Members

06854.description: Volunteers Needed for the Relay For Life of Naugatuck Valley 2016-2017! Relay For Life is the American Cancer Society's signature fundraising event and is the number one fundraiser aimed at eliminating cancer in the world. Each year, four million people at over 6,000 events in 24 countries participate in this walk to fight against this disease that takes too much from too many. Relay For Life events raise critical funds that fuel the mission of the American Cancer Society, an organization that touches the lives of so many. Relay For Life events not only raise money for cancer research, but for services that focus on improving a cancer patient's quality of life as well as cancer prevention and early detection programs. The Relay of Life of Naugatuck Valley is looking for some passionate, energetic, movers and shakers to become a part of our Event Leadership Team! This team plans and executes the Relay For Life of Naugatuck Valley. Event logistics, recruiting teams to join us on the track, marketing the event, planning our cancer survivor reception, creating and facilitating event ceremonies, scheduling entertainment and activities - these are just a few of the many opportunities and responsibilities taken on by our team of dedicated volunteers aimed at eliminating cancer once and for all! It only takes a LITTLE time and a BIG heart! Being on the Event Leadership team involves... 1. Attending planning meetings once a month 2. Spreading the word about Relay 3. Encouraging people to sign-up 4. Coming up with creative ideas 5. Planning fundraisers 6. Helping with the event day-of 7. Having FUN! If you have a passion to end cancer, then please contact Grace Scinto at grace.scinto@cancer.org. Join us in helping create a world with more birthdays and less cancer!
06854.title: Volunteers Needed for the Relay For Life of Naugatuck Valley 2017!

06854.description: EVENT LEAD ROLE: Serves as the face and voice of the American Cancer Society and Relay For Life of Greenwich event within the community to lead and manage by empowering the Relay For Life Event Leadership Team (Planning Committee). Individuals in this role possess strong leadership and interpersonal skills, are outgoing, and are knowledgeable about the American Cancer Society and Relay For Life program (mission, history, accomplishments, format, and purpose). Primary responsibilities for individuals in this role are to mentor and guide the Event Leadership Team in fulfilling their responsibilities and achieving goals for the Relay event within their community. SPECIFIC TASKS CAN INCLUDE: * Work with the Relay For Life Staff Partner to ensure that training of roles and resources takes place. * Communicate regularly with the People Lead, Experience Lead, Fund the Cure Lead, as well as the Relay For Life Staff Partner. * Work with People Lead, Experience Lead and the Fund the Cure Lead to ensure partnership agreements are completed for all positions. * Mentor and lead income and non-income planning and goal-setting initiatives in partnership with Relay For Life Staff Partner and Event Leadership Team. * Meet monthly or bi-monthly with the Relay For Life Staff Partner, People Lead, Experience Lead and Fund the Cure Lead to discuss benchmark goals and progress. * Lead and manage Event Leadership Team workshops, meetings, and other sub-leadership team meetings as needed. * In partnership with the Relay For Life Staff Partner, recruit a full Event Leadership Team and ensure all Event Leadership Team leads and members understand and fulfill their commitments to develop the Relay For Life event in their community. * In partnership with the Relay for Life Staff Partner, ensure coordination, preparation, and implementation of regularly scheduled Event Leadership Team meetings. * In partnership with the Relay For Life Staff Partner, review and discuss fundraising goals, expenses, and progress on a monthly or bi-monthly basis. QAULITIES: Excellent leadership skills Goal-oriented Knowledge of the Greenwich community Ability to Manage and delegate others Through enthusiasm ability to Motivate others Comfortable speaking in front of groups Organized
06854.title: Relay For Life of Greenwich in search for a Event Lead for 2017!

06854.description: Russkim yazykom volunteeer neobkhodima dlya okazaniya pomoshchi mestnomu cheloveku s chteniyem , sortirovka pochty i druzhestvennyy poseshcheniya. This man speaks great English and is very social but legal blindness makes reading paper and sorting mail a real challenge. The idea volunteer will be able to speak both English and Russian though Russian is not necessary. Apply today if you have: a desire to help others; a pleasant demeanor; a good reading/speaking voice; average reading skills; organizational or planning abilities; a good driving record; a clear criminal history; two references access to a car with proof of insurance; a minimum of $50/100k liability and $5,000 of property damage coverage.
06854.title: Russkim yazykom volunteeer neobkhodima dlya okazaniya pomoshchi mestnomu cheloveku s chteniyem , sor
06854.org: Department of Rehabilitation Services; Services for the Blind

06854.description: The American Cancer Society is seeking a group of Young Professionals within Fairfield County that are looking to make a difference in the global movement to end cancer! We need your help in 'brainstorming’ new and exciting ways to raise funds and awareness for the fight against cancer within Fairfield County. Through our Relay For Life campaign, communities around the world are able to honor cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost, and fight back against a disease that has already taken too much. Relay For Life's volunteer-driven model helps make it the most successful fundraising event in the world! MISSION: \"Young Professionals Against Cancer (YPAC) is a volunteer organization comprised of young adults from Fairfield County and surrounding areas dedicated to supporting the American Cancer Society in its mission to eliminate cancer through research, education, advocacy, and service. Activities and events also provide members with the opportunity to socialize, network, and serve the local community.\" For over 100 years the American Cancer Society has been the nationwide, community-based, voluntary health organization dedicated to eliminating cancer as a major health problem by preventing cancer, saving lives, and diminishing suffering from cancer, through research, education, advocacy, and service. All are welcome to join us for our monthly meetings held locally in the Stamford, CT area. *For more information please contact Grace Scinto at: grace.scinto@cancer.org (203)563-1520
06854.title: Young Professionals Against Cancer (YPAC)

06854.description: Are you a certified Medical Assistant or EMT? We need your help in our busy free clinic. Please help us provide the best possible care to the low-income uninsured of our area. We have clinic times during the week as well as on Saturday mornings. We will work with your schedule. Come be part of our compassionate medical team!
06854.title: EMT or Medical Assistant for Norwalk AmeriCares Free Clinic

06854.description: APRN needed for primary care Free Clinic. There are various clinic sessions during the week, but the greatest need is on Saturday mornings from 8:45 am to noon. Our medical volunteer team includes nurses and medical interpreters as well as a full time clinic manager and patient care coordinator. We serve the low income uninsures of the Norwalk area. Come join our professional and caring medical team. Most of our volunteers work one 4 hours clinic session one or two times per month. Flexible schedule.
06854.title: APRN needed for Norwalk AmeriCares Free Clinic

06854.description: Family & Children’s Agency is seeking individuals to be \"homework helpers\" for high school students in FCA's ASPIRE program. Come join a dynamic team of committed volunteers and professionals who provide guidance and homework support to high school students at Norwalk Community College during the academic year. Tutors would work one-on-one with high school students after school or after work hours. No experience is necessary and volunteers are asked to volunteer for a minimum of one hour per week (4-6 pm), Monday through Thursday for a minimum of three months. Adults and older high school students are eligible for volunteering. Program Information Family & Children’s Agency seeks to improve the lives of Norwalk’s youth by enabling their successful transition into high school and increasing their ability to be productive, independent young adults. Knowing that frequent, consistent contact with program alumni is critical to academic achievement in high school, FCA recently instituted drop-in homework help hours for alumni. Volunteers in the After School Program play a vital role in allowing us to empower the at-risk youth we serve so that they become productive, independent young adults. The program operates on the school calendar and does not offer programs during holidays and vacations. Requirements To become a volunteer in the After School Program, volunteers must complete an application and necessary background checks, including criminal, state, and Department of Children and Families checks. Volunteers must also complete an Agency orientation with Volunteer Services and a program orientation with the After School Program staff. Family & Children’s Agency expects volunteers to commit to one hour per week for a minimum of three months. However, volunteers are encouraged to commit for the academic year. Many volunteers have seasonal activities or commitments and time off can be arranged to accomodate these activities. Skills Needed: * Positive role model * Desire to work with youth * Patience * Good judgment * Dependability/consistency * Cultural sensitivity/awareness * Ability to maintain appropriate boundaries * Clean background check Family & Children’s Agency is a leading non-profit, human service organization that is committed to increasing the social and emotional well-being of our clients. We provide strength-based, solution focused services that respond to the individual needs of children & families, youth, adults, and seniors. Last year more than 10,000 individuals of all ages and all walks of life experienced life-altering, positive changes as a result of their work with Family & Children’s Agency.
06854.title: Homework Helpers Needed (After Work Hours Available)

06854.description: Administrative help needed at our Norwalk AmeriCares Free Clinic. Conversational Spanish needed to communicate with patients who seek medical care at our free clinics. Take down demographic information and get the patient chart ready for the doctor. No experience necessary and flexible schedule. Come join our committed team of compassionate professionals.
06854.title: ADMINISTRATIVE HELP-Norwalk Free Clinic (Bilingual)

06854.description: Family & Children’s Agency is seeking a volunteer to offer administrative assistance in our Home Care Services for Seniors office. This position is 4 - 5 hours per week and days are flexible. Volunteers should have prior experience working in an office setting. Ideal candidate will be competent working with computers, have great customer service, and have the ability to use of office equipment (phone, copy/fax). Program Information Both the physical limitations of aging and the increasing impact of medical conditions play a decisive role in whether a senior can age successfully at home. Our services, which range from having the security of a Personal Alert button to having a full-time, live-in home health aide, allow seniors to retain their independence throughout the aging process. Other services include short-term home health aides, carpentry and home modification, homemakers and assisted transportation. Requirements To become a volunteer with Family & Children’s Agency, volunteers must complete an application and necessary background checks, including criminal, state, and Department of Children and Families checks. Volunteers must also complete an agency orientation with Volunteer Services and a program orientation with their supervisor. Skills Needed: Desire to work in an administrative capacity General knowledge of office setting including filing, computers, phones, etc. Dependability and consistency Ability to maintain appropriate boundaries Clean background check Family & Children’s Agency is a leading non-profit, human service organization that is committed to increasing the social and emotional well-being of our clients. We provide strength-based, solution focused services that respond to the individual needs of children & families, youth, adults, and seniors. Last year more than 10,000 individuals of all ages and all walks of life experienced life-altering, positive changes as a result of their work with Family & Children’s Agency.
06854.title: Provide Office Support for Home Care

06854.description: Family & Children’s Agency is seeking volunteers to sponsor a Sunday lunch for homeless adults at our Community Connections Center. This includes, planning and purchasing pre-made/pre-packaged foods from stores or restaurants then delivering it to our Community Connections Center. Approximately 40-50 adults visit the center each day and we offer them a mid-day meal as their opportunity for meals at the local shelter is limited on Sundays. This is a great opportunity for a group of friends, family or co-workers to go shopping together and plan the meal. The meal may be a tray of sandwiches from a deli with a fruit platter or salads, soup, stew or pasta from a restaurant or grocery store. Any healthy option is very much appreciated and volunteers should plan on enough food for 30-40 adults. Program Information Established in 1986, the Community Connections Program at Family & Children’s Agency have established a continuum of care for homeless adults. We have homelessness prevention programs, programs working with adults experiencing homelessness, and supportive housing. The Community Connections Center in South Norwalk provides a safe, supportive, partial day social and recreational opportunity for homeless individuals. Most are clients from the Norwalk or Westport shelters; all have limited resources and difficulty coping with day-to-day expectations. With its non-structured atmosphere, the Community Connections Center is the first step toward engaging clients in needed treatment and rehabilitation. Requirements Volunteers must purchase and deliver lunches by 12 noon on a designated Sunday. Volunteers can commit to one time, or provide lunch on a scheduled basis. Skills Needed: Dependable Organized Preparation Family & Children’s Agency is a leading non-profit, human service organization that is committed to increasing the social and emotional well-being of our clients. We provide strength-based, solution focused services that respond to the individual needs of children & families, youth, adults, and seniors. Last year more than 10,000 individuals of all ages and all walks of life experienced life-altering, positive changes as a result of their work with Family & Children’s Agency.
06854.title: Sponsor a Sunday Lunch for Homeless Adults

06854.description: Volunteer Interpreter needed for our Tuesday late afternoon/ evening clinic. Must be fluent in Spanish and English. Help someone who needs medical care this year! The clinic runs from 4:00 to 7:00 pm. This clinic accomodates patients who work during the day and cannot make it to our daytime clinics. All eligible patients are seen at no cost. Volunteers normally work either 1 time per month or more, depending on their availability.
06854.title: Interpreter TUESDAY EVENING  4-7 pm at Norwalk AmeriCares Clinic

06854.description: AmeriCares Free Clinic of Norwalk needs your help interpreting for patients. The AmeriCares Free Clinic of Norwalk needs volunteers that are fluent in Spanish and English to assist doctors and nurses in interpreting our patients needs. Interpreters are an integral part of the clinics' volunteer staff. Come be a part of our medical team serving the low income, uninsured residents of the Norwalk area. Volunteers usually work a 3 hour clinic session one to two times per month. Interpreters are especially needed during our weekday sessions. For more information please contact Lorraine Larkin at llarkin@americares.org or see our website americaresfreeclinics.org. URGENT NEED FOR TUESDAY VOLUNTEER 4:00 TO 7:00 PM but other clinic sessions also available.
06854.title: Interpreters (Spanish-English) needed in Norwalk

06854.description: Volunteer nurses needed for our Norwalk free clinic! Most of our nurses work one 3-4 hour clinic session every 2 to 4 weeks. In Norwalk, we have clinic sessions on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday, as well as Saturday mornings. Our full-time APRN clinic director is present during each session to provide continuity and coordination. Currently we are in need of volunteer nurses for our Saturday morning clinic session which is from 8:45 am to noon. But all sessions are open to new nurses. COME BE A PART OF OUR DEDICATED VOLUNTEER MEDICAL TEAM! AmeriCares Free Clinic of Norwalk provides free health care to the low income, uninsured residents of the Norwalk area.
06854.title: VOLUNTEER NURSE at AmeriCares Free Healthcare Clinic of Norwalk

06854.description: COME JOIN OUR TEAM OF EXCEPTIONAL PHYSICIANS! Our physicians have an excellent support team of caring and competent nurses, interpreters and screeners. Physicians are required to be Board-Certified/Board-Eligible in Internal Medicine, Family Medicine, Emergency Medicine or Pediatrics. Our medical volunteers work a 4 hour clinic session usually once every 4 to 6 weeks. Currently our greatest need is for physicians on Saturday morning from 8:45 am to noon. We do have other clinic sessions during the week when we need physicians as well.
06854.title: PHYSICIANS NEEDED at AmeriCares Free Clinic of Norwalk

06854.description: Gallery Guides are needed 363 days a year to help visitors appreciate and learn more about Long Island Sound's rich maritime history and marine life. They are the Aquarium's primary interface with our visitors. They staff the Seal Pool, the Open Ocean Gallery, the Touch Tank, plus other exhibits throughout The Maritime Aquarium. Training courses are held in March, June, and October.
06854.title: Gallery Ambassadors

06854.description: Would you like to make a difference in the lives of children? Then become a volunteer teacher for Junior Achievement of Southwest Connecticut. Our In School Program educates students (K-12) about business and the free enterprise system. We provide you with everything you need to succeed (training, lesson plans and materials)! The In School Program consists of the following: 1) Elementary School Program - Offered to Kindergarten through fifth grade. This program consists of five classes (one class a week) with each class lasting 35-45 minutes (depending on grade level). Themes include: self, family, community, city, region, and nation 2) Middle School Program - Offered to grades 6-9. This program consists of 6 classes (one class a week) with each class lasting approximately 45 minutes. Themes include: Global Marketplace, Economics for Success and JA America Works 3) JA Success Skills - Offered to high school students. This program consists of 7 classes (one class a week) with each class lasting approximately 45 minutes. Components of the class include: Success Skills and Leadership. We have several other High School Programs, including Business Ethics and others. We do our best to place you in a school convenient to you. If you are interested in participating or would like more information please call Arlene Viscomi at 203-854-1700
06854.title: In School Program Volunteer Teachers

06850.description: Volunteers are essential to the delivery of quality hospice care and Masonicare Home Health & Hospice’s Veteran-to-Veteran volunteer program builds on that by pairing Veteran patients with a Veteran volunteer who shares their common language and experience. Veteran volunteers support Veterans who are terminally ill by providing companionship through conversation, facilitating life review, playing card and/or board games, providing respite for weary caregivers and much more. Veteran volunteers may also participate in recognition and pinning ceremonies and assist in replacing lost medals. Masonicare offers a free, thorough training for all of our volunteers. Veteran volunteers receive additional training focused on specific Veteran needs. Training classes are held throughout the year. Once trained, volunteers visit patients in their local area and set their own level of commitment based on their available time. Volunteers also receive ongoing support through continuing education and regular communication with the volunteer coordinator. Volunteers are needed across the state. Contact us today to find out more about how you can help fulfill the mission to serve America’s Veterans at a critical time in their lives. Masonicare Home Health and Hospice is proud to be a member of the We Honor Veterans program, a collaborative project between the National Hospice and Palliative Care Organization and the Veteran’s Administration.
06850.title: Veteran Volunteer

06850.description: Are you an enthusiastic and outgoing person looking to help your community? Are you passionate about history, the arts and culture? Then the Lockwood-Mathews Mansion Museum is the perfect place for you! Built between 1864-1868, this National Historic Landmark offers educational programs, exhibits, and an array of special events to children and adults. As a non-profit organization, the Museum relies on its dedicated volunteers for a variety of tasks including: guided tours, Gift Shop sales, monitoring events, clerical, curatorial, marketing, and much more. Come and join our incredible team!
06850.title: Looking for Museum Volunteers

06850.description: Peppermint clears the mind, removes toxins from the body and relieves pain, isn't that amazing. You can be a peppermint life saver to a person with blindness who needs occasional rides. You can clear her mind, take her to dialysis to clear her body and relieve her worries. If you can make a once a week trip to a doctor appointment, drop her off at dialysis or assist in any way, this is for you. It is a low impact way to try out a volunteer opportunity with just an hour or two per week. Requirements to be a great volunteer include: a desire to help others; a pleasant demeanor; a good reading/speaking voice; average reading skills; organizational or planning abilities; a good driving record; a clear criminal history; two references access to a car with proof of insurance; a minimum of $50/100k liability and $5,000 of property damage coverage
06850.title: Peppermint Life Saver Needed!
06850.org: Department of Rehabilitation Services; Services for the Blind

06850.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned Connecticut citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
06850.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Norwalk CT

06850.description: Family & Children’s Agency is seeking volunteers to provide store or restaurant bought pre-packaged snacks for clients in multiple programs. Volunteers may purchase and provide packaged breads, muffins, cookies, fruit, pretzels or any snack of your choice (healthy snacks are always a good option). This a great way to get friends and family plan the snack and shop together. Opportunities Provide snacks for 40 - 50 middle school students in the After School Program located at Norwalk Community College. Snacks must be delivered by 3 p.m. on a selected weekday. Provide snacks for 40 - 50 homeless adults at the Community Connections Center located at 140 Water Street in South Norwalk. Snacks can be delivered any time on a selected day. Provide snacks for 10 women in our MOMS Group held at 140 Water Street in South Norwalk. Snacks must be delivered during program hours. Provide snacks for 10 women in our recovery program, which is held at 9 Mott Avenue in Norwalk. Snacks must be delivered before 10 a.m. on a selected Monday, Wednesday or Friday. Requirements To become a volunteer with Family & Children’s Agency, volunteers must complete an application. Volunteers are also invited to attend an agency orientation with Volunteer Services. Volunteers can commit to one time, or participate on a scheduled basis. Skills Needed: Good judgment Dependability/consistency Cultural sensitivity/awareness Family & Children’s Agency is a leading non-profit, human service organization that is committed to increasing the social and emotional well-being of our clients. We provide strength-based, solution focused services that respond to the individual needs of children & families, youth, adults, and seniors. Last year more than 10,000 individuals of all ages and all walks of life experienced life-altering, positive changes as a result of their work with Family & Children’s Agency.
06850.title: Provide Snacks

06850.description: Have an elective class you can teach? Family & Children's Agency is looking for individuals to facilitate a 6 week class (once weekly) for the students in our ASPIRE (after school program) at Norwalk Community College. Class options include: Art, Music, Theater, Photography, Cooking, Computers, Dance, etc. Lessons may be held weekdays, Monday - Friday, between the hours of 3:30 to 5:30 p.m. (once a week for six weeks). Or a one-time workshop Program Information Family & Children’s Agency seeks to improve the lives of Norwalk’s middle school youth by enabling their successful transition into high school and increasing their ability to be productive, independent young adults. This is accomplished by providing a safe and structured community-based After School Program for students to improve academic performance, develop character, and promote healthy peer interactions and lifestyles. The program operates on the school calendar and does not offer programs during holidays and vacations. Requirements To become a volunteer for ASPIRE, volunteers must complete an application and necessary background checks, including criminal, state, and Department of Children and Families checks. Volunteers must also complete an Agency orientation with Volunteer Services and a program orientation with the ASPIRE staff. Family & Children’s Agency is a non-profit, 501(c)(3), family service agency that meets the needs of more than 10,000 individuals--including children, adults, and families--throughout Fairfield County and beyond. Skilled professionals serve clients in seven primary impact areas: youth development, family strengthening, foster care, adoption, behavioral health, homeless service, and services for seniors.
06850.title: Teach an Elective Class/Workshop for ASPIRE Program

06850.description: Hospice is not about dying but about living and hospice volunteers are present to help patients live life to the fullest. Masonicare Home Health and Hospice trains volunteers to provide non-medical support to hospice patients statewide. Volunteers assist our hospice patients by engaging in companionship activities such as listening to music, reading, looking at photos together, providing respite for weary caregivers, and much, much more. Administrative volunteers also help in non-direct patient care roles. In addition, there are opportunities for special complementary programs including spiritual support and bereavement care, Expressive Arts and Creature Comforts (pet visits with your registered therapy animal), Spirit Song including playing an an instrument or singing, and our Veteran-to-Veteran volunteer program. We offer a free, thorough training process for all our volunteers as well as ongoing education and support. Training classes are held throughout the year. Once trained, volunteers set their own level of commitment based on their available time. Volunteers are needed across the state. Contact us today to learn more about how you can help bring comfort and care to those in need at a critical time in their lives.
06850.title: Masonicare Home Health and Hospice

06851.description: The Courage to Speak Foundation, is a Norwalk-based non-profit organization dedicated to keeping our children safe from drugs. We have several volunteer opportunities available and are currently seeking enthusiastic adult and student volunteers to assist with our upcoming media event, The 13th Annual Courage to Speak Empowering Youth to be Drug Free Family Night. Volunteers are needed for checking in guests, setting up the event, overseeing the dinner, babysitting and more. For more information, contact Ginger Katz at 203 831 9700 or gkatz@couragetospeak.org. Please visit www.couragetospeak.org for more information. Serving dinner, registratlion, setting up student posters at the event, greeting participants, cleaning up after dinner, setting up event and more.
06851.title: Courage to Speak Empowering Youth to be Drug Free Family Night 2017

06851.description: ALZHEIMER’S ASSOCIATION, CONNECTICUT CHAPTER OFFICE ASSISTANT VOLUNTEER JOB DESCRIPTION GENERAL STATEMENT OF RESPONSIBILITIES: Under the supervision of the Alzheimer’s Association Connecticut Chapter Statewide Walk Director, the office assistant will perform a myriad of office activities to help assist and support the Regional Event Planner as well as other statewide Regional staff to ensure an effective and efficient office environment at the Regional Office in Norwalk, Connecticut. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: Manage the day-to-day administrative operations at the Norwalk, CT Office, including but not limited to welcoming visitors and constituents, ordering of office supplies, maintaining an orderly and organized office space and environment, organizing and maintaining files and records, fulfilling all photocopying needs, maintaining necessary stock levels of brochures and other Chapter-related materials and act as the liaison between facilities and office management. Provide all database management support to the Region and, as applicable, the state, utilizing Convio, Walk Central, Sign-up Genius, RivALZ, etc..... In support of the Fairfield County Walk to End Alzheimer’s (WTEA) Administer, manage, and document all welcome calls to newly registered Team Captains Ensure that all WTEA information is disseminated to appropriate staff members and volunteers and answer any questions pertaining to this information/data Set-up and attend all WTEA meetings; responsible for taking and issuing meeting minutes to Walk Chair Respond for all requests for Walk fundraising materials and arrange for receipt of materials by constituents Participate and play a designated leadership role on the day of the Fairfield County WTEA Coordinate all administrative details pertaining to wrap around and other Chapter-sponsored events in the Region, including accepting and managing RSVP’s, outreach calls to increase attendance, answering event questions and all necessary logistics and supply support Issue or support all post-event communication and correspondence to donors, constituents and/or volunteers, including thank you notes, phone calls, etc..... Handle initial inquiries for supporter and/or partnership events, gathering baseline information, issuing Supporter Event Agreement forms as appropriate, documenting requests and ensuring that all Alzheimer’s Association property is returned upon completion of event. Manage special projects and conduct research Prepare and edit reports, newsletters, and presentations Act as liaison between staff and volunteers Plan and schedule various meetings and conferences Organize and prepare expense reports for various staff members POSITION REQUIREMENTS: BA/BS degree Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications, especially Word, Excel, and Power Point. Understanding and knowledge of how to navigate databases and web-based software Proficiency with Google and Google Drive Proven ability to solve problems and work effectively with staff and volunteer populations Superb written communication and presentation skills Ability to manage multiple priorities and utilize resources efficiently and effectively to meet numerous deadlines Ability to work effectively with diverse populations High level of integrity, diplomacy and initiative Ability to work evenings and weekends as needed Must have ability to travel by automobile. This is not meant to be an exhaustive list of job duties. Essential element may change when necessary. Working Conditions: Office environment High volume of public contact Travel by car to attend meetings, issue and gather supplies, etc..... Ability to perform job functions during periods of high volume or tight deadlines
06851.title: Administrative Assistance at Alzheimer's Association Norwalk Office

06851.description: Do you enjoy helping others and giving back to your community? If so, join the Norwalk Health Department’s Emergency Response Team. This team of people donates their time and expertise to prepare and respond to emergencies, and to promote healthy living throughout the year. Emergency Response Team ( ERT) volunteers include community members with both medical and non-medical backgrounds . Interpreters, home makers, chaplains, office workers, legal advisors, medical and public health professionals are all needed for key positions in the ERT program. Lend a hand when there’s a need and help the Norwalk Health Department help others. Use your current skills and develop new skills while gaining additional experience. AND... meet other people who share your interests. We provide training and insurance. You provide your time and skills. After training, no time commitment required.
06851.title: Emergency Response Team

06851.description: Volunteers are the core of our organization, for they possess the special qualities of a loving heart and a unique call to serve. Some have had personal experience of loss, some bring professional skills or specialized expertise, but most are ordinary people who want to help. Volunteers provide caring compassion for both the person facing the end of life and those who love them. Orientation and training is provided in English for every volunteer. We want you to feel confident and competent. We believe in a team approach in all that we do, so you never feel alone or unsupported. We serve patients wherever \"home\" is: skilled nursing facilities, assisted living facilities, retirement communities or their own residences. Patient and Family Support Volunteer Provide friendly companion visits Read aloud, write letters, share an interest Provide gifts of music, art, scrapbooking Actively listen and be supportive in hearing expressed fears and concerns Create a written legacy for other loved ones Offer prayers (and quiet presence) Assist in picking up medications, light errands, outdoor chores Bereavement Volunteer (Additional training Needed) Writing sympathy cards, other significant anniversaries or events Supportive telephone calls Participation in Greif Groups and Remembrance Services Community presentations in Grief Volunteers must have 15 hours of mandatory training and make a commitment of a few hours per week or per month Volunteers will learn the history of hospice, the goals and philosophy of care, and the emotional and spiritual needs of patients at the end of life. They develop the communication skills necessary to comfort and support patients and families because they spend quality time with patients, they often give valuable feedback to the care team. To volunteer today, call Marie Keogh, Coordinator of Volunteer Services at (203) 663-6732, or visit www.constellationhs.com
06851.title: Speak Spanish Fluently and wish to make a difference?  Become a Hospice Volunteer!

06851.description: Los voluntarios son el núcleo de nuestra Organización, por poséan las cualidades especiales de un corazón amoroso y una llamada única a servir. Algunos han tenido experiencia personal de la pérdida, algunos traen habilidades profesionales o conocimientos especializados, pero la mayoría son personas comunes que quieren ayudar. Los voluntarios proveen cuidado compasión para la persona que enfrenta el final de la vida y de quienes los aman. Orientación y entrenamiento es proporcionada en inglés para cada voluntario. Queremos que usted se sienta seguro y competente. Creemos en un enfoque de equipo en todo lo que hacemos, por lo que nunca se sienta solo o compatible. Servimos a los pacientes donde su \"hogar\" este: casas de reposo, comunidades de retiro, o sus propias hogares. El Apoyo a pacientes y familiares Proporcionan del voluntario con visitas amables leen, escriben cartas, comparten un interés personal ofrezcan participacioń a la música, el arte, el teatro escuchen activamente y ser solidarios con sus temores y preocupaciones Crear un legado escrito para sus queridos ofrezcan oraciones (y presencia silenciosa) ayuden en la recogida de medicamentos, recados y tareas Voluntariado El Duelo (formación adicional necesaria) escribir tarjetas de pésame, aniversarios importantes, eventos o llamadas telefónicas de apoyo. participación en grupos de Greif y Servicios y presentaciones en el dolor de la p`erdida. Los voluntarios deben tener 15 horas de formación obligatoria y hacer un compromiso de unas pocas horas por semana o por mes los voluntarios conocerán la historia del hospicio, los objetivos y la filosofía de la atención hospicio y el bienestar emocional y necesidades espirituales de los pacientes que se encuentren al final de la vida. Se desarrollan las habilidades de comunicación necesarias para consuelo y apoyo a los pacientes y familias. Porque pasan tiempo de calidad con los pacientes, dan información valiosa para el equipo entero que cuidan al paciente. Para ser voluntario, llame, Coordinador de Servicios de Voluntarios al (203) 663-6732, o visite www.constellationhs.com
06851.title: !Alto!  Se busca voluntarios

06851.description: Do you have a certified pet therapy dog? We are looking for canine good citizens to join our growing hospice program as a furry friend to our patients. If you have the passion, skills, and a heart full of love and would like to share your therapy dog with us we would love to meet you. Training is required for all handlers. 1. Trained/certified through Therapy Dogs, International, Pet Partners, or other programs. 2. Ability to communicate well with all people of diverse backgrounds and ages. 3. Able to respect confidentiality at all times. 4. Comfortable with the death and dying process. 5. Self-motivation, dependable and responsible. 6. Able to work independantly. 7. Able to work in an ever-changing environment. 8. Able to practice proper infection control. 9. Able to maintain appropriate personal and professional boundaries. 10. Must be at least 18 years of age. Responsibilities 1. Provide support to patients and caregivers. 2. Provide friendly companionship to patients. 3. Visit patients with therapy dog. Requirements 1. Complete online volunteer application at www.constellationhs.com, interview, background check, fingerprinting, health screening, TB test or chest x-ray if history of BCG exists per hospice program policy and volunteer and company orientation. 2. Provide proof of pet therapy training and documentation of dog's health records. 3. Able to make a commitment of a few hours per week/month for one year. 4. Maintains open communication with other team members, reporting events or changes in patient condition to the Volunteer Supervisor or other interdisciplinary team members. 5. Records accurate, objective, timely documentation of volunteer activities. 6. Completes mandatory in services annually. 7. Attends volunteer support meetings as needed.
06851.title: Looking for Certified Pet Therapy Dogs to Join Our Growing Hospice

06851.description: Join our growing hospice program serving all of Fairfield County including Greenwich, Stamford, Darien, Norwalk, New Canaan, Wilton, Easton, Bridgeport, Stratford, Shelton, Milford, Orange, Oxford, Hamden, New Haven and Wallingford. Orientation and Training is provided for every volunteer in our Orange and Norwalk Offices. We want you to feel confident and competent. We believe in a team approach in all that we do, so you never feel alone or unsupported. We serve patients wherever \"home\" is: skilled nursing facilities, assisted living facilities, retirement communities or their own homes. Patient/Family Volunteer (wherever \"home\" may be) * Provide friendly companion visits * Read aloud, write letters, share an interest * Provide gifts of music, art, scrap booking (strong need for musicians) * Actively listen and be supportive in hearing expressed fears and concerns * Create a written legacy for other loved ones * Offer prayers and serve as a vigil volunteer (special training required) Bereavement Volunteer (requires additional training in bereavement) Volunteers learn the history of hospice, the goals and philosophy of care, and the emotional and spiritual needs of patients at the end of life. They develop the communication skills necessary to comfort and support patients and families and because they spend quality time with patients, they often give valuable feedback to the care team. *15 hours of training * Commitment of varies from person to person, visits are typically a minimum of 45 minutes per person and can ranged between 2-3 times a week and 2-4 hours per month.
06851.title: School is Back in Session... Volunteer While your Child is in School for Growing Hospice Program

06851.description: Assist hospice chaplains by making follow-up bereavement calls, help lead remembrance services for all faith backgrounds and support other religious themed activities. Ability to wheel residents and patients back and forth from their rooms to services is a vital part of this experience. Interest in thantology and theology, and pastoral work preferrred.
06851.title: Pastoral and Bereavement Volunteers Needed

06851.description: Are you a recent retiree looking for something meaningful to do? Join our volunteer family and age with purpose. Participate in hands-on activities with hospice patients and clients who value your lasting contribution of time or volunteer a few times a month (or more) in our office. If you are looking for a work environment where you can utilize your passion, expertise and leadership skills we want you. We have many opportunities for volunteers of all backgrounds including office work, bereavement call bank, patient satisfaction survey administration, community relations, circle of care, etc... Call Amy Faith Lionheart to learn more about our current opportunities at 203-663-6732.
06851.title: Recently Retired?  Office Assistance Needed at Growing Hospice & Bereavement Program

06851.description: What we are looking for: Myth: Hospice is a place Myth: Hospice is for people who have no hope Myth: Hospice is only for people with Cancer Myth: Myth: Hospice is for people who have only a few days to live Myth: Hospice requires family members and friends to be available to provide care Are you looking for a way to give back to the community? Joining the Constillation Hospice team is an incredible and rewarding experience. Our volunteers support the hospice mission in many capacities. The majority of our volunteers provide direct services to our clients and their families and caregivers by generously spending time in the home of someone who is living with a life-threatening illness. Hospice volunteers are a specialized group of 'professional volunteers’ who offer many things including companionship, a silent prescence, emotional support and practical assistance to our clients, and short-term relief to client families and caregivers. Many practical and supportive tasks can make a significant difference to those who are living while they are dying. For some, volunteers bring normalcy to day-to-day life. From offering some warm companionship, reading stories or the local paper, talking about world events, to remembering past life experiences and the accomplishments that people have experienced...to name just a few. Many volunteers assist with life’s basic tasks such as organizing papers, writing letters or helping to make phone calls, to assisting with, light household duties, shopping assistance, providing comfort measures and personal care. For many families and caregivers hospice volunteers offer much needed additional support, including respite relief and 'listening ears’. Constellation Hospice also has other specialized roles for volunteers who have other professional experiences and interests. Complementary Therapy volunteers are registered practitioners with experience in Registered Massage Therapy, Reiki, Healing Touch, Therapeutic Touch, Reflexology, Music or Expressive Arts Therapy; who are able to share their skills with our clients. We also offer a specialized training for volunteers to work within our Bereavement Support Programs. These volunteers work with bereaved individuals, families or groups. With the support of Constellation Hospice's volunteers, together with our professional staff, we assist hundreds of individuals and families/caregivers each year. Together we can make a difference, please consider joining our team. Due to the sensitive nature of our work, we are committed to ensuring that all volunteers are fully screened and trained prior to working directly with our clients. This process is extensive and requires a tremendous commitment to all that join our team.
