The process includes attending a volunteer information session, submitting an online application, an interview, reference checks, a background check and 12+ hours of initial training. We also offer ongoing professional development opportunities, volunteer support and social activities throughout the year.
06851.title: Provide Companionship, Dignity, Respect and Comfort to a Hospice Patient

06851.description: Is your group interested in making a difference in the lives of others? Do you fill your days with crochet? We are looking for donations of crocheted or knitted afghans, quits and lap robes in a variety of colors. Your donation will help individuals enrolled in hospice to live their lives with the comfort, dignity and respect they deserve. Please note we are especially looking for patriotic colors to be donated to veterans.
06851.title: Blanket us with Your Love, Make a Blanket for a Hospice Patient

06851.description: Join our growing hospice and palliative care program serving New Haven and Fairfield Counties! Orientation and Training is provided for every volunteer. We want you to feel confident and competent. We believe in a team approach in all that we do, so you never feel alone or unsupported. We serve patients wherever \"home\" is: skilled nursing facilities, assisted living facilities, retirement communities or their own homes. Program Support Volunteer (in the Hospice Office) * Assist with mailings * Copies/Packet Assembly * Filing * Special Projects Patient/Family Volunteer (wherever \"home\" may be) * Provide friendly companion visits * Read aloud, write letters, share an interest * Provide gifts of music, art, scrap booking ( strong need for musicians) * Actively listen and be supportive in hearing expressed fears and concerns * Create a written legacy for other loved ones * Offer prayers * Assist in picking up medications, light clean up, outdoor chores Bereavement Volunteer (requires additional training in bereavement) Volunteers learn the history of hospice, the goals and philosophy of care, and the emotional and spiritual needs of patients at the end of life. They develop the communication skills necessary to comfort and support patients and families and because they spend quality time with patients, they often give valuable feedback to the care team. *15 hours of training * Commitment of 2-4 hours/monthly
06851.title: Looking for a Loving Heart and a Unique Call to Serve!

06851.description: Individuals and groups can assist with special events and activities for people with developmental disabilities. This position requires a positive disposition, tolerance and understanding of individual differences, and a sense of cooperation with STAR staff and other volunteers to assist in providing services to our clientele, staff and the public. Volunteers may assist with: A group project that benefits the population, such as organizing and helping update and fix our Clothing Exchange for low income adults with developmental disabilities A group project that benefits the population socially and/or recreationally, such as a sponsored outing with adults with developmental disabilities An interactive group project that benefits the population socially and/or recreationally, such as an activity for our day programs, such as arts, music, crafts, dancing. Assisting with upcoming events such as our Theater of STARs show on December 3. Individual volunteers may help with set-up, refreshments, photography, videography, ushering, packing up the trucks, programs. Another event or activity of your choice. STAR serves individuals with developmental disabilities throughout Mid Fairfield County. Contact Megan Johnson, Volunteer Coordinator, 203-846-9581 x339 or mjohnson@starinconline.com
06851.title: Assist With Events for Non-Profit Agency for People With Developmental Disabilities

06851.description: Provide computer, clerical and/or office assistance to agency that serves people with developmental disabilities. Part or full time support needed, Monday through Friday, between 9am and 3pm. Help needed for filing, sorting, mailings, computer database updates and/or assisting in clerical duties. This position requires a positive disposition, good spelling skills, and a mature individual who can work with a variety of types of office employees and clients who have developmental disabilities. STAR serves individuals with developmental disabilities throughout Mid Fairfield County. Contact Megan Johnson, Volunteer Coordinator, 203-846-9581 x339 or mjohnson@starinconline.com
06851.title: Office Assistance for Non-Profit Agency

06851.description: Looking for someone passionate enough to lead a task force involved in substance abuse prevention in Norwalk. Leadership requires bringing together a group of volunteers to work on this and related issues and recording notes of monthly meetings and activities. This group will set up a schedule to disseminate materials on substance abuse, underage drinking and tobacco use; work with representatives of local housing authority to prepare for Family Day events; help expand program activities. This will take approximately 10 hours per month.
06851.title: Are you passionate about preventing substance abuse??

06851.description: SCORE is seeking an ecommerce specialist to assist our clients, who are budding entrepreneurs, in utilizing the web to develop, market and grow their businesses. We help people in a supportive and non-judgemental manner to flesh out their ideas and bring them to fruition. We have over 100 business mentors with vast experience from many industries and services.
06851.title: E Commerce Specialist

06851.description: Admin Manager Assist with inputting of data and general office duties The position is strictly volunteer. The amount of time devoted is solely up to the individual. Any time spent is appreciated though we estimate the entire function to be 1-3 hours per week.
06851.title: Administrative Manager

06851.description: Potential dual role: 1) Assist new or existing entrpreneurs with social media as a marketing tool using LinkedIn, FaceBook, Twitter, Pinteret and others. 2) Work with chapter media team to promote the awareness of SCORE and its small business orientated services, face to face and email mentoring, workshops and education programs. The position is strictly volunteer and open to whatever time the applicant has to devote.
06851.title: Social Media Specialist

06851.description: Part or full time clerical support needed, Monday through Friday, between 9am and 3pm. May be used for an internship if you obtain necessary requirements and paperwork from your school advisor. Help needed for filing, sorting, and assisting in clerical duties. This position requires a positive disposition, good spelling skills, and a mature individual who can work with a variety of types of office employees and clients who have developmental disabilities. STAR serves individuals with developmental disabilities throughout Mid Fairfield County. contact Peter Saverine, Director of Philanthropy psaverine@starct.org
06851.title: Internship-Clerical Support Needed to Assist at STAR Headquarters

06851.description: Assist adults with developmental disabilities in enjoying recreational activities such as bowling, movie night, game night (Wii), music/band night, dances, crafts and other activities. Experience with caretaking and/or individuals with developmental disabilities prefererable. Make a difference in others' lives and see what a difference it makes in your life!
06851.title: Bring smiles to adults with developmental disabilities- assist them with recreational activi

06851.description: You can volunteer just one hour a week right in your own neighborhood and make a huge difference in a young person’s life! The Norwalk Mentor Program is looking for caring individuals who can spare just one hour a week to be a \"mentor\". Following a brief training, you will be matched with a student in one of the Norwalk Public Schools. You choose the school and the grade. You then meet with your \"mentee\" at school once a week for an hour - talking, playing games, reading or enjoying other activities. You can be that student’s friend, confidante, role model and advocate. As a mentor you will feel rewarded just seeing the difference you make as the young person you mentor matures and grows to reach his or her full potential. If you’re interested in having a positive influence on a child or teen, contact Nancy Pratt, Director of the Norwalk Mentor Program at The Human Services Council at npratt@hscct.org or 203-849-1111.
06851.title: ONE HOUR A WEEK CAN CHANGE LIVES FOREVER..BECOME A MENTOR

06851.description: By providing childcare at either of our sites in Norwalk or Stamford, you will help the mothers who receive DVCC's services to be able to participate fully in support groups and counseling sessions, or to attend doctors' appointments, job interviews or just have a few moments to themselves. You must be 15 years of age or older in order to do this and a comittment of 2 hours a week would be most welcomed. Before becoming a Certified Volunteer and being able to have direct client contact, you will be required to take our state certified 20-hour Educational Seminar, This is given twice a year, Spring and Fall (upcoming Spring dates to be announced).
06851.title: Child Care Volunteers

10523.description: Help Save Lives! Join the New York Blood Center Volunteer Team in the Hudson Valley area. Educate others about the importance of donating blood and enhance the donor experience at a blood drive. Greet and register donors, provide for donor safety by escorting and monitoring donors post donation. All volunteers are required to complete a volunteer application, a criminal background check and attend a 2 hour training/orientation session. Flexible assignments to choose from right in your own community.
10523.title: Ambassador Volunteer - Westchester Cnty

10520.description: Assist Recreation staff to run activity programs with residents
10520.title: Assist in leading actvity programs

10520.description: This volunteer position has been created to assist the Director of Volunteers with clerical work related to volunteer management. Specifically keeping track of, and totaling of annual hours of all of the organization's volunteers.
10520.title: Clerical Assistant to Director of Volunteers

10520.description: Friendly Visitor Volunteers may participate in a range of activities, such as: Wheelchair Transport Assistance Gardening/Beautification Conventional Visits Recreational activities Arts & Crafts Reading Letter writing Cards Table Games Reviewing Current Events Bingo Entertaining Holiday/Festive Parties Birthday Celebrations Shopping Trips Outdoor Walks on the Grounds Assist with Exercise Class
10520.title: Friendly Visitor Volunteer

10303.description: Help distribute fresh produce, free of charge, in an open-air market setting to hundreds of families of need! Volunteers will be stationed at 3-4 market tables, each supplied with thousands of pounds of fresh fruits and vegetables that they will help distribute to eligible market-goers. As the market-goers stop by each table, volunteers greet them and then weigh and bag the produce. The Mobile Markets take place outdoors, rain or shine. We stress that it's important to wear comfortable, weather appropriate clothes. As this is a very hands-on activity and there is no secure place to leave your property, it is recommended that you travel light, i.e., personal belongings should be left at home/office or a messenger bag/backpack should be used. All volunteers should arrive promptly at 8:45am. Your promptness ensures that we will be able to start the Mobile Market on time . If you are running late, please contact the market manager (number below). The market should end around 12pm. Please note that all volunteers must be at least 18 years of age. Be sure to plan your travel in advance, especially if you are unfamiliar with the area. Use Google maps and check the MTA website for any service changes or delays the day of the event.
10303.title: Mariner's Harbor Mobile Market Food Distribution!

10303.description: When City Harvest was founded in 1982, it was run entirely by volunteers who connected a handful of neighborhood restaurants to food programs serving those in need. Now, more than 30 years later, City Harvest volunteers remain a critical part of our food rescue operations and our comprehensive Healthy Neighborhoods programming. Our two Mobile Markets on the North Shore of Staten Island are in high need of volunteers! Mobile Markets are bi-monthly farmer’s market style distribution of fresh produce to residents of our Healthy Neighborhoods. As a volunteer, you will help distribute thousands of pounds of fresh fruits and vegetables to over 400 families. Mobile Markets are a great opportunity to directly interact with the communities that City Harvest serves! The Stapleton and Mariner’s Harbor Mobile Markets take place from 8:45 AM-12:00 PM, one weekday and one Saturday a month. Volunteers will be able to complete an orientation online for this opportunity! Email volunteerservices@cityharvest.org for details on how to get involved!
10303.title: Fight Hunger in Staten Island!

06840.description: We are seeking mature college students, recent college graduates or graduate students who are interested in the mental health field and who would like to volunteer to support our teen patients (ages 13-17) during their school time period on weekday mornings. Volunteers work with the teacher to support teen patients while they complete homework assignments or engage in other structured activities (puzzles, arts/crafts, board games). Volunteers provide supportive, positive dialogues that motivate and support our youngest patients who are in treatment for a psychiatric or addictive disorder. After being selected for this position, volunteers must complete a one-day hospital orientation that takes place on the first Monday of the month (except on holiday Mondays). Candidates must also provide one written reference and complete a TB screening (PPD).
06840.title: Adolescent Programs-School Time Assistant

06840.description: Share your skills, hobbies and interests by being a companion or assisting in therapeutic recreation programs. Opportunities exist to perform on our world renowed Main Street in the village or design your own program such as sharing a collection, gardening or teaching a class. Some serve lunch, dinner or tea while others prefer to greet visitors at the reception. Waveny is a five-star non-profit facility that seeks volunteers with warm hearts and a wide array of interests.
06840.title: Friend

06840.description: Show patients in our new residential eating disorders program located on the second floor of our Main House how to knit and to also appreciate the value of knitting. Choose Monday, Tuesday OR Friday from 6:30-7:30 pm to offer your talents and supportive conversation. Your ongoing (weekly) presence offers you and the patients an opportunity to develop a rapport and to pick up any threads of conversations from the previous weeks. It's all in good fun and gives patients a creative outlet for eating disorder recovery. To ensure that you will have what you need each time you volunteer, you will select easy to use (simple) knitting supplies and yarn and the hospital will reimburse you for your purchases. Hospital orientation and criminal background check are required and ongoing volunteer supervision is provided.
06840.title: Knit One, Purl Two: Teach Knitting to Patients

06840.description: We seek mature, personable, and discreet individuals to greet and direct visitors to the inpatient adolescent unit during regularly scheduled family programs and visiting hours on the weekends (12:45-2:30PM Saturday and Sunday). This volunteer position will afford you with an opportunity to interact with patients, family members and staff and gain exposure to the operations of a psychiatric hospital and various staff roles and functions. You will also learn about the types of services offered to individuals with psychiatric or addiction disorders. Volunteers may select available weekend dates that work with their availability.
06840.title: Adolescent Unit-Greet Visitors on Weekends

06840.description: We seek mature individuals to share their love of art in a relaxed home atmosphere with adult patients on Mondays at 10:00 a.m. You do not have to be a professional artist; however, if you love art, you have likely been dabbling in it for a while as a hobby or in a classroom setting. Alternate your volunteer schedule with other volunteers who also support this program that provides an enjoyable pastime for our patients. Hospital orientation required and ongoing supervision is provided. Please tell us more about yourself by writing to volunteer@silverhillhospital.org
06840.title: Monday 10:00 a.m. Art Group for DBT Program

06840.description: Patients at Silver Hill Hospital who are struggling with addiction or psychiatric illness engage in many therapeutic activities, including patient enrichment groups provided by our volunteers. We are seeking volunteers to share their love of music and their musical talents (e.g., voice, guitar, keyboard) once or twice per month on an ongoing basis, especially on the weekends. You don't have to be a virtuoso, concert master or a stage performer, but you should be comfortable working in a group setting and have a relaxed, warm manner.We will provide you with an orientation and staff support. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at 203-801-2320 or volunteer@silverhillhospital.org
06840.title: Make some music!

06840.description: Using any format that you practice, lead a 30-45 minute group of adult patients in a seated yoga and/or meditation session that helps patients achieve a more relaxed state and acquire new skills. You must possess outstanding communication skills, practice meditation or yoga in your personal life and be comfortable leading an educational group. All volunteer-led groups are monitored by our professional staff. Hospital orientation and training session required. Must provide one reference and authorize criminal background check. All volunteers must also have a recemt TB screening test (PPD) prior to starting as a volunteer. We are looking for volunteers for Tuesday at 10:30 am or any day Mon-Fri at 4:00 p.m.
06840.title: Seated Yoga/Meditation Group Leader

06840.description: The admissions department is one of the central hubs of activity at Silver Hill Hospital. Play an integral role in our admissions department by taking ownership of a key administrative task: patient chart assembly. Each new patient chart contains standardized forms that allow the clinical staff to record the patients' treatment and discharge plans. These charts must be complete and ready to go for each new patient admission. We are looking for organized individuals who thrive on doing a job well and efficiently! As a member of the admissions intake team, you will learn about the vital role this department plays in the successful operation of a psychiatric hospital.
06840.title: Admissions Office Assistant

06840.description: We seek mature, personable, and discreet individuals to greet and direct visitors for our Main House facility during regularly scheduled family visiting hours and patient dining hours on the weekends (12:30-2:30PM Saturday and Sunday). This volunteer position will afford you with an opportunity to interact with patients, family members and staff and gain exposure to the operations of a psychiatric hospital and various staff roles and functions. You will also learn about the types of services offered to individuals with psychiatric or addiction disorders. Volunteers may select available dates that work with their availability.
06840.title: Greet Patients & Families During Weekend Visiting Hours

06840.description: Have you made a difference in your community? Here's a great idea, change a life - with just one hour per week you can help a blind person continue toward their goal of independent living. Read their mail, drive them to the grocery store or bank, help them label household items. It's easy and you can set your own schedule! This is a great way to spring into action and dust off to achieve that olde New Year's Resolution to make your world a better place!
06840.title: Spring into Action:  Can You Change a Life in One Hour a Week?
06840.org: Department of Rehabilitation Services; Services for the Blind

06840.description: Patients in our Women's Transitional Living Program (28-day program) attend volunteer-led 12-step discussion groups and workshops as part of their therapeutic program and personal recovery journey. Volunteers who are women in recovery play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of strength, hope and recovery and how they maintain sobriety and a healthy lifestyle. Volunteers use AA literature like \"Living Sober\" and \"The Big Book \"and discuss a variety of themes/topics, i.e., Slogans, Acceptance, Living Sober, Relapse Prevention with small groups of women at our Barrett House residence
06840.title: Women's Group 12-step Meeting Leader

06840.description: Adolescent patients in treatment for substance abuse disorders participate in a wide variety of therapeutic programs and also attend 12-step based discussion groups as part of their recovery journey. Volunteers, who are also in recovery, play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of messages of hope, as well as how they maintain sobriety and a healthy lifestyle. Daytime and evening volunteer opportunities are available in our adolescent inpatient and transitional living program (residential, 28-day program).
06840.title: Help Teens Overcome Addiction (12-step group)

06840.description: Assist the business office with administrative tasks or special organizational projects
06840.title: Business Office Assistant

06840.description: Patients at Silver Hill participate in a wide variety of therapeutic programs and also attend 12-step practicum meetings as part of their recovery journey. Volunteers play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of strength, hope and recovery and how they maintain sobriety and a healthy lifestyle. Daytime and evening volunteer opportunities available for both adult and adolescent inpatient and transitional living program (residential).
06840.title: 12-Step Discussion Group Leader

06840.description: Work directly with our patients and recreational therapy staff to provide recreational activities that enrich and enhance our patients' existing treatment programs in our adult psychiatric unit on weekdays at 2:00 p.m.
06840.title: Recreational Group Assistant

06840.description: Join our volunteer team as a Library Resource Assistant! We are seeking volunteers to serve as ambassadors to our residential houses to ascertain the residents' current book preferences and to make these matierials available to them using the resources of our library. The Silver Hill patient library boasts a broad selection of self-help, fiction and nonfiction books, magazines and newspapers for our patients and their families. Your job will be to help bring these resources to the residents in our houses and also help ensure that materials are returned before patients discharge. We prefer volunteers who could be available during the week to interact with patients during their free time (Mon-Fri 10:00-11:30 or late afternoon). Volunteers will receive a hospital orientation (offered on the first Monday of the month 10:00 a.m. to 5:00) and also access to our on-site medical education seminars. This is a great opportunity for a college or graduate student, recent college or graduate school graduate , or individuals wishing to enter the healthcare and mental health field in the areas of nursing, social work, medicine or clinical psychology. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at volunteer@silverhillhospital.org or 203-801-2320. We look forward to hearing from you!
06840.title: Library Resources Assistant/Ambassador

06840.description: Join a very special group of gardening enthusiasts who have, for over 30 years, been making stunning floral arrangements for Silver Hill Hospital's patient units, reception areas and dining room. This group meets only on Tuesday mornings from 9:00 am to noon to arrange nature's floral bounty in vases and whimsical planters that delight patients and bring even more vibrancy to Silver Hill's indoor spaces.
06840.title: Delight Patients with Your Floral Creations

06840.description: The Admissions Office at Silver Hill Hospital is where individuals experiencing distress due to psychiatric or addiction challenges first come to determine where they will be assigned in the hospital to receive the best possible treatment. You will work alongside the admissions staff, who are expertly trained to help people in crisis and to ensure that each patient will receive the most appropriate care. After training as an Admissions Office Greeter, you will use your interpersonal skills and empathy for others to offer support to patients and their families by providing written information, food and beverages, and descriptions of our programs and facilities. Your calm presence and good people instincts will guide you so that patients are made to feel welcome, respected and encouraged. Volunteer candidates are selected on the basis of their maturity, abiility to handle sensitive situations in a discreet and professional manner and a willingness to also accept supervision and ongoing feedback.
06840.title: Family & Patient Greeter-Admissions Office

10528.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 2-4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
10528.title: Harrison, NY: Autism Volunteer

07457.description: Change a life, it's forever! Become a Girl Scouts volunteer and use your expertise, skills, interest and life experience as a coach, mentor or advisor. Inspire and empower girls ages 5-17 to have a fun and enriching leadership experience as they reach their personal best.
07457.title: Volunteer - Direct Services to girls (work with girls)
07457.org: Girl Scouts of Northern New Jersey

07452.description: BRING YOUR FAMILY OR COME WITH A FRIEND TO PLANT AND MAINTAIN SMALL FLOWER BEDS AT GROUP HOMES IN BERGEN COUNTY . THE LOCATIONS ARE HOME TO 6 ADULTS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES THAT NEED HELP TO PLANT AND MAINTAIN A GARDEN.
07452.title: Adopt a Garden Volunteers

10118.description: Who you are: You are an aspiring software engineer and quick study, comfortable learning new development languages, tools, and technology. You can work well in a team but can also put on headphones and power ahead on a challenge. You not only talk the talk of a developer but can also explain to non-developers what your work means and how it impacts users. You’re open to new projects, new ideas, and excited about figuring out first-to-market solutions for a rewarding data-intensive domain. You'll be essential in building and scaling the products, services and APIs that power Rare Genomics research. You could be working on our patient or researcher facing interfaces, internal systems, help spec and design new products and features, or improve our core abilities. Most of our systems are written in Python, Ruby, or Javascript. We're a small team, conscious of encouraging a productive and rewarding culture of inclusivity, diversity and fun, with opportunities to grow and shape the role and organization. Skills we'd love to see: Experience with modern languages and systems - Some years of Python, Ruby, NodeJS, Go or similar languages - Comfort with databases such as Postgres, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, or Redis - Excited to use containers, Docker, new cloud techs in a project - Git, Mercurial, etc; Linux experience; can setup own dev environment - Bonus for having built/used data analysis frameworks or pipelines Experience developing web and mobile applications - Have worked with or built APIs for web and mobile - Comfortable with basic HTML / CSS / JS - Knowledge of the JS ecosystem - Familiarity with the D3 library or writing code for charts and visualizations - Bonus for experience with Ionic, Cordova or native iOS and Android apps General awesomeness criteria - Someone who is comfortable with wearing many hats - Analytics/data wrangling experience is greatly appreciated - Experience writing software for a startup or tech company or CS coursework is a plus - A background in engineering or science and a track record of building interesting projects - Extra bonus points for having contributed to open source projects!
10118.title: Awesome Full-Stack or Back-End Hacker

10118.description: Contribute to your community while using your professional expertise, and work with talented peers in a rewarding, non-profit environment! The Rare Genomics Institute (RG) is making a difference in the rare disease community . RG is a nonprofit organization that helps families in need of genome research. Job Description: Assist with coordination, writing, & editing for patient/inquirer/expert communication vehicles both on and offline, including but not limited to emails, newsletters. Assist with coordination of updates & improvements on RG's websites Manage BeHeard's Social Media presence via Facebook, email marketing, Twitter, Blogs, etc. as directed by management Develop & update general and program brochures, media kits, key messages, fact sheets, & other collateral material as needed. Assist with coordination of media outreach & coverage with media releases, TV/radio interviews, feature stories, etc. Other duties as assigned Qualifications: PhD or MA in the Sciences BA or Higher degree in Writing, English, Public or Media relations, Communications, or related field or demonstrated min. of 2 yrs experience in one or more of these areas Highly organized, attention to detail, results oriented Exceptional verbal, written, & presentation skills Strong editing skills Proficiency in Microsoft Office computer programs Basic design/layout experience desired Knowledge of electronic media such as Websites, e-Newsletters, Social Media,etc
10118.title: Communications Associate

10118.description: Do good for your community while using your professional expertise. Work with talented peers on a rewarding non-profit cause related program. The Rare Genomics Institute (RG) is a nonprofit organization that helps families in need of genome research. The Rare Disease Task Force addresses inquiries from both patients and caretakers regarding rare diseases. Position Responsibilities: Respond promptly to patients’ inquiries Perform literature and clinical trial searches Effectively communicate the scientific literature in plain language Write formal reports on the result of your research. Connect patients to researchers in the field. Follow up with patients regularly Qualifications: MD, PhD or doctoral candidate Comfortable with navigating through PubMed and clinicaltrials.gov Excellent writing skills
10118.title: ANALYST

10118.description: Do good for your community while using your professional expertise. Work with talented peers on a rewarding non-profit cause related program. Rare Genomics Institute is making a difference. Rare Genomics Institute is a non-profit organization that helps families in need of genome research. The IT Department is responsible for supporting and maintaining the IT systems, infrastructure and for providing technical support to users across the institute. The post holder will provide effective data governance assistance across all aspects of the business. Responsibilities: The position will involve the following areas of responsibility: Establish of a data governance framework, policies, and standards to comply with privacy, confidentiality, and information Devise, develop, and maintain documentation related to Data Governance and data sharing processes and partnerships Work with teams across the institute to ensure data is collected, accurate, stored, released, and reported in a manner consistent with the mission and needs of the organization Act as point of collaboration between business and IT to ensure data quality and integrity Qualifications : Knowledge of data governance models and data management practices Experience of designing and building a Data Governance strategy from the ground up

10118.description: Rare genomics Institute RG is an international non-profit that provides access to cutting edge research technologies, physicians, and scientists across the globe. By providing an expert network and an online crowdfunding mechanism, RG helps families pursue personalized research projects for diseases not otherwise studied. We bring together scientists who share our passion for helping rare disease patients and leverage the crowdfunding capabilities of the Internet to bring the hope of a cure to our patients. We are looking for an experienced developer with a passion for frontend work. You have built complex web apps using AngularJS or another modern Javascript framework. You create structured, modular CSS. You play nicely with designers and care about implementing pixel-perfect, responsive, jank-free interfaces Requirements You have a demonstrable track record of building highly interactive Web/Mobile applications. You write elegant, reusable, well tested code and can strike the right balance between writing perfect code and shipping it rapidly and iteratively. You are able to design and implement large projects in a self-directed fashion. You quickly assimilate whatever technologies are needed for a project. When pointed at a target, you eliminate obstacles and just make it happen - usually in a way that is more awesome than originally envisioned. Hybrid Mobile development iOS, Android, hybrid (PhoneGap/Cordova), Ionic framework Helpful experience Phonegap, Ionic framework, HTML5 apps using Cordova, CSS, Ruby on Rails, Sass, Angular.js, Node Rare genomics Mobile App Team: We are building a great Patient centric mobile App for Rare Genetic conditions, composed by patient-centric features such Medication logs, Mood and Symptoms trackers, Social network and Donors engagement Platform using gamification tools. If you are highly committed to our Rare Genomics cause join us!. We welcome people who recognize the importance of collaboration to turn great ideas into great products.
10118.title: Front-End Hybrid Mobile App Developer

The department is also responsible for resolving any IT-related faults quickly and efficiently, including a broad range of queries from how to set up an email account to system diagnostics, plus enhancing and developing the IT provision extended within the business. The IT Department is responsible for supporting and maintaining the company’s IT systems and for providing support to all users. The department is also responsible for resolving any IT-related faults quickly and efficiently, including a broad range of queries from how to set up an email account to system diagnostics, plus enhancing and developing the IT provision extended within the business. Responsibilities : The position will involve the following areas of responsibility: Perform basic administrative support duties as required to meet specific operational objectives Provide assistance and support to colleagues in IT-related matters Undertake small to medium-sized IT projects Work with Google and Microsoft support to diagnose and resolve technical issues (e.g. Google and Microsoft 365) Oversee and assist teams to set up new users and disable expired accounts in accordance with HR requirements Perform basic administrative support duties as required to meet specific operational objectives Provide assistance and support to colleagues in IT-related matters Undertake small to medium-sized IT projects Oversee and assist teams to set up new users and disable expired accounts in accordance with HR requirements

The Rare Genomics Institute is making a difference. RG is a nonprofit organization that helps families in need of genome research. The Project Manager has responsibilities in managing special projects for their Department Creates, tracks and manages projects by contributing information to strategic plans and reviews Create detailed project completion plans, estimates and schedules Identify trends, determine system improvements, implementing change Ensure completion of deliverables and adherence to timelines Update job knowledge by reading professional publications in marketing and science Manage day-to-day operational aspects across multiple project areas, project teams, budgets, and timelines, etc. using best project management processes/practices Work cross-functionally across multiple areas to bring cohesion to a broader corporate environment Enhance organization reputation by exploring opportunities Skills and Experience: BA (required), MA (a plus) Strong knowledge of Project Management processes and tools Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects efficiently Excellent oral and written communication skills for effective communication to clients, internal staff and the management team Ability to demonstrate tact, diplomacy and initiative when working with others; Passion for learning the latest interactive technologies and techniques Able to thrive in a fast-paced, self-starter environment
10118.title: Project Manager

10118.description: Reporting to the RareShare Science Director and working with the RareShare team, the Education/Advocacy Content Developer will design, develop, author and implement engaging materials for the Rare Genomics Institute’s rare disease websites and communications. Content may include features on the rareshare.org webpage, written e-books, disease summaries, podcasts, videos and newsletter articles. Position Responsibilities: The Content Developer works with the scientific team to prepare informational content, expand the organization’s scientific competencies, develop new assessment tools, analyze web traffic to improve outreach and validate content for accuracy. Attend and participate in work group and weekly team meetings via conference call. Enlist and manage other volunteers who can assist in the research and content preparation work. Support the overall efforts of the Rare Genomics Institute and its RareShare team. Desired Skills and Experience: Bachelor’s or higher degree in life sciences or biomedical field. Ability to interpret, critically assess and validate the accuracy of complex rare disease information. Strong writing, editing, reviewing and verbal communication skills. Proficient computer skills in writing, data analysis and presentation software. 5-10 hour commitment each week. Ability to work collaboratively and independently to achieve stated goals. Ability to organize, engage, lead and mentor others.
10118.title: Education/Advocacy Content Developer (RareShare)

Rare Genomics Institute is making a difference. Rare Genomics Institute is a non-profit organization that helps families in need of genome research. We are looking for Full Stack Developer with working knowledge of HTML5 /CSS / Java script. Experience on Mobile App development: Although no previous experience is required, a certification on programming language is mandatory. Ability to write quality unit tests. Understanding of repeatable automated processes ( iterations ) for building the application, testing, documenting, and deploying it at scale. Awareness of security concerns, as each layer presents its own possible vulnerabilities. Experience on requirement compliance submitting a Mobile App to Google Play or Apple Store. The Rare Genomics Institute is making a difference. RG is a nonprofit organization that helps families in need of genome research. As a Sr. Hybrid Mobile App developer you will manage and work with a team of developers, a Mobile App Dev Lead, and work in collaboration with Agile Project Manager, and UX experts to build a new Patient-centric Mobile App for Rare Genomics. The primary responsibility of our Hybrid Mobile Developer is to develop utility and functionality using Xcode, Ionic, JQuery, PhoneGap. As a Non profit organization, we are intending to design a Patient-centric mobile App based on open source platforms, or any free service mobile App development framework and AWS services. Experience with hybrid tools\frameworks\API’s such as PhoneGap, Ionic, jQuery Mobile, Dojo Mobile, Cordova, etc. Experience with 3rd party API’s integration, consuming web services (REST) and processing data (XML/JSON ) Extensive experience with HTML5, Javascript and CSS3, including Angular JS Experience having deployed developed apps to Google Play and Apple App Store Commitment to Rare Genomics values of attitude, commitment, and excellence Familiarity with one or more beta app framework such as TestFlight, HockeyApp, Google Play Beta, AppBlade, Appaloosa, etc. General Assembly candidates are welcome to Apply to this position.

Design application and architecture Test application performance. Test application and report issues with senior Staff. General Assembly candidates are welcome to Apply to this position .

The Rare Genomics Institute is making a difference. RG is a nonprofit organization that helps families in need of genome research. Responsibilities include Develop and write grant proposals to foundations and other grant-making organizations, persuasively communicating RG’s mission and programs to potential funders Assemble and submit grant requests, including letters, proposals, budgets, and presentations Maintain calendar to ensure timely submission of letters of inquiry, proposal deadlines, and reports Identify, define, and develop funding sources to support existing and planned program activities Prioritize projects to keep multiple projects moving in a timely manner and meet deadlines Must be able to attend team meetings every other Thursday at 8pm EST Must have an interest or background in science and technology Desired skills and experience: Masters Degree in relevant field 3+ years professional experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills 5-10 hour commitment each week (required) Solid understanding of budgets as they relate to proposals and grants Work collaboratively and independently to achieve stated goals Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, self-starter environment You will: Meet a tremendous group of like-minded professionals Deepen your connection with your community Keep your skills sharp by applying them in the nonprofit sector Share your expertise with others Boost your resume and portfolio Stand out from others in your field Create lasting relationships Network with an active online community of professionals
10118.title: Grant Writer

10119.description: Vets International is a registered charity whose mission it is to use sound veterinary expertise to enhance the health of humans, animals and the environment globally. Our organization is in search of a dedicated board treasurer who is committed to our mission, will act as an ambassador, and is willing and able to provide leadership in the financial life of our organization. That financial leadership requires a combination of skills and characteristics. A great treasurer balances these responsibilities: Knowledge - Thorough understanding of the financial reports. It helps to have some non-profit financial background, which may require some supplemental training in nonprofit financial terminology and requirements. Communications - Able to translate financial information and financial concepts for the board. Financial reports do not need to be presented by the treasurer specifically at board meetings, but the board may need to help to explain and re-frame the reports. It’s also the treasurer’s role to interpret and translate the board’s questions, goals, or concerns about the financial information or financial situation to the staff. Planning - Partner with the President to develop a useful budget. The treasurer can bring great value in preparing for budget discussions and conveying budget information to the board. Budgets are the financial version of an annual or strategic plan and the treasurer is in the best position to make sure that budget priorities and decisions reflect the intentions and objectives of the board. Strategy - Great treasurers go beyond annual budgets, audits, and financial reports to bring financial leadership to the organization. Great treasurers look down the road to find the financial options and decisions needed for longer-term goals and initiate discussions to connect finance and mission. CPA REQUIRED. Interested candidates should include their resume with their submission.
10119.title: Do you love animals and understand finance?

10116.description: Volunteer Board Member Young Starr Movement, INC. Greater New York City Area Nonprofit Organization Job Description Seeking Member of the Board of Directors Mission Young Starr Movement, INC. Nonprofit’s mission is to improve the lives of people affected by domestic violence abuse. The Young Starr Movement, fights for more than 38 million women who have experienced either physical domestic abuse, financial abuse, emotional abuse or a combination of all three. There can be and should be a life after a physical or emotional crisis for more people. Our mission is to educate, empower, support and give necessary resources to rebuild and change lives. The Young Starr Movement provides direct services and life skills training to anyone affected by domestic violence abuse; and community crisis intervention. Our innovative programs and life skills training are aimed at reversing the negative effects of silence and violence affecting thousands of people in our communities. We are commited to the recovery of women and people of all background and ages through empowerment, stability, and self-fullfilment. For more information, please visit our website at www.youngstarrmovement.org. Position The Board will support the work of Young Starr Movement, INC. and provide mission-based leadership and strategic governance. While day-to-day operations are led by Young Starr Movement, Founder and President, the Board-President relationship is a partnership, and the appropriate involvement of the Board is both critical and expected. Specific Board Member responsibilities include: Leadership, governance and oversight Serving as a trusted advisor to the President as she develops and implements Young Starr Movement, strategic plan. Reviewing outcomes and metrics created by Young Starr Movement, for evaluating its impact, and regularly measuring its performance and effectiveness using those metrics; reviewing agenda and supporting materials prior to board and committee meetings. Approving Young Starr Movement's annual budget, audit reports, and material business decisions; being informed of, and meeting all, legal and fiduciary responsibilities. Contributing to an annual performance evaluation of the President. Assisting the President and board chair in identifying and recruiting other Board Members. Partnering with the President and other board members to ensure that board resolutions are carried out. Serving on committees or task forces and taking on special assignments. Representing Young Starr Movement to stakeholders; acting as an ambassador for the organization. Ensuring Young Starr Movement’s commitment to a diverse board and staff that reflects the communities Young Starr Movement serves. Fundraising Young Starr Movement Board Members will consider Young Starr Movement a philanthropic priority and make annual gifts that reflect that priority so that Young Starr Movement can credibly solicit contributions from foundations, organizations, and individuals, Young Starr Movement, INC. expects to have 100 percent of Board Members make an annual contribution that is commensurate with their capacity. Board Terms/Participation Young Starr Movement’s Board Members will serve a three-year term to be eligible for re-appointment for one additional term. Board meetings will be held quarterly and committee meetings will be held in coordination with full board meetings. Qualifications This is an extraordinary opportunity for an individual who is passionate about Young Starr Movement’s mission and who has a track record of board leadership. Selected Board Members will have achieved leadership stature in business, government, philanthropy, or the nonprofit sector. His/her accomplishments will allow him/her to attract other well-qualified, high-performing Board Members. Ideal candidates will have the following qualifications: Extensive professional experience with significant executive leadership accomplishments in business, government, philanthropy, or the nonprofit sector. A commitment to and understanding of Young Starr Movement’s beneficiaries, preferably based on experience. Savvy diplomatic skills and a natural affinity for cultivating relationships and persuading, convening, facilitating, and building consensus among diverse individuals. Personal qualities of integrity, credibility, and a passion for improving the lives of Young Starr Movement’s beneficiaries. Service on Young Starr Movement’s Board of Directors is without remuneration, except for administrative support, travel, and accommodation costs in relation to Board Members’ duties.
10116.title: Volunteer Board Member

11575.description: The Children’s Learning Center is the school component of the Cerebral Palsy Association of Nassau County, a non-profit organization. The school serves over 250 students, ranging in age from 18 months to 21 years of age, and coming from most school districts across Nassau County, a few from Suffolk County, and many from the boroughs of New York City. During the school hours, assistance is needed to assist the classroom staff to transport students to their specials - art therapy, music therapy and adapted physical education. At CP Nassau, medical, nursing and clinical services (i.e. occupational therapy, physical therapy, speech therapy, psychology) are available at the main campus through the Fortunoff Treatment and Rehabilitation Center. At times, the students require assistance being transported to and from their scheduled appointments, within the building. The volunteer transporter will assist in getting the participants to their appointments on time. Volunteer Participant Transporter Description: Transport students between their classroom and medical offices for schedule appointments. Transport students between their classroom and nursing office for daily visits. Transporters help make sure that the students reach their destination on time. Communicate information between nurses and/or medical specialist and staff within the assigned classrooms. Maintains safe, secure, and healthy work environment by following agency policies and procedures. Volunteer opportunities within : Days : Monday - Friday Hours : 9:00AM - 3:00PM
11575.title: CLC Volunteer Transporter
11575.org: Cerebral Palsy Association of Nassau County, Inc.

11575.description: At ucpn, medical, nursing and clinical services (i.e. occupational therapy, physical therapy, speech therapy, psychology) are available at the main campus through the Fortunoff Treatment and Rehabilitation Center. The Day Habilitation program serves individuals ages 21 and older who are developmentally disabled. At times, the individuals require assistance being transported to and from their scheduled appointments, within the building. The volunteer transporter will assist in getting the participants to their appointments on time. Volunteer Participant Transporter Description: Transport participants between their program room and medical offices for schedule appointments. Transport participants between their program room and nursing office for daily visits. Transporters help make sure that the participants reach their destination on time. Communicate information between nurses and/or medical specialist and staff within the assigned program rooms. Maintains safe, secure, and healthy work environment by following agency policies and procedures. Volunteer opportunities within : Days : Monday - Friday Hours : 9:00AM - 3:00PM
11575.title: Volunteer Transporter
11575.org: Cerebral Palsy Association of Nassau County, Inc.

11575.description: Assist in selling clothes, home goods, books, accessories, children's wear, board games, and so much more to our consumers and staff in our on site thirft store! The Curiosity shoppe at ucpn is a fun filled atmosphere where new merchandise is always coming in. Where your desire to help ucpn and your love for thrifting meet!
11575.title: Curiosity Shop Assistant
11575.org: Cerebral Palsy Association of Nassau County, Inc.

10115.description: Assist CWS in developing web content and organizing electronic data Standardizing language found on different web and public platforms (i.e.: making sure all our websites sound similar) Graphics and mailings support Creating an organizing tool for tracking social media posts throughout CWS - including affiliates - i.e.: making a list of affiliate social media handles and setting up a Hootsuite account to monitor them.

10115.description: The Administrative Assistant volunteer will be the front line representative of the Early LIFE pre-school, the receptionist at the front desk of the school. Provide clerical support for the Administrative Assistant as well as other departments that are part of the Early LIFE Center. Perform receptionist duties. Provide office support including monitoring postage meter, pre-school’s copying machines, ordering supplies, requesting repairs. Perform data processing as requested by the site Administrative Assistant, attendance card management, and all data for each individual child.
10115.title: Administrative Assistant Volunteer

10115.description: Lutheran Social Services of New York has an opportunity for a Office Assistant/Recptionist volunteer, to start immediately. This is a great opportunity to develop your skills while you are supporting our Programs. we need a highly motivated, well-spoken, energetic, detail oriented individual who is comfortable and effective in a support position and able to excel in a fast-paced, creative environment. The office assistant will welcome visitors and directs phone calls to appropriate staff extensions. Assist by overseeing the general appearance and functionality of office space, also providing general support for other staff when needed.
10115.title: Office Assistant/Reception
10115.org: Lutheran Social Services of New York

Are you experienced with web programming and/or Social Media Platform design? We would love to hear from you.
10115.title: Web development /Design /programming support - Please help us help those in need

11572.title: Clerical Assistant- Employee Health Services

10111.description: The National MS Society New York City-Southern New York Chapter is looking for volunteers to help with our upcoming event - Climb to the Top! Climb to the Top will be held on Sunday, March 5th at Rockefeller Center. This is a unique event that the New York City - Southern New York Chapter of the National MS Society hosts to raise awareness and funds for the 12,000 people living with MS that they serve in the five boroughs and Westchester, Putnam, Rockland, Orange and Sullivan counties. Groups and individuals of all ages and abilities are invited to volunteer. We are always looking for youth clubs, corporate and service-oriented community groups to lend a hand before, during, and after our events. There is only one requirement: a desire to end MS now! If you are interested in volunteering, please review the positions below and register online here: http://main.nationalmssociety.org/site/TR?fr_id=28095&pg=informational&sid=13793 Climb to the Top - Volunteer Positions Pre-Event Set-up Team: Date : Saturday, March 4, 2017 Shift: 9:00am-1:00pm Description: Volunteers will assist with the setup of tables, chairs, materials and signage. You must be able to lift boxes, stand for long periods of time and climb numerous flights of stairs. No seated positions are available. Event Information Team: Date: Sunday, March 5, 2017 Shift: 5:00am-10:00am Description:Volunteers will answer participant questions and direct them to various event areas. Attendance at a training session will be required. Participant Support Team: Date: Sunday, March 5, 2017 Shift: Various Shifts Description: Volunteers will provide support to various participant areas including, but not limited to: Bag Check, Start Line, Rest Stops, Food & Beverage and Top Fundraiser Lounge. Photography Team: Date: Sunday, March 5, 2017 Shift: 5:30am-11:00am (Finish Line - Top of the Rock) 6:00am-10:00am (Sponsor Photos) Volunteers will choose one shift* Description: Volunteers will take photos of participants at the finish line at the Top of the Rock as well as photos of event sponsors and general atmosphere. Muscle Team: Date: Sunday, March 5, 2017 Shift: 5:00am-11:00am Description: Volunteers will assist with moving barricades, tables, chairs and other heavy objects and hanging/removal of signs and banners. No seated positions are available. Spirit Team: Date: Sunday, March 5, 2017 Shift: 5:00am-9:00am (1st Shift) 8:00am-11:00am (2nd Shift) Volunteers will choose one shift* Description: Volunteers will cheer for the participants as they cross the finish line. Volunteers are asked to bring lots of enthusiasm, spirit and cheer! Stair Support Team: Date: Sunday, March 5, 2017 Shift: 5:00am-11:00am Description: This team will be stationed in the stairwell to ensure the safety of our participants and cheer them on! All volunteers must be able to stand for long periods of time and climb numerous flights of stairs. No seated positions are available Volunteer Check-in: Date: Sunday, March 5, 2017 Shift: 4:30am-10:00am Description: Volunteers will check-in volunteers and direct them to assigned locations. Attendance at a training session is required. If you have any questions, please contact: Amber Young - Manager, Volunteer Engagement/Logistics at Amber.Young@nmss.org or 212-453-3258
10111.title: Volunteer for Climb to the Top!
10111.org: National MS Society - New York City

08807.description: Help an adult learn or improve their English. Become literacy tutor! Training provided. Literacy Volunteers of Somerset County is looking for volunteers to become Basic Literacy and English as a Second Language (ESL) tutors. Volunteers must complete a 15-hour training course during 5 class sessions. Upon completion of training, tutors will be matched with students. Tutoring is usually held at the local libraries in Somerset County. The schedule for our next Tutor Training class is as follows: Wednesday January 25, 2017 6-9 pm; Saturday February 4, 2017 9am - 12pm; Wednesday February 15, 2017 6-9pm; Saturday February 25, 2017 9am - 12pm; and Wednesday March 8, 2017 6-9pm. To learn more about becoming a tutor, information sessions will be held at local library branches in January. See the following link for dates and times: http://www.literacysomerset.org/index.php/tutor-information-sessions Training takes place at the PeopleCare Center, 120 Finderne Ave., Bridgewater. There is a $50 charge for training materials. Please visit our website at Literacysomerset.org for details. To register for training, please visit http://literacysomerset.org/index.php/tutor-online-registration
08807.title: Become a Literacy Tutor - Change Someone's Life

08807.description: Support overall comprehensive public relations strategy of the American Diabetes Association’s MidAtlantic Region. Partner with staff to oversee a consistent and active communication strategy to all stakeholders for the purposes of program messaging, fundraising, awareness and branding. This is an action committee and members of the committee are expected to share contacts and help with outreach activities. The region covers New Jersey, Eastern Pennsylvania (including Philly),Delaware, and NYC. Responsibilities: Build on current brand and develop creative market outreach programs that will drive new partners and friends. Advise staff on strategies and development for various marketing communications channels and web presences including, electronic/social media (e.g. Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc), newsletter, website and printed collateral. Maintain and build relationships with key industry partners and members of the press in conjunction with staff efforts. Investigate and pitch newsworthy stories to media and bloggers. Write stories and editorials for online and print. Identify key speaking engagements for staff and community to help market and brand the ADA. Skills and abilities needed to succeed as a member of the Marketing & Communications Taskforce Personal Willing and able to make asks on organization’s behalf (ambassadors). Honesty, integrity and respect for others. Good communications skills; open-minded and articulate. Leadership skills. Self-confident and outgoing personality. Professional Experience developing and implementing marketing strategy. Demonstrated interest is the non-profit/social responsibility sector. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Graphic design knowledge Comfortable working in a fluid environment and taking initiative and direction. Leadership experience in another organization or committee Have a network of community/business contacts and willingness to reach out as an ambassador of the organization for awareness and fundraising. Estimated time commitment and meeting format Attend four Committee meetings per year Participation in a monthly conference call Participation in events, taking part in at least one event or program activity per quarter. Volunteer benefits Develop new skills Build resume Meet a diverse range of people. Help make a difference in the day-to-day life of people affected by diabetes The American Diabetes Association is leading the fight to Stop Diabetes and its deadly consequences and fighting for those affected by diabetes. The Association funds research to prevent, cure and manage diabetes; delivers services to hundreds of communities; provides objective and credible information; and gives voice to those denied their rights because of diabetes. Founded in 1940, our mission is to prevent and cure diabetes and to improve the lives of all people affected by diabetes. If you are interested or have questions, please contact Doreen Pustizzi at Dpustizzi@diabetes.org
08807.title: Volunteers Needed for Public Relations Task Force

08807.description: RideWise is seeking volunteer drivers for the launch of its Community Cars Somerset ride program. When you become a volunteer driver you're giving so much more than a ride or your time to someone in need. You're allowing senior citizens and persons with disabilities to remain active, healthy and independent by transporting them to the doctor, the grocery store, adult daycare or day-to-day errands. Our volunteers: Help elderly persons and persons with disabilities Drive agency vehicles leased by RideWise See the residents they are helping Set their own hours and schedule Earn ride credits for eligible family members to use

11375.description: Volunteer at the New York City VisionWalk! The VisionWalk is the Foundation Fighting Blindness' signature fundraising event. The event takes place on Saturday, April 8, 2017 at Flushing Meadows-Corona Park in Queens, NY. We need volunteers to help with set-up/clean-up, the kids zone, refreshments, and monitoring the walk route. We appreciate all the efforts volunteers do for us and hope you can contribute to our event. Please contact me if you are interested in being part of our great event! For more information about this event, please visit: www.FightBlindness.org/WesternNewYorkVisionWalk Be sure to like us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/FoundationFightingBlindnessNewYork/?fref=ts

11375.description: GallopNYC uses therapeutic horsemanship to help riders walk, talk, connect, focus, behave and learn, inspiring each one to live life as fully, productively and independently as possible. Volunteers are needed to assist our riders on horse back. Volunteers lead horses or walk alongside them during lessons. Classes are conducted by a trained instructor. Our riders are people with disabilities and/learning disabilities. We have a great team of volunteers and we really love what we do. One of our riders said \" When I ride my horse I feel free.\" We love making that free feeling possible -- plus we see very concrete achievements in our riders' abilities. We conduct lessons seven days a week at locations in Forest Hills, Queens and Brooklyn. Email us today and we will provide you with information on our orientation program. Experience with horses is helpful but not at all neccessary. Please contact us for more info on how to become a volunteer at: volunteer@gallopnyc.org Or visit our website at: http://gallopnyc.org/how-to-help/volunteer/

11375.description: The Songs of Love Foundation is a 501(c)(3) non-profit dedicated to helping sick children nationwide by providing them with their very own personalzied 'song of love'. We are looking for motivated, enthusiastic individuals who want to help our charity. We have a wide variety of different ways that you can help Songs of Love. We are accepting volunteers for any amount of time that can be dedicated wheather it be full or part time. The volunteering experience can be counted as highschool, college or any other type of credit that an individual requires. Can be from 1 to 5 days a week, full or part time. An intern would be ideal.

11377.description: Sunnyside Community Services, based in Queens, New York, offers a range of life-enhancing programs that benefit approximately 14,000 individuals per year. From Early Childhood Education to Senior Services, we provide programs for all ages. Our services include: pre-kindergarten and after school programs; college prep and career programs for teens and young adults; Our after-school programs provide fun and challenging enrichment activities for your children. We provide after-school programs at P.S. 150 and P.S. 199 in Sunnyside for elementary school students (grades K - 5). Programs for middle school students (grades 6 - 8) are available at SCS’ main site and at the Boulevard Family Residence in Elmhurst. The Sunnyside Cornerstone Program at Woodside Houses provides opportunities for children, teenagers, and adults to participate in structured after-school programs and drop-in activities including performing arts and music, athletics, computers, reading, chess, and more. Our Needs: Volunteer Tutors What We’re Looking For Volunteers to do Lead tutoring sessions while supported by staff Support participants with homework completion and a subject of your choice, including: English, Math, Science, and Social Studies; Serve as a role model and build positive relationships with youth; Strong background in one or more of the following academic subjects: English, Math, Science, and/or Social Studies Previous experience working with youth; Posses enthusiasm and patience Strong oral communication skills Ability to make weekly commitments Previous tutoring experience (a plus) At least one 2 hour to 2.5 hour session per week, Monday-Thursday. Times vary between 3:30 pm to 5:30 pm, based on youth/volunteer and program schedules. HIGH SCHOOL & COLLEGE students encouraged to apply Benefits Gain invaluable experience for professional development Give back to the community and mentor youths Job Type: Internship/Volunteer
11377.title: Math,Science & Tech Tutors Needed at Sunnyside Cornerstone

Please come and share your expertise with our novice. * Art students are welcomed For further information please feel free to contact Tiffany @ twatsonscsny.org
11377.title: Volunteer Art & Ceramic Instructor

11377.description: DESCRIPTION OF PROJECT / PURPOSE OF ASSIGNMENT: Woodside on the Move holds regular fundraising events often featuring New York State elected officials Events can range from sit down meals to lectures. WOTM needs assistance maintaining our client database and OUTLINE OF VOLUNTEER’S RESPONSIBILITIES: Volunteers will typically asked to assist with general filing/organization of WOTM’S files across various departments. Volunteers will occasionally be asked to perform clerical duties, specifically faxing,copying, and notarizing material upon request. TIME COMMITMENT: Administrative volunteers will typically be asked to commit at least 2-4 hours per month. Schedule will be determined based on volunteers availability. Volunteers are welcome to offer their services as frequent as they wish. Volunteers are required to notify their coordinator 24 hours prior to their proposed volunteer shift. QUALIFICATIONS : Qualifications vary, depending on specific tasks/events BENEFITS: Volunteers will be part of the decision-making body of a neighborhood organization that has been providing after school and affordable housing for four decades, which support critical programs that are LIFELINES for Queens’ families. Depending on the type of event, volunteers may be able to attend the event free of charge or at a reduced price. All WOTM volunteers receive the WOTM’s newsletter in addition to, receiving recognition on WOTM’s social media handles and on our published works . Event volunteers also have the opportunity to learn skills from professionals, while fostering healthy community engagement. For all inquiries, please send resume and brief cover letter via email. Contact Aaron Frager at afrager@woodsideonthemove.org or call at (718)-476-8449.
11377.title: Administrative Volunteer

Program aides will assist with the following duties Assist activity specialist and counselors in the classroom, work with students in small groups Assist with Classroom Supervision Assist transporting children throughout facility when necessary(Restroom,Main Office,etc.) Volunteers are expected to meet the following requirements Fingerprinting by DOH & DOE( We Cover cost) SCR Background Check Complete volunteer application, with 1 personal reference, and 1 professional reference Must submit cover letter & Resume

TIME COMMITMENT: Event day volunteers will typically be asked to commit at least 3 hours. Participation on an event planning committee typically requires larger time commitments over several months. Depending on the type of event, volunteers may be able to attend the event free of charge or at a reduced price. All WOTM volunteers receive the WOTM’s newsletter and receive recognition on WOTM’s social media handles and on our published works . Event volunteers also have the opportunity to learn skills from professionals, while fostering healthy community engagement. For all inquiries, please send resume and brief cover letter via email. Contact Aaron Frager at afrager@woodsideonthemove.org or call at (718)-476-8449.

11377.title: Volunteer- Computer Tutor(Beginners Level)

11377.description: Volunteer with the ReStore team and help us raise funds for Habitat for Humanity NYC! GENERAL SUMMARY: Habitat for Humanity NYC’s ReStore sells building materials, appliances, tools, and home décor items at 50-80% off the original retail value. Proceeds from the sales of these items help cover the administrative costs of the affiliate and contribute to further homebuilding efforts. ReStore volunteers have the opportunity to help with a variety of tasks including; assiting customers, staging the sales floor, pricing and merchandising, repairing donations, and even donation procurement! *All volunteers interested in volunteering at the ReStore are required to complete a ReStore Volunteer training.* HOW TO SIGN UP: Trainings are held in person at the ReStore and Online. In-Person Trainings: Trainings are held at our ReStore located at 62-01 Northern Blvd, Woodside, NY 11377. Create a new account on http://restore.habitatnyc.volunteerhub.com/events/index After logging in, select \"ReStore\" from the home page Select a \"ReStore Volunteer Training\" You will receive a confirmation email Online Trainings: Online trainings are quick, easy, and convienient! Start volunteering today by completing the online training via this link: http://bit.ly/NYCReStoreTraining Learn more about Habitat NYC: www.habitatnyc.org/volunteer
11377.title: Habitat for Humanity NYC ReStore Volunteers Needed!

07757.description: Move For Hunger is looking for runners and walkers to help us turn miles into meals at the New Jersey Marathon, 1/2 Marathon & 5K! Team members receive a free race entry, training help and some stylish running gear. By joining Team Move For Hunger, you can help us race away hunger and food waste one mile at a time. WHAT DO MY DONATIONS DO? By becoming a member of Team Move For Hunger, your fundraising donations go to keep the food banks in America stocked and meals on the table. Our network of relocation industry specialists help to reduce food waste and deliver much needed food to our local food banks when people are moving. With over 6 million Americans that are food insecure, your help is needed more than ever. And since 96% of every dollar donated going back to our hunger relief and food rescue programs, you can be assured that your miles are turned into meals for those in need. In the last six years, our network of movers have delivered over 7 million pounds of food - let's keep it moving! HOW DOES THE TEAM WORK? Great question! All you need to do is fill out our online registration form and our Team Captain Emily will send over some fundraising and training tips, along with a link to create your personal fundraising page on Crowdrise. Upload your personal picture and information and you’re ready to go! Gather donations from friends, family, coworkers and anyone who wants to help us fight hunger in America. You’ll receive bi-monthly newsletters filled with great information to help you cross the finish line, all while your fundraising donations enable us to continue our lifesaving services. Once you’ve raised the minimum, we will register you with the race, getting your free registration along with a stylish Team Move For Hunger technical tee or tank top (your choice). If you raise more, the incentives just get better! WANT MORE INFORMATION? Contact our Team Captain Emily at emily@moveforhunger.org, call 732.832.5025 or visit: https://moveforhunger.org/event/new-jersey-marathon-12-marathon-5k-april-30-2017/
07757.title: Volunteers Needed to Turn Miles Into Meals at the New Jersey Marathon, 1/2 Marathon & 5K!

We are starting a new initiative of creating a collection of short videos that focus on different subjects that are promoted by our organization. The goal is that through these short videos to make everyone aware of what we do, and also impart knowledge on ancient healing sciences. These videos will be posted on social media sites and our website. Ishwar Center is a non-profit 501 (c)(3) tax-exempt organization.
