07628.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07628.title: Hospice Volunteer

10302.description: Love working with seniors? We are looking for a volunteer to teach exercise class to our very active seniors. Once or twice a week for 45 minutes to 60 minute session. Preferably in the mornings Monday - Friday.
10302.title: Exercise Instructor
10302.org: Catholic Charities, Archdiocese of New York

10302.description: Make the Road New York ( www.maketheroadny.org ) is a non-profit organization that builds the power of Latino and working class communities to achieve dignity and justice through organizing, policy innovation, transformative education, and survival services. We have 16,000 members and operate five community centers in Bushwick, Brooklyn; Jackson Heights, Queens; Port Richmond and Midland Beach, Staten Island; and Brentwood, Long Island. Our Care Specialist will volunteer under the direction of our experienced and caring MRNY Adult Literacy Counselor to help underserved immigrants navigate the complex housing system and connect people to survival services. Our counselor will take the time to train and guide one volunteer per cycle who is committed to our mission and our community. The volunteer will be a part of a network of volunteers committed to social justice. TASKS: Help people fill out the NYCHA housing application online who do not have access to the internet and are computer illiterate. Help people who can't read or do not understand certain words used in the application. Help people who have filled out forms on their own before but never heard back and thus feel hopeless to ask for help again. Data Entry FEEL GOOD MOMENTS: We get to explain what the process is after submitting the application. We provide numbers to clients on who to contact in case they want to edit the app. We give reassurance that they can come back for additional assistance (ex; read/translate letters). We provide them with the tools to access community resources at free or very low costs. We encourage them to find their voice and advocate for themselves. LOCATIONS: Various Locations SCHEDULE: Commitment of 1 Class cycle Flexible hours Min of 10hrs per week. Days are flexible REQUIREMENTS: Interview, application materials, and background checks will be required from all volunteers for this opportunity. Bilingual (Spanish/English) The volunteers don’t have to be fluent but it some comprehension of the language will aid in communicating with the students. Basic computer skills Patient and good sense of humor a plus Reliable and responsible (volunteers are asked to commit to at least 1 cycle of classes and to follow our attendance policy guidelines Interest in the Latino immigrant community Willingness to learn and to work in teams and autonomously Highly Motivated If seeking an internship you must show proof that you would be receiving course credits and educational gain and provide us with the educational goals of the internship. Please note we currently can only accept non-paid interns.
10302.title: Care Advocacy Specialist - Volunteer to gain skills while helping Immigrants

10302.description: Seniors in nursing facilities tend to have few visitors, but with a few hours of your time, you can provide the social interaction that is important to keeping their spirits soaring. There are a variety of projects with seniors such as knitting, gardening, and even teaching basic computer skills. Just a few hours of your time can help brighten up a senior’s week. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
10302.title: Seniors Projects with New York Cares in Staten Island

10302.description: Volunteers on New York Cares' Hunger projects do more than just serve a meal -- they provide a warm smile, friendly conversation, and the reassurance that someone cares. These projects serve hundreds of men, women, and children at homeless shelters, churches, and senior centers each day. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
10302.title: Hunger Projects with New York Cares in Staten Island

10302.description: On New York Cares' Health and Wellness projects, volunteers bring much-needed companionship to long-term hospital residents and individuals living with devastating illnesses, such as HIV/AIDS. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
10302.title: Health and Wellness Projects with New York Cares in Staten Island

10302.description: Keeping kids active is an important part of their development, so help us get them off the couch! Some projects available for volunteers include sports, field trips, and even culinary activities. Sports and fitness projects keep children healthy and active, arts and culture projects help them discover their creativity, and recreational outings expose them to the unique activities and culture of New York City. Search our projects here: http://www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at http://www.newyorkcares.org.
10302.title: Children's Recreation Projects with New York Cares in Staten Island

10302.description: Help give kids a strong foundation for academic achievement. New York Cares' Children's Education projects help New York City's underserved children develop their academic skills at an early age, improving their chances of getting into college and preparing them for future success. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
10302.title: Children's Education Projects with New York Cares in Staten Island

10302.description: New York Cares offers many programs serving adults and children with special needs. Our volunteers provide a little extra care and attention to the physically disabled, who often face limited recreational activities and educational opportunities. These projects provide important social interaction while teaching essential independent living skills. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
10302.title: Adults and Children with Special Needs Projects with New York Cares in Staten Island

10302.description: Planning for a better future starts by believing that one is possible. On New York Cares' Adult Education projects, volunteers help capable but struggling New Yorkers, many of whom are transitioning out of homelessness, build a brighter future for themselves and their families. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
10302.title: Adult Education and Job Readiness Projects with New York Cares in Staten Island

10301.description: We are part of Migration Resource Center to achieve the mission by working together. As a team, we will touch lives every day, in a great and small way. Therefore, we are committed to serving families, and individuals with dignity. Migration Resource Center (MRC) is devoted to being client services and provide legal services in the United States. Currently Migration Resource Center (MRC) is looking for volunteer Immigration Assistant to perform the following duties: Prepare various immigration forms Legal research for particular immigration cases Draft letters, memos Communicate with government agencies Maintain records in our immigration system Answer the phone Reports to assigned Supervisor. The length of Commitment: MRC is looking for two days a week for three months period. Week (T&Th) for six hours (10-4).
10301.title: Immigration Assistant

10301.description: Staten Island Family Sevices provides counseling programs for families struggling with a variety of challenges, including mental health issues, substance abuse, domestic violence, transitions, separation, and loss. Staten Island Family Services also conducts Brief Strategic Family Therapy (BSFT) for families with youth who are having serious problems with their behavior. As an Administrative Assistant at Staten Island Family Services, you will be assisting at the front desk, and would be one of the first people clients will meet when coming into the office. Volunteer duties include greeting clients, answering the front desk phone, taking and distributing messages, taking referral information from clients over the phone, and general clerical duties as needed. Staten Island Family Services is open Monday - Thursday 8:30 -6:00pm, and Friday 8:30-5:00 pm. To register for our volunteer website, please visit www.jewishboard.org/volunteer.
10301.title: Administrative Assistant- Staten Island
10301.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10301.description: Staten Island Day Hab Without Walls is looking for a volunteer music instructor to teach a small number of our supported individuals, the basics of music (how to read/write). We are looking for someone once a week on Tuesdays from 12:00pm to 2:00pm, starting September 29, 2015 (end day TBD). The opportunity will be to work with people with developmental disabilities. If you feel you are able to volunteer, please send me a brief description of yourself and your qualifications, along with your contact information. Benefits of this opportunity: experience teaching music, willing to provide letter of recommendation, giving back to your community! For more information regarding our agency please visit: www.ahrcnyc.org
10301.title: Music Instructor

10468.description: Join New York Common Pantry's program Nourish in it's fight to end hunger in the senior community! Nourish is funded by New York State Department of Health for the Commodity Supplemental Food Program (CSFP) and helps provide over 14,000 seniors a month with supplemental food packages. To distribute these food packages to seniors, we need your help at our mobile site RAIN Tolentine on February 17th only. The Nourish program at NYCP distributes groceries 1-2 times a month at over 90 mobile sites around NYC, if you are interested in volunteering on a different day or at a different location please email sgonzalez@nycommonpantry.org. Please note that we do not have any weekend opportunities currently available. WE ONLY DISTRIBUTE GROCERIES AT THIS SITE ONCE A MONTH
10468.title: Help Give Out Free Groceries at RAIN Tolentine Senior Center!

10468.description: Join New York Common Pantry's program Nourish in it's fight to end hunger in the senior community! Nourish is funded by New York State Department of Health for the Commodity Supplemental Food Program (CSFP) and helps provide over 14,000 seniors a month with nutritious food packages. To distribute these food packages to seniors, we need your help! We currently have 5 senior centers located in Fordham, Packchester, Throgs Neck, West Farm, and Allerton sections of the Bronx where we distribute food 1-2 times a month. We are looking for volunteers who are available during weekdays to help us give out groceries at any of these sites. Please email me directly at sgonzalez@nycommonpantry.org for more information on the senior centers where we need your assistance.
10468.title: Bronx Volunteers Needed!

10156.description: Foster a cat or kitten in your home for two-three weeks until \"room\" opens up at the KittyKind adoption center. KittyKind is a no-kill, all volunteer, non-profit, cat rescue group. In space that the Petco Corporation donates, KittyKind adopts over 1,500 rescued cats a year, into loving homes. www.kittykind.org (Petco, 17th Street & Broadway, NYC) When space is full at the adoption center, foster parents provide temporary care. This opportunity is great for people who travel a lot and cannot commit to full-time care, for people who want the company of a pet but not on a full-time basis. Please let me know if you're interested, and we can discuss the details further. Your home helps to save a cat! Thanks.
10156.title: Foster Parents for Pets

11238.description: After School Instructor Achievement First Endeavor ES - Brooklyn, NY Chess Teacher We are seeking an enthusiastic and knowledgeable Chess player to volunteer to teach elementary school scholars the game of Chess. The ideal volunteer will work with students interested in learning the game of chess and building strategies for the game. If long term, the volunteer will prepare a group for a Chess Tournament at the end of the school year. The volunteer will help Achievement First Endeavor Elementary School achieve their goal of preparing students for academic success using Chess as a vehicle for building critical thinking and developing problem solving skills. The ideal volunteer must have a love for chess and the desire to share and teach young kids. Requirements & Commitment: Background check & finger printed One day a week from 4:30-5:30 pm from March 15 th - June week of June 9 th Previous experience teaching young kids
11238.title: After School Chess Teacher

11238.description: AF Endeavor Elementary School seeks a part time instructor for our Encore After School program in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, NY. The participants in the program are 100 students in KG-4 th. The goal of our program is to provide the academic and social support needed to help students develop the skills required to successfully complete their secondary and collegiate education. We achieve these goals by providing a holistic program that includes homework assistance, physical exercise, and fun extracurricular activities. The hours of this position are one day a week from 4:30pm-5:30pm. Rate of Pay: $20 per hour for a maximum of 2 hours per week. Major Duties and Responsibilities include: -Provide leadership on a day to day basis for a class of 10- 15 elementary school students. Instructors are representatives of our school and are responsible for maintaining the culture of our school in the afternoon. -Create lesson plans in advance of implementation ensuring that they are age appropriate and coincide with the goals of the program and our stakeholders. Much of our planning is based in exploration activities. Staff will work as a team to provide activities and experiences that increase student’s awareness and keeps their attention. -Ensure student safety and attendance to the program at all times. -Instructors are a role model for our students. Everyone on our team must be outstanding in adherence to policies on attendance and punctuality, dress code, and setting a tone of respect in interactions with students, colleagues, parents, and AFE staff members. -Communicate with parents when there is a concern that must be resolved. Provide excellent customer service and a professional, caring demeanor. Education and Experience: Study plan towards college graduation with a BA (minimum) At least one year of experience working with Elementary School age group in a professional setting Commitment to the program through the end of June 2017 is a non-negotiable requirement Bilingual fluency in Spanish and English is needed but not required Demonstrated Abilities Knowledge of best practices in working with children in an extracurricular setting Strong communication abilities in one-on-one meetings and in group settings, Takes personal accountability for the program outcomes, and takes initiative to implement positive change in the face of challenges Interested and qualified candidates should respond to this posting with their cover letter and resume by email only. Any attachments should be in PDF or MSWord formatting. Please include the title of this position in the subject line of your email. For more information about our organization please visit our website at www.achievementfirst.org Job Type: Part-time Salary: $20/hour Required experience: Work with elementary school students in a school setting: 1 year Required language: Spanish preferred
11238.title: After School Spanish Teacher

11238.description: Protect our environment and the special world in which we live. Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New York citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Together we can protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. Want to know more? Please join our weekly Introductory Conference Call. The next one is on Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. It is a live call, about an hour long, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. Please register for the call at this link so that we can follow up with you: https://citizensclimatelobby.org/join-weekly-intro-call/ We look forward to working with you!
11238.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Brooklyn NY

11239.description: Purpose Regular exercise is an essential part of a healthy lifestyle. Lead a weekly exercise class for seniors to help keep them in top shape. Responsibilities Lead a group of seniors in a weekly exercise Create exercise routines suitable for varied physical abilities Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills Exercise certification Experience leading seniors in exercises Experience with group exercise classes Knowledge of several light exercise techniques Comfortable leading a group of varying skill levels. Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11239.title: Exercise Instructor - JASA Starrett City Senior Center

10019.description: Friday, March 17 | 7 am until the books run out! On St. Patrick’s Day, March 17 th, each year, we rely on great volunteers to help us hand out free books by Irish and Irish-American authors across the boroughs of New York City. Come be a part of a great day celebrating one of Ireland’s greatest offerings: its stories! Volunteer shifts can be suited to your availability and we try our best to match people to the borough of their choice. You will not be required for the entire day. To sign up, please fill out an availability survey here: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/RPNRMQX If you aren't available on Book Day itself, Friday, March 17th, don't fret! A large part of the event prep depends on your help in making sure each book has an Irish Arts Center sticker and bookmark. Volunteering for these \"stuffing\" days is a fun way to get involved with the center in a relaxed environment. If you have any questions, please email: kestrel@irishartscenter.org or call (212) 757-3318 extension 203. \"This is a lovely way to remind everybody that the Irish are known for their literature.\" - The Wall Street Journal In a citywide celebration of Irish literature we'll be handing out 10,000 free books and want you to be part of the fun!
10019.title: St. Patrick's Day Book Giveaway with Irish Arts Center!

10019.description: Make a Difference. Graphic Design Internship at ClassWish.org! Work in NYC or Virtually We are recruiting outstanding graphic design students as interns for late Summer 2012 and the 2012-2013 school year (either or both!) to collaborate on the boldest nonprofit initiative we know. We are looking for passionate, energetic students with exceptional skills to create web page layouts, flyers, logos, etc. for ClassWish.org. This is an outstanding leadership opportunity in an innovative start-up nonprofit organization. Here is the problem we are tackling: K-12 schools in this country do not have enough resources to let children explore their potential and excel. Art supplies, books, computers, musical instruments, science equipment, sports equipment, and even paper for computers and printers are all in desperately short supply. Our Approach: ClassWish . org, an exciting new nonprofit, uses modern business practices and the latest marketing techniques to help 125,000 schools serving 56 million kids, inform, inspire and engage supporters. Teachers visit the site to create Wish Lists of the resources they need. People in the community can see exactly what is needed and contribute to help. About Us: The people behind ClassWish.org include such prominent education and business leaders as Adam Hirsch, former COO, Mashable; Laurie Coots, CMO, TBWA; Scott Cutler, EVP, New York Stock Exchange; Betsy Morgan, former CEO, Huffington Post; Nancy Pelz-Paget, Director, Education and Society Program, Aspen Institute; Sharon Robinson, CEO, American Association of Colleges of Teacher Education. Forbes Magazine liked our approach so much that they donated a full page to help raise awareness. Yo-Yo Ma, Tony Hawk and Dwight Howard are among the celebrities who have offered to help promote ClassWish.org. The work: Teachers and students are already getting supplies from ClassWish.org. Now, we need to develop attention-grabbing graphics so we can help more kids. You will take a leadership role and work with other highly motivated interns, established professionals, and directly with our co-founder. What do we offer? You will enhance your portfolio with projects that will be displayed on the Internet as well as in print, visible to potential future employers, and you will have the satisfaction of knowing that you have helped children get the tools they need to perform at their best. If you want to gain great experience and do something you will always be proud of, send a cover letter and a resume to interns @ ClassWish . org. Impress us. This is competitive. FAQ Is this a business or a nonprofit? ClassWish is a nonprofit, but we use the latest techniques from the business world to make a leveraged, scalable and financially-self sustaining difference in the lives of tens of millions of children. This sounds ambitious! Daniel Burnham, the great Chicago architect, said \"Make no little plans; they have not the power to stir men’s souls.\" (Nor women’s, we hasten to add). Little plans also do not have the power to provide a better education to 56 million kids who deserve more than they are getting today. We face a crushing need in schools, have a solid plan to address it, and with your help, we intend to grow this very large and very fast. Where are you located? We are in Manhattan, conveniently located right across from Madison Square Garden. There are four express subway stops within one block. We will also hire interns to work remotely from other cities. I looked at your site and have some suggestions. Great! This is a collaborative project, and we want to hear from you. Is this a paid internship? We can offer a great experience, a great addition to your portfolio, academic credit (if your school allows), stunning recommendations, and a chance to make a difference, but we are a start-up nonprofit, so can only offer unpaid internship and volunteer positions. When will you select the interns? We’re agile. When we see a great candidate, we extend an invitation immediately. We won’t keep you waiting for a decision. What dates will the internship run? We are hiring for the spring semester, for the summer, and beyond. Tell us what you are looking for. What are the hours? We welcome full-time and part-time interns. Let us know what works for you. What will I need to bring? Brains, heart, passion, energy, a notebook computer, and a passion to make an immediate improvement to the education of tens of millions of children. Sounds exciting! How can I apply? Please send an impressive cover letter and a resume to interns @ ClassWish . org.
10019.title: Make a Difference.   Graphic Design Internship at ClassWish.org!

10019.description: Brighten an aging actor’s week! Be a friendly visitor to Calvin, a kind and amiable senior who is living with Alzheimer’s disease. Calvin is an actor who has lived in the Times Square area of Manhattan his whole life. He likes to wear a bow tie every day, always looks dapper, and always has a smile on his face. Calvin would love a friendly visitor to converse with and liven up his week. However, Calvin’s Alzheimer’s is fairly advanced, and it limits his conversational abilities. We are looking for volunteers who have experience with Alzheimer’s disease (in a professional or personal capacity). There is a short orientation and training for this program, but we want someone who is familiar with and comfortable around individuals with Alzheimer’s disease. Please apply to help make a big difference! When you apply please tell me about your experience with Alzheimer's disease.
10019.title: Looking for a Meaningful Volunteer Experience?

10019.description: We match isolated and lonely seniors with volunteers in the community who make weekly visits in the senior’s home. The Friendly Visiting program is an opportunity to form rewarding relationships and ongoing companionship for both seniors and volunteers. Seniors and their visitor can converse and enjoy the company, take part in activities like going to cafes and museums, share stories, learn new skills, and a variety of other things based on the desires of the companions. You will be matched with a senior who has a similar personality and interests and you can decide together how to spend your time. Visits can easily fit into your schedule because matches are made based on your availability. Your time as a friendly visitor is invaluable, and you gain a new friend!
10019.title: Want to make an impact? Become a Friendly Visitor today!

10019.description: Lighthouse Guild has three health plans through which we manage every medical and healthcare need, especially for those who are visually impaired. We coordinate healthcare, therapy, in-home care and other services so that members can live safely at home. We are looking for a volunteer, who is currently a licensed Registered Nurse in New York State (NYS) who has data entry skills. This volunteer will be responsible for maintaining accuracy of the GuildNet case list on the NYS Department of Health Uniform Assessment System (UAS) website by removing disenrolled members. Principle duties and responsibilities: Review the list of GuildNet monthly disenrollments. Update the UAS system to confirm disenrollments. Qualifications: Current New York State Registered Nurses license, required. Strong computer skills, required. The ability to take and follow instruction, required. Prior experience where computer use was required is necessary. The ability to exhibit excellence in the execution of assigned responsibilities is required. Detail of service opportunity: The ideal candidate is available approximately 8-12 hours during the first or second week of each month, or as long as it takes to complete the assignment. The registered nurse will have to complete on line training in the UAS software system prior to starting the task. There will also be ad hoc training as mandated by the Department of Health.
10019.title: Administrative Nursing Opportunity in NYC

10019.description: Art for Healing NYC Org still has a huge donated art collection for sale at super prices, We also share the funds raised with other charities! Please contact us and visit our website for more information. We need marketing outreach online, so you can live anywhere to help us get the word out. Also when you help us make a big sale we give you a piece of art work as a thank you! Win /win for all.
10019.title: Online marketing outreach about our donated art collection for sale at super low prices!

10019.description: Art for Healing NYC org is in need of someone who likes doing art inventory, at the gallery. Also marketing outreach of our donated art works for sale, and sharing with other charities. After helping 20 hours total, you recieve a FREE pice of art work from a super collection we have!
10019.title: Inventory of our Donated Art works,  history book archiving, share art sales with other charities

10019.description: We are looking for Christian women who have a desire to see pregnant and parenting teens meet Jesus and live in the fullness of who they were created to be as young woman and mothers. This ministry is growing in various parts of New York City, so we need lots of helpers! Our most immediate needs are as follows: -Administrative Assistance (including social media) -Mentors who have time to invest in a deep relationship with a young mom for at least 1 year -Childcare Leaders -Board Members -Adult Helpers Email to join our team!
10019.title: Impact this generation and the next by serving teen moms and their children through YoungLives

10019.description: It is easier than you think to put a smile on a senior's face. All you have to do is be a Friendly Visitor. A Friendly Visitor is someone who brightens someones day, week, month, and ultimately, their life by paying them visits at their homes. You will be matched with a homebound senior that has a similar personality, similar interests, and similar hobbies and meet with them each week for about an hour. The goal is to diminish some of the isolation the senior may be experiencing and for a new friendship to blossom in the process. A visit may consist of listening to music, going to a coffee shop, or maybe even visiting a museum. Many of the friendly visiting volunteers have been visiting the same senior for a number of years and have expressed that it feels like having another family member. You can have this experience too as a Friendly Visiting volunteer!
10019.title: Gain a FRIEND. Make an IMPACT. Visit an isolated senior today!

10019.description: The Chad Foundation is seeking volunteer cardiologists, ultrasound echo technicians and nurses to help provide cardiovascular screenings for young athletes and students in the 5 boroughs of NY to help prevent Sudden Cardiac Death by identifying structural heart anomalies such as HCM (hypertrophic cardiomyopathy), the leading silent killer of SCD in young athletes and premature cardiovascular risk factors such as hypertension, high cholesterol, obesity and diabetes. Thanks to the donated services of cardiologists from some of the leading hospitals in the country such as \"Childrens Hospital Los Angeles,\" \"Childrens National Medical Center,\" Wash. D.C., \"Johns Hopkins Medical Center,\" Baltimore, and \"Columbia Presbyterian,\" NYC, Chad has provided overr 6,000 echocardiograms to young athletes and students in 5 states and abroad in Austria and Sweden (16 and 26 countries of athletes participating in the \"1st and 2nd Homeless Streetsoccer World Cups.\") Thanks to recent grants, we are expanding our heart screenings to include tests for cholesterol and diabetes in youth utilizing state-of-the-art Cholestech machines. In a recent pilot study, Chad and the Living Heart screened 250 high school students in Holyoke, MA and found one-third were at risk for hypertension, high cholesterol, diabetes, obesity and/or structural abnormalities. Also, we are glad to tell you, Johns Hopkins Heart Hype Program, will house collected data from Chad screenings for future research. Typically, a Chad screening is held on a Saturday, for 4 or 5 hours at a school gym or community center, often honouring a child who succumbed to Sudden Cardiac Death or a survivor, who through preventive screenings, is alive and thriving with appropriate medical treatment and lifestyle change. Ultrasound manufacturers donate their latest portable ultrasound equipment for the events. We invite you to visit our website, www.chadfoundation.org to view the \"Chad Preventive Heart Screenings\" in action. Thank you.
10019.title: Volunteer Cardiologists, Echo Technicians and Nurses Needed
10019.org: The Chad Foundation for Athletes and Artists

10018.description: Global Green NY is looking for volunteers to help with our food donation work this summer. Volunteer opportunities are for food donation pick-ups in Midtown Manhattan on weekday nights (during typical resutrant closing time), where food will then be transported to food banks and shelters for those in need. http://www.globalgreen.org/getinvolved/ Ideally volunteers: For food rescue volunteers, the only qualifications are that they are punctual, reliable and able to carry 20+ lbs of food.
10018.title: New York GGUSA Volunteer

10018.description: America Needs You fights for economic mobility for ambitious, first generation college students. We do this by providing transformative mentorship and intensive career development. Our flagship Fellows Program is a two-year, intensive mentoring and professional training program where first-generation students (\"Fellows\") are paired with young professional volunteers. We operate in Illinois, New Jersey and New York. Mentor Coach Volunteers develop a one-on-one mentoring relationship with a low-income, first-generation college student (Fellow), working with them at 28 professional development workshops to cultivate their strengths, interests, and passions into successful careers. Mentor Coaches prepare students for selective internships through a structured career development curriculum. Time commitment: 1-2 Saturdays per month for 2 years Workshop Experience: Workshops are held on Saturdays throughout Manhattan and Brooklyn. Year One workshops occur bi-weekly and typically run from 10:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M, followed by optional volunteer-led social events. Year Two workshops occur monthly and are shorter with more industry and skill-specific events tailored to our Fellows' needs and interests. Curriculum includes professional development topics such as resumes and cover letters, elevator pitches, mock interviews, networking, professional etiquette, and more. Benefits of Volunteering: Develop a one-on-one mentoring relationship with your Fellow and help them achieve their career ambitions Build your own personal network as you work closely with highly accomplished professionals from a variety of industries Gain access to exclusive professional development and social events Serve as a role model and resource for your class of Mentor Coach/Fellow pairs To see eligibility and application: https://www.americaneedsyou.org/mentors-apply/ New York Applicants Application Deadline: March 6, 2017 Finalist Interviews: April Notification of Acceptance: By May 31, 2017 Program Begins: July
10018.title: Pay It Forward! Apply to be a 2017 Mentor Coach with America Needs You!

10018.description: America Needs You fights for economic mobility for ambitious, first generation college students. We do this by providing transformative mentorship and intensive career development. Our flagship Fellows Program is a two-year, intensive mentoring and professional training program where first-generation students (\"Fellows\") are paired with young professional volunteers. Our New York program workshops take place in Manhattan and Brooklyn. Career Coaches work with college students during Saturday sessions to build their professional skills and help them realize their career potential. Career Coaches work with Fellows on the day's curriculum and activities by serving as a substitute Mentor Coach when the Fellow's Mentor Coach is absent for the day or by offering additional professional perspectives to an existing Mentor Coach/Fellow pair. ANY curriculum covers all kinds of professional development topics from resume preparation and interview etiquette to giving and receiving feedback and managing up. At workshops, Career Coaches typically participate in group or one-on-one work with Fellows; for example, writing and reviewing a cover letter or building a pros/cons list for deciding between two internships. Workshops are generally from 10am to 4pm. Career Coaches will expose students to their industries and prepare students to pursue internship/job opportunities by leading small group activities, networking, serving on panels, or giving industry presentations. We will send you a guide a few days beforehand with an overview of the event. Volunteers also attend a brief orientation on the day of the event. Please complete the survey below to be contacted about volunteering at an upcoming workshop: https://newyorkneedsyou.wufoo.com/forms/rn5685a0sqkdux/
10018.title: Volunteer to mentor ambitious first-generation college students

10018.description: Looking for a rewarding and challenging opportunity to help those in our community affected by Huntington's disease? Join us in the Huntington's Disease Society of America National Office in mid-town Manhattan! We are looking for individuals to help us with calls, mailings, donation/sponosorship packets, assemble kits, send emails, and other various office type duties. This opportunity is available to any ages 15 and older during our normal buisness hours (Mon - Fri 9am - 5pm). We are focused on ending this fatal genetic disorder and with your help this can become a reality for so many in our community! Join us today!!
10018.title: Huntington's Disease National Office Volunteer

10018.description: Product Donation Volunteer Post The New York Product Donation Volunteer supports the GOOD+ Foundation’s mission of providing essential clothing, gear and services to low-income families. This individual will do so by sorting and screening through incoming product donations, helping to maintain the organization’s inventory, and assisting the Donations/Volunteer Program Assistant. Responsibilities include: Screening and sorting incoming Individual Product Donations. Ensuring that all gear, such as strollers and highchairs have not been recalled before storing away for donation. Clean all baby gear and put them away. Help to maintain organization of the warehouse. Process incoming donations into our inventory system with the use of mobile application, Canvas. Assist the Donation & Volunteer Program Assistant with volunteer groups and donations. Skills and Experience: Responsible, reliable, hard-working, detail-oriented and comfortable standing for long periods of time. Self-motivated and able to work independently, while also collaborating in a team setting. Great attitude and ability to pick up new information quickly, while taking direction and guidance well. Knowledge of children’s product is a plus! Motivation to make a difference! Reporting : This role will report directly to the Donations & Volunteer Assistant If interested, send an email to Kelly at Kelly@goodplusfoundation.org.
10018.title: Product Donation Volunteer

10018.description: The Latinas On the Verge of Excellence, L.O.V.E., Mentoring Program supports and empowers young Latinas to strive both in school and life through positive role modeling. The L.O.V.E. Mentoring Program aims to enhance academic performance and high school graduation rates among young Latinas with the support of positive role models who believe in their inner power and are committed to help them achieve their full potential. The L.O.V.E. Mentoring Program is currently looking for an intern who will collaborate with the development and implementation of the program. The future intern will perform her activities in partner high schools. The intern will work 15 hours per week. L.O.V.E. Intern responsibilities Supports with L.O.V.E. mentors recruiting process Helps plan and implement L.O.V.E. mentoring sessions Maintains records of mentees academic progress Keeps accurate records of mentors and mentees Assists in conducting L.O.V.E. Mentoring Program evaluations Maintains and develops L.O.V.E. social media platforms Communicates effectively, verbally, and in writing with L.O.V.E. Mentoring Program Director Qualifications University female student GPA: 3.0 and above Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Creative capacity Strong organizational, project management and presentation skills Be proficient in Word and Excel Be available a minimum of 15 hours per week Commit to work for the organization for a semester
10018.title: L.O.V.E. Mentoring Program - Internship Position
10018.org: LATINAS ON THE VERGE OF EXCELLENCE LOVE INC

10018.description: We're seeking immediate help from a graphic design professional to support visualization and communication of data from a report on our food waste composting and pilot programs conducted at 10 multi-family buildings in 2015. The project is unique in that we included messaging to residents on both composting and food scrap reduction. We'd like help with graphic design that can help show: a) how the results vary by building and building type b) what was the impact of our food waste reduction messaging?
10018.title: Data Visualization Volunteer Needed for Food Waste Report
10018.org: Coalition for Resource Recovery Global Green USA

10018.description: BCAGlobal, a diversity nonprofit in the culinary arts, is recruiting for one or two interns for school credit and travel/lunch stipend. Duties range from office organization, data management, and assisting in general program implementation. Opportunities for more substantive projects including marketing, social media campaigns, and grant/policy writing will also be available. Seeking interns who are happy to learn and are looking to add value to the organization through reliable, hard work a couple days a week for a few hours. School credit will be given!
10018.title: DIVERSITY NON-PROFIT INTERNSHIP, CULINARY ARTS (School Credit & Stipend)

10018.description: Free Arts NYC provides underserved youth and families with a unique combination of educational arts and mentoring programs that help them to foster the self-confidence and resiliency needed to realize their fullest potential. What is TAP- Portfolio Mentorship? As a volunteer in the Portfolio Mentorship Program, you’ll have the opportunity to mold a young artist while developing your own skills as an artist and educator. During weekly sessions, you’ll guide your mentee through the technical and artistic process of creating a visual portfolio, practice interview and audition skills, while serving as a positive role model. By the end of the program, you will both have shared and strengthened your arts backgrounds and your mentee will have applied to New York City arts high schools! Time Commitment Pairs will meet weekly for 2-3 hours from April- December Mentors can expect to spend an additional hour each week commuting, creating lesson plans, and completing Free Arts NYC online evaluations or monthly phone calls Attendance to H.S. Open Houses, Interviews & Auditions, where possible As a Portfolio Mentor You Can Expect Free Arts to Provide Six hours of professional development trainings in Youth Development Portfolio Mentorship manual (includes resources on pair bonding, goal setting, portfolio development, and interviewing / auditioning) Dedicated Teen Arts Program staff support, including weekly online & individual monthly check-ins Monthly lesson plan clinics with fellow volunteers and Free Arts NYC staff Networking with other arts education professionals Portfolio Mentor Responsibilities Utilizing Portfolio Mentorship manual and TAP Manager support, create a plan for all sessions that ensures teen’s goals are met Support mentee in improving their artistic skills, culminating with the creation and mounting of 20 original portfolio pieces Help mentee to develop interview / audition skills, as necessary Portfolio Mentor Applicant Requirements BFA, MFA, or working knowledge of foundational art skills Portfolio development experience Minimum 6 month NYC residency TAP Portfolio Mentor Application Process 1. Complete Free Arts NYC’s Online Application 2. Supplemental Application, including a resume & portfolio of 3-5 pieces 3. Interview with Free Arts Staff & References ( 2 professional, 1 personal) 4. Fingerprinting with GoPass 5. Attend required Portfolio Mentorship training and meeting with mentee (March 2 nd, March 12 th, March 23 rd)
10018.title: Be a Portfolio Mentor with our Teen Arts Program!

10018.description: The Jumpstart Tri-State Young Professionals Board (YPB) is a forum for young people from all sectors to network with one another while utilizing their skills, connections and ideas to work towards a worthy cause. YPB members work directly with the Development team to advance the Jumpstart mission by assisting with local opportunities for fundraising and strengthening organizational visibility. Members also volunteer in Jumpstart classrooms or participate in special events.
10018.title: Jumpstart Seeking Young Professionals for Junior Board

10018.description: Purpose JASA maintains a commitment not only to the seniors we serve, but also to our volunteers. Help us fulfill this commitment to our volunteers by assisting with outreach, recruitment, and ongoing communication. Responsibilities Solicit and monitor volunteer feedback via phone calls, emails and internet Assist with filing & mailings Computer research and data entry Additional volunteer duties as assigned Skills Have a good general knowledge of computer operations including internet applications and Microsoft Office. Ability to work independently and as part of a team Good organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks Strong communication skills Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
10018.title: Volunteer Ambassador

10018.description: Sing for Hope’s Volunteer Artist Roster lies at the core of our mission and features artists from almost every artistic discipline--actors, singers, musical theater performers, classical and jazz instrumentalists, dancers, and more. Working in tandem with our dedicated staff, our roster of artists gives back to local communities, donating their time and talent. Our Volunteer Artists are the engines that power our broad range of arts outreach programs, inspiring and fostering positive change for those in need.
10018.title: Share Your Art: Become a Sing for Hope Volunteer Artist!

10018.description: The Children’s Scholarship Fund (CSF) is looking for dedicated and enthusiastic young professionals, concerned about America’s education system and passionate about CSF’s mission, to join our Young Leaders Board. Despite recent education reforms, demand for CSF scholarships remains extremely high and is only growing. As we strive to serve this demand, CSF seeks to identify and cultivate the next generation of leaders committed to our continued success. A key to this effort is the Young Leaders Board, which works closely with CSF staff to grow the Young Leaders program and build awareness about CSF. Children’s Scholarship Fund (CSF): CSF aims to maximize educational opportunity for all children: for those in need by offering tuition assistance in grades K-8 for alternatives to faltering conventional schools, and for all children by supporting and cultivating education reform and parental choice efforts. Young Leaders Board: CSF Young Leaders Board seeks to maximize educational opportunities for all children by supporting CSF’s mission through a network of young professionals in NYC. The Young Leaders Board assists in fundraising, volunteer activities, and spreading awareness of CSF’s brand and objectives. Please contact Jane Lee at jlee@scholarshipfund.org for more information!
10018.title: Children's Scholarship Fund Seeking Young Leaders Board Members

11230.description: Seeking someone to update and manage the progress reports for an international recycling program on the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals platform. Great opportunity for someone who wants to help promote the success of global sustainability and social entrepreneurship initiaitves as part of the UN SDGs program, and can just jump in in this online opportunity and help build an active campaign forward! A 501c3 recycling nonprofit organization is looking for a new administrator that can assess the opportunities that are available on the site, and then propose updates to reporting and the overall planning strategy. Founded in Jerusalem and Philadelphia, and now based in NYC, the focus of this project is on our partner communities in Nigeria and Zimbabwe. Please be in touch! Thank you!
11230.title: UN Sustainable Development Goals Project Manager

11230.description: The eldest trees often bear the sweetest fruit! Visit a senior in your area and learn from them and grow mentally and spiritually all while relieving the feeling of isolation by visiting a homebound senior in their home for one hour a week. We match you with one senior who you will visit for 1 hour per week up to 6 months or more should you wish to commit further than the 6 month requirement. For more information call 718-449-5000 ext. 2212 or email Libby with your contact information at L.feldman@jccgci.org. Learn more on our website at www.friendlyvisitingny.org and like our facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/pages/Friendly-Visiting-Program/332936972502
11230.title: We all have a best friend through each stage in life! Visit a Senior in Your area!
11230.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11230.description: You can volunteer and make a real difference in a homebound individuals life in so many different ways. W e are a dynamic and diverse group of volunteers or Friendly Visitors who visit homebound individual in their area each week. Every member of our team is willing and eager to share their time with someone who is older, wiser, and has had a lifetime of experience. Volunteer by visiting a senior at there home, escorting them to appointments and recreational outings!
11230.title: Be the Reason a Senior Smiles Today!
11230.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

10012.description: The Bubble Foundation Volunteer Wellness Educators teach wellness classes to pre-K and elementary students in one of our partner NYC schools (currently in Manhattan- Harlem and Washington Heights, Brooklyn- Bedstuy and Brownsville, and Bronx- Mott Haven). Volunteers will use Bubble curricula to teach one or two interactive 45-min classes per week on topics relevant to food and health (e.g., cooking, nutrition, gardening, agriculture, food literacy). Wellness Educators are asked to commit to teach for the entire academic semester and will be paired with at least one co-teacher with complementary skills. We provide complete training to our volunteers. Throughout this volunteer experience, Wellness Educators will gain skills in: nutrition education, garden education, culinary arts education, cooking, teaching, classroom management, teamwork, public speaking, working with kids and underserved populations. Thank you for your interest in volunteering with Bubble! Visit our website to learn more and apply www.welcometobubble.org. Or use this form to apply: https://goo.gl/forms/kz12sztVwgtfLS3x1 Questions? Please contact: volunteer@welcometobubble.org.
10012.title: Nutrition, Cooking, and Gardening Wellness Educator

10012.description: Esperanza is dedicated to keeping young people at home with their families. We work to safely reduce reliance on out-of-home placement for court-involved youth by offering a community-based alternative to incarceration throughout the five boroughs of New York City. Esperanza began delivering direct services in 2002 and currently serves young people who are prosecuted in Family Court as well as youth who are being prosecuted as adults in Supreme/Criminal Court. Our home-based, direct-service program includes up to six months of intensive therapy for youth and their families, as well as case and crisis management. Towards the end of this period, some of our participants are matched with mentors for a period of time to further support the work they have done while in Esperanza. Esperanza NY, Inc. is looking for individuals to mentor youth. Interested applicants must have a passion for working with young people and the ability to build positive relationships with them. This is a volunteer opportunity.
10012.title: Mentor

10012.description: Bond Street Theatre has been a pioneer in Theatre for Social Development and Arts in Peacebuilding in critical areas worldwide, currently in Afghanistan, Myanmar, Lebanon, Greece and Malaysia. As the company grows, the need for a strong, active and effective board is increasingly essential to the continued growth and success of the organization. We are especially interested in diversifying our membership to match our international outreach, and younger members who may be first-time directors. Since our work is primarily overseas, one of our challenges is in spreading the word about our good work here in the US. We are looking for creative thinkers who are excited about the arts in peacebuilding and making an positive impact in some difficult places worldwide.
10012.title: Board Members

10012.description: Housing Works is powered by a vibrant community of volunteers who lend their time, dedication, and passion to many different roles within our organization. For more information about our mission and programs, visit our website: www.housingworks.org Join our team of volunteer Bookstore Sales Associates! Our bookstore serves many purposes for the community and with that, our volunteers enjoy a wide variety of responsibilities. Bookstore Sales Associates price and shelve books, run the register, take donations, maintain sections and displays, and help customers. You act as the friendly face that keeps customers coming back and supporting the Housing Works mission! Bookstore Volunteers are frequently asked to support us at exciting special events held at the Bookstore, such as concerts, book launches, and trivia events. Volunteer Requirements * Complete an online application. You can find it here: http://www.housingworks.org/volunteer/bookstore-cafe-volunteers/ * Be at least 16 years of age to be a sales associate * Attend a New Volunteer Information Session, to which you will be invited shortly after you apply . * Commit to one four-hour shift per week for a minimum of six months. We are not recruiting short-term volunteers, so please apply if you can find a shift that will fit with your schedule for the next six months. We are currently in need of volunteers with weekday morning (10am-2pm) availability.
10012.title: Support Housing Works as a Volunteer Bookstore Sales Associate!

10012.description: Housing Works is powered by a vibrant community of volunteers who lend their time, dedication, and passion to many different roles within our organization. For more information about our mission and programs, visit our website: www.housingworks.org The Inventory & Internet Sales Associate volunteer position is a great opportunity to discover thousands of books you may not get to see elsewhere! In this role, you help to manage over 60,000 books listed online. You will process all of our customer orders, help pick books from shelves and pack them for shipping. Other responsibilities include helping process donations, organizing and maintaining shelves and the packing area, and moving boxes of books. Volunteer Requirements * Complete an online application. You can find it here: http://www.housingworks.org/volunteer/bookstore-cafe-volunteers/ * Be at least 16 years of age to be a sales associate, and at least 18 years of age to be a barista. * Attend a New Volunteer Information Session, to which you will be invited shortly after you apply * Commit to one four-hour shift per week for a minimum of six months. We are not recruiting short-term volunteers, so please apply if you can find a shift that will fit with your schedule for the next six months. ALL Bookstore Volunteers are frequently asked to support us at exciting special events held at the Bookstore, such as concerts, book launches, and trivia events. Volunteer Shifts Monday-Friday, 9-2p, 2-6p Saturday-Sunday, 10-2p, 2-6p Not all volunteer shifts are open. Please contact the Volunteer Coordinator directly for more details.
10012.title: Help us end AIDS one book at a time!

10012.description: Housing Works is powered by a vibrant community of volunteers who lend their time, dedication, and passion to many different roles within our organization. Responsibilities include making espresso drinks, serving food, stocking and maintaining the cafe, washing dishes, working at the cash register, and, most importantly, helping us sustain the warm, welcoming, and unique environment our café has come to provide. All training is done on-site, where you get to learn how to use the espresso machine and the basics of proper food handling. Volunteer Requirements * Complete an online application. You can find it here: http://www.housingworks.org/volunteer/bookstore-cafe-volunteers/ * Be least 18 years of age to be a barista. * Attend a New Volunteer Information Session, to which you will be invited shortly after you apply. * Commit to one four-hour shift per week for a minimum of six months. We are not recruiting short-term volunteers, so please apply if you can find a shift that will fit with your schedule for the next six months. We are currently looking for volunteers with morning (10am-2pm) and afternoon (2-6pm) availability All Bookstore Volunteers are also invited to volunteer at our special events, such as concerts, comedy shows, and book launches. Volunteer Shifts Monday-Friday, 9-2p, 2-6p, 6-10p Saturday-Sunday, 10-2p, 2-6p Not all volunteer shifts are open. Please contact the Volunteer Coordinator for further details.
10012.title: Help us End AIDS one cup of coffee at a time as a volunteer Barista!

10012.description: About Met Council on Housing: Met Council is dedicated to the belief that everyone deserves a decent, safe, and affordable home, and organizes tenants to be the force behind achieving this reality. We have been at the forefront of the housing movement for the past half century. We work to combat displacement at the individual level through our tenant help hotline and clinic while bringing tenants together in citywide campaigns to fight for structural changes to solve the affordable housing crisis for current and future generations. About the position: Through our Tenant Help Hotline, you will help thousands of tenants across New York City who call in with their housing issues. You will inform tenants of their rights and ensure they are not taken advantage of by predatory landlords and management companies. Volunteers quickly become very knowledgable about tenants' rights and the housing landscape in New York City. No prior knowledge or experience is necessary as training will be provided. Spanish speakers are needed! Shifts are flexible-Monday and Wednesday 1:30-5:30 Friday 1:30-5:00
10012.title: Tenants' Rights Hotline

10012.description: BRC is a leading provider of housing and services to thousands of New York City's neediest individuals. Offering a hand up, not a hand out, BRC asks one simple question: What can we do for you? BRC sees the potential in each individual it serves, and provides each the opportunity to find it. Whatever our clients may seek, BRC has it, 24/7/365. What can you do to help? BRC is in need of food service volunteers once weekly on Saturday, Sunday, Monday or Tuesday, specifically during breakfast hours from 5:30am to 8:00am. In order to continue to provide healthful breakfasts to our 110 clients at the BRC Palace, located in the lower east side of Manhattan, we are in need of additional volunteer assistance in the kitchen and dining area with light food preparation and service and post meal clean-up. For more information about our organization, please contact Rick Akin, Director of Volunteer Services, at 212-803-5720 or via email at rakin@brc.org
10012.title: Help with breakfast preparation and service at a BRC homeless shelter

10012.description: During the warmer months, some of our programs like to provide roof top barbecues for their clients. At other times throughout the year, another provides a special monthly Candlelight Dinner, bringing the food to the tables, serving the residents in a â restaurant styleâ environment. Whatever the occasion, we always try to provide opportunities for our clients to socialize and eat. In order to provide this very special service, we need enthusiastic, friendly volunteers who can act as servers, busboys, waiters and more. Locations vary throughout the city.
10012.title: Help us serve a very special dinner to our clients

10012.description: Are you exceptionally outgoing and friendly? Are you able to jump right in and engage folks in conversation? Do you have a hobby or passion that you'd like to share, such as backgammon, chess, checkers, other board games? Perhaps you're great at arts and crafts, crochet, knitting or even embroidery? If so, our residents and staff can definitely use your enthusiasm! Socialization is a crucial component of our clients' therapy, allowing them to fluidly readjust to daily living, gaining the ability to communicate effectively, and allowing them the confidence to express their thoughts and ideas. You can help in this capacity simply by coordinating and implementing a Bingo night, a chess tournament, movie festival, card games, arts & crafts and more. This is a great opportunity for small groups of friends or coworkers! Locations are throughout the city. Some limited weekend hours are available.
10012.title: Play a game, teach a skill, have a great time and still do some good!

10011.description: We are in need of passionate coaches to mentor high school students from low-income families who are typically first generation college applicants. As a college coach volunteers will spend at least one day a week, for 3 hours, coaching either verbal or math. Our verbal sessions are on Tuesdays from 5:30-8:30 pm and our math sessions are on Thursdays from 5:30-8:30pm. Lets Get Ready wil provide all the materials and lesson plans! Our program really makes a difference: LGR students increase their SAT scores an average of 115 points, and 92% of LGR students enroll in college after high school! For our coaches we will have great bonding activities and create a community atomsphere that is fun and fulfilling for everyone involved! TO APPLY USE THIS LINK: https://www.tfaforms.com/451366
10011.title: Coach/Mentor High School Students (First Generation / Low-Income Families)

10011.description: Job Description Development and Special Events Intern (Unpaid) About Corlears Corlears School, is a Nursery through 5th Grade, New York City independent school. When you enter Corlears School from its front door on West 15th Street in Chelsea, you are immediately struck by the energy and the excitement of the community. Students and teachers know each other in deep and authentic ways. Families support and partner with the school to elevate every child’s experience. Our Mission: Corlears students learn, play and grow together in a school designed for who they are at ages 2 through 10. During these crucial formative years, we build a foundation of compassion, critical thinking, imagination and leadership, and cultivate a joy and confidence in learning that serves our graduates throughout their lives. Responsibilities Working closely with the Director of Development & Alumni Affairs assist with the following key projects: Assist in reviewing our current Annual Fund messaging, researching current strategies used by small independent schools serving N-5th grade Analyze FY17 Annual Fund strategies and develop recommendations for changes to strategies and timing for FY18 (July 1, 2017 - June 30,.2018). Review FY17 Annual Fund metrics, tabulating and reporting on FY17 outcomes. Assist in developing tracking and metrics for Alumni engagement program. Research Alumni current industries/geographic distribution and craft tracking database to be used for engagement strategies. Special Events: Assist Director of Development in collaborating with the Auction Committee for our annual gala fundraising and auction event on Friday, March 3rd at Tribeca Rooftop, including opportunity to assist day of event and attend the event. Assist in the development and execution of two Alumni events aimed at cultivation A spring intergenerational community service project A summer cocktail event Qualifications Strong analytical skills and some experience working with databases helpful Interest in learning about the field of philanthropy especially individual giving, major gifts and special events. Excellent written and verbal communications skills Passion for education and the impact child centered early childhood education has in building a lifelong love of learning. Availability Minimum 12 hours weekly on-site. Monday-Friday between 8:00am -5:00pm. Specific days/hours are flexible. Location Corlears School, 324 West 15th Street, New York, NY 10011 Website : www.corlearsschool.org To Apply Please send a cover letter and resume to Mallory King, Director of Development & Alumni Affairs at: malloryk@corlearsschool.org . In your cover letter please share why you are interested in this position and what skills and experience you bring that are relevant to this opportunity. College credit may be arranged at the discretion of your institution.
10011.title: Development/Special Events Intern

10011.description: Job Description Admissions and Marketing Intern (Unpaid) About Corlears Corlears School, is a Nursery through 5th Grade, New York City independent school. When you enter Corlears School from its front door on West 15th Street in Chelsea, you are immediately struck by the energy and the excitement of the community. Students and teachers know each other in deep and authentic ways. Families support and partner with the school to elevate every child’s experience. Our Mission: Corlears students learn, play and grow together in a school designed for who they are at ages 2 through 10. During these crucial formative years, we build a foundation of compassion, critical thinking, imagination and leadership, and cultivate a joy and confidence in learning that serves our graduates throughout their lives. Responsibilities Working closely with the Communication and Admission Associate assist with the following key projects: Improving the website SEO Utilize guidance provided by enrollment consultant and SEO consultant to implement their plan to modify Corlears website content and structure with a focus on optimizing the site’s search engine results. Assist in adding keywords throughout the Corlears website and testing the SEO results under the direction of the SEO consultant. (Corlears website is powered by SquareSpace ) Launch corporate connections initiative Utilize guidance provided by enrollment consultant to identify materials needed for outreach to the HR departments at local corporations re: locally based independent school options Draft corporate outreach materials working with Communications Associate Research local corporations HR/People Operations/Employee Success departments to identify most appropriate contacts for outreach to employees on pre-school/elementary school options. This may include a YouTube channel, a Blog and other social media/web-based outlets. Assist with drafting and launching new web content Assist with creating new web/social media presence (potentially a YouTube Channel, a Blog, Instagram) Social Media Content Assist Communications Associate with weekly social media posts on varied platforms with a focus on Facebook Qualifications Social media experience in business/non-profit settings Experience creating website content and editing/updating existing website content Skills in Photoshop and/or working with digital images on social media / website platforms Ability to conduct business research and compile findings for further use Web-based marketing skills a plus Availability Minimum 12 hours weekly on-site. Monday-Friday between 8:00am -5:00pm. Specific days/hours are flexible. 10011.description: Education Program Coordinator - Chelsea Sculpture Park. New York , New York. Basic Requirements: BA or MA in related discipline required (Art Education) Post college professional work experience required Demonstrated experience with art education or other informal art programming and curriculum design Demonstrated knowledge of Microsoft computer programs and excellent presentation skills Job Responsibilities: Coordinate and develop of new partner-institution/organization relationships and curriculum Provide leadership and direction towards the design and implementation of art educational programming and curriculum in compliance with national and state learning objectives, accreditation guidelines, and innovative art methodologies Establish and grow professional relationships with constituents, peers, associations and partner schools To Apply: Please submit your resume with cover letter and references to the contact information listed below. Set against the backdrop of the Hudson River, Chelsea Sculpture Park will offer fine art for the public to experience, up close and outdoors. The park's mission is to provide an aesthetic oasis in the Chelsea Cove section of Hudson River Park located between 22nd and 26th Streets, just steps away from the world-class Chelsea Art District. We are looking for a Education Program Coordinator to assist the founder and executive-director of Chelsea Sculpture Park develop and implement an educational program foccusing on the exhibitions of the sculpture park.
10011.title: Educational Program - Coordinator

10011.description: Chelsea Sculpture Park New York, New York Are you considering a future in arts administration, nonprofit management, fundraising, arts education or a related field? This is a great opportunity to gain experience working at a brand new nonprofit arts organization that is dedicated to building a sculpture park on the banks of the Hudson River Park. Gain invaluable insights and learn fundraising strategies as part of a dynamic Development team. Assist with prospect research, special events, direct mail, and our donor database, as well as pursue special projects. Internship credit may be arranged through your academic program. The ideal candidate will be organized and detail-oriented, and have good computer skills. Those with prospect research experience and graduate students in arts administration and arts education are especially welcome. The hours for this position are flexible within the work week. A modest stipend is available. To Apply: Please be sure to include current contact information so that we may arrange an interview. To get a response please send RESUME .
10011.title: Development Intern

10011.description: VISIONS’ Intergenerational Program recruits and trains students, 14 years of age and over, to assist seniors who are blind. Working in pairs, the youth travel to the homes of seniors to read, assist with the computer, shop, run errands and/or escort within the neighborhood. These friendly visits help to decrease the loneliness and isolation often experienced by homebound elders. Students may also be asked to assist with meal service where they escort, socialize and serve meals to the seniors at our community center, VISIONS’ at Selis Manor. Services are provided between the hours of 2:00-5:30 pm, Monday through Friday, and are based on the students schedule. A mandatory orientation/training is required before volunteering. Students will also be participating in a variety of classes and training seminars. Must be 14 and over, punctual, reliable, mature, and have good reading and verbal communication skills. Able and willing to travel throughout Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens and the Bronx. Please submit a completed application via mail or email (.doc format). Only applicants that will be considered for the program will be contacted for an interview.
10011.title: Teen Volunteer Opportunity - Intergenerational
10011.org: VISIONS/Services for the Blind and Visually Impaired
