10011.description: www.CitiIMPACT.org Regional & National Opportunities Put YOU in the Picture of WHO we are. CitiIMPACT Ministries, an international missions organization, has openings for va rious positions at local, regional and national levels. You could be one we need! Do you sense God calling you to something new? Perhaps you are in a position that is not fulfilling and you'd like to explore using your gifts and talents in ways that will make a Kingdom difference. Or.. Are you reaching retirement age but not ready to \"hang up the hat\"? Or, possibly you are a recent graduate who wants some real life experience in an internship role. Openings Include, but not limited to: Project Coordinators Area Directors Mission Team Leaders Marketing & Resource Development Web & Social Media If this doesn't strike a cord with you, please think of others you know who might be interested and pass it on. Send an email to info@CitiIMPACT.org with your resume and an interest letter ASAP. WHO IS CitiIMPACT? Put yourself in the picture! As a catalyst of HELP and HOPE, CitiIMPACT Ministries mobilizes collaborative partnerships between local churches, groups and individuals for greater effectiveness in meeting human needs. Together we can BE & Do more for hurting people. VISIT our website for lots of information & ways to partner! www.CitiIMPACT.org Email us also for more information: INFO@CitiIMPACT.org
10011.title: Regional Director Position

10011.description: Do you have a passion for dacne? Do you enjoy working with children? Are you looking to gain experience and new skills? then volunteering with Dance to Unite, Inc. could be the right volunteer opportunity for you! Dance to Unite, Inc. is a non-profit organization whose mission is to use dance as a vehicle to teach and to celebrate cultural diversity. WE ARE LOOKING FOR VOLUNTEER DANCE TEACHERS AND TEACHER ASSISTANTS! Qualified applicants are required to have some background in dance but most imporatntly a strong interest and desire to work with inner city children and youth. A one hour weekly comittment is required throughout the school year (October-June) and availability during after-school hours (3:00-6:00pm). We offer FREE training in a warm and supportive environment with plently of opportunities for professional and perdonal growth. Responsibilities of Volunteer Dance Teachers: -Become familiar and comfortable with implementing our educational component which includes leading our 5-10 minutes 'Circle Talk' . *We provide supervision, guidance and support to ensure that everyone is properly trained and fully prepared to implement our educational component. -Create and teach a year-round dance routine and choose the music that will accompany your choreography. -Facilitate one special guest artist workshop (which is offered to each Dance to Unite, Inc. Class throught the school year) by briefing students about the style of dance or other artistic medium which is explored that day and collaborate with all those involved in making the workshop a success. Responsibilities of Dance Teacher Assistants: -Work closely with a teacher and support her/his efforts in fulfilling all of her/his duties/responsibilities. -Participate in/or lead a weekly warm-up exercise routine. -Learn the choreography taught by the teacher by rehearsing a weekly dance routine with the students. -Assist the teacher with running/managing the classroom by providing positive feedback and addressing inappropriate behaviors when needed. -Periodically take photos/videos that can be used for our social media (using a camera phone). Benefits of these volunteer opportunities: -Gain knowledge/experience and develop various set of skills related to creating a year-round dance choreography, leading a short discussion and managing a classroom. -Receive references and recommendation letters as evidence to support your accomplishments when applying for internships, jobs or graduate schools. *Internship opportunities are available to both high school and college students. -Recieve free training in a warm and supportive environment that offers countless opportunities for professional and personal growth. -Volunteers who have been with us long enough to show commitment and dedication to our organization are acknowledged by being featured on our organization's website. -Cultivate new personal and professional contacts. -Receive a free invitation to our annual benefit and other events. -Join our Dance to Unite, Inc. Meetup group and meet like-minded people in the local community who share a passion for making a difference. THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTEREST IN JOINING OUR DANCE TO UNITE FAMILY! For further information, please check our website: www.dancetounite.org FOR QUESTIONS AND INQUIRIES, PLEASE CONTACT: info@dancetounite.org
10011.title: Teach dance to inner city kids!

10010.description: Do you have a deep-rooted passion to change the world? Are you a natural networker? Do you choke up when you witness a girl discover her own inner worth? Most importantly, do you believe photography can be a tool for achieving gender equality? What we’ve got going on. We change gender dynamics in economically challenged communities by teaching photography to girls. The girls then teach the boys. Girls build self-confidence while improving their leadership & presentation skills, while boys respect & value the girls in their communities. We are looking for a new Board of Director with a passion for finances who can help us grow & expand as an organization so we can scale our programs to achieve greater impact. We have held workshops in Haiti, Kenya, India & NYC. A Uganda workshop is starting in 2017. This is where you come in. What makes you a rockstar for this role. + You understand global gender equality is more than a \"girls only\" effort. It can only be achieved when both girls & boys understand the importance of living as equals. + You love crunching numbers, creating & overseeing budgets and knowing what will make the IRS happy. + You are a natural at fundraising by networking with corporations, individuals, foundations & others; throwing successful fundraising events; and have no qualms about asking people to open up their wallets. + You communicate clearly. You write well. You inspire through the written word. + You are based locally to NYC for 4 quarterly Board Meetings + 3-5 hours of remote work per month. And you play well in the sandbox with others. + You are motivated & driven. You’ll take ownership of the time you spend as a Board Member & truly make a difference. You are slightly OCD about your work & take pride in it. Extra awesome if + You have prior Board or Advisory Board experience. To join the fun +  Email babita@KIOOproject.org sharing what part of our mission you connect with the most, your resume & an example of an introduction you can make on behalf of KIOO that would further our fundraising needs. Show off your Board Member superpowers! + Attach or describe your favorite photograph & why it speaks to you. Can be taken by you or another photographer. No judgements. Just want to get you thinking like a photographer!
10010.title: Are you a financial genius? Come be our new Board Member!

10010.description: Crisis Text Line provides free, nationwide, 24/7 support for people in crisis, all via text message. The service is powered by volunteer Crisis Counselors who work remotely anywhere with a computer and secure internet connection. Crisis Counselors answer texts from people in crisis, bringing them from a hot moment to a cool calm through active listening, collaborative problem solving, and safety planning. Apply to volunteer at crisistextline.org/volunteer HOW DO YOU BECOME A CRISIS COUNSELOR? Step 1: Fill out the 30-minute application at crisistextline.org/volunteer Step 2: Consent to a background check Step 3: Complete the 34-hour web-based training Step 4: Take your first shift and start changing lives! You will commit to volunteer 4 hours a week for one year. Volunteering can be done in 2 hour increments. THE PERKS Learn skills. In 34 hours, you’ll walk away knowing active listening, collaborative problem solving, and crisis management. (These are skills that will help in your personal relationships too!) Train & volunteer from the comfort of your home. Oooh, impressive! Our Crisis Counselors highlight the training on their resumes when interviewing for jobs, applying to grad school, and building out their LinkedIn profile. VOLUNTEER WORK THAT ENRICHES YOUR LIFE Level up. Earn volunteer leadership positions. Get the first crack at Crisis Text Line internships and job openings. Gain access to special privileges, including discounts and gifts. Hone your skills. Work alongside volunteers who are also social workers, therapists, and psychiatrists to sharpen your crisis counseling skills-while in your jammies, at home! Feel supported. This is a community. We support each other. We are a big awesome family. READY TO VOLUNTEER? APPLY HERE: crisistextline.org/volunteer Questions? Email: support@crisistextline.org
10010.title: Save lives from your couch by becoming a Crisis Counselor

10017.description: Peace Boat US is currently accepting internship applications for both the spring and summer 2017. Candidates must commit to working in the Peace Boat US office at 777 United Nations Plaza for 15 hours per week for at least three consecutive months; with an opportunity to attend United Nations conferences as a part of their experience. Internships with Peace Boat US are unpaid, but serve as credit toward the cost of joining all or part of a Peace Boat Global Voyage. Peace Boat US is organizing a special study program focused on the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) during the summer from June 20 - July 3, 2017 onboard the 94th Global Voyage of Peace Boat, visiting Panama, traveling through the Panama Canal and experience the local cultures in Nicaragua and El Salvador. We encourage all youth ages 16-35 to travel with us this summer. Traveling with Peace Boat provides a space where people can interact, study, create events, and have access to facilities such as conference and seminar rooms. Cabin accommodation, daily meals, medical service, recreational facilities, and highly trained professional team of officers and crew members ensure that passengers can travel with safety and comfort as they engage in learning. There is no other form of travel in the world that allows people to be a part of a borderless \"international floating village\" like a Peace Boat voyage. Program costs are calculated according to length, content, staffing, and travel requirements. Flights are separate from program quote. Please consult with Peace Boat US to obtain program quote. Visit www.peaceboat.orgfor more information about Peace Boat. Please complete our Intern Application and email it to info@peaceboat-us.org or contact us for more information. We look forward to hearing from you!
10017.title: Spring and Summer Internship Opportunity with Peace Boat US

10017.description: The Associates Council The Associates Council (AC), our young professionals group, is a group of talented young professionals from across diverse sectors who lend their time, energy and expertise to support the organization’s mission. Members achieve this end through fundraising, awareness building, volunteering, and pro bono activities. While the AC provides a forum for committed young professionals to engage in meaningful work, it also offers members an array of benefits including professional networking and leadership development opportunities to further elevate their personal and professional standing. Benefits Affiliation with The Children’s Aid Society-one of the largest, most reputable, and influential non-profits in New York City Professional development opportunities through hands-on experiences in relation to non-profit organizations, fundraising, and leadership Exclusive social and volunteer events for AC members and their guests Opportunities to attend exclusive Children’s Aid events & programs and invitations to select donor events Membership recognition on the Children’s Aid/AC website & social networking sites (LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram), and other avenues if needed Connection with like-minded, motivated peers, interested in raising awareness, making a change, and supporting the community Roles & Responsibilities Annual give or get contribution of at least $750 Give must include: Purchase ticket(s) to the Annual Spring Fundraiser $150 member contribution (100% tax deductible)-can be made in two consecutive monthly installments Give/Get can include: Monetary contributions of friends/family/colleagues to events (tickets, raffle tickets, sponsorships) OR other donations to the organization Up to $250 worth of in-kind donations (raffle items or other items needed for events/activities) or products (product sponsorship for events) Corporate sponsorship and matching gifts Support the Annual Spring Fundraiser by making at least three asks (raffle, financial, or product sponsorship) Facilitate a corporate introduction to help grow the AC and Children’s Aid network and resources Attend at least two general meetings per year Attend and support at least two of the following AC activities: volunteer event (volunteer day at a Children’s Aid site) or other AC specific event (happy hour, cultivation event, roundtable meeting, mini fundraiser) Actively participate in at least one committee: Events, Membership Engagement, or Marketing Introduce two new individuals to the Associates Council each year and share our recruitment ads on social media network at least twice per year Complete an Associates Council Member Profile For more information, visit our website: http://www.childrensaidsociety.org/volunteer/associates-council Check us out on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ChildrensAidSociety/
10017.title: Associates Council Member - Young Professionals Group
10017.org: The Children's Aid Society - New York, NY

10017.description: The Muscular Dystrophy Association (MDA) is looking volunteer summer camp counselors! This is a summer camp for the children MDA serves living with muscular dystrophy and other muscle diseases. MDA camp features sports, swimming, campfires, dances, and more! Each camper is paired with their own counselor for the week. Camp is not only a place to have fun, but it is also a place of understanding, confidence, and hope. When asked their favorite holiday, our kids respond with summer camp! Camp provides excellent practical experience for individuals in medical school, physical and occupational therapy programs, and nursing programs. However, no prior experience is required to be a part of this amazing opportunity. We are currently looking for volunteers to make camp possible for Summer 2017. You must be 16 years or older to apply. You must be able to lift at least 50 lbs. MDA Summer Camps for the NY/NJ area are held during the first three weeks of August 2017 (specific dates to be announced next month). Interested or know someone who would be? Please akeenan@mdausa.org for more information.
10017.title: Summer Camp for Children with Muscle Disease

10017.description: Are you 55+ and would like to become an Adult Literacy Program Volunteer? The Adult Literacy Program is based in Brooklyn, N.Y. It offers free, small group and one-on one classes in: Basic Literacy, English for Speakers of Other Languages (ESOL), Pre-GED and GED Test Prep. The literacy program provides a supportive environment and designed to help each student reach their specific needs and educational goals. To learn more about this program and to volunteer, please contact Bobbie Futrell at 212 614-5386.
10017.title: Become a Literacy Program Volunteer

10017.description: We are currently recruiting new co-organizers for the NYC chapter of the Action Corps. This is a rewarding volunteer position that allows the individuals to cultivate their leadership skills and creativity, all while fighting global poverty and hunger. Action Corps NYC is a national, volunteer-led, grassroots effort to fight poverty, hunger, and injustice around the world. We make it our mission to educate the community on global campaigns and initiatives that many times are life changing to those with a voice. We have worked on the Green Climate Fund, the refugee crisis, American poultry works, women cocoa farmers, food aid reform, and many many others. We table at local events and concerts, plan our own events, and send communications and requests to legislators and corporations insisting upon better practices and reform. We’re not a stiff group; we try to have fun, but still take our work and efforts very seriously. As a co-organizer, you would lead the monthly meetings, maintain the email accounts, tell people what to do J, and just help keep us on track. We have core volunteers who will be there every step of the way, including our current organizers who have been leading for 2.5 years. But it’s important to turn over leadership to ensure that vitality, creativity, and vision remains strong. Most of the responsibilities would be remote, but you do need to attend events within the city at least monthly. Please email us for more information or complete the application here. https://goo.gl/forms/xVPKO6ztn3jS43hF2
10017.title: Volunteer Co-Organizer of Action Corps NYC

10017.description: The Retired & Senior Volunteer Program (RSVP) of the Community Service Society of New York matches the skills and interests of adults aged 55+ with NYC youth impacted by juvenile justice interactions or parental incarceration, mentoring them in skills to overcome challenges and to build on their strengths. RSVP Mentors will serve as part of a community of older citizens that 'has their back’ and assists youth as they navigate within ever shrinking resources in New York City. The RSVP staff provides you the training, placement and support at a number of nonprofit, community based partner organizations for youth. Be a Mentor with the Retired & Senior Volunteer Program! For more information contact Karen Brown at kbrown@cssny.org or telephone 212.614.5557.
10017.title: Attend Orientation to be a Mentor to NYC Youth

10017.description: Are you 55 or older with a strong desire to help others? If so, consider becoming an outreach volunteer. We are looking for people persons who are interested in becoming experts in a public benefit, comfortable using e-mail, happy to assist clients with forms and other paperwork, able to travel to events, patient with others, and willing to do basic research and ask questions as needed. Ability to communicate through another language (especially Spanish or Cantonese) would be an added plus, though is by no means a requirement.

10017.description: The Caregiver Coach will provide support to the caregiver as they face many challenges: medical, financial, emotional, family, and social. The Coach will work to make the connection to the caregiver, assessing what is needed at the moment, so that the caregiver feels supported and understood. The coaches will provide this support in a non-judgmental and professional manner. Communication skills, such as active listening, are a must.
10017.title: Caregiver Coach

10017.description: An Independent Living Facility is seeking volunteers to provide translation for the Chinese/Korean senior residents. Volunteers will provide their services 2-3 times a month at meetings and presentations.

10017.description: Teach ESOL and conversation classes to a group of students (Arab American/Immigrants). Plan and prepare with lessons provided for weekly classes. The ESOL and conversation classes will provide social and educational services to help them adjust to their new home and become active members of society.

Tutoring sessions prepare clients on the speaking, civics, reading and writing portions of the exam. Training for all tutors is provided. Training covers the test subjects and all materials needed for the exam. Monday- Friday, 10am - 5pm. This position requires one hour minimum per week.

10017.description: The volunteer will provide support with doing client intake when they come to the Pantry for assistance. Tasks include confirming eligibility, updating records and assisting with general office duties. Support is generally needed Wednesday afternoon between the hours of 1:30 and 4 pm. Requirements:The volunteer needs to be someone with a natural ability to connect to clients. Bilingual English/Spanish preferred. Must be patient, great with Excel. Food pantries provide food to those most in need. By helping to distribute food in an organized way, you will help create a clean and dignified atmosphere. By confirming eligibility and updating records, you will help provide people with access to other services they may need.

10017.description: Make a difference, foster innovation, and be a part of the small business and entrepreneurial boom in New York State -- volunteer with Business Mentor NY! Mentors connect with small businesses for one-on-one guidance in a range of business issues- from lending general business guidance to specialized technical advice. Business Mentor NY is designed to allow volunteers to use their skills efficiently, with maximum impact, and is also extremely flexible - you set the schedule and the expectations with your mentee. Meanwhile, our support staff is by your side every step of the way to help you succeed as a mentor. Business Mentor NY is an exciting opportunity to not only utilize your core skills to help small businesses but also drive your own professional development, hone leadership skills, and expand your skill set! Join at BusinessMentor.NY.gov!
10017.title: Use your professional skills to help entrepreneurs grow!

10017.description: Looking for a fun, engaging way to teach teens the fundamentals of finance? Become a Financial Volunteer Teacher. Volunteers are trained to provide workshops on goal setting, budgeting, savings and banking. To find out more about this volunteer opportunity, please contact RSVP. \"Tell me and I forget. Teach me I remember. Involve me and I Learn\" Benjamin Franklin This wonderful opportunity and so much more is available through the Retired and Senior Volunteer Program for individuals 55 and over in all 5 boroughs! After participating in a thorough interview with an RSVP representative, you will be placed in one of our 400 community-based partner organizations. We pride ourselves on helping you find the right volunteer opportunity to fit your skills and interests.
10017.title: "A Penny Saved is a Penny Earned"

10017.description: We are looking to connect passionate volunteers with struggling readers to help students build strong literacy skills, gain confidence, and discover a passion for reading. You can be a mentor, a leader and a friend to students in need. No formal teaching experience is required, commit just one hour a week. \"Tell me and I forget. Teach me I remember. Involve me and I learn\" Benjamin Franklin This wonderful opportunity and so much more is available through the Retired and Senior Volunteer Program for individuals 55 and over in all 5 boroughs! After participating in a thorough interview with an RSVP representative, you will be placed in one of our 400 community-based partner organizations. We pride ourselves on helping you find the right volunteer opportunity to fit your skills and interests.

10017.description: Many seniors are isolated in their homes and could benefit from companionship. Play a game, read mail, discuss a book - there's so much you can do to make a person's day. Retired and Senior Volunteer program has opportunities throughout the five boroughs to visit seniors and much more. Contact us today to meet with one of our experts. Today's the day to find your passion!
10017.title: It's never too late to make a good friend.  Visit a homebound senior today.

10017.description: Pets Are Wonderful Support (PAWS NY) is a grassroots, volunteer-driven organization. If you enjoy spending time with both people and pets, we offer wonderful opportunities for our volunteers (18 years old or older) to provide direct services to our clients, mainly through our Housecall Program. Volunteers provide help with things such as dog walking, litter box maintenance, transportation to/from the vet, and other pet-related tasks our clients struggle to do on their own. For more information, please visit our website at www.pawsny.org. In order to begin providing services, all volunteers are required to attend an orientation. We are flexible in terms of the level of commitment, and welcome all interested individuals to attend an orientation session to learn more about our work. You will learn more about PAWS NY and the services you will ultimately provide to our clients, so please sign up today. We hope you will join us! To sign up for September 26th volunteer orientation, please visit: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/paws-ny-volunteer-orientation-september-26th-2016-tickets-26883677804 To sign up for October 26th volunteer orientation, please visit (different location, please check listing): https://www.eventbrite.com/e/paws-ny-volunteer-orientation-october-26th-2016-tickets-26883740993 Can't make any of above? Check out website at www.pawsny.org for the most up to date info!
10017.title: Help Seniors and Others in Need Keep Their Pets! Volunteer with PAWS NY!

10017.description: Seeking volunteers to serve as a pantry customer service specialist. The volunteer will answer pantry customer's questions; greet customers; explain unfamiliar food items; assist customers; direct crowd flow; monitor clothing distribution. This wonderful opportunity and so much more is available through the Retired and Senior Volunteer Program for individuals 55 and over in all 5 boroughs! After participating in a thorough interview with an RSVP representative, you will be placed in one of our 400 community-based partner organizations. We pride ourselves on helping you find the right volunteer opportunity to fit your skills and interests.
10017.title: Help feed hungry New Yorkers. ( 55+ only)

10017.description: The Advocacy, Counseling and Entitlement Services ( ACES) Project of the Community Service Society is seeking individuals age 55 to serve as volunteer public benefit counselors dedicated to helping financially disadvantaged people. Volunteers participate in an intensive seven-week training program beginning October 4, 2016. The training covers eligibility requirements and application procedures for Medicaid, SSI, SNAP, and other public benefit programs. Upon completion, volunteers are placed in agencies in one of the five boroughs to provide information on government benefits to low-income families, older adults and individuals with disabilities. Volunteers assist clients with completing applications and helping correct benefit related problems.
10017.title: Help Families and Individuals Get Back on Their Feet!

10017.description: Help struggling readers improve their literacy. Volunteer to help youth and adult students throughout NYC transform into confident readers who are excited about learning. Training is provided. This opportunity is part of the Retired and Senior Volunteer Program. In order to volunteer through RSVP, you must be 55 or older. RSVP has hundreds of opportunities throughout the five boroughs of NYC in addition to the above mentioned. Contact us today to schedule an interview and find a new passion!
10017.title: Change someone's life.  Give them the gift of literacy.

10017.description: Work one-to-one with an older adult or person with a disability to help with monthly bill paying tasks. This would include organizing bills into a folder, writing out checks for the client’s signature, balancing the checkbook, reconciling the bank statement. Depending on need, volunteers may also help with budgeting, paying down debt and money-saving strategies. Volunteer opportunities in Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens and the Bronx.
10017.title: Help homebound seniors organize their bills. ( 55 + only)

10017.description: Facilitate an interactive 45-60 minute class for vital, homebound seniors that engage them in a meaningful way right from your home or office computer. Flexible class scheduling includes weekly, bi-weekly, monthly, short term series or sporadic classes. Weekday, evening or weekend options. Lead a class on a topic that you are passionate about. We have had classes with wide-ranging topics that have included: Music and Art appreciation, Social Sciences, History, Health/Wellness, News and Politics, Exercise, Computer training, Language Arts, Interactive Games, Storytelling & more. Let's brainstorm ideas! Each class accommodates from 1 to 9 attendees for meaningful interaction. Classes can be discussion-based, an activity (like a chair exercise class) or performance-based (singing/musical instrument) with some discussion. Technology Needs: Computer w/high speed internet & webcam along w/speakers. You must be 55 or older to volunteer at the Retired & Senior Volunteer Program. Guess what! There are even more great opportunities for volunteers 55 and over in all 5 boroughs! After participating in a thorough interview with an RSVP representative, you will be placed in one of our 600 community-based partner organizations. These community-based organizations include non-profit agencies, schools, hospitals, and cultural institutions located throughout the 5 boroughs of New York City. We pride ourselves on finding the right volunteer opportunity to fit your skills and interests.
10017.title: "Help Bring the Internet to Homebound Seniors - Become a Virtual Class/Activity Leader"

10017.description: Are you retired? Looking for a way to give back to your community? Join the Financial Coaching Corps and volunteer one day a week as a financial coach! The Retired and Senior Volunteer Program is recruiting volunteers age 55 or older to work one-on-one with low-wage individuals and families helping them improve their money management skills and increase their financial stability. Applicants must have strong communication, research and computer skills. Training begins Tuesday, February 28, 2017. For more information, please call: Courtney Davis (212) 614-5413 To apply, go online: www.cssny.org/programs/entry/financial-coaching-corps
10017.title: MAKE A DIFFERENCE AS A FINANCIAL COACH - 55+ ONLY

10017.description: City Meals-on-Wheels - Volunteers needed to deliver meals to homebound individuals. Meal delivery takes about an hour or two and your route can be close to your home or place of employment. Guess what! There are even more great opportunities for volunteers 55 and over in all 5 boroughs! After participating in a thorough interview with an RSVP representative, you will be placed in one of our 500 community-based partner organizations. These community-based organizations include non-profit agencies, schools, hospitals, and cultural institutions located throughout the 5 boroughs of New York City. We pride ourselves on finding the right volunteer opportunity to fit your skills and interests.
10017.title: Make a Difference! Make a Food Delivery - 55+ Only

10017.description: Why not be the one to make a difference? Started in 1966 by the Community Service Society, a 170-year-old nonprofit agency, RSVP (Retired & Senior Volunteer Program) matches the skills and interests of adults 55 with volunteer opportunities at New York City nonprofit organizations. With more than 3,000 volunteers, CSS/RSVP in New York City is one of the largest senior volunteer programs in the nation. There are 650 RSVPs nationally with RSVP programs operating internationally. Guess what! There are even more great opportunities for volunteers 55 and over in all 5 boroughs! RSVP has more than 3,000 members who volunteer in many different capacities, but mainly focus on the areas of education, healthy futures, economic opportunity, veterans and military families, environmental stewardship and disaster services. They are involved in volunteer activities such as mentoring a troubled child, providing homework assistance at libraries, tutoring children in schools and after-school programs, providing adult education, GED prep and English as a second language assistance, providing meal delivery to older adults, providing financial coaching and benefits counseling, assisting at soup kitchens and food pantries, and so much more! We pride ourselves on finding the perfect volunteer assignment that utilizes your lifetime of experience, skills and knowledge to make a difference in a community.
10017.title: Many Volunteer Opportunities Available  For Older Adults - 55+ Only

10016.description: Volunteers are needed to help with feminine hygiene kit packing in coordination with #HappyPeriodNYC at our main office on Friday, February 17th from 12pm - 3pm. These kits of feminine products will be used to empower homeless women to take charge of their health via screenings and education, including Pap testing, immunizations, breast cancer awareness, and more. Any and all help would be appreciated! If interested in participating in the above volunteer opportunity, please contact our Volunteer Coordinator Jaden at jriendeau@cfhnyc.org. ** Volunteers are encouraged to donate feminine hygiene products of their own as part of the drive. Feel free to bring any products to the event or drop them off at our main office, located at 30 E. 33rd St., Monday - Friday before 5pm. Items needed include pads, tampons, panty liners, underwear, wipes, and soaps.
10016.title: Help Care for the Homeless and #HappyPeriodNYC Provide Feminine Hygiene Products to Homeless Women!

10016.description: Left Forum seeks organized and tech-savvy individuals to work alongside our experienced organizers and volunteers in managing our growing administrative systems and expanding collection of special projects that are essential to the maintenance and growth of the organization. This volunteer position can be modified to fit your interests and/or schedule. Depending on the time you have to give and the areas you would be interested in helping out in, this volunteer position can focus on a specific project (i.e. managing our fundraising administrative processes and correspondence) or have a general focus that develops as new projects arise. With this rounded general focus: volunteers will spend time collaborating with others and working with various coordination teams (from PR to Event Planning) as we build upon our existing databases, administrative systems, content, and overall resources. The ideal person for this role is someone who is committed to social justice, self-motivated, comfortable taking on project-coordination, has a keen eye for detail, and has the ability to bring creative ideas into organizational and administrative processes. Experience in administrative systems is also a plus. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES and PROJECT AREA EXAMPLES Engage all aspects of contact record and database management, including: maintaining/updating/deduping contact records, inputting and searching data, generating reports, etc. Physical and digital administrative file organization and maintenance Update website and social media content Assist in volunteer/intern outreach, recruitment, and application evaluation Assist in the development and maintenance of office schedules, procedures, and timelines Assist in the day to day operational concerns (from financial planning and research to cross-team coordination and long-term planning/roadmap development for the upcoming conference) Work alongside Left Forum coordinators to engage and develop new administrative projects as necessary BACKGROUND AND DESIRED EXPERIENCE Strong organizing and research skills High level of attention to detail and ability to see projects through to their completion Ability to prioritize and handle a variety of projects simultaneously Ability to work effectively both individually and in a team Strong written and verbal communication skills Generally tech savvy and a quick learner Excellent communication and research skills Experience working with Microsoft Office and Google Docs is a plus Passion for grassroots organizing and social justice ABOUT VOLUNTEERING We're a small organization with a dedicated group of staff, organizers, and volunteers, leaving lots of room for your creativity. We understand that every volunteer’s schedule is different and would be thrilled to have you commit a couple hours a week or more (if you are able). This opportunity can begin immediately or according to your upcoming availability. Please note: this volunteer opportunity is unpaid.
10016.title: Administrative Systems and Special Projects

10016.description: Project Background The New York Public Library's Community Oral History Project (oralhistory.nypl.org) is an initiative taking place throughout the NYPL system that aims to document, celebrate, and make accessible the rich history of the city's unique neighborhoods by collecting the stories of people who have experienced it firsthand. As the project moves into fall 2016, we’ll be documenting stories in Kips Bay and the Lower East Side. We’re looking for volunteers to help build local collection efforts by facilitating oral history trainings and assisting the project director in engaging volunteers through community events and regular communication. Please send a brief e-mail of interest (no more than 250 words) to oralhistory@nypl.org by Monday, September 26th.
10016.title: NYC Oral History Neighborhood Leaders
