10016.description: Required Skills: Windows OS, Linux FTP, WinSCP Web Development and CMS - specifically Drupal 7, we want to use bootstrap for reflexivity. good to have, but not a must: SQL (MySQL, MS SQL, Oracle, Access, NaviCat), ASP.Net, PHP, JavaScipt, TypeScript, JSON, CSS Web Development and Database Urgently needed: Web Developer responsible for designing, coding and modifying website module, from layout to function according to Left Forum’ specifications in drupal 7. Patching Drupal and CiviCRM security vulnerabilities Testing, maintenance and troubleshooting of existing Left Forum sites Would be nice when we get this done to: Create and maintain software documentation Integrate data from various back-end services and databases Custom programming and web application development for Drupal Contributing ideas and efforts towards internal projects and working as part of a team to find solutions on various problems Knowledge with source control systems such as Subversion, Drush and SSH with LF Sites. JavaScripts, JSON, Typescripts creation and implementation for Website, InDesign, etc. Database management with Drupal and CiviCRM API Improvements to CiviCRM’s code architecture
10016.title: Website Development Drupal 7

10016.description: Volunteer Position Description: Left Forum is looking for volunteers who have experience and interest in graphic design. We seek creative, skilled individuals interested in helping design featured graphics, flyers, banner ads, website graphics and content, and conference and event program guides as well as possibly helping to design imagery for merchandise. Left Forum engages hundreds of artists every year who bring their ideas and work to share with thousands of other conference and event participants. This volunteer opportunity taps into this and other creative communities of the graphic arts, and engages the artistry of editing and content production. We’re a small organization with a dedicated group of organizers, staff and volunteers with a passion for social justice, community organizing, and progressive change. Located in the CUNY Graduate Center, you’ll be working in an interesting (and very relaxed) office where you’ll interact, meet, and learn from scholars, activists, authors and artists in a rewarding intellectual political milieu. Primary Responsibilities * Help design brand images and a logo * Design posters, flyers, banner ads, website graphics and more. * Help design and brainstorm web content and layout, social media content, press-media content, and all Public Relations content * Help produce the conference program guide utilizing InDesign * Long term possibilities of web design or graphic design projects * Help design and collect \"lefty\" images, memes, etc. (with a focus on various content areas such as: environment, labor, feminism, LGBTQ issues, race and class, etc.) for use on social media, email blast communications, website, and merchandise. Background and Desired Experience * Experience with InDesign, Illustrator Photoshop, and other design and publishing software (for Graphic Designers and Editors), html knowledge preferred * High level of attention to detail and seeing projects through to their completion * Ability to prioritize and handle a variety of projects simultaneously * Ability to work effectively both individually and in a team * Interest in grassroots organizing and social justice About Volunteering This specific volunteer position, while could benefit from in office time and brainstorm, can be carried out in large part, remotely. We also ask for a minimum of a three month commitment though this would ideally be a position that would last through the conference (which will be June 2 - 4, 2017) as projects will certainly arise on a rolling basis from now until then. This volunteer opportunity can begin immediately. If interested or if you have any questions please email: ashley@leftforum.org or volunteer@leftforum.org
10016.title: Left Forum Graphic Design Volunteers Needed

10016.description: This opportunity is available daily from 5:30 PM-6 PM! Rescuing Leftover Cuisine is a nonprofit food rescue organization dedicated to reducing food waste and feeding the hungry. We are currently looking for Lead Rescuers to join our leadership team. A Lead Rescuer is a passionate and dedicated volunteer who commits to leading one event, once per week. Training is provided. Help rescue leftover pastries from a cafe in Rose Hill that would otherwise have been thrown away and bring it to those who need it the most! This food will be delivered on-foot to a nearby homeless shelter. Lightweight: the average amount of food is a total of 15 lbs.
10016.title: Weekly Volunteer Needed for 5:30PM-6PM Daily Food Rescue Events!

10016.description: Action Corps is seeking new volunteers for with concert outreach with Oxfam! We believe that music can change the world. Do you? If so, it’s time to make some noise. Join our network of volunteers and spread the word at concerts in your community. Through Oxfam's strong connection with musicians, labels, managers and media, we have reached out to 100,000's of music fans around the country to spread Oxfam's work and take action to end poverty, hunger and injustice. What does it include: Day of volunteering involves arriving at the venue approximately 45 minutes prior to doors opening. You will set up a table with Oxfam materials and canvass the crowd for signatures on Oxfam's current campaign before the show and between music sets. Training will be offered prior to your first show. Perks: Free access to the show. Oxfam swag like t-shirts, bandanas, etc Opportunities for special or signed merch for the bands for most signatures collected. Perferred access to volunter at special shows as they come up the more you volunteer. More rewards opportunities to come! Bands and Festivals We Table At: Angelique Kidjo Arctic Monkeys Ben Sollee Bloc Party Cat Power Coldplay David Wax Museum DJ Shadow Dirty Heads Editors Explosions in the Sky Fitz and The Tantrums Floggin Molly LCD Soundsystem Lucius The New Pornographers Neko Case OK GO Ra Ra Riot Radiohead State Radio Thao & the Get Down Stay Down The Breeders Tune-yards TV on the Radio Wilco Bonnaroo (TN) Global Citizens Festival (NYC 2015) Lollapalooza (Chicago) Outside Lands (San Francisco) Find out more about Oxfam's Music outreach here: https://www.oxfamamerica.org/explore/inside-oxfam-america/ambassadors/musicians/ More About Action Corps: Nine years ago, Oxfam America founded the Oxfam Action Corps as a global advocate for those who weren’t being heard. The Oxfam Action Corps aimed to right the wrongs of poverty, hunger, and injustice. Oxfam Action Corps embodied the campaigns and efforts of Oxfam America’s work. Our volunteer organizers across the United States have lobbied our elected officials in nationwide efforts, campaigned in our communities for international food companies to improve their policies, an ... d canvassed to educate and empower. Hundreds of lobby visits were conducted, tens of thousands of signatures were collected, and over twenty campaigns were championed, all culminating in an unstoppable momentum of people power. Equally important are the relationships fostered through our efforts. As we grew our networks, we strengthened our forces to mobilize for human rights. Recently Oxfam announced that in response to changing global realities, Oxfam is restructuring internationally, which means the end of the official Oxfam Action Corps program; however, we the volunteers and grassroots organizers choose to continue and expand upon our work under a new a banner: Action Corps. We choose to persevere and continue our mission. As we embark on this new chapter, we commit to creating positive change in our world and believe we can end poverty in our lifetime regardless of the challenges we may face. We ask each of you to continue to stand for global economic justice and the human right to food. Whatever your background, career, ethnicity, gender, join us in our mission -- We are Action Corps. \"Small acts, when multiplied by millions of people, can transform the world.\" Howard Zinn
10016.title: Concert Outreach with Oxfam

10016.description: For over 27 years, the Volunteer Referral Center has helped thousands of New Yorkers find great volunteer opportunities. Through personal, one-on-one interviews, we can match your interests, skills, and availability with a non-profit that needs your help. We work with over 275 non-profits in NYC. Best of all, our services are always FREE! Call for your interview appointment: (212) 889-4805 or sign-up at: www.volunteer-referral.org.
10016.title: Want to Volunteer in NYC? We Can Help You.

10016.description: CARE FOR THE HOMELESS (CFH) needs YOUR help planning the 5th Annual Health Empowered Beauty Fashion Show in October 2017! Join the Planning Committee in creating \"the most inspiring fashion show of the year\", which includes a gourmet food reception, signature mocktails, live entertainment and raffle prizes! All funds raised will go to Susan's Place, CFH's 200-bed shelter for mentally ill and medically frail homeless women in the Bronx. THE MODELS of the night are the women from Susan’s Place, where they are invited to a professional casting call, fitting, and a full makeup and hair treatment before the Show. Participating in the show and the funds raised give these women the confidence to lift themselves out of poverty and the resources to start new lives. SUSAN'S PLACE is more than just a shelter for the residents. Through counseling, goal-setting, educational and cultural activities, personal development and healthcare, the residents at Susan’s Place are offered opportunities to work toward independence again. THE SHOW FEATURES Producer Traveling Trousseau and high-end and up-and-coming designers. Past designers have included Demestiks NYC, Shirley + Alice Vintage & Indie designer boutique, Monif C. Plus Size, JustFab Shoes, Seychelles Footware,NYU fashion design student Madeline Dolgin and many more. With YOUR help on our Planning Committee we can help women be back on the path to independence and stability. Together we will work on several aspects of the event, including the following: Event planning (decor and event logistics) Styling (fashion design) Promotion (social media and press) Donation requests (gift bags and raffle items) And more! Visit the CBS link below to learn more about the Health Empowered Beauty Fashion Show: http://newyork.cbslocal.com/2016/10/13/bronx-homeless-fashion-show/ Contact us if interested in attending our first meeting on Wednesday, February 22 at 6:00 pm at 30 East 33rd Street, Floor 5 New York, NY.
10016.title: Volunteer for the Health Empowered Beauty Fashion Show!

10016.description: This opportunity is available every Monday-Wednesday! Hot prepared food needs to be brought to the Mainchance Center at 120 East 32nd Street. This is just fifteen minutes of your time, and brings great cuisine to the people who need it. Lightweight: the average amount of food is 15 lbs. Split between two people, each person carries less than 10 lbs each.
10016.title: Stop Food Waste & Feed the Hungry in Kips Bay 5:30PM-6PM

10016.description: This opportunity is available every Monday-Friday! Help rescue healthy roasted vegetables that would have been thrown away and bring it to people who need it at the nearby Antonio Olivieri Center at 257 W 30th Street, New York NY 10001! Mediumweight: the average amount of food is a total of 30 lbs. Sign up directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10016.title: Fight Food Waste & Feed the Hungry in Midtown East 9:10PM-9:40PM!

10016.description: Help your community to stop food waste and fight hunger by bringing excess food to homeless shelters. You will be taking bags of excess food, which would have been thrown out by the restaurant, to the nearest homeless shelter. This is a great opportunity to gain community service experience while helping others at the same time!!!! Please sign up for events directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10016.title: Stop Food Waste & Feed The Hungry This Holiday Season!!!!

10016.description: Volunteers needed who are available during the day to take disabled adults to doctor's appointments and other necessary places that can only be done during the day. If you have a couple of hours a week and would like to donate your time to this worthy cause let us know. Please call 718-606-9712
10016.title: Volunteers needed who have daytime hours
10016.org: Helping Hands for the Disabled of NYC

10016.description: Volunteer Drivers needed to help disabled adults to enjoy a day out because Access A Ride is unreliable. Must have your own car.
10016.title: Drivers Needed
10016.org: Helping Hands for the Disabled of NYC

10016.description: 80% of our volunteer force is made up of women. Without them, our volunteer program would not exist. Starting this year, we want to make special effort for our kids to see more male role models when they come to our Reading Parties. With Pajama Program, you will make a positive difference in your community and in a child's life. During our 70 minute Reading Parties, you will provide a child in need with the one on one story time that they rarely experience. We invite volunteers (18 or older), who have completed our volunteer application and passed our background check, to share their love of reading with the children we serve in NYC. Our Reading Parties begin with circle time introductions and then we dive into reading in pairs or small groups. During the Reading Party, the children receive a snack, a new book of their choice, and a new pair of pajamas. The age range of the children is from 4-12 years old. Reading Parties last about an hour and run throughout the year during business hours from Tuesday-Friday. How to Apply: You must fill out our volunteer application and sign up for your background check. Please email Najamah Abdullah at najamah@pajamaprogram.org to receive the appropriate links. Please know that ALL volunteers must pass the background check and fill out the volunteer application to be able to attend the Reading Parties. All personal information will be kept confidential. Please check out the Pajama Program website or email Najamah Abdullah at najamah@pajamaprogram to learn more about volunteer opportunities. Thank you for your interest!
10016.title: Be a Male Role Model for Children in Need!

10016.description: City Harvest offers volunteer-taught nutrition education courses for people of all ages across NYC. Our programs, including cooking demonstrations and classes, teach participants how to prepare healthy, delicious meals on a budget. Volunteers will receive a 3-hour training to prepare you to teach good nutrition and healthy cooking skills. No prior certification or professional experience is required - just an interest in cooking and healthy eating! Lend your skills and help New Yorkers live a healthier lifestyle.
10016.title: Cook for Good!

10016.description: When City Harvest was founded in 1982, it was run entirely by volunteers who connected a handful of neighborhood restaurants to food programs serving those in need. Now, more than 30 years later, City Harvest volunteers remain a critical part of our food rescue operations and our comprehensive Healthy Neighborhoods programming. Whether you are a member of your company’s volunteer team at Mobile Markets, teach one of our nutrition education courses, or help with mailings and data entry in the office - your time and passion are important resources in the fight against hunger. We offer a wide variety of individual and group volunteer opportunities - including our Nutrition Education Program, Mobile Markets, Greenmarket Rescues, Corporate Repacks, Office Projects, and Food Drives. If you haven't volunteered with us before, please sign up for one of our New Volunteer Orientations held bi-monthly at our NYC office.
10016.title: Volunteer with City Harvest!

10016.description: If you have an interest in healthcare, have computer skills, enjoy research, reading about the various professions within the healthcare field, then working in the hospital's medical library is the ideal place to volunteer. Volunteer in our medical library and assist with helping to research programs, and on-line resources, which would benefit the individuals utilizing the Medical Library. The days and hours for volunteers are flexible Monday-Friday. Prior Library experience would be helpful, but is not a requirment. If you have time to volunteer between 8:00 AM-5:00 PM come to Bellevue.
10016.title: Medical Library

10016.description: With Pajama Program, you will make a positive difference in your community and in a child's life. During our 70 minute Reading Parties, you will provide a child in need with the one on one story time that they rarely experience. We invite volunteers (18 or older) from a range of diverse backgrounds and ethnicities, who have completed our volunteer application and passed our background check, to share their love of reading with the children we serve in NYC. Our Reading Parties begin with circle time introductions and then we begin reading in pairs (1 child to 1 adult) or small groups. During the Reading Party, the children receive a snack, a new book of their choice, and a new pair of pajamas. The age range of the children is from 4-12 years old. Reading Parties last about an hour and run throughout the year during from Tuesday-Friday at 11 am - 12 pm. How to Apply: You must fill out our volunteer application and sign up for your background check. Please email Najamah at najamah@pajamaprogram.org to receive the appropriate links. Please know that ALL volunteers must pass the background check and fill out the volunteer application to be able to attend the Reading Parties. All personal information will be kept confidential. Please check out the Pajama Program website or email Najamah at najamah@pajamaprogram to learn more about volunteer opportunities. Thank you for your interest! http://pajamaprogram.org/
10016.title: Make a Child Smile through Reading!

10016.description: English in Action (EiA) and Andrew Romay New Immigrant Center (ARNIC), programs of the English-Speaking Union of the United States, match non-native speakers with American volunteers for one-to-one conversation practice. EiA and ARNIC are always looking for friendly new tutors. As an EiA/ARNIC Volunteer you will make a difference in your community, meet new people, share your culture and experiences, and learn about other cultures. Volunteers need no formal training, just an interest in other languages and cultures and the willingness to befriend a newcomer. Time commitment: minimum 2 hours per week. Volunteer leadership positions available. English in Action may mean the beginning of a lifelong interest in a particular area of the world, or even a deeper understanding of one's own culture.
10016.title: English Conversation Tutors needed!
10016.org: The English-Speaking Union of the United States

10016.description: Individuals interested in working in a large municipal hospital, where they will assist patients of various age ranges and ethnicities. Ability to answer telephone phones, data entry, explain medical services, follow-up and/or remind patients about their medical appointments and work with charts and files. Volunteers are needed during the day and evening hours.
10016.title: Administrative Assistant

10016.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New York citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
10016.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate New York City NY

10016.description: We offer amazing opportunities for two day per week, or full time pro-life workers, in NYC, who can live either at home or in our own two-family house in the Bronx. We teach you to counsel girls and women in crisis pregnancy providing them with life-affirming pregnancy testing, ultrasounds, pre-natal care, and long term assisatnce. We expect a minimum of two full days, or three part time days of volunteering per week, and provide Metro Cards. Full time interns get stipends, too.
10016.title: NYC Pro-Life Full & Part Time Paid Interns
10016.org: Expectant Mother Care, a project of The Evergreen Association, Inc.

10016.description: Seeking nurses with a current NY State license, with a pro-life philosophy to work in pro-life centers in Brooklyn, Queens and the Bronx, to assist in supervising and or performing ultrasounds, pregnancy tests, and learning and engaging in pro-life counseling. No contraceptives, or abortions are prescribed, referred for or offered in our facilities.
10016.title: Volunteer and Paid Nurses Needed for Pro-Life NYC Clinics
10016.org: Expectant Mother Care, a project of The Evergreen Association, Inc.

10016.description: Volunteers are needed who have good communication skills, can work well with people, who have computer skills, have telephone skills. Volunteer should be able to file documents. Volunteers are need in the administrative offices and clinics. Bi-lingual skills helpful, but not required. Volunteers are needed day, evening and on weekends.
10016.title: Clerical

10016.description: Assist the Director of Volunteer Services create a volunteer newsletter. The newsletter will highlight volunteers, volunteer opportunities, etc. Some volunteerism will take on-site. However, some aspects of the position can take place off-site. Volunteer hours are flexible. Volunteer should have good writing skills, ability to communicate with a variety of individuals. (volunteers and staff) Vounteer should be computer literate.
10016.title: Writer

10016.description: Volunteers are needed to visit hospitalized patients on various floors of the hospital. Volunteers will work with people of all ages, ethnicities, and religion. Volunteers should enjoy working with people, as they will interact with the clinical and support services staff within the hospital. Volunteers may read to patients, write letters, escort a patient, play board games, communicate with nursing or social work on behalf of the patient. Volunteers can be utilized Monday-Sunday. Bi-Lingual skills are helpful, but not required
10016.title: Volunteer Friendly Visitors

10016.description: Do you have a curiosity about global affairs? Lead a U.S. foreign policy discussion group today! For over 55 years, the Foreign Policy Association's Great Decisions program has brought together people and communities to encourage individuals to engage in the world around them and to think critically about the global issues facing policymakers. Each year, FPA produces the Great Decisions briefing book, examining eight U.S. foreign policy and global affairs topics. All across the U.S., discussion groups meet to consider and discuss these topics, constituting the largest civil-education network in the country. Discussion group leaders organize and lead these meetings in their communities. Become a group leader now!
10016.title: Lead a global affairs discussion group today!!

10016.description: For over 27 years, the Volunteer Referral Center has helped thousands of New Yorkers find great volunteer opportunities. Through personal, one-on-one interviews, we can match your interests, skills, and availability with a non-profit that needs your help. We work with over 275 non-profits in NYC. Best of all, our services are always FREE! Call for your interview appointment: (212) 889-4805 or sign-up at: www.volunteer-referral.org.
10016.title: Want to Volunteer in NYC? We Can Help You Find the Perfect Volunteer Job!

10016.description: Assist the Department of Volunteer Services in creating a newsletter. Help design a logo and cover for the newsletter. Assist in writing articles for the newsletter and interviewing volunteers and/or staff for the newsletter. This assignment is flexible in terms of time. The volunteer can work on some of the assignments off site, but must be available to meet to compile the newsletter prior to printing. Art background helpful.
10016.title: Volunteer Newsletter

10016.description: Volunteers are needed to assist patients in the Patient Library with information regarding the books housed in the library. Volunteers will visit patients on the in-patients floors with the book cart and offer books, magazines and newspapers to the patients. Volunteers will assist with book sales, shelving of books and work at the information desk. Volunteers will assist in providing books to the some of the outpatient clinics via the book cart, and assist the outpatient in selecting a book or magazine.
10016.title: Patient Library

10016.description: Volunteers are needed to work in a variety of departments within the hospital. Clerical and customer services assistance is needed in our ambulatory care(clinics), Admitting Servcies and Rehab Medicine to name a few. Volunteers will assist with telephone calls, scheduling appointments, greeting patients, providing directions, assisting with data entry. Volunteers will work with the clinical and support services staff of the hospital. Volunteers who are bi-lingual will assist patients whose first language is not English. The volunteer is needed at least 3 days per week for at least 3 hours per day.
10016.title: Clerical/Customer Services Assistant

10016.description: Volunteers are needed to visit patients who do not have visitors and or family. Also, read to a patient, play cards or chess, write a letter, obtain books from the Patient Library or just sit and talks with the patient(s). Volunteer who speak languages other than English are capable of using their language skills by interpreting for the patient.
10016.title: Volunteer Friendly Visitors Program

10016.description: MAKE A DIFFERENCE! VOLUNTEER! Want to Volunteer? Need help getting started? Come in for a free and personal one-on-one interview to help find the right match for you! The Volunteer Referral Center has opportunities at over 300 non-profit agencies in New York City, ranging from social services organizations, advocacy work, and children's agencies to theater groups and museums. VRC has been serving the NYC community for 27 years and is a great place to learn about a wide range of volunteer needs. Call 212-889-4805 for an interview or sign up online at http://www.volunteer-referral.org/. (Note: Interviews are free of charge and by appointment only.)
10016.title: Volunteer Referral Service

11236.description: Purpose Assist with registering senior center members for lunch, class and events. Responsibilities Greet members Assist with sign in and selling tickets for lunch Assist with registering seniors for trips Additional clerical assistance as needed Skills Ability to work independently and as part of a team Good organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks Strong communication skills Patience Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week during business hours Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11236.title: Registrar - JASA at the HES

11236.description: Purpose Regular exercise is an essential part of a healthy lifestyle. Lead a weekly exercise class for seniors to help keep them in top shape. Responsibilities Lead a group of seniors in a weekly exercise Create exercise routines suitable for varied physical abilities Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills Exercise certification Experience leading seniors in exercises Experience with group exercise classes Knowledge of several light exercise techniques Comfortable leading a group of varying skill levels. Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11236.title: Exercise Instructor - JASA  at the HES Senior Center

11237.description: Description: The Student & Program Support volunteer (SPS) will be placed in the Adult Education team and will work along our Adult Education Staff to support adult students and teachers. Duties can include: assisting teachers during and/or outside of class, conducting students assessments, conducting student outreach, and program promotion and evaluation (see more details under duties). Schedule: Somewhat flexible, will be discussed with the volunteer Tasks and responsibilities: Assist teacher(s) during class with translation, tutoring, and class management Assist with intake or testing of students as needed Collect, evaluate,and organize examples of student work, and other student- related documents such as surveys for program improvement. Record and maintain program data related to their project for use by program managers. Participate in community networking and outreach efforts with team staff and evaluate strategies to determine most effective Help revise and organize the department’s training tools Potentially create or update short instructional videos or write ups describing processes as needed Requirements: Bilingual (Spanish and English) Strong interest in and commitment to working with the Spanish speaking/ immigrant community through the lens of Adult Education. Detail Oriented Strong communication and decision making abilities Readiness to work autonomously and on team driven projects Strong and effective time management skills GED or High school Diploma; Some college Comfort and Knowledge of basic computer programs (Windows, Microsoft Word, Excel, Internet Searching, Google Drive.) Desired but not required Experience: Comfort speaking to and/or facilitating groups. Group Facilitation, Teaching, or Tutoring Prior volunteer work with ESL students and / or with computer literacy students. Training Provided: Testing and assessment Outreach and Organizing students MRNY’s administrative protocols & computer software General MRNY Orientation Benefits: The volunteer will receive training and hands-on experience in a structured and well supported environment while enhancing the service experience of our members. The members will help improve accessibility to MRNY currently provided services. By the end of the service term the volunteer will have increased their networking opportunities and gained knowledge in: Intro to Adult Education Program management Basics of outreach, intake, program evaluation MRNY’s administrative protocols & computer software Modern technology and software used for research, community training, program evaluation, outreach and intake Program Design and Planning Effective teamwork Location: We have various offices. We’re looking for someone to help with our Bushwick and Queens offices and occasionally our MTA accessible Staten Island office.
11237.title: Adult Education Student & Program Support Volunteer

11568.description: Volunteer at HorseAbility to support our horses and riders with disabilities.Roles may include leaders, sidewalkers, equine and facility care. HorseAbility will provide the necessary training, continuing education and guidance to make your volunteer experience safe and enjoyable. Weekday and weekend availability. Times are flexible.
11568.title: Volunteer at a Therapeutic Equine Facility with children and adults with Special Needs

11202.description: We are looking for young patrons for the Museum. Help plan events, meet new people and have lots of fun. This is a group for those 21 years old and older. Were you active in college and now working yet still interesting in planning and attending events? Looking for an exciting way to get back into some socializing and doing good at the same time. Considering joing our Young Patrons group. Interested applicants, please let us know.
11202.title: Young Patrons and Coordinators

11202.description: Video editor or AE to help edit webisodes. We have all the footage and need someone to come in once a week for a few hours to put it all together. The webisodes are short, less than 10 minutes. Filming as well using our equipment. We use Adobe Premiere.
11202.title: Video Editor Intern

07444.description: Stella Therapy Riding in Pompton Plains NJ is looking for volunteers to assist with therapeutic horseback riding lessons. You will learn about horses and at the same time help a student learn how to ride horses. Volunteers must have the reliability, strength, endurance and communication skills necessary to assist participants during lesson activities.
07444.title: Bring the joy of horses to adults and children with disabilities!

10278.description: Score NYC is the local chapter servicing the NYC business community. We have over 90 members. Currently we are seeking a dynamic digital marketing professional, to lead our digital efforts. Volunteering at SCORE is one of the ways for you to give back to our community, stay connected with business leaders, and use your knowledge and expertise to bring SCORE’s resources to the next generation of entrepreneurs in your community. We hope to hear from you. RESPONSIBILITIES: Partner with the Marketing Chair in formulating a high impact, multi-channel marketing program Lead digital advertising initiative on Google Adwords and Facebook to increase workshop attendance, mentoring clientele, participation at major trade events, and volunteer signup Monitor, analyze and optimize ad performance and landing page effectiveness to maximize ROI Develop and lead a content marketing strategy; work with key constituents to create content and publish to our blog and other relevant platforms Manage our local chapter website and analyze web traffic to improve user experience and optimize for search and conversion Help create and lead an internal team of volunteers to execute and sustain this initiative VOLUNTEER REQUIREMENTS - 3+ years of experience creating, implementing, and tracking results of a targeted digital marketing program Fluency with Wordpress, Google Analytics, Hootsuite; Familiarity with SEOMoz, Leadpages, RiteTag, Semrush, etc.; Knowledge of HTML/CSS a plus Experienced in blogging, use of Google Adwords and paid ads on Facebook Attendance at marketing committee meetings, usually 2 hours each, once a month, at 26 Federal Plaza NYC, during business week Time commitment of 8-10 hours per week. Work is flexible and can be done virtually. TO APPLY - Email to: VOLUNTEERNOW@scorenyc.org ** your resume, a brief note regarding the number of hours you could volunteer each week AND please let us know the days and times you are NOT available. Any personal information you feel would help us get to know you better, including the circumstances that allow you to volunteer at this point in your life. Best day and time for you to come in to meet our team Your contact information ** Interviews for this position will be conducted by MARY TAN so please email both volunteernow@scorenyc.org and tan@scorenyc.org
10278.title: Volunteer - Digital Strategist

10278.description: Volunteer Opportunity for: Corporate Directors and Senior Management Consultants Position: Practice Leader, Advisory Board Practice to Small to Medium-size Enterprises in Manhattan, Brooklyn and The Bronx. Background: For over 50 years, SCORE Mentors have been providing counsel and assistance to thousands of entrepreneurs and small business owners across New York City. Some SCORE client firms have grown to the point that they need to add outside perspective and expertise to help them shape their business strategy and to keep them looking beyond managing their companies on a day to day basis to focus on the broader picture. SCORE NYC seeks to recruit an experienced corporate director or management consultant to create this practice. Responsibilities: With the ability to schedule this SCORE volunteer commitment around your available time, and working closely with SCORE NYC's senior leadership: Lead the effort to develop this Advisory Board practice; including identifying contacting, and persuading established businesses that they in fact would be well served by creating an Advisory Board Create ideal candidate profiles for members of the Advisory Board team; Build a roster of potential Advisory Board members from the current roster of SCORE Interview Mentors and qualified external recruits; Create practices and standards necessary to build a resource that will serve SCORE NYC's clients with distinction; Serve on one or multiple Advisory Boards in order to set a high level of service to SCORE's clients; Contribute to the strength and growth of SCORE New York through adding your management expertise to this totally volunteer organization. Ideal Candidate Profile: 30+ years as a business leader; Senior experience in general management, or on board(s) of directors, or in management consulting; An ability to quickly assess business opportunities and problems; Excellent listening skills and the ability to act as a responsible advisor; Ability to establish rapport with successful entrepreneurs and small business leaders. A real desire to help others succeed. Compensation: Volunteering at SCORE is one of the ways for you to give back to your community, connect with fellow business leaders, and pass on your knowledge and expertise to the next generation of entrepreneurs in your community. Enjoy the satisfaction of contributing to the success of others; Share great experience with other SCORE volunteers and make new friends; Provide leadership for the local business community; Participate in life-long learning, growing professionally and personally. To learn more about SCORE NYC, go to www.newyorkcity.scorenyc.org and If you’d like to discuss this opportunity to serve the New York business community: EMAIL: humanresources@scorenyc.org or CALL: Diane Drey, Score NYC Chapter Chair at 212-264-4507
10278.title: Volunteer - Advisory Board Member - for established businesses

10278.description: We are looking for an organized computer literate person who can assist in the prepartion and administration of the business workshops we put on annually for entrepreneurs. In addition to helping us you will have the opportunity to attend the workshops for free - so this is perfect opportunity for someone that is interested in going into business or having a business career. The workshops offerings cover 25 subject areas including marketing and sales, finance and accounting, leadership and management, and industry specific workshops. The Workshop Committee, which organizes these educational experiences needs qualified volunteer with event planning skills to participate in the team effort. AS EVENT COORDINATOR YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES ARE: Prepare the materials which will be distributed at the workshops Arrive at the workshop 45 minutes in advance to Meet and Greet the participants, check them in Make sure participants have paid the proper fee Collect and tally surveys on the workshop Prepare statistical information Introduce speakers (optional) REQUIREMENTS We seek individuals who can CONSISTENTLY volunteer four hours a week. Workshops are primarily given during the business day, although some are in the early evening.
10278.title: Volunteer - Event Planner - for Business Seminars

10278.description: We have an immediate opening for an administrative assistant to support our non-profit organization that mentors small businesses and start-ups. This is a key role because it is often the first point of contact for clients and volunteers visiting or calling our main offices. It also provides important support for the Membership and Workshop Committees. Responsibilities include - answering the telephone, - preparing promotional material, - responding to client inquiries, - assisting with workshop registrations - attending events and meeting and greeting prospective clients - assisting the mentors with a variety of administrative and computer tasks. We seek individuals who can consistently commit to at least one \"five hours per week\" at our downtown office. By joining our organization you will be making a significant contribution to New York City's small business community.
10278.title: Volunteer Administrative Assistant and Reception

10475.description: We are looking for an energetic and passionate, creative Teen Group Specialist to facilitate our teen groups and teach young girls on self-esteem, character and healthy relationships! College Students, Teachers and Social Workers are welcome! Please email your resume to hrm@iraiseinc.org ***Stipend Provided***
10475.title: Teen Group Specialist *Girls*

10475.description: We are looking for an energetic and passionate person to serve as Cheer Coach this year for our new Cheer Team (ages 13 & up). Past experience as cheerleader is required*** Perform at games and competitions!
10475.title: Cheer Coach

10475.description: Do you have experience teaching or assisting with ESL programs? Do you love to work with seniors? Met Council is looking for an English as a Second Language tutor to assist some of the residents at our senior housing facility in the Bronx. Our senior residents speak a variety of different languages and have varying levels of English skills but are very eager to learn. Volunteers should be able to commit to one two-hour time block of their choosing per week and feel comfortable working with senior populations.
10475.title: Volunteer ESL Tutor for Seniors Needed

10475.description: Youth Lacrosse Coaches needed to develop youth Lacrosse program located in the North Bronx. We will introduce the sport to this area by conducting a series of clinics. Upon developing interest we will develop teams based on age groups. Teach youth ages 8-13 the skills and fundamentals of Lacrosse. Playing and or Coaching experience preferred. Prepare youth to compete against teams throughout the Tri State area. Flexible scheduling is available. All volunteers subject to MANDATORY BACKGROUND CHECK.
10475.title: Youth Lacrosse Coaches
10475.org: North Bronx Youth Sports Association, Inc

10475.description: We are launching a campaign to help single parents that live in NYC shelters with there children. We need energetic persons to help us. If you are computer literate,or not you still can help. Said fundraiser is happening soon. So get on board .And lets change some lives.
10475.title: Lets do some long term good

10475.description: Youth Soccer Coaches needed to develop youth soccer program located in the North Bronx for the 2016 season. Teach youth ages 6-13 the skills and fundamentals of Soccer. Playing and or Coaching experience preferred. Those without experience willing to learn from the ground up are welcome. Prepare youth to compete against teams throughout the Tri State area. Flexible scheduling is available. All Coaches and Volunteers go through MANDATORY BACKGROUND CHECK.
10475.title: Soccer Coaches
10475.org: North Bronx Youth Sports Association, Inc

10475.description: Youth Cheerleading Coaches needed for Youth Cheerleading program located in the North. Teach youth ages 6-13 the skills of Cheerleading. Coach candidates should have experience and or knowledge of tumbling, gymnastics, acrobatics, dance, choreography, stepping, etc. Develop and prepare new youth cheerleaders for Cheer Competitions against teams for local, regional and national competition. Assist the Cheer Coordinator to develop program curriculum and training schedule. Flexible scheduling is available. All Coaches and Volunteers go through MANDATORY BACKGROUND CHECK.
10475.title: Cheerleading Coaches
10475.org: North Bronx Youth Sports Association, Inc

10475.description: Youth Football Coaches needed for Youth Football program located in the North Bronx for the 2016 season. Teach youth ages 6-13 the skills and fundamentals of Football. Teach all positions on the Football Field. Playing and or Coaching experience preferred. Those without experience willing to learn from the ground up are welcome. Prepare youth to compete against teams throughout the Tri State area. Develop youth to be competitive for loca, regional and national tournaments. Flexible scheduling is available. Practices start now. Commitment, dedication, learning training techniques and above level communication with youth and people of varied backgrounds is required. All Coaches and Volunteers go through MANDATORY BACKGROUND CHECK.
10475.title: Football Coaches
10475.org: North Bronx Youth Sports Association, Inc

10475.description: The North Bronx Youth Sports Association, Inc. was founded in 2004 to provide recreational opportunities to at risk youth in the North Bronx. We are a sports based youth development program. We provide training and competition in Football, Soccer and Cheerleading for ages 5-14 as well as academic monitoring. We are seeking Board Members that can assist this grass roots based community program achieve its goal of taking the steps to reach a higher level of service through strategic planning, fundraising, management and capital building.
10475.title: Seeking Board Members
10475.org: North Bronx Youth Sports Association, Inc

10475.description: Purpose Lead a weekly class to help seniors learn to use their cell phones. Responsibilities Create weekly lessons for a small group of seniors with varied technology abilities Guide seniors step by step through making phone calls, sending emails and using apps Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Additional tasks may include assistance with computers and iPads Skills Have a good general knowledge of cell phones including apps Experience working with seniors is helpful, but not required Patience Strong communication skills Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
10475.title: Cell Phone Instructor at JASA Dreiser Senior Center

11560.description: Volunteer opportunities range from animal care and rescue to education outreach and office work. Training is provided on-site. It's an exciting way to learn about local wildlife! Please visit the following site for more information and how to apply: http://www.volunteersforwildlife.org/#!volunteer/cu9t
11560.title: Wildlife Education Center Volunteer

11520.description: We are hoping to recruit experienced Advisory Board members to help develop a regioanl strategic plan, support meeting the budget through special events, individual giving & corporate sponsorships. We are also begining to meet with our annual Friendship Walk committee and need more committee members. This opportunity is more for event planning and donation seeking. Please reach out if you have an interest in either or both the Advisory Board or Friendship Walk Committee.
11520.title: Advisory Board & Event Committee Members needed

11520.description: The Book Fairies is a growing nonprofit that is seeking motivated board members who are interested in making an impact on illiteracy across metropolitan New York. Please email the answers to the questions listed below: 1. Why are you interested in committing your time and energy to The Book Fairies? 2. What do you think are the characteristics of a great board member? 3. Board members bring experience, wisdom, strategic thinking, and their connections. Can you tell us about yours? We look forward to hearing back from you!
11520.title: Seeking Board Members for The Book Fairies

11520.description: Helping develop contact lists (emails and snail mails) Hand out brochures at our events Possibly set up and tear down prior and after our events Other opportunities as they come up
11520.title: Volunteers to help at our programs and services
11520.org: LONG ISLAND ARTS COUNCIL AT FREEPORT INC

11520.description: These small book clubs of 6-8 people offer adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities the opportunity to read for pleasure. Guided by a pair of trained volunteer facilitators, Next Chapter Book Clubs will meet once a week for an hour at select libraries across Long Island.
11520.title: Next Chapter Book Club Facilitator

11520.description: In addition to our one-on-one tutoring program, our brand new Small Group Instruction classes (SGI) are a great opportunity to have a positive impact with multiple students. To participate as a tutor in SGI, you must be a certified teacher and take the SGI Tutor Training Workshop.
11520.title: Small Group Instructor (Certified Teachers Only)

11520.description: Teach literacy skills to adults reading below a 6th grade level and/or English to new English language learners. Opportunity welcomes creativity and initiative! Volunteers work closely with student's identified goals, which can range from obtaining a job, studying for citizenship, or even reading a bedtime story to a grandchild. No previous experience necessary. You will meet at a library of your choice. Some of our high need areas are New Hyde Park, Westbury, Hicksville, Uniondale, and Freeport. If we don't have a student in your area, you may have to travel to a surrounding library.
11520.title: Adult Literacy Tutor

11520.description: The Warehouse Supervisor will be responsible for training volunteers, handling incoming and outgoing books, and he general structure and organization of the warehouse. The volunteer can work 1-3 days a week from 10am-3pm. Full training will be provided. It’s a fun environment with amazing volunteers, great music and a relaxed atmosphere. Bonus: take home any book you want! Must be available 1-3 set days a week from 10am-3pm.
11520.title: Book Fairies Warehouse Supervisor

11520.description: The Book Sorting Trainer will teach new volunteers how to check and sort books. As your knowledge grows, the trainer will also be responsible for quality control over the checked books and make sure they are in the right grade level and in acceptable quality. The Book Trainer would work set hours each week. This is ideal for a teacher or someone who can easily distinguish between preschool, elementary, middle school and high school books. Average hours per week: 5hr - 15hr (depending on how many days you choose to work in the warehouse)
11520.title: Book Sorting Trainer

11520.description: We are looking for special people to open their hearts and homes while a shelter dog awaits their forever home. What better way to spend your time than helping a homeless pet in need? Make sure to click on [+] READ MORE button below to read more information on this opportunity! WHY? Fostering saves 2 lives for each 1 dog fostered. Fostering frees up a space for another dog to be brought to kennel (helps us to save more dogs from euthanasia!!!) Provides a loving home for an animal that is looking for a fur-ever home!! Fostering is very rewarding No money is needed!! We provide the food, medical care, crates....you provide the love! We have 2 options available --- 1. Foster & 2. Foster-to-Adopt!! Fostering is pretty much self-explanatory but the \"Foster-to-Adopt\" program is a little unique. It allows potential adopters to take a pup home for up to two weeks to ensure that a pup is the right fit for the family. Situations include, but are not limited to: if your current pet needs some transition time to accept a new pup and vice versa, a pup that needs to complete heartworm treatment, or a pup that has a medical condition. MORE INFORMATION: Check out \"Fostering 101' on our website. Check out the Manual -- you must click on the \"Ruff House Rescue Foster Manual\") once in the website. NEXT STEPS: Check out the dogs in need of fostering Complete Foster Application: 1) Go to www.ruffhouserescue.org, 2) Click on the \"Foster\" tab, and 3) Click on \"Foster Application\" If you do not get a response from us within 3-4 days please outreach to us at ruffhouserescue@gmail.com If you are undecided, ask us questions --- Please click on the red button \"I want to help!\" on the upper left hand corner of the page and Include in the comments: Your residence (City in New York), Question(s) and If you have questions about the Application OTHER INFORMATION: Only serious inquiries please AGE REQUIREMENT: Head of house must be at least 18 years old UNDER AGE REQUIREMENT: See our \"Junior Volunteer\" positions REQUIREMENTS: Must be located near our Rescue in Long Island, NY. We have a Foster Application that once approved we can suit the right dog to your home. TIME COMMITMENT/DURATION: Depends on baby-adult/Approx. 1 to 2 months commitment (sometimes shorter, sometimes longer). For Foster-to-Adopt program (see below) up to 2 week commitment. PROVIDED TO FOSTERS: All expenses are paid by RHR (food & medical/vet bills) we just ask for you to give the dog a loving and comfortable place to stay while he/she awaits their forever home. We provide the crate/puppy play pen and water bowls. COMMUNITY HOURS: Letter ONLY provided for some In-person Opportunities BUT if you do a \"drive\" for Kennel Supplies, Pennies for RHR Fundraiser or a Garage/Tag Sale at your school/church/community center you could have someone LOCAL be a Coordinator of your hours. Also see the \" Exercise + ResQWalk\" or \"Exercise + Wooftrax\" volunteer opportunities where your time and distance exercised is recorded on the cell phone application. MORE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES: See below or ** PLEASE CLICK ON THE BLUE \"Ruff House Rescue (RHR)\" LINK (located on the upper, left-hand side of the page ABOVE the red \"I want to help!\" button). ** Once a new page opens click on the volunteer listing you are interested in learning more about. ************************************************************************* VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES WITH RHR: http://www.volunteermatch.org/search/org840639.jsp (Copy and paste the above link into your web browser or Click on the blue \"Ruff House Rescue RHR\" link located on the upper, left hand corner of the screen). Look below for even more positions posted on Our website too! Dog Walkers [or] Kennel Cleaners -- 3 hrs/week! (Freeport, NY) Adoption Counselors, Post-Adoption Counselors [or] Foster Coordinators (Virtual) -- HOLD Unique Volunteer Positions (Virtual & In-person) E-mail Assistant [or] Social Media Blogger (Virtual) -- HOLD Exercise + ResQWalk (Virtual Opp) Foster-to-Adopt [or] Foster Dogs/Puppies ** Urgent** (Freeport, NY) Garage/Tag Sale [or] Tupperware, PartyLite Hosting (Virtual Opportunity) Grant Researcher/Writer [or] Fundraising Scout (Virtual) -- HOLD Internet Surfing --- 3 Ways to Help Out (Virtual Opportunity) Junior Volunteers -- Virtual Opportunities (and In-person too)! Transport Our Pets (Near Freeport, NY) -- HOLD Owner Surrender Coordinator (Virtual) -- HOLD Pennies for RHR Fundraiser -- Easy, Any Age/Group (Virtual Opp) Photographers & Videographers (In-person) Post Flyers [or] Install/Collect Donation Boxes (Long Island, NY)-- HOLD RHR Store Assistant (Long Island) Shoppers Get Your Coupons & \"Shop-On\" (Internet/Virtual Opportunity) Supplies for Rescue's Kennel (Virtual and In-person Opportunity) Exercise + Wooftrax (Virtual) Wear Jeans for A Day (Virtual) The following positions are listed on RHR's website. Please go to www. ruffhouserescue.org & click on the \"Volunteer\" tab to learn more details about these positions: help with Mailings, help at Petco Adoption Events and others, Poster Campaign, Baked Goods for events, Dog Treat Sales, Marketing Specialist, Donate Prizes for fundraising events, PLUS MORE. After visiting the website please contact us via e-mail at ruffhouserescue@gmail.com if you interested in this positions. *********************************************************************** Our mission is to rescue homeless pets that suffer from abuse, neglect, and indifference. Our goal is to create awareness of the epidemic of homeless pets and educate on the importance of spaying and neutering, ID tagging, and training these pets. Through our rescue efforts we are both saving lives and cultivating the natural connection between man and his best friend. DOGS/CATS FOR ADOPTION OR FOSTER: https://www.petfinder.com/pet-search?shelterid=NY936 THANK YOU FOR LOOKING AT OUR VOLUNTEER POST AT RHR!
11520.title: Foster-to-Adopt |or| Foster Dogs or Puppies ** Urgent** (Freeport, NY)

11520.description: Help Sort Books Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays 10am-3pm Do you love books? Are you looking for a fun, relaxed and flexible volunteer position? Then, The Book Fairies is the perfect fit! Books keep tumbling into the warehouse and we need dedicated sorters to help fly through the books. We are searching for volunteers to help us on a consistent weekly basis. It would be one day a week or more, your choosing, with flexible hours. We are open Tuesdays through Thursdays from 10am-3pm (stay for the day or choose a few hours). The task is easy, you can sit or stand, no heavy lifting is required as we can bring the books to you. The task involves sorting through the books we receive from school book drives. We check each book for wear and tear and place them into categories from preschool through adult. The best part? You can take home any books you want as payment! Join us for a day and see if it's right for you. We would love to have you!
11520.title: Weekly Book Sorting Position

10470.description: I am looking for a fundraiser who specilaized in girl's education, WASH gala and literacy for girl. To help plan, coodinate and raise funds for the above event in New york
10470.title: Hygiene for Girls Gala/WASH GALA

10470.description: Emerald Isle Immigration Center The Emerald Isle Immigration Center is a non-profit organization that serves the needs of the Queens and Bronx communities. We are pleased to have a staff team consisting of Immigration Counsellors, social workers and NY State Health Navigators and many more. We provide support to both Irish and American citizens and advise on immigration, housing, employment, education, health insurance and social services matters. We run a variety of classes and volunteering opportunities, including our Meals on Wheels program. EIIC’s Meals on Wheels program provides daily meals to local seniors in the Bronx area who are unable to prepare meals for themselves due to an age related disability or illness. The meals are delivered daily by a group of dedicated volunteers. Not only do our local seniors enjoy the food they receive but they enjoy the social interaction with the volunteers, because for a lot of them - this is the only form of socializing they get. We currently need drivers and non-drivers for our Meals on Wheels program. What we need from you: · To be available to volunteer at least one morning per week, Monday to Friday from 9.30am until 12pm. · To have a clean record, we will run checks. · To be friendly, enthusiastic, approachable and have a desire to help seniors. · No experience is needed. What will you get in return? · Training. · Extensive and rewarding experiences. · A glowing reference for future employment. · Any out of pocket expenses. If interested, please give the Bronx office a call and speak to Keva on 718-324-3039 ext. 204 or our receptionist on ext 101.
10470.title: Meal's on Wheels Volunteer

10473.description: Yoga has been linked to healthy circulation, ease of movement, and is a proven de-stressor. This program is one that we feature across many of our programs and there's many age groups to instruct, the choice is yours. Yoga certification required.
10473.title: Be an Adult  YOGA Instructor !

11208.description: For our Non-Profit organization we are looking to build and have volunteers work at our local High School called High School for Civil Rights. At this school we will be working directly with students during block times and during lunch times. Our volunteers will facilitate workshops for a book club, chess, job readiness and vocational training etc. We would also like to have volunteers to assist with our community center for the adults in the community where we offer job skills training, senior services to local senior centers, community advocacy and more.
11208.title: Youth Empowerment Program (10weeks)

11208.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
11208.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 7K, Brooklyn)

11208.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning. The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
11208.title: Become a reading partner now- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 108 Sal Abbracciamento, NYC)

10573.description: Children who grow up with books from an early age have improved success in school. Open Door participates in Reach Out and Read a national literacy program designed to take place at medical offices across the country. Our team of reading volunteers read books aloud to preschool children and help them select a book to take home. Book Delivery: we need volunteers to take books from our book storage in Ossining to our 4 other health centers located in Port Chester, Sleepy Hollow, Mt. Kisco and Brewster each week. Volunteers can select one or more sites to deliver books to Commit to delivering the books once each week to the chosen location Organize the book cart or book shelf and store additional books where directed Book pick up and drop offs would be your choice of day(s) Monday - Friday, between 9:30am - 5:00pm It would be okay to pick the books up on one day and deliver the books on another day. Advise volunteer coordinator when book storage in Ossining is low on a particular type of books. Notes: This is a good individual position and would also be a great volunteer position for two friends to take on! You need to be in good physical condition. The book storage is in the basement, so would not be great for someone with many allergies. Volunteer would need to use their own vehicle. Application Requirements: Complete an on-line Volunteer Application All volunteers 18 years and older will have a background check performed by Open Door Medical requirements: Provide documentation of a physical exam and PPD Test (TB) not older than 12 months Provide an immunization record or documentation of blood work for titer levels Provide documentation of the seasonal flu vaccine Sign a Hepatitis B form Have two reference forms completed and submitted directly to Open Door Complete an on-line volunteer orientation. Complete an on-line safety post-test and a volunteer orientation post-test. Sign a Volunteer Service Agreement and Pledge of Confidentiality. Please contact Alicia Ward, Open Door Volunteer Coordinator with any questions: award@odfmc.org / 914-502-1468 Open Door and the young patients we serve can really use your help!
10573.title: Children's Book Delivery
10573.org: Open Door Family Medical Centers Inc

10573.description: Open Door needs 2 volunteers to read with preschool children and work on coloring sheets while their mother participates in a parenting class. The parent will be either in the same room or just nearby. We will provide training in bringing a book to life for the children and how to be interactive with the story. Volunteers need to enjoy working with young children. Goals: To provide an environment to allow the mother to participate in the parenting program To encourage children to enjoy books and reading, to better prepare them to become Kindergarten Ready. This is part of our Reach Out and Read Program, a national literacy program. Coloring sheets often have targeted messages such as nutrition, wellness and self-esteem. Time: Mondays: 11:30am - 12:30am Location: Port Chester Open Door, 5 Grace Church Street, Port Chester, NY Call: Alicia Ward, Volunteer Coordinator for more information: 914-502-1468 or email: award@odfmc.org Requirements to volunteer: Application Background check 2 References Medical information PPD test and Flu vaccine (free of charge from Open Door if needed) Volunteer Orientation
10573.title: Read to Preschool Children
10573.org: Open Door Family Medical Centers Inc

10573.description: Reading volunteers are needed! Help become the positive change we need. Statics prove that children read to at an early age are more successful in school. You can help change a child's world by becoming a reading volunteer for Open Door's Reach Out and Read Program. Volunteers read aloud with one or more children, model reading techniques for parents and have a conversation about the importance of reading with their children. Our Reach Out and Read Coordinators will train you about working with our families, what books are best by age and more to help you feel ready to make a difference. Wonderful flexible volunteer opportunity for everyone who loves to read and work with children. We are building our team of daytime volunteers especially and can use your help. If you are recently retired or at home and looking for a little something to do, give us a call. Many colleges have approved Reach Out and Read for required course hours. We also use after school support as well, so all of you high school students who need community service hours and are reliable, give our rewarding program a try. Locations: Port Chester, Ossining, Sleepy Hollow and Mt. Kisco, NY Days/Hours: all business hours Shift: a shift is 1 hour or longer if desired Not sure? Come for a Reach Out and Read trial to see if our environment is a good fit for you. Then all volunteers complete a volunteer application and volunteer Orientation. Open Door Family Medical Centers is a non-profit community-based health organization. We are buliding strong, healthy communities. Join our team! Contact: Alicia Ward, Volunteer Coordinator at award@odfmc.org or call 914-502-1468.
10573.title: You Can Change a Child's World, One Story at a Time
10573.org: Open Door Family Medical Centers Inc

11249.description: Help your community to stop food waste and fight hunger by bringing excess food to homeless shelters. You will be taking bags of excess food, which would have been thrown out by the restaurant, to the nearest homeless shelter. This is a great opportunity to gain community service experience while helping others at the same time!!!! Please sign up for events directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
11249.title: Volunteers Needed For Weekly Food Rescue Events (Great Way To Give Back To The Community)

07405.description: Mary Ann is a quiet and gentle woman in her 30’s who lives in our sheltered apartments in Butler, NJ. These apartments provide support for people who cannot manage on their own but are capable of a level of independence. Mary Ann would enjoy someone to share her hobbies with. She cannot drive so would love a friend to go to an occasional movie, bowling or other activity in the community. She would benefit from a good friend that will help her to develop her confidence.
07405.title: Do you like scrap-booking and crafts?

07405.description: Sue Anne is a lovely woman who lives in our sheltered apartments in Butler. She is wishing for a volunteer that likes to browse in the dollar store or have coffee at the diner. She very much enjoys going to church and sending thoughtful cards to friends. She needs assistance with reading and writing but loves to remember people on their birthday. She is a very positive and upbeat person and appreciative of the little things.
07405.title: Do you like to browse the dollar store and an occasional trip to a diner?

07405.description: If you have a certified therapy/comfort dog then we have a loving audience for you. The men and women who have developmental and intellectual disabilities that live in our homes are not able to have a pet of their own but miss the opportunity to spend time with a dog or cat. We have various locations and are especially in need of a pet therapist in the areas of Wayne, Butler, and Pompton Lakes. Please visit our website to learn more about our organization. www . dpd .org
07405.title: Pet Therapy / Comfort Animals

10080.description: This opportunity is available every Saturday & Sunday! Help get excess bagels donated from a really great food business! The final destination will be the NYC Rescue Mission at 90 Lafayette Street. Middleweight: the average amount of food is 15-20 pounds. Sign up directly on our calendar: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10080.title: Fight Food Waste & Feed the Hungry in FiDi 6PM-6:30PM

10080.description: This opportunity is available every Monday-Friday Help get excess bagels donated from a really great food business! The final destination will be the NYC Rescue Mission at 90 Lafayette Street. Middleweight: the average amount of food is 15-20 pounds. Sign up directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10080.title: Stop Food Waste & Feed the Hungry in FiDi 5PM-5:30PM

07401.description: Be a Hospice Volunteer! Hospice Volunteers are needed for supportive visits to patients, offering emotional support and companionship. Volunteers can read to patients, hold their hand, talk and pray with them, write letters, be a good listener, or various other supportive acts. We offer free Hospice training. Compassionate Care Hospice is recruiting volunteers to work with our hospice patients and their families in home settings, assisted living settings, and nursing facilities near you! (Passaic County, Bergen County, Essex County, Hudson County, Union County) Please Call Volunteer Coordinator Jessicalee Huggins 973-916-1400 or email Jessicalee.huggins@cchnet.net
07401.title: Be a hospice volunteer in Bergen County

07401.description: Do you sing or play an instrument that can provide comfort to a patient on Hospice? Playing music for our patients provide a higher level of care like no other... We offer free Hospice training. Compassionate Care Hospice is recruiting volunteers to work with our hospice patients and their families in home settings, assisted living settings, and nursing facilities near you! (Passaic County, Bergen County, Essex County, Hudson County, Union County) If interested Please contact the Volunteer Coordinator Jessicalee Huggins at 973-916-1400
07401.title: Do you sing or play an instrument that can provide comfort to a patient on Hospice?
