Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
11428.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS Edward M. Funk Elementary, Queens)

11427.description: We have a lovely senior who would like a friendly visitor. Her interests include photography and theater. If you can get to the St. Johns University area on weekday afternoons and have an hour to spend lessening a seniors social isolation, please contact Suzanne Windland at 718 454-2100, ext 123 or reply to this ad. Thank you!
11427.title: Friendly Visitor with an interest in photography

11427.description: We have a lovely senior client who used to play piano and would love someone to come spend time with her and play her piano for her. (This mught even get her playing again) If this opportunity interests you and you can get to Queens village area on the weekend, please call Suzanne at 718 454-2100, ext 123 or reply to this ad. Thanks for reading!
11427.title: Can you be music to this Senior's ears?

11427.description: Do you like working with seniors? Do you have an interest in helping others? This group is geared toward helping memebers through difficult time in thier lives though problem solving and conversation. Please contact if you are interested in leading a discussion group. This opportunity is help for one hour at 10 or 11am Monday Morning.
11427.title: Beyond the Barriers Discussion Group Leader

11427.description: Do you like working with seniors? Are you interested in helping women? If so, we would like you to lead a women's discussion group here at our senior center. Please contact us for more details.
11427.title: Women's Discussion Group

11427.description: Are you certified to teach self defense to seniors? Do you love working with older adults? If so, we are looking for someone to start a self-defense class for seniors here at our senior center. Please contact us for more details.
11427.title: Self Defense for Seniors

11427.description: Are you interested in working with seniors? Do you like to help plan parties and events? If you answered yes! Please contact us at SNAP for more details.
11427.title: Volunteer Helpers!

07650.description: We need volunteers who can teach English to children whose first languag is not English. Most of our children are on very basic course. The class schudule is as followed. Monday to Thursday from 3:30 PM or 4:00 PM to 6:15 PM.
07650.title: ESL tutoring, Art work for kids

07650.description: We need volunteers who can teach English to children whose first languag is not English. Most of our children are on very basic course. The class schudule is as followed. Monday to Thursday from 3:30 PM or 4:00 PM to 6:15 PM.
07650.title: Homework Tutoring

07650.description: We are going to have community events visiting daycare, nursing homes, and/or hospitals around us and we need your talent. Also, you can teach our children so that they can share what they learn from you with others. Any kind of talent that makes our children and audience happy is greatly appreciated.
07650.title: Talent Sharing

07652.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07652.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07652.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07652.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07652.description: What: A nationwide awareness and fundraiser campaign through the National Inclusion Project. You will assist in wrapping gifts for store patrons. Help a great organization while spreading some holiday cheer! When: The Holiday Season - The contact will send specific dates and times. Why: To help raise awareness and funds for the National Inclusion Project, spread holiday cheer, and have fun! Specific Dates/Times: 12/2 from 4 pm - 10 pm 12/10 from 4 pm - 9 pm 12/22 from 8 am - 4 pm 12/26 from 11 am -4 pm
07652.title: 2016 Wrapping for Inclusion - Parasmus, NJ

07652.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation. And mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some well needed smiles.
07652.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice

07652.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07652.title: Hospice Volunteer

07652.description: Seeking volunteers to assist with our grant research and fundraising/development department. This is a multifaceted position where you would gain experience in grant research and writing, donor development, planned giving, marketing research, strategic marketing, and general knowledge of fundraising. These skills would allow you to learn the duties and challenges of a non-profit while learning how to expand a marketing and development department. Duties would include: Statistical Research Creating letter and calendar templates Donor Research Social Media Strategic Marketing And much more! Position is: On-going Position is suitable for court-ordered volunteers: No Time of Volunteer Position: Availability during the business day or early evenings, Monday through Friday Number of Volunteers Needed For This Position: Flexible Area of Impact: Health and Wellness, Other (Can Serve As Intern Experience) Skills Required: Telephone skills, computer skills- as mentioned Age Group Served: All Ages
07652.title: Marketing and Fundraising/Development Volunteer or Intern

07652.description: Assist with 5-6 major annual fundraisers which generate funds for critical diabetes medications, children’s camp scholarships, education and patient support services. Duties include staffing events, assisting with event planning and post-event activities Data entry, registrations and recordkeeping), obtaining donations and raffle items, and more. There is also room for those interested in creating new fundraisers to do so, as we rely so heavily on these funds to continue our programs and patient assistance.
07652.title: Fundraising and Special Events Volunteer

07652.description: Looking for volunteers to attend health fairs & events within the community, organizing and maintaining outreach material, researching health fairs and other relevant events, and providing support to community programs where there is an opportunity to educate the public. The ideal volunteer should possess: Strong communication, interpersonal and organizational skills Compassionate, articulate and patient demeanor Computer proficiency using Microsoft programs Bilingual Spanish skills a plus but not required Community-based, per diem (days, nights or weekends). 1 year commitment. Flexible hours- we will work with your schedule!
07652.title: Outreach and Community Education

07652.description: Seeking volunteers to assist with phone calls in our Patient Support Services Program. These individuals work to connect people living with diabetes that are uninsured or underinsured to long-term prescription assistance programs, medical facilities and ongoing health and wellness resources. Helping patients who have utilized the Foundation’s short-term emergency medical assistance find long-term assistance is critical to ensuring that each patient will not experience a lapse in their diabetes treatment plan. Bilingual English/Spanish proficiency a plus but not required. Experience speaking with patients or customers via phone, and/or familiarity with diabetes is a huge plus, but also not required. Basic computer proficiency and typing skills are required.
07652.title: Patient Support Services

07652.description: Our organization works feverishly to help people in New Jersey with diabetes to obtain affordable medication, education and additional resources so they can live healthier lives. Maintaining patient information, educational resources, spreadsheets, data entry, event data organization, fundraising mailings- these are just some of the things that need to happen everyday to make our office run! We need great people to help us keep the workflow going and to reach as many people in need as possible. If you are comfortable using Microsoft Office, we need you!
07652.title: Love office work? Your skills are needed in a busy diabetes organization!

07652.description: Put your specialized database skills to work for a great cause! The Diabetes Foundation, Inc. is seeking a volunteer with considerable experience using Microsoft Access, great data entry ability, and some spare time to volunteer at our office in Paramus. The Foundation is looking to consolidate the Excel documents of contact information that has been collected over the years and transfer this information into Access. It is a big job that requires time and patience, but when the project is complete, there will be an organized database that will save the staff a lot of time - and headaches! We are a small non-profit dedicated to improving the care and quality of life for people living day to day with diabetes through medical assistance, diabetes education programs, and a campership program. We rely on volunteers like you to help keep our programs moving forward. Please contact us if you think you are the right person for this position by emailing info@diabetesfoundationinc.org. For more information on the Diabetes Foundation, please visit www.diabetesfoundationinc.org
07652.title: Microsoft Access "Whiz"

07656.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07656.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07656.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice

Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. 07656.description: Dog Handler/Walker/Visitor In this position, you will provide walks, transport and train dogs in our Halfway Hounds program. You are not required to work with large dogs, but if you are comfortable working with larger breed dogs, that is helpful. Most dog walking takes place in Northern Bergen county. Our highest need for walkers is on weedays in the morning, midday and evening. If interested, please complete a volunteer application on our web site, http://www.halfwayhounds.org/halfwayhounds/volunteer/volunteer-application.html You are required to complete a dog handling training session prior to be able to work with the dogs. We prefer volunteers age 18 and up. Location - NY/NJ Counties of Bergen, Passaic, Hudson, Rockland, Sussex and more.
07656.title: Dog Handler

06877.description: Do you Drive? We need you! Can you answer a phone? We need you! Help a senior or a resident with a mobility disability get out and about. We need volunteers to answer questions about the ride programs available to our residents and we need drivers to provide rides when no other servcice is available. We need volunters to write press realeases, news articles and help publish our newsletter. We also need board committee members for marketing, outreach & development. No resident should feel they are confined to their residence because they cannot drive. If you have a few minutes in your schedule to help out we'd love to hear from you.
06877.title: Help senior and mobility disabled residents get a ride!

06877.description: \"Oh Say Can You See...\" If you answered yes I can, then you can help. This individual who is legally blind needs an assistant for shopping, driving, reading and sorting mail. One hour per week is enough to ease the burden for this individual who is trying to maintain their independence and run a household. Please call today!
06877.title: Help the Blind Remain Independent
06877.org: Department of Rehabilitation Services; Services for the Blind

10314.description: Please help support our program for adults with Developmental Disabilties. Office Work Volunteers Needed: Filing, Shredding, Faxing, Filing, Copying, Scanning, Data Entry, Organizing, Etc.
10314.title: Office Help Wanted-Staten Island Area

07094.description: Sort and pack Medical Supplies during three hour sessions held Wednesdays 1PM-4PM and Saturdays, 9 a.m. to Noon. Our volunteers work to organize, sort and package surplus medical supplies to be sent to hospitals and clinics that serve the poor throughout the world. Without the efforts of our MedShare volunteers, many of these usable supplies would be discarded because of production overages, procedural excess and regulatory requirements. As a volunteer, you can truly make a difference by helping us keep these supplies out of landfills and putting them in the hands of those caring for the poor. Contact: Jason Montagna jmontagna@medhsare.org
07094.title: Sort medical supplies! Help the environment and save lives!

07094.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. Thank you for your time!
07094.title: Secaucus NJ: Autism Volunteer

07093.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 2-4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
07093.title: Guttenberg, NJ: Autism Volunteer

07093.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
07093.title: West New York>>>Advice Counselor

07092.description: Volunteers will provide assistance and supervision for individuals with disabilities (ages 6-21) during social and recreational activities. Activities may include but are not limited to games, crafts, sports, music, gardening, and more. Volunteers will assist staff with activity/program set-up and clean-up. Help to facilitate social interaction with peers and provide a good model for appropriate social behaviors.
07092.title: Club Rec

07092.description: Volunteers will provide assistance and supervision for individuals with disabilities (ages 13-21) during social and recreational activities. Activities may include but are not limited to games, crafts, sports, music, and special events. Volunteers will assist staff with activity/program set-up and clean-up. Help to facilitate social interaction with peers and provide a good model for appropriate social behaviors.
07092.title: Teen Night

07092.description: Provide supervision of assigned child (ages 8-16) during class to ensure safety; keep participants focused on task through cueing; provide physical assistance to participants as needed (i.e. Hand over hand assistance); assist in setting up & cleaning up after each class; assist instructors as requested.
07092.title: Expressive Arts Program Volunteer

07092.description: Provide one to one supervision of assigned child ( ages 4-13) during class to ensure safety; keep participants focused on task through cueing; provide physical assistance to participants as needed; assist in setting up & cleaning up after each class; assist instructors as requested.
07092.title: Martial Arts Program Volunteer

07092.description: Primary role is to provide socialization opportunities as well as assist patient with set-up and execution of day’s homework. If no homework to be done then volunteer can read to, play video games and interact with patient in individual room or playroom. Volunteer is to do activities that patient suggest as long as they are appropriate.
07092.title: Patient Pal

07092.description: To provide staff assistance with assorted clerical tasks including but not limited to the answering of phones, xeroxing, filing, addressing envelopes and any other clerical related duties as needed.
07092.title: Office/Clerical Assistance

07092.description: To provide Departments with assorted administrative tasks including but not limited to copying, scanning, filing, labeling and stuffing envelopes, light data entry, answering telephone, special event general support, research and database clean-up and any other clerical related duties as needed.
07092.title: Office/Clerical Assistance

07092.description: Volunteers will assist Patient Access Services staff by escorting patients, families and visitors to their destination within our Mountainside facility. Volunteers will also interact with the patients, family members and visitors who are waiting in our Lobby area and engage in conversation, address customer needs and provide children with appropriate toys from activity cart and ensure their return to the cart when waiting time is complete.
07092.title: Lobby Escort

07092.description: To offer 1:1 assistance to boys and girls ages 3-10 years old who are participating in an adapted swim program. Having 1:1 volunteers with children promotes safety for children, encourages participants to feel comfortable in the water, and gives individual attention and encouragement to help each child do his or her best. You do not need any special training or certification. You must be 15 years old to volunteer.
07092.title: Swim Volunteers Needed

07090.description: Are you looking for a flexible, rewarding volunteer opportunity ? Have you ever been told you are a good listener ? Do you have a yearning to really make a difference? Become a Caring and Crisis Hotline Listener. You could save a life. Volunteers receive 52 hours of comprehensive training in active listening, Mental Health First Aid and Applied Suicide Intervention Skills Training. You also are supported by seasoned listeners during 24 hours of internship before you answer calls on your own. Even once you are a certified listener, we provide a range of support and training opportunities so you can continue to develop your skills. Join our listening community . Our next volunteer training will be held: March 20, 2017 - June 12, 2017 7 pm - 10 pm One evening weekly Plus one full weekend First Baptist Church 170 Elm Street, Westfield NJ 07090 Register Now ! Registration is limited. To learn more and apply, please log onto http://caringcontact.org/volunteer-listener-application/ or call 908.301.1899
07090.title: Become a Caring and Crisis Hotline Listener
07090.org: Caring Contact

07090.description: We are looking for an accountant to prepare financials, do budgets, etc. This would be with the potential growth of becoming a board member.

07090.description: There is an ongoing need for Confidential Sexual Violence Advocates (CSVAs) to respond to the Center's 24-hour hotline, which may involve crisis intervention, providing emotional support, offering referrals, and/or providing in-person medical/legal accompaniment to victims of sexual violence. The Union County Rape Crisis Center offers a free, state-mandated training in order to equip volunteers with the knowledge and skills to assist victims of sexual violence. No prior experience/training is necessary. Basic Requirements: Resident of Union County, NJ 18 years of age or older Valid U.S. driver's license Personal (own) means of transportation (i.e. a car) Informal interview (during business hours of 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.) Attendance at all CSVA training sessions Spring 2017 training dates, each class runs from 6:00 p.m. until 9:30 p.m.: Tuesday, April 4th Thursday, April 6th Tuesday, April 11th Thursday, April 13th Tuesday, April 18th Thursday, April 20th Tuesday, April 25th Thursday, April 27th Tuesday, May 2nd Thursday, May 4th Tuesday, May 9th Thursday, May 11th Tuesday, May 16th Thursday, May 18th Tuesday, May 23rd Thursday, May 25th For additional information, please visit us online at: http://www.unioncountyrapecrisiscenter.blogspot.com/.
07090.title: Confidential Sexual Violence Advocates - Spring 2017 Training
07090.org: Union County Rape Crisis Center

10474.description: Rocking the Boat is look for an individual to assist two visually impaired teenagers in our Boatbuilding program on Tuesday and Thursday afternoons. No previous boatbuilding experience needed!
10474.title: Build a Boat with a Visually Disabled Teenager

10474.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
10474.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (Hyde Leadership Charter, Bronx)

10474.description: Join New York Common Pantry's program Nourish in it's fight to end hunger in the senior community! Nourish is funded by New York State Department of Health for the Commodity Supplemental Food Program (CSFP). We have volunteer opportunities available Monday-Friday from 3:00PM-5:00PM unloading our vans after deliveries, light sweeping, putting commodities back into inventory and assisting in counting returned items. We are flexible on the days you can volunteer and will provide instruction and support throughout the volunteer process.
10474.title: Nourish Program Volunteer - Unloading Vans/Cleanup

10474.description: Join New York Common Pantry's program Nourish in it's fight to end hunger in the senior community! Nourish is funded by New York State Department of Health for the Commodity Supplemental Food Program (CSFP). We have volunteer opportunities available Monday-Friday from 8:00AM-12:00PM. Volunteers will help to provide free supplemental grocery packages for low-income seniors by packing food pallets at our warehouse for distribution at our mobilte sites.
10474.title: Nourish Program - Packing Site Orders (Building Pallets of Commodities)

11735.description: Trained AARP Foundation volunteers lead informative small-group one hour grocery store tours teaching the ins and outs of the aisles. Volunteers teach participants how to buy fruits, vegetables and whole grains on a Budget, Compare Unit Prices to Find Bargains, Read and Compare Food Labels. We are also looking for store captains and outreach volunteers. If you think this may be something you are interested in you can register and join us on a free tour by calling 1-855-850-2525.
11735.title: Grocery Guides Tour Leader

11735.description: Good Shepherd Hospice, a program of Catholic Health Services of Long Island, is looking for compassionate, kind, and devoted volunteers to make a difference in the lives of our patients and their families. Volunteers serve in many roles, both with patients and in our administrative offices. Hospice refers to the specific type of care that a patient receives as they near the end of their life. Many of our patients are alert, active, and interested in socializing with volunteers, while other families request volunteers to be present with patients so that they can address their own needs outside of the home. Most volunteers give 2-4 hours of time a week. We work diligently to tailor each role to suit the time and talents of each individual volunteer. If you are interested in becoming a volunteer or would like more information please call 631-828-7611 or email pamela.brenner@chsli.org
11735.title: Become a Hospice Volunteer

11735.description: Good Shepherd serves 400+ families every day. Volunteers are needed in our main office to provide administrative support, responsibilities may include: Answering phones Creating packets Coordinating mailings Scanning records Other duties based on interest and skill This opportunity is great for individuals wanting to gain experience in healthcare administration. We are open from 830am to 430pm. Before volunteering, individuals must pass a background check, complete a physical and attend a brief orientation. The background check and orientation will provided at no cost to the volunteer. Please Contact: Pamela Brenner 631-828-7648 or pamela.brenner@chsli.org
11735.title: Administrative Volunteers for Healthcare Company

11735.description: Rebuilding Together Long Island is seeking volunteers to help their neighbors in Nassau and Suffolk. We are an all volunteer group dedicated to assisting low-income individuals and families with home repairs and wheelchair ramps. Our clients include the elderly, the disabled, veterans and families with children. Oftentimes, we are the last hope for help. Each time we receive a call for assistance, a home visit is arranged by one of our volunteers to meet the client, determine what is most important to the homeowner and gather the paperwork. Following the visit, the volunteer prepares a brief outline and submits the paperwork to our Board for approval. As the demand for help increases, so does the demand for more home visitors. Think about joining us. You’ll get to meet some wonderful people and truly feel like you are helping others. Scheduling is completing flexible and visits can be made at your convenience. Training is provided. No experience necessary. Bring a friend!
11735.title: Home Visitors Needed

11735.description: Handy with tools? Looking to give back to your community? Join Rebuilding Together Long Island’s all-year-round home repair program for a wonderful opportunity to help low income seniors, veterans, disabled, and families with children. Help us provide a safe, healthy, warm and accessible home at no cost to qualified homeowners. The high cost of living in Nassau and Suffolk leaves little room for home maintenance and repairs. Many of our clients survive on limited fixed incomes and fear they will lose their independence and be forced to leave their homes. Some of our disabled clients are prisoners in their own homes because they cannot afford a wheelchair ramp that would provide access in and out of the home and to critical health care needs. Our volunteers work diligently to alleviate those problems. You can help with weatherization, spackling and installing sheetrock, minor plumbing and electrical work, painting and installing wheelchair ramps. It is difficult to keep up with the high demand for help and we urgently need your help!
11735.title: Skilled Volunteers needed for home repairs

07801.description: Reports to: Young Athletes program Coach Time Commitment & Training: This individual must be able to commit to the full duration of the event as scheduled. If unable to commit, please do not select this position. General Description Assist the Program Director in maintaining the flow and integrity of Young Athlete Program. Orientation will be provided on-site day of the event. Duties & Responsibilities Possible positions include: Serve as a Young Athlete escort through the various sport/motor stations Check in athletes and/or volunteers Work specifically with a sport/motor station as directed by Program Director Skills & Qualifications Excellent verbal communication is a must, as well as ensuring professional and friendly service, including the ability to multitask and respond quickly to changes in schedules and plans. Physical Requirements The usual and customary methods of performing the job's functions require the following physical demands: occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling. Generally the job requires 70% walking, 25% standing, and 5% sitting. Must be able to stand and walk the majority of the volunteer shift. Questions regarding this position should be directed to: Amy Simmons | Volunteer Director | volunteer@sonj.org
07801.title: Special Olympics New Jersey - Young Athlete Program Morris County

07801.description: Are you a good listener? Do you enjoy meeting people? Are you able to provide a comforting touch? Do you enjoy making an immediate difference in someone's life? If you answered \"Yes\" to any of these questions, then this volunteer opportunity is for you! We are a hospice program that provides services throughout Warren County. ***Free Training is provided*** How Can Volunteers Help? Trained volunteers provide many different services: - Relief for the Family - so they can run errands, companionship when family cannot be there, and Respite Care - Primary Caregiver - by sitting with the patient, making phone calls, support for the patient and family -Emotional Support - active listening to the patient and family, holding the patient's hand when he/she is scared, by just being there when they need to talk - Patient and Family Assistance - running errands, helping with light housework, preparing a light meal Volunteers can also come into the office and do office work: - Admission Packets - they put together the admission packets, make copies for the packets - Filing - do some light filing of patient's paperwork for their files
07801.title: Make an Immediate Difference in Someone's Life!---Morris County

11730.description: Sign up to volunteer in opportunities in faith-based organizations in your area. ChristianVolunteering.org connects high-quality Christian volunteers with Christian social service organizations, urban ministries, camps, schools and churches. Some of our volunteer opportunities include: Going on a short term mission trip Helping a local food pantry Deliver toys to children Supporting other local non-profits You can view the full descriptions and volunteer now by visiting www.ChristianVolunteering.org/zip/11730.jsp You can create a free volunteer profile and volunteer in your community.
11730.title: ** Find family and group friendly Christian Volunteering Opportunities in Islip **

10471.description: If you are patient, understanding, friendly, caring, and available just one morning per week, you can make a real difference in the lives of those we serve. Our wonderful volunteers provide personalized weekday calls to homebound elderly, providing social contact from someone who also listens for signals indicating a homebound participant requires additional support. In many cases, this weekly phone call is the only outside contact these people have all week. We provide all training and great support. Your fellow volunteers on the team are a really friendly, fun group. You'll have a great time interacting with them as you do this important work. Also, as a thank you, we take our volunteers out for special outings, whether a trip to the New York Botanical Gardens for a private tour and lunch, a holiday luncheon, or other activities.
10471.title: Senior Telephone Reassurance Program

10471.description: The Riverdale Neighborhood House is seeking a Marketing and Promotion Assistant to get involved in all marketing aspects of our Health & Harmony Programs. Launched in October 2015, the Health & Harmony Programs, which this year was the subject of a front page article in the local newspaper, is an array of classes and workshops geared to nourishing people's spiritual self to bring inner peace, and fortifying and improving mind and body to enable a longer, healthier, more fulfilling life. Meditation, yoga, fitness, coping with grief, and nutrition constitute only a partial list of our offering areas. The ideal candidate will have experience in marketing/promotion, social media, have an entrepreneurial and creative spirit, and want a hands-on role. This is a great opportunity to have an exciting, well-rounded experience as we take the Health & Harmony Programs to the next level. The Marketing and Promotion Assistant will have the opportunity to strategize, and then apply their marketing and promotion knowledge and experience, real time. Here is the link to our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/HealthHarmonyNH/
10471.title: Marketing and Promotion Assistant

10471.description: GallopNYC uses therapeutic horsemanship to help riders walk, talk, connect, focus, behave and learn, inspiring each one to live life as fully, productively and independently as possible. Volunteers are needed to assist our riders on horse back. Volunteers lead horses or walk alongside them during lessons. Classes are conducted by a trained instructor. We have a great team of volunteers and we really love what we do. One of our riders said \"When I ride my horse I feel free.\" We love making that free feeling possible -- plus we see very concrete achievements in our riders' abilities. Our riders have a wide range of disabilities, but all of them enjoy riding and are a joy to to work with. The horses are nice too! We conduct lessons seven days a week at four different locations and could use your help! Email us today and we will provide you with the dates of upcoming orientation sessions for new volunteers.. Experience with horses is helpful but not at all necessary. Please contact us for more info on how to become a volunteer at: volunteer@gallopnyc.org Or visit our website at: http://gallopnyc.org/how-to-help/volunteer/
10471.title: Volunteer With a Therapeutic Horsemanship Program in the Bronx (Van Cortlandt Park)

10004.description: Be part of the movement of college students helping high school students get into and graduate from college! As a College Access Coach, you will coach and mentor a small group of high school students by providing FREE SAT preparation and college admissions counseling to students who do not have access to college preparation support. The commitment includes: One evening per week from early February through early May (times vary from between 5:30-8:30pm) Locations range from Manhattan (Harlem, Chelsea, etc.) to Queens Training session prior to start of program to prepare you to teach SAT material You'll gain: Excellent hands-on education field and non-profit experience Training and professional development that will make your resume stand out Opportunity to impact students on a personal and systemic level! Questions? Contact ominick@letsgetready.org to learn more and apply!
10004.title: Calling all college students who are passionate about education & mentorship!

10004.description: Fraunces Tavern Museum is always looking to invite talented individuals to assist with our educational programming. Our well trained volunteer School Program Educators ensure the continual success of our educational mission. If you have a passion for history and hope to share that interest with others, you would be a great addition to ur team of educators! Requirements Available to volunteer for at least 1 weekly School Program (approx. 90 minutes long). Comfortable administering inquiry-based learning and hands-on activities with students K-12. Interest in New York City history as it relates to Colonial America, the Revolutionary War, and the Early Republic. Responsibilities: Conduct exhibit-based school programs for K-12 students in the Museum’s galleries and period rooms. Use various educational strategies to lead school programs and engage students with the Museum’s collection. Set-up & break-down of school program’s supplies and spaces. Expectations: Able to work with a team; is enthusiastic, dependable and flexible. Enjoys interacting with the public and communicates effectively with individuals, families, and school groups. Willing to learn new information through hands-on experience and materials provided by the Education & Public Programs Coordinator. Capable of 2-4 hours of physical activity. Benefits: This is a great opportunity for those interested in enhancing their public speaking skills and gaining experience in working with various populations in an educational setting. Benefits include free admission to the museum and its lectures, exhibit openings, eligibility for a free $22 (cash value) monthly MetroCard, and an annual volunteer luncheon. We need volunteers to ensure the success of our educational programming, so you would truly be making a difference. Former teaching or public speaking experience is a plus. Training involves receiving an Educator manual, shadowing tours, and subsequent Educator meetings. If interested please submit a resume and cover letter to: Jacqueline Masseo Education & Public Program Coordinator Email: 2education@frauncestavernmuseum.org
10004.title: School Program Educator

10004.description: A core rescuer is committed to one or more food rescue events every week. You will deliver food from restaurants to homeless shelters nearby and will lead other volunteers through these events. The restaurants and shelters are always within walking distance and there are hundreds of events all over Manhattan. This easy yet rewarding experience allows you to directly see the difference you make to the community!
10004.title: Core Rescuer at Rescuing Leftover Cuisine

10004.description: Under Mentorship Lead, the mentor will play a crucial role in supporting the positive growth of the girls. Key Responsibilities Take a lead in supporting a girl’s interest in tech through ongoing relationship building. Serves as a role model and friend. Build relationships with your mentee by planning, participating in and supporting monthly meetings. Help set goals and work towards accomplishing them. Build youth self-efficacy, motivation, and sense of belonging. Requirements Educational or Occupational experience in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) Be at least 18 years old Background verification; $50 out of pocket expense from each Mentor. Attend mentor training Willing to adhere to all program policies and procedures Willing to complete application and screening process Listening and motivational skills Be dependable and consistent in meeting time commitments Expected Commitments Face-to-face monthly meetings with the mentee for 6 months. 3-4 hours/week, documentation of activities and program progress communication with mentorship lead, availability to attend chapter sponsored mentee events and optional group events. Please send in your resume at akanksha.kochhar@chicktech.org
10004.title: Volunteer Mentor - ChickTech NYC

10004.description: The New York Asian Women’s Center (NYAWC) is the largest Asian American focused domestic violence agency in the country, a premier human trafficking service organization, and a national demonstration project that provides model services to survivors of sexual assault. We are looking for a volunteer to provide interpretation between Burmese and English to facilitate communication with survivors of domestic violence, human trafficking, and sexual violence.
10004.title: Burmese Interpreter

10004.description: The New York Asian Women's Center (NYAWC) provides culture and language responsive services to Asian survivors of domestic and sexual violence, human trafficking, and elder abuse. Purpose/Overview: The Development Volunteer supports the Development Department through donation processing, document preparation, as well as administrative and fundraising assistance. Depending on the volunteer's time availability, skill set, and interests, other projects may be offered, such as assistance with grant and newsletter writing, events, and prospect research. Benefits: Volunteer will gain insight into the various facets of Development, including donor stewardship, fundraising, and grant solicitation. There may also be opportunities to network, social opportunities, and discounts to events as available to all NYAWC volunteers. Schedule: 1-2 days a week, with a total of at least 8 hours per week. Schedule to be agreed upon at start of volunteer position. Position will begin with a two-week trial period before signing volunteer agreement. Core Competencies & Qualifications: Volunteer must have basic knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel; prior experience and/or comfort with database management is preferred. She/he/they should enjoy working independently, taking initiative, and have a willingness to learn. Training Requirements: Volunteer will be required to attend a NYAWC volunteer orientation run by the Manager of Volunteer Engagement. Orientation may be completed after the start of the volunteer position. Support/Continuing Education Plan: The Development Associate will provide day-to-day on-site training as needed, with opportunities to receive further training, also as needed and desired.
10004.title: Development (External Communications and Fundraising) Volunteer

10004.description: ABOUT US: iMentor is fighting to rebalance the odds by giving every student a fair chance to graduate college and pursue their dreams. iMentor partners with high schools in low-income communities, where a majority of students served will be the first in their families to attend college. We match every student with a mentor, and equip our mentors with the resources to support their mentees on the path to college graduation. ABOUT YOU: Our mentors are college-educated volunteers who commit to working one-on-one with a student for a minimum of three years. Mentors will connect online with their student once a week and meet in-person once a month, using the iMentor curriculum to guide them. * If you are a female that is applying to become a mentor, it is possible you may not be matched with a student until next season. Apply as soon as possible to expedite your process! Also, w e are still in need of about 100 MALE mentors for our male students this year. If you know of any men that would make a great mentor, pass this along to them!* HOW TO APPLY: Please fill out & submit our Online Mentor Application at imentor.org
10004.title: MALE MENTORS NEEDED

10004.description: Requirement: 5-10 hours/week (more if requested) Seeking an administrative volunteer primarily for front desk-related work. Light crisis hotline work will also be involved. Position ideal for college students seeking to explore social justice and nonprofit work in a gender-based violence prevention and intervention organization. Volunteer responsibilities will include: Answering the main line/crisis line if a staff member is unavailable Administrative tasks such as filing, copying, and assisting with overall office tasks Greeting clients and vendors Other responsibilities as assigned To qualify for this position, you must have an interest in social justice, specific to sexual violence prevention and intervention. You must also be personable and sensitive to client issues and to the work that is being done. An elevated level of maturity is needed to handle the subject matter. An in-person interview will be required and, if selected, an in-person training that will cover the basics of crisis intervention and answering the crisis line. You will also need to sign a non-disclosure agreement in order to guarantee confidentiality for our clients. We are seeking a minimum commitment of at least one semester with the option to extend. To apply, send your resume and a brief statement as to why you are interested directly to Bryan Aston, intervention coordinator, at baston@svfreenyc.org.
10004.title: Seeking Administrative Volunteer Looking for Experience in Social Justice Work!
10004.org: NEW YORK CITY ALLIANCE AGAINST SEXUAL ASSAULT

10004.description: Rescuing Leftover Cuisine is a food rescue nonprofit organization that is dedicated to eliminating both food waste and hunger! We are looking for a Core Rescuer, a member of our leadership team of volunteers, to help with ten food rescue events per week, for a time commitment of 8-10 hours per week. You will pick up leftover food from restaurants, delis, kitchens, and offices, and deliver it to local homeless shelters and soup kitchens. This position will come with a stipend at the end of the commitment OR an unlimited monthly MetroCard for each month. The Core Rescuer position is a four month commitment.
10004.title: Fight Food Waste & Feed the Hungry - 10 hours per week (Stipend or Monthly MetroCard Included!)

10004.description: The New York Legal Assistance Group (NYLAG) provides free civil legal services to low-income New Yorkers. NYLAG has launched the Language Access Volunteer program to enhance its ability to provide high-quality, free civil legal services to poor and near-poor New Yorkers in one of the most diverse metropolitans in the world. Volunteers skilled in translation and interpretation will work closely with NYLAG attorneys to interpret during client interviews, meetings, and court proceedings, and to translate legal documents. Language Access Volunteers will significantly increase NYLAG’s capacity to work with low-income clients of diverse backgrounds. The Language Access Volunteers (LAVs) will provide \"on-call\" availability time(s) and contact information, which NYLAG attorneys, paralegals and staff will use to contact volunteers directly when they require language assistance. All translation/interpretation work will occur on weekdays during normal business hours. Currently there are immediate and ongoing opportunities available for Language Access Volunteers (LAVs) with a fluency in written translation for languages listed below. This is an excellent opportunity for bi-lingual/multi-lingual volunteers interested in law to learn about civil legal proceedings, and receive hands-on experience working with clients and in collaboration with experienced attorneys and legal staff. Immediate Languages Needed: Croatian German Greek Gujarati Haitian-Creole Hebrew Indonesian Mandinka Pashto Polish Romanian Shanghainese Szechuan Thai Turkish *These languages require a fluency in written translation in addition to oral interpretation.* Additional Languages: Arabic ASL Bengali Bosnian Bulgarian Cantonese Chiew Chow French Hindi Japanese Italian Korean Chinese Mandarin Chinese Cantonese Chinese Fuzhou Portuguese Punjabi Russian Serbian Spanish Taiwanese Tibetan Urdu Vietnamese Yiddish *You are welcome to apply if the language you speak is not on this list. Requirements: We are seeking volunteers who are native speakers, have bi-lingual proficiency, or professional verbal proficiency of one of the designated languages. Applicants should have some college education, and/or experience with interpretation. Volunteers should be comfortable working in a professional environment. Written translation, not required but very helpful. Applicants will be interviewed by speakers of your designated language to assess fluency and general qualifications. Once accepted into the program, volunteers will be trained in language access and cultural competency. How to apply: Please email your resume and a brief introduction to LAV@nylag.org. Please include \"Language Access Volunteer\" in the subject line of your email.
10004.title: Language Access Volunteer

10004.description: Rescuing Leftover Cuisine is a nonprofit food rescue organization dedicated to eliminating both food waste and hunger. We are currently looking for Core Rescuers to join our leadership team of volunteers! A Core Rescuer is a passionate volunteer who commits to leading 10 food rescue events/10 hours every week, the same events every week. You will be picking up food from our partner restaurants and companies, and dropping it off at local homeless shelters and soup kitchens to feed those in need. We will provide a stipend and an unlimited monthly MetroCard! This is a four-month commitment.
10004.title: Fight Food Waste and Feed the Hungry! Core Rescuer Needed - Stipend and Monthly MetroCard Included!

10004.description: Library Pilot Program: Launched by DHS on March 30, 2015, the Library Pilot Program aims to increase the English literacy rates of NYC family shelter residents. The program institutes libraries within shelters, making reading materials readily available for school-age children and their parents. DHS links shelters to resources like books, electronics, and educational programming from the public library, literacy partners, and private donors. The program partners with 27 shelters and will expand to 30 by December 2016. Library Specialist Volunteer Role: The Library Specialist will report to the Shelter Director and DHS AmeriCorps Member and will work closely with other shelter staff to ensure the library program is effective and supports clients with their literacy and educational/vocational needs. TASKS INCLUDE: -Act as a liaison between supervisors, clients and other organizations such as the public library to ensure clients access free services available in the community -Organize the library and book lending activities -Support with data collection to ensure program meets its goals -Assist with field trips and other activities as needed -Attend training and meetings -Mentor youth and link them to resources in the community REQUIREMENTS: -Must have a High School Diploma/GED -Must pass a fingerprinting and background check process TIME: one to two days per weeks (2 to 4 hours a day) NYC DHS Mission Statement: With our partners, our goal is to prevent homelessness when possible; to provide temporary, emergency shelter when needed; and to help individuals and families transition rapidly into permanent housing. We do this through providing coordinated, compassionate, high-quality services and supports.
10004.title: Library Specialist with the NYC Department of Homeless Services
10004.org: New York City Department of Homeless Services

10005.description: Girl Vow, Inc is seeking volunteer women mentors who can conduct various gender-focused workshops or who are interested in mentoring a girl for an academic year. You must live in the NYC area. Please send an updated resume to the email address girlvow@gmail.com.
10005.title: Mentor Girls in the Foster Care & Juvenile Justice Systems

10005.description: Organization Overview: CMMB is an international NGO providing long-term, co-operative medical and development aid to communities affected by poverty and unequal access to healthcare. For over a century, CMMB has worked to strengthen and support communities through healthcare programs and initiatives, the distribution of medicines and medical supplies, and the placement of volunteers. CMMB’s Volunteer Program addresses the critical need for professionals in areas that lack sufficient resources for quality preventive and curative health services, especially for women and children. Our Volunteer Program has placed thousands of practitioners around the world to help develop and implement community health interventions, work at local hospitals and health facilities, conduct clinical training for host country counterparts, and deliver essential medicines and supplies. The ultimate goal of CMMB's Volunteer Program is to support our country teams and local healthcare workers by sending volunteers that are dedicated to strengthening local health systems and supporting a pattern of sustainable development. We believe in a world in which health and human dignity are shared by all. We believe that access to quality healthcare is a basic human right. For more than 100 years, we have worked with global partners to deliver locally sustainable, quality healthcare solutions to women, children, and their communities. We’re ready to make it 100 more. We believe change starts with her. We work tirelessly for women’s and children’s health because they are disproportionately affected by illness and poverty. We know that healthy, educated, and empowered women are better able to raise healthy, educated, and confident children, and that communities depend on their livelihoods. We believe in people. We strive to live out our core values of collaboration, love, excellence, and respect every day. We provide our volunteers with a meaningful volunteer package, and the opportunities to learn, grow, and leave a longstanding legacy. We especially encourage all persons of diverse backgrounds to apply. In 2015, CMMB: Volunteers dedicated 101,353 hours valued at almost $4.9 million Assisted 43,969 pregnant women Provided health services to 447,566 people Trained 4,734 health workers (1,400 were trained by volunteers) Provided critical health services to 91,013 children Delivered medicines & medical supplies valued at $266 million About the Position The Human Resources department is responsible for building and leading the people functions of CMMB, including that of employees, volunteers, and interns, as well as strategies, policies, practices and systems that result in a high performing, engaged, and resilient workforce and culture that retains close alignment to CMMB’s global strategy. The volunteer will work as an HR generalist or coordinator to help our HR director with the day to day/operational work (e.g. setting interviews, entering staff in the system). General Requirements: - Someone ideally with at least 3+ years HR generalist (first preference) or HR coordinator (secondary preference) experience and has graduated from an HR degree. - If no experience, candidates who have or are studying HR at a University would also be valuable - Proficient at excel, powerpoint and word - as well as being a fast learner. - Does not mind paperwork, mundane tasks. Apply online at www.cmmb.org/volunteer Email: volunteer@cmmb.org Phone: 212-242-7757 For more information about CMMB, visit www.cmmb.org
10005.title: Human Resources Internship at CMMB

10005.description: Positions: Global Health Volunteers and Interns (various positions available) Location: 100 Wall Street, 9 th Floor, New York City, NY 10005 USA Term: 3 - 12 Months Conditions: - Unpaid - College/university credit available - Part-time, Flexible schedules - Office hours: Monday - Friday 9am - 5pm EST Contact & Application: Apply online at www.cmmb.org/volunteer Email: volunteer@cmmb.org Phone: 212-242-7757 Program Description CMMB is an international NGO providing long-term, co-operative medical and development aid to communities affected by poverty and unequal access to healthcare. For over a century, CMMB has worked to strengthen and support communities through healthcare programs and initiatives, the distribution of medicines and medical supplies, and the placement of volunteers. CMMB’s Volunteer Program facilitates year-round opportunities for students and professionals to serve in our New York City office where they contribute to vital operational and programmatic projects in support of our global health initiatives. We have worked with thousands of interns and volunteers who help to develop and implement community health interventions, conduct research, develop communications content and build our donor base, and provide critical administrative support to the diverse teams in our offices. The ultimate goal of CMMB's Volunteer Program is to support our New York departments, country teams and local partners by finding meaningful placements for interns and volunteers who are committed to supporting a pattern of sustainable development. In addition, our International Volunteer Program addresses the critical need for professionals in South Sudan, Zambia, Kenya, Peru, and Haiti in areas that lack sufficient resources for quality preventive and curative health services, especially for women and children. A message from Bruce Wilkinson, President and CEO of CMMB: As President of CMMB, I would like to thank you for your interest in volunteering with us and joining our journey to bring healthier lives to women, children, and their families worldwide. CMMB has embarked on our second century of service to the most marginalized. Our vision of a world in which every human life is valued, and health and human dignity are shared by all is at the core of who we are. We are always looking to join hands with students and professionals who want to volunteer their time and energy to our work, and are so pleased you are considering CMMB for your next volunteer experience. Volunteer positions are critical to our mission and vision. I welcome your interest in joining the diverse, talented, and motivated CMMB volunteer movement. Cheers, Bruce We invite you to join our movement for Healthier Lives Worldwide! Variety of Opportunities for individuals from a number of majors and fields such as: - Public Health - International Development, International Relations, Global Affairs, Humanitarian Studies - Social Work, Sociology - Health Administration, Supply Chain Management - Pre-med, Nursing, Nutrition, and Health Sciences (non-clinical administrative work only in NYC) - Marketing, Communications, Public Relations - Finance, Business, Accounting - Human Resources - Computer Science, Information Science, Mathematics, Statistics - Spanish, French, Haitian Creole (Interpretation/Translation) Examples of Internship Positions include: Marketing and Communications Assistant(s): social media, website, blogging, storytelling, writing and producing content, newsletters, mailings, outreach, events Designer(s), Photographer(s), Videographer(s): generally project based work, events, editing Data and Reporting Assistant(s) and Analyst(s): data entry, analysis and processing, report generation and systems streamlining, transition to new technology, some IT related projects also available Administrative Assistant(s): supporting multiple departments and teams including the Office of the CEO, office operations, programmatic support, liaising with diverse stakeholders (internal and external) Researcher(s): generally project specific, programmatic based research focused in women’s and children’s health and development, producing reports, white papers Programs and Special Projects Assistant(s): monitoring and evaluation, administrative support, writing and editing, liaising with country offices Resource Mobilization Assistant(s): donor reporting, proposal writing, individual donor communication, partnerships support Healing Help Assistant(s): support needed for both Manhattan Office and Distribution Center in Long Island City, generally administrative roles, some research support as needed Volunteer Program Assistant(s): outreach, recruitment, volunteer engagement and communications, administrative support, content production, travel planning, pre-departure orientation and preparations Interpreter/Translator(s) Spanish and Haitian Creole: Translate written documents, materials, guides and communications. Support needed for programs, human resources and strategy and innovation teams. General Requirements and Qualifications: Specific requirements vary based on position. - Relevant degree or coursework - Familiarity and interest in global health issues, especially maternal and child health - Commitment to CMMB’s mission, vision and values - Ability to work collaboratively and professionally while navigating cultural and language barriers - Ability to be flexible and prioritize projects and tasks effectively; self-starter; takes initiative - Problem solver, able to identify needs, and develop solutions - Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills - Adaptable and flexible - Proficiency in English; strong communication skills - Spanish, French or Creole Fluency required for interpretation/translation positions
10005.title: Global Health Volunteer Intern In New York City (Various Positions Available)

10005.description: Dare2B serves as a charitable agent to make it easy for you to do good in your community. Efforts focus on providing -unique experiences that make living in a shelter less traumatic for homelesschildren. -innovative solutions that equip and inspire homeless children, ages 5 - 17,to break the cycle of poverty. Currently, the Dare2B team is seeking part-time volunteers to help expand efforts throughout New York City. Volunteers will benefit from a ground floor opportunity with an early-stage non-profit joining a diverse and proven team of entrepreneurs in international business and program development. Reports to Executive Director Classification Part-time Volunteer This position requires the following with flexibility offered: -3-month commitment is highly appreciated -6 - 7 hours 2 days a week Available office hours Tuesday and Thursday from 10:30am - 4:30pm Job Description Under general direction and supervision, the Graphic Designer will assist in the development of program materials, branding of special events and graphics for the web to raise awareness on the organization. -Conceptualize, design, and create mock-ups from small enhancements to entirely new designs -Design beautiful, clear and engaging communication pieces. This will include logos, images, newsletters, website and social media graphics, flyers, print pieces and web experiences for our audience -Collaborate with leadership team to determine project scope and timeframe -Work closely with project team (specifically Fundraising Coordinator, Social Media Coordinator and Public Relations Coordinator) to translate their messaging concepts into marketing materials Qualifications/Requirements -Volunteer must bring own laptop to work on assigned tasks -Access to graphic design and layout software (Photoshop, Illustrator or any other software -Solid conceptualization, design and artistic ability -Strong communication and organizational skills -Have familiarity with mobile/responsive design principles -Creative and social-media savvy -Ability to work independently as part of a team -Strong understanding of real-world web needs -Ability to maintain confidentiality -Commitment to high standards, customer service, integrity, and ethics -Strong desire to want to improve our community and the quality of life for the homeless children we serve -BONUS - A bachelor’s degree in graphic arts/design or equivalent work experience Age requirement 18 and older Dress code Business Casual Support/Training & Supervision Two-day orientation and training Free monthly developmental workshops Benefits Build your portfolio of work -Help meet an important community need -Job reference letter from Executive Director -Flexible scheduling -Career skills you can develop or enhance while working with Dare2B: Leadership Time management Problem solving Adaptability Negotiation Communication Relationship management Evaluation Monthly evaluation to help both the organization and the individual volunteer identify strengths and weaknesses in their respective contributions.
10005.title: Volunteer Graphics Designer

10005.description: Dare2B serves as a charitable agent to make it easy for you to do good in your community. Efforts focus on providing * unique experiences that make living in a shelter less traumatic for homeless children * innovative solutions that equip and inspire homeless children, ages 5 - 17, to break the cycle of poverty Currently, the Dare2B team is seeking part-time volunteers to help expand efforts throughout New York City. Volunteers will benefit from a ground floor opportunity with an early-stage non-profit joining a diverse and proven team of entrepreneurs in international business and program development. Position Reports to Social Media Coordinator and Executive Director This position requires between 6 - 7 hours a week - Flexibility offered Available office hours - Tuesday and Thursday from 10:30am - 4:30pm 3 - month commitment highly appreciated Under general direction and supervision, the Content Coordinator is responsible for the organization's content (social media, PR, website and related projects): * Writes, edits, and proofreads new content * Create and maintain a blog for the website and create articles * Making sure that the content strategy is in line with the SEO rules. And all the SEO related keywords are properly used * Content writing for the monthly newsletter * Report to the senior management about tasks and targets Qualifications/Requirements * Volunteer must bring own laptop to work on assigned tasks * Internet, Microsoft office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) * 2+ years’ experience in managing content related keywords are properly used * Exceptional communication and writing skills * Should have creative thinking * An understanding of SEO and web content management systems * Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Technical Writing or a related field * Strong organizational skills * Ability to work independently as part of a team * Strong written and verbal communication skills * Ability to maintain confidentiality * Strong desire to want to improve our community and the quality of life for the homeless * Commitment to high standards, customer service, integrity, and ethics Support/Training & Supervision * Job specific training * Two-day orientation and training * Free monthly developmental workshops * Help meet an important community need * Job reference letter from Executive Director Career skills you can develop or enhance while working with the Dare2B team * Business Development * Time management * Relationship management Monthly evaluation to help both the organization and the individual volunteer identify strengths and weaknesses in their respective contributions

10005.description: Job Description Supervise 2-3 kids, so that their parents can focus on the fitness classes - This may include - overseeing homework, drawing, playing a group board game This is to allow their parents to focus on the fitness class that we run.
