10001.description: GMHC is a not-for-profit, data-driven, volunteer-supported, and community-based organization committed to national leadership in the fight against HIV/AIDS. We provide HIV prevention and coordinated care services to men, women and families living with or affected by HIV/AIDS in New York City. The Development Department plays an important role in maintaining the financial health of the organization by raising funds through special events and other efforts such as direct mail campaigns, cultivating relationships with donors, and applying for grants. GMHC's Individual Giving Intern will support a part of the Development Department that focuses on managing the charitable donations left to the organization through major gifts or through wills and estates. The position will provide the intern with a range of experiences from a variety of efforts implemented by a development department in a major non-profit organization. Essential Job Functions The following duties are mandatory requirements of the job: Assist in donor cultivation, including preparing acknowledgement letters and other mailings Assist with database entry and maintenance Complete prospect research using a variety of print and online tools to identify new donors and family foundations; present a report proposing new methods of outreach for moving forward Draft proposals for major donors Provide support during special events, such as managing social media, assisting with preparation/set-up, and day-of-event support Filing, organizing, and other administrative tasks Additional responsibilities may be added based upon the interests of the intern and the needs of the department Education and Certification Applicants must be enrolled in a degree program (at least half-time) as an undergraduate or graduate student. Special Skills and Knowledge In addition to the above-listed job responsibilities and educational requirements, the ideal candidate for this position possesses most or all of the following: Excellent writing and editing skills Computer literacy in MS Office suite and the ability to learn new software Experience with a donor database, especially Raiser’s Edge, a plus Ability to multitask, meet deadlines, and work well both independently and as part of a team Basic knowledge of and commitment to HIV/AIDS prevention and treatment A positive attitude Previous experience in a non-profit environment a plus Time Commitment 15 hours per week during regular business hours (Monday through Friday, 9am-6pm) 3-month minimum commitment Occasional evening and weekend hours may be requested to assist with special events Internship opportunities are open to qualified individuals affiliated with an accredited academic institution for academic credit only. Since we are a nonprofit environment, our internships are unpaid, but we will support academic institution requirements for students by completing all paperwork required by the intern’s school or program. A small travel stipend may be available. How to Apply Send a resume and cover letter outlining the applicant's interest (and background, if any, working in the field of HIV/AIDS prevention and treatment) to internships@gmhc.org.
10001.title: Individual Giving Intern

10001.description: GMHC is seeking volunteers who would like to provide general administrative support to a range of departments throughout our agency. Duties include: photocopying, data entry, filing, scheduling, reception work, assistance with mailings, etc. Reception experience as well as bilingual English/Spanish is a plus.
10001.title: Administrative Support Volunteer

10001.description: For corporations and community groups that would like to volunteer with their colleagues and peers for the day, we offer a number of group opportunities including meal service, assisting with community outreach, and special projects throughout the year. Meal Service We serve lunch Monday through Thursday and dinner on Friday evening, providing our clients with a warm, friendly atmosphere where they can receive nutritious meals and have an opportunity for social interaction. Volunteers are an essential part of our dining room, helping us serve meals to 350 clients each day. We can host up to 10 volunteers. Safe Sex Kit Workshop Groups can help contribute to our community outreach efforts by assembling Safe Sex Kits, which are handed out at various events to promote safe sex as a method of preventing the spread of HIV and other sexually-transmitted diseases. GMHC provides the group with an education on the necessity of each item in the kit and the importance of safe sex practices. The workshop can accommodate up to 15 volunteers. Workforce Development For our clients who are actively seeking employment, we provide them with valuable job search skills including resume and interview preparation. This is a great opportunity for groups with some experience in hiring and recruiting. Holiday Events GMHC has a number of special events during the Holiday Season, including a Thanksgiving Dinner, a Holiday Dinner, and a Gift Wrapping Party. These volunteer opportunities are a great way for your group to give back in the spirit of the season. We can host up to 10 volunteers. Other Special Events Special projects come up throughout the year, and we are often looking for large groups to come in and help. Whether we have a mailing to go out or a space that needs to be freshly painted, we need volunteers to get the job done! Or, if your organization has a unique idea of how you can use your talents, please let contact The Volunteer Center and let us know.
10001.title: Days of Service for Groups

10001.description: GMHC serves lunch Monday through Thursday and dinner on Friday evening, providing our HIV+ clients with a warm, friendly atmosphere where they can receive nutritious meals and have an opportunity for social interaction. Volunteers are an essential part of our dining room, helping us serve meals to 350 clients each day. Responsibilities include: serving food, assisting disabled clients, clearing trays, cleaning dishes, scrubbing pots, etc. We also have opportunities in food preparation. Available shifts: Monday through Thursday, 11:30am-3:30pm Friday, 4:30pm-8:30pm
10001.title: Meal Service

10001.description: The Time In Children's Arts Initiative transforms the lives and educations of underserved public elementary school children through an intellectually and aesthetically stimulating arts immersion integrating opera, art, museum visits, gallery hops, language and literature into the normal school day. Joyously engaging the arts to give at-risk children the tools and support that they need to flourish, thrive & hope, Time In ensures at risk-children a thoughtfully crafted, arts-enriched education in which each child’s talents and needs are recognized, and the support for greater creativity, intelligence, self-esteem and a brighter, better future is more than just a promise. Help Time In make a difference by putting your amazing web skills at the service of at-risk children! We’re looking for a skilled web developer to help us maintain our website. Ideally, we hope that you will: Using industry best practices, oversee the maintenance of Time In’s website. Ensure website is operational at all times; respond quickly to reported problems and bugs; review enhancement requests; implement upgrades. Update and document website functionality, installation and/or administrative procedures. Experience with WordPress is necessary. The ideal candidate has a passion for the arts and education. We look forward to welcoming you!
10001.title: Time In Web Maintenance
10001.org: The Time In Children's Arts Initiative

10001.description: The primary function of a Buddy is to provide emotional support to a GMHC client (from newly diagnosed to a long-term survivor). The volunteer works as a liaison to connect the client to services at GMHC or other social service agencies, as needed. The Buddy can assist with errands and socialization though various activities with the client. The volunteer will provide monthly reports, and maintain ongoing contact with the program coordinator. We ask for one year commitment and to visit with your client for 1-4 hours per week at a mutually agreed time.
10001.title: Buddy Volunteer

10001.description: Thank you for your interest in Maya's Hope! Our mission is to improve the lives of orphaned, special needs, and disenfranchised children on a global scale. We need your help! If you have neat, clear handwriting please send an email to info@mayashope.org Please include an example of your handwriting. Thanks again! Maya's Hope Volunteer Team
10001.title: Volunteer with neat handwriting

10001.description: Thank you for your interest in Maya's Hope! Our mission is to improve the lives of orphaned, special needs, and disenfranchised children on a global scale. We need your help! Right now we need for individuals with great handwriting that can do calligraphy for special invitations. If you have neat handwriting/can do calligraphy, please send an email to thomas@mayashope.org bonus points if you can attach an image of your handwriting. Thanks again! Maya's Hope Volunteer Team
10001.title: calligraphers

10001.description: Maya's Hope is a 501(c)3 organization that is dedicated to improving the lives of orphaned, special needs, and disenfranchised children on a global scale. We are looking for someone that is EXTRA organized to help us coordinate all the spectacular volunteers that help us with our mission! This is a part-time volunteer position that includes working onsite and virtually. Some of the duties will involve using microsoft excel, google sheets, and google calendar to organize and schedule the dates and times our numerous volunteers will be working. The coordinator will also follow up with volunteers on when they would like to come in, give them updates about new events and opportunities, and help new volunteers get started. If you are organized, energetic, and qualified, please send an email to thomas@mayashope explaining why you would excel as a volunteer coordinator. Bonus points if you attach a resume!
10001.title: Volunteer Recruiter / Coordinator Extraordinaire!

10001.description: Super FUNraisers! Maya’s Hope works to improve the quality of life of orphaned, impoverished, and special-needs children on a global scale. Whether providing funding for loving caregivers, vitamin-rich formula, or access to quality medical care, Maya’s Hope improves lives, one child at a time. We are looking for people to join our amazing fundraising team! Our FUNraisers help us organize our donor lists, help plan and attend Maya Hope events, and make phone calls, spread awareness, get more people involved in what we do. Let’s face it, we can’t help improve our children’s lives without fundraising. Funraisers will be expected to spend up to 5 hours a week helping us meet our fundraising goals. They will expected to be able to work independently, but should be able to meet with staff at least once a month at our office. A good Funraiser will be personable and friendly, hard-working, and passionate about helping impoverished, orphaned, and special needs children. Bonus points if you have contagious enthusiasm. If you are interested in becoming a Super Funraiser with Maya’s Hope, please contact Thomas@mayashope.org for more information.
10001.title: Super FUNraisers

10001.description: Time In seeks resourceful, mission-driven, forward thinking leaders, with a passion for the arts and equality to bring their expertise to our Board of Directors. Our Board’s work is dedicated to the belief that every child, regardless of socio-economic background, is entitled to a thoughtfully crafted, arts-enriched education in which each individual child’s talents and needs are recognized, and the support for greater creativity, intelligence, self-esteem and a brighter, better future is more than just a promise. Since its founding in 2006, The Time In Children’s Arts Initiative has transformed the lives and vistas of nearly 2000 of the city’s youngest and most disadvantaged public school children. An award-winning arts intervention for children from chronically impoverished communities, Time In joyfully engages opera, hands-on art, museum visits, gallery hops, intensive language and literary texts every week - as part of the normal school day, yet outside of school - for underserved elementary school children from Harlem and the South Bronx. Collaborating uniquely with under-resourced Title 1 schools, Time In ensures unprecedented access to the highest quality of educational and creative environments, providing the tools and support that at-risk children need to flourish, thrive and hope. In the Harlem and South Bronx communities that we currently serve, where debilitating academic, cultural and social inequities severely limit a child’s opportunities, Time In has brought transformative change to the lives of children, families, teachers and school administrators through its signature interdisciplinary literacy and arts-based learning platform. We look forward to welcoming you!
10001.title: Board of Directors
10001.org: The Time In Children's Arts Initiative

10001.description: Time In's award­-winning arts education programming is uniquely provided to the city's most challenged, Title 1 public schools, whose repeatedly cut funding denies children the cultural access that is fundamental to their future success. Time In has experienced steady growth during the past 3 years and consequently, data management and fundraising systems are not up to the level of our programs' needs. We already have the Salesforece licenses and have committed the time needed to clean all our data to be used within the platform. Unfortunately, given the nature of our work with some of the city's poorest children, we do not have the financial resources to design and implement a CRM. We are seeking a professional to help us to tailor the Salesforce platform to our organizational needs. This project is critical for us as we expand our programs, so that we can ensure continued service to the very needy and deserving population of children from Harlem and the South Bronx who we serve. Volunteer should be willing to train the staff in the use of the database. We look forward to welcoming you!
10001.title: Salesforce Implementation
10001.org: The Time In Children's Arts Initiative

10001.description: The Time In Children's Arts Initiative is America's leading opera and art program, specializes in providing an incredibly sophisticated arts immersion that begins from Pre-K and alternates between opera through hands-on studio art in our light-filled Chelsea studio and museum visits and gallery hops to some of the city's leading contemporary art venues. Serving over 600 children/week from some of NYC's most underserved public elementary school children from Harlem and the South Bronx, The Time In Children's Arts Initiative looks forward to your joining us! Beginning in 3rd grade, Time In's extraordinarily impactful Arty Readers meets the intellectual, aesthetic and social-emotional needs of upper elementary school children. Taking place at the children's home schools in Harlem and the South Bronx as part of the regular school day, Arty Readers mentors kids in reading, creative writing, and the Japanese art of manga - highly technical drawing - through the prism of opera. Volunteers will join Time In staff to work 1:1 with whole classrooms of kids on a weekly basis. As a classroom teacher recently said, \"This is the highlight of their whole week!\"
10001.title: Arty Readers:  Working with kids in Literacy through Opera and Japanese Manga
10001.org: The Time In Children's Arts Initiative

10001.description: Time In would welcome those who love opera and the visual arts to join us and to support our kids as they make art! We work very closely with whole classes of some of the youngest and most underserved children from seriously challenged public schools in Harlem and the South Bronx. Kids join us at our studio or out in the field - we visit all of the city's leading museums and galleries - sketchbooks and pencils in hand. Time In is also proud to employ 19 of the city’s most up-and coming contemporary artists, with whom you will have the opportunity to work side by side! A true opportunity to change the lives of kids through mentorship and to broaden one's own perspectives on music and art. Ideally, all volunteers would commit on an ongoing basis since so many of our children struggle with the instabilities of homelessness, shifting families, immigration, etc. On the upside, this is a very real opportunity to impact the lives of hundreds of young children from age 4-9, in very transformative ways! Time In's Opera 'N Art Program runs Tuesday-Friday throughout the school year from 9:30am-1:30pm. Volunteers can come for the full shift or for one shift - from 10am-11:30am or from 11:30am-1pm. We look forward to welcoming you!
10001.title: Make art with at-risk public school kids!
10001.org: The Time In Children's Arts Initiative

10001.description: The Soldiers Project is looking for licensed, insured mental health professionals to help us provide free mental health services to Post 9/11 Veterans and their loved ones in the New York City area! The Soldiers Project is a 501 (c)3 non-profit organization that has been providing critically needed mental health services for over 10 years to Post 9/11 Veterans and their loved ones. Help us Heal the Hidden Wounds of War!
10001.title: Mental Health Clinicians Needed to help Veterans and their Loved Ones in the New York City area!

10001.description: We are looking for super fundraisers for Maya's Hope! Want to save the world? Want to be a hero? Want to save a child battling cancer? NOW\"S YOUR CHANCE! We are looking for Fundraising Warriors who are good on the phone who want to make a direct difference for cutie pies. If you have the gift of gab and a big heart... and LOVE glitter... then this volunteer position is for you! We want you!
10001.title: FUN AND PASSIONATE FUNDRAISER!

10001.description: GMHC's Wellness Department is looking for licensed massage therapists to offer their services for our HIV+ clients. We are currently able to offer Swedish and Shiatsu massages, but are open to other techniques as well. Days and times are fleixible but must be within our normal business hours (Monday-Friday 9am - 6pm).
10001.title: Licensed Massage Therapists

10001.description: Mission: A Global Friendship is an international non-profit that works towards poverty alleviation through women empowerment. We create economic opportunities for women in developing regions by helping them build small business skills and giving them access to an international market. The Board supports the work of AGF and provide mission-based leadership. While day-to-day operations are led by AGF's president and founder, the Board-President relationship is a partnership, and the appropriate involvement of the Board is both critical and expected. We are looking for someone who can: -Engage with the community -Raise awareness -Create partnerships with various respected businesses/individuals - Suggest possible nominees to the board who can make significant contributions to the work of the board and the organization - Connect with potential donors and lend his/her skillset to grow the organization. Experience securing donations of 10K and over is preferre. 10001.description: The Actors Theatre Workshop (ATW) is a non-profit theatre company and educational institution founded in 1990 by award-winning actor, writer and director Thurman E. Scott, whose mentor Stella Adler named \". . . the inheritor of the Stanislavsky legacy and of my legacy.\" This dynamic theatre seeks an experienced Literary Manager to lead new initiatives in ATW’s Literary Department, and support ATW’s overall mission to develop and present original dramatic material that reveals the issues we are grappling with as a collective community. The Literary Manager must possess a theatre background. Areas of responsibility include reviewing submitted plays, outreach to playwrights, assistance with contractual issues, and helping to recruit and lead a team of volunteers. The Literary Manager will report directly to ATW’s Artistic Director and Founder, Thurman E. Scott. This individual must be an articulate, enthusiastic communicator who can work well in a creative ensemble. Join with us as we support, develop, and produce new plays! G o to http://www.actorstheatreworkshop.com to find out more, and fill out an application for this position today!
10001.title: Seeking Volunteer Literary Manager for innovative, award-winning theatre company!

10001.description: BRC is a leading provider of housing and services to thousands of New York City's neediest individuals. Offering a hand up, not a hand out, BRC asks one simple question: What can we do for you? BRC sees the potential in each individual it serves, and provides each the opportunity to find it. Whatever our clients may seek, BRC has it, 24/7/365. In order to continue to provide healthful meals and snacks for our clients, several of our residential programs require additional assistance in their respective kitchens and dining areas with light food preparation and service, clean-up afterwards and more. The time and needs vary by location so please get in touch if this is of particular interest to you. Shifts are available for all meals, seven days per week, particuarly at our lower east side facilities, as well as Chelsea, Bed-Stuy and Harlem.

10001.description: Make a Difference. Graphic Design Internship at ClassWish.org! Work in NYC or Virtually Prefer PowerPoints to Text? See http://ClassWish-Intern-Postings.org Our education nonprofit offers internships focusing on a large number of fields, including: Art, Graphics, Fashion Marketing, Photography, Video Computers, SEO, Digital Marketing Communications, Journalism, Social Media, PR, Celebrity Campaigns Book Marketing, Publishing, Music Marketing, Sports Marketing, Science, Education Research, Philanthropic Fundraising, Grant-writing, Nonprofit Management Cause Marketing, Business Development We seek outstanding undergraduate and graduate graphic design students as interns for the school year, summer and winter to collaborate on the boldest nonprofit initiative we know. We are looking for entrepreneurial, passionate, and energetic students with exceptional skills to create web page layouts, flyers, logos, etc. for ClassWish.org. This is an outstanding leadership opportunity in an innovative, emerging nonprofit. Here is the problem we are tackling: K-12 schools in this country do not have enough resources to let children explore their potential and excel. Art supplies, books, computers, musical instruments, science equipment, sports equipment, and even paper for computers and printers are all in desperately short supply. Our Approach: ClassWish . org, an exciting new nonprofit, uses modern business practices and the latest marketing techniques to help 125,000 schools serving 56 million kids, inform, inspire and engage supporters. Teachers visit the site to create Wish Lists of the resources they need. People in the community can see exactly what is needed and contribute to help. About Us: The people behind ClassWish.org include such prominent education and business leaders as the: former COO of Mashable; EVP of the New York Stock Exchange; former CEO of Huffington Post; former Provost of Harvard; CEO of the Dana Farber Cancer Institute; Director of the Institute for Advanced Study; Director, Education and Society Program of Aspen Institute; CEO of the American Association of Colleges of Teacher Education. Most importantly, current and former interns will offer a great review of ClassWish.org. The Work: Teachers and students are already getting supplies from ClassWish.org. Now, we need to raise greater awareness and encourage more participation so we can help more kids. Interns will work in small teams focused on such things as: marketing around particular verticals, e.g., art, music, sports, books, computers, science, and special education marketing to particular audiences, such as businesses, bloggers, press, educators, moms, religious organizations, civic organizations, unions, nonprofits, authors, magazine readers, teens celebrity marketing campaigns particular promotions, such as student video and journalism contests creating and implementing social media campaigns building and managing relationships and cause marketing campaigns with strategic partners building and leading a national network of volunteers enhancing the websites creating graphics, videos, and promotional materials You will take leadership on projects and work with other highly motivated interns, established professionals, and directly with our co-founder. The Environment: This is, frankly, a great place to work. We get great interns from all over the country and all over the world, so the atmosphere is energetic, creative, and fun. It’s also casual; we’re interested in your brains, creativity and heart. Want to work in jeans, a t-shirt and flip-flops? Why not! What do we offer? You will enhance your portfolio with projects that will be displayed on the Internet as well as in print, visible to potential future employers, and have the satisfaction of knowing that you have helped children get the tools they need to perform at their best. To see PowerPoint presentations about some of our activities, please see http://ClassWish-Intern-Postings.org. If you want a great experience doing something you will always be proud of, send a short cover letter and a resume to interns @ ClassWish . org. Impress us. This is competitive.
10001.title: Make a Difference. Graphic Design Intern at ClassWish.org!

10001.description: Background: Established in 1893, Visiting Nurse Service of New York (VNSNY) is the nation’s largest not-for-profit community-based health system in the United States, providing home health care services in the five boroughs of New York City and Nassau and Westchester counties. The VNSNY Hospice Care volunteer’s role is to be a supportive, caring person to the patient, their caregiver and family. Our goal is to provide comfort, care and choice to our patients and their families during this difficult time in their lives. Some of the ways that volunteers help includes visiting to ease social isolation, calling caregivers and families to offer emotional support, reading, listening to music, playing games, knitting, helping patients write memoirs and more. Volunteers with special skills, such as singing, massage or hairstyling are also needed. Bilingual Volunteers are also needed in all boroughs. VNSNY Hospice Care provides expert, compassionate care for individuals and families living with progressive, serious illness at the end of life. We are the resource of choice for hospice and palliative care information, education and service for every resident and health care provider in Metropolitan New York. For more information, go to our VNSNY Hospice Volunteering website at http://www.vnsny.org/community/support-vnsny/hospice-volunteer-opportunities/
10001.title: Hospice Volunteers - Visiting Nurse Service of NY
10001.org: Visiting Nurse Service of New York Hospice and Palliative Care

10001.description: Make a Difference. Social Media Internship at ClassWish.org! Work in NYC or Virtually Are you a wizard at Facebook, Twitter, blogs, and other social media? We seek outstanding students as social media interns for the current school year and for the summer to collaborate on the boldest nonprofit initiative we know. We are looking for entrepreneurial, passionate, and energetic students with exceptional skills to help promote ClassWish.org through high-profile social media campaigns. This is an outstanding leadership opportunity in an innovative, emerging nonprofit. Here is the problem we are tackling: K-12 schools in this country do not have enough resources to let children explore their potential and excel. Books, computers, art supplies, musical instruments, science equipment, sports equipment, and even paper for computers and printers are all in desperately short supply. Our Approach: ClassWish.org, an exciting new nonprofit, uses modern business practices and the latest marketing techniques to help 125,000 schools serving 56 million kids, inform, inspire and engage supporters. Teachers visit the site to create Wish Lists of the resources they need. People in the community can see exactly what is needed and contribute to help. About Us: The people behind ClassWish.org include such prominent education and business leaders as Adam Hirsch, former COO, Mashable; Laurie Coots, CMO, TBWA; Scott Cutler, EVP, New York Stock Exchange; Betsy Morgan, former CEO, Huffington Post; Nancy Pelz-Paget, Director, Education and Society Program, Aspen Institute; Sharon Robinson, CEO, American Association of Colleges of Teacher Education. Forbes Magazine liked our approach so much that they donated a full page to help raise awareness. Yo-Yo Ma, Tony Hawk and Dwight Howard are among the celebrities who have offered to help promote ClassWish.org. The Work: Teachers and students are already getting supplies from ClassWish.org. Now, we need to raise greater awareness and encourage more participation so we can help more kids. Interns will work in small teams focused on such things as: marketing to particular audiences, such as businesses, bloggers, press, educators, moms, religious organizations, civic organizations, unions, nonprofits, authors, magazine readers, teens celebrity marketing campaigns marketing around particular school subjects, such as science, music, art, reading and sports marketing around particular promotions creating and implementing social media campaigns building and managing relationships with strategic partners such as ClassWish.WebThriftStore.com, BookstoreThatGives.org and http://TheMutual.com building and leading a national network of volunteers enhancing the websites creating graphics and promotional materials You will take leadership on projects and work with other highly motivated interns, established professionals, and directly with our co-founder. The Environment: This is, frankly, a great place to work. We get great interns from all over the country and all over the world, so the atmosphere is energetic, creative, and fun. It’s also casual; we’re interested in your brains, creativity and heart. Want to work in jeans, a t-shirt and flip-flops? Why not! What do we offer? You will enhance your resume with a solid record of professional achievement and community service, and you will have the satisfaction of knowing that you have helped children get the tools they need to perform at their best. See presentations about some of our activities at http://ClassWish-Intern-Postings.org. If you want a great experience doing something you will always be proud of, send a short cover letter and a resume to interns @ ClassWish . org. Impress us. This is competitive. FAQ - Review ClassWish.org’s outstanding internship program here: Is this a business or a nonprofit? ClassWish is a nonprofit, but we use the latest techniques from the business world to make a leveraged, scalable and financially-self sustaining difference in the lives of tens of millions of children. This sounds ambitious! Daniel Burnham, the great Chicago architect, said \"Make no little plans; they have not the power to stir men’s souls.\" (Nor women’s, we hasten to add). Little plans also do not have the power to provide a better education to 56 million kids who deserve more than they are getting today. We face a crushing need in schools, have a solid plan to address it, and with your help, we intend to grow this very large and very fast. Where are you located? We are in Manhattan, conveniently located right across from Madison Square Garden and Penn Station. Four express subway stops, LIRR, and the PATH train are all within one block. We also hire interns to work remotely from other cities. What skills and experience are you looking for? We seek a wide range of skills: graphic designers, videographers, writers, researchers, creative thinkers, analytical sorts, community organizers, social media stars, people with great communication skills, MBA students, and more. I looked at your site and have some suggestions. Great! This is a collaborative project, and we want to hear from you. Your ClassWish review will be helpful. Is this a paid internship? We can offer a great experience, a great addition to your rsum, academic credit (if your school allows), stunning recommendations, and a chance to make a difference, but we are a start-up nonprofit, so can only offer unpaid internship and volunteer positions. Do check to see if your school offers a stipend program. When will you select the interns? We’re agile. When we see a great candidate, we extend an invitation immediately. We won’t keep you waiting for a decision. What dates will the internship run? We are flexible. Tell us what you are looking for. What are the hours? We welcome full-time and part-time interns. Let us know what works for you. What will I need to bring? Brains, heart, passion, energy, a notebook computer (as an early-stage nonprofit, we just can’t afford to buy dozens of machines), and a passion to make an immediate improvement to the education of tens of millions of children. Sounds exciting! How can I apply? Please send a short cover letter and an impressive resume to interns @ ClassWish . org.
10001.title: Make a Difference.   Social Media Internship at ClassWish.org!

10001.description: We are looking for special families to open their hearts and homes and join our family of puppy raisers. Puppy Raisers make a commitment to take a puppy home for approximately 12-14 months. They provide a safe and loving home where the puppy will be taught housebreaking, obedience, excellent house manners, and socialization in public places. v Hours of Volunteering: The puppy lives with the family for 12-14 months. v Preliminary Requirements: Puppy orientation session, attend two obedience classes, and a home visit by a Foundation representative as well as temping a young and an older puppy. v Future Requirements: Food and toys are paid for by the volunteer and are tax-deductible. Foundation-approved food is approximately $50 per month. Attending a minimum of two obedience classes per month held by our puppy advisors. Advisors are here to assist you with any questions you may have. Veterinary care is covered by Foundation-approved veterinarians. Questions? Contact: 631-930-9060, email: Nadine@guidedog.org We look forward to hearing from you soon!

10001.description: Everyone has a dream to express their individuality. The Scott Acting Conservatory of The Actors Theatre Workshop, provides semi-private classes where each individual student receives one-on-one attention from the director. Classes take place in a safe creative environment where students are encouraged to express their ideas and insights and supported to gain clarity, discipline and focus to hone their craft. This professional acting conservatory was founded by award-winning actor, writer and director, Thurman E. Scott. Mr. Scott teaches an original acting and writing technique to both professional actors and students embarking upon the journey of an education in drama. Begin the process of discovering and developing the uniqueness of your natural talent in a safe and supportive environment. This process will allow you to experience that uniqueness and support you to accept your power, which will give you confidence to express your creative essence in the world. No one has your DNA. No one else has lived your life. Make your mark. Train with award-winning Actor and Director, Thurman E. Scott. Enroll in the Ten Session Intensive, Sunday afternoons at ATW. To be considered, Apply online ASAP for an interview/information session at http://www.ActorsTheatreWorkshop.com .
10001.title: Beginning Acting Classes - Ten Sessions!

10001.description: The Front Desk Receptionist volunteer provides support by greeting clients and answering questions, guiding clients to appropriate programs and services, as well as answering the phone. Front desk receptionists are the face of GMHC as they are often the first person that someone interacts with at the organization. Bilingual in English and Spanish is a plus. Duties: Answer phones and relay messages to staff, provide a welcoming experience at front desk and answer guests’ questions, direct clients to designated services and programs, handle walk-ins for intake and work with high volume traffic at front desk. Flexible shifts are available during our regular office hours: 9am-6pm, Monday-Friday.
10001.title: Front Desk Receptionist

GMHC currenltly has a specific need for: Swedish Massage Therapists Reflexology Massage Therapists Meditation Leaders State-held licenses, certifications, or prior teaching experience required.

Here is the problem we are tackling: K-12 schools in this country do not have enough resources to let children explore their potential and excel. Books, computers, art supplies, musical instruments, science equipment, sports equipment, and even paper for computers and printers are all in desperately short supply. Our Approach: ClassWish.org, an exciting new nonprofit, uses modern business practices and the latest marketing techniques to help 125,000 schools serving 56 million kids, inform, inspire and engage supporters. Teachers visit the site to create Wish Lists of the resources they need. People in the community can see exactly what is needed and contribute to help. About Us: The people behind ClassWish.org include such prominent education and business leaders as Adam Hirsch, former COO, Mashable; Laurie Coots, CMO, TBWA; Scott Cutler, EVP, New York Stock Exchange; Betsy Morgan, former CEO, Huffington Post; Nancy Pelz-Paget, Director, Education and Society Program, Aspen Institute; Sharon Robinson, CEO, American Association of Colleges of Teacher Education. Forbes Magazine liked our approach so much that they donated a full page to help raise awareness. Yo-Yo Ma, Tony Hawk and Dwight Howard are among the celebrities who have offered to help promote ClassWish.org. The work: Teachers and students are already getting supplies from ClassWish.org. Now, we need to raise greater awareness and encourage more participation so we can help more kids. Interns will work in small teams focused on such things as: marketing to particular audiences, such as businesses, bloggers, press, educators, moms, religious organizations, civic organizations, unions, nonprofits, authors, soap operas, magazine readers, teens and celebrities marketing around particular school subjects, such as science, music, art, reading and sports marketing around particular promotions (such as http://ClassWish.org/days and http://ClassWish.org/books/124) creating and implementing social media campaigns building and managing relationships with strategic partners such as http://EdRover.com building and leading a national network of volunteers enhancing the website creating graphics and promotional materials You will take leadership on projects and work with other highly motivated interns, established professionals, and directly with our co-founder. What do we offer? You will enhance your resume with a solid record of professional achievement and community service, and you will have the satisfaction of knowing that you have helped children get the tools they need to perform at their best. If you want a great experience doing something you will always be proud of, send a cover letter and a resume to interns@ClassWish.org. Impress us. This is competitive. FAQ Is this a business or a nonprofit? ClassWish is a nonprofit, but we use the latest techniques from the business world to make a leveraged, scalable and financially-self sustaining difference in the lives of tens of millions of children. This sounds ambitious! Daniel Burnham, the great Chicago architect, said \"Make no little plans; they have not the power to stir men's souls.\" (Nor women's, we hasten to add). Little plans also do not have the power to provide a better education to 56 million kids who deserve more than they are getting today. We face a crushing need in schools, have a solid plan to address it, and with your help, we intend to grow this very large and very fast. Where are you located? We are in Manhattan, conveniently located right across from Madison Square Garden. We will also hire interns to work remotely from other cities. What skills and experience are you looking for? We seek a wide range of skills: graphic designers, videographers, writers, researchers, creative thinkers, analytical sorts, community organizers, social media stars, people with great communication skills, MBA students, and more. I looked at your site and have some suggestions. Great! This is a collaborative project, and we want to hear from everyone. Is this a paid internship? We can offer a great experience, a great addition to your resumé, academic credit (if your school allows), stunning recommendations, and a chance to make a difference, but we are a start-up nonprofit, so can only offer unpaid internship and volunteer positions. When will you select the interns? We're agile. When we see a great candidate, we extend an invitation immediately. We won't keep you waiting for a decision. What dates will the internship run? We are hiring for the summer, for the fall semester, and beyond. Tell us what you are looking for. What are the hours? We welcome full-time and part-time interns. Let us know what works for you. What will I need to bring? Brains, heart, passion, energy, a notebook computer, and a passion to make an immediate improvement to the education of tens of millions of children. Sounds exciting! How can I apply? Please send an impressive cover letter and a resume to interns@ClassWish.org.
10001.title: Help Children Get A Better Education: Intern at Classwish! Work in NYC or Virtually

10001.description: Our Hotline program is GMHC’s oldest volunteer opportunity and provides support and information to callers in need of someone to talk to. Volunteers with the Hotline have the opportunity to make a real difference in the lives of callers while also learning a wealth of information regarding HIV/AIDS, counseling methods, and more. Hotline Counselors provide information and referral services regarding HIV/AIDS and GMHC's programs and services to the general public who contact the GMHC Hotline by phone and email. Volunteers need to be able to respond to a diverse group of callers with diverse needs, and to stay informed about latest HIV/AIDS developments as well as GMHC policies and protocols. Bilingual Spanish/English is a plus. There is a critical need for daytime, weekday availability (Monday 2 - 6 pm, Wednesday10 am - 2 pm, and Friday 2 - 6 pm.) Calls and emails to the GMHC Hotline could include topics such as: Concerns about HIV and AIDS Questions about HIV transmission and prevention Referrals to HIV/STI testing Connection to care Information about GMHC services How to become a GMHC client Training will be provided by GMHC staff members and includes a 3-day intensive training, a series of Practicum sessions, and a listening-in period where trainees shadow senior Hotline Counselors to gain a real understanding of the work. Training is offered twice a year in the spring and in the fall. Due to the extensive training involved, we require a minimum one-year commitment from all Hotline Counselors.
10001.title: Hotline Counselor

10001.description: Join our Volunteer team and make a meaningful contribution to our community by using your talents to support the award-winning programs at The Actors Theatre Workshop. The Actors Theatre Workshop is an award-winning non-profit theater, educational institution and community center in NYC founded by award-winning actor, director, writer and producer, Thurman E. Scott, an acclaimed master teacher of acting and creative process with over 30 years of professional experience. We are currently seeking a Salesforce.com Developer for our Salesforce application. The Developer will be responsible for the analysis, design, development, testing, implementation and support of our Saleforce.com application. The Developer should possess knowledge of Saleforce.com platform architecture, relational databases, and experience with creating custom Apex and Visualforce code to enhance the Salesforce.com application. Responsibilities: - Facilitate meetings with key users and define / specify CRM requirements and customizations according to ATW needs. - Develop functional requirements and deliver CRM solutions according to ATW requirements. - Complete migration of contacts and data from current web-based CRM application to Salesforce. - Remain up-to-date and knowledgeable on Salesforce resources, best practices, tools and technologies in order to leverage the latest and best of Salesforce at ATW. Qualifications: - Experience with Salesforce OR experience with relational databases and SQL is required. - Experience with Apex and Visualforce is recommended. - Excellent verbal and written communication skills. - Bachelor of Science in Computer Information Systems or related field is preferred. - A passion and interest in Salesforce. - An openness to ideas and a curiosity to learn new things is required. The community we serve will be tremendously thankful for your service. To find out more about our organization, please RSVP to attend our next info session, RSVP! for our Volunteer Information and Interview Session! Go to our website http://www.actorstheatreworkshop.com; click on \"Volunteer Program\" to fill out our online application and we will set up an Information and Interview Session for you! IMPORTANT: In response to the overwhelming number of applicants who wish to be considered for the upcoming program, the Info Session will also include an Application and Interview Session. We will extend the Information Session until everyone has completed their interview. Please plan ample time to complete this process. Join our Volunteer Leadership team and make a meaningful contribution to our community through using your managerial talents and leading teams to support the award-winning programs at The Actors Theatre Workshop.

10001.description: Find out how you can grow creatively as a Video Volunteer at an award-winning non-profit theater that serves our community! RSVP for our Information Session for Video Professionals! (See RSVP details below!) Our goal is to put together a volunteer team that can edit the groundbreaking work being done at The Actors Theatre Workshop. Using your professional skills to edit this wonderful material will surely stimulate hope, excitement and I believe bring true enlightenment to those who participate. At the same time you will reach another dimension in your craft as you learn about the unique filming/editing perspective of the ATW Founder and Artistic Director, Thurman E. Scott. ATW has long been on the front lines of disciplined creative training for theater professionals and individuals committed to fulfilling their creative potential. ATW has also been a safe haven for thousands of at-risk and homeless youth. The original theater and educational technique which has been tremendously successful with our professional acting students, has proven to be equally beneficial to the children we teach in our after-school programs. We have many years of footage from our adult acting workshop's and community program's that we want to share with you and the world. We've started sharing this video online and we've received such positive feedback from every corner of the globe that we are taking steps to put out more. This process takes time and so we would like to find more dedicated individuals who want to learn and make a difference in other people's lives and be a part of something hopeful by joining our video editing team. Our editors often talk about the beautiful, inspiring and deeply moving moments they have witnessed when a student actor or a child from a homeless shelter brings forth his talent and reaches for their potential. You literally see the moments when there is a shift in consciousness and they begin to accept their strength and the unique gifts that they have to offer the world. And in that moment you know that this person has changed forever-- and as a result undoubtedly so have you. By working directly with this material you will gain deep insight into the emotional and psychological breakdown of drama, and learn to see the penetrating insights that come out of script analysis, which gives you the ability to find and understand the eternal essence of ideas that are then formulated into a universal idea that helps to instill faith and spread hope to all individuals on a creative journey. So without further ado.. We invite you to a Volunteer Info Session for video editing professionals .To RSVP go to: http://www.actorstheatreworkshop.com, click on \"volunteers\" and fill out an online application. We will contact you to set up an Information and Interview Session. At the Info Session you'll have a chance to meet leaders in the organization, learn about the work ATW has done in the community and see some of the inspiring videos that have already been cut. Thank you! For more information go to http://www.actorstheatreworkshop.com or contact us at outreach@actorstheatreworkshop.com or call 212-947-1386 x0. ATW is located at 145 W. 28th Street, New York NY.

10001.description: Non-Profit Management/Video Internship for Award-Winning Non-Profit Theater Conservatory in NYC! This is an intensive Leadership Training Program in non-profit business management. Interns receive hands-on training as a management assistant. If skilled in video, interns may assist in video production and editing at our award-winning theater arts and community service organization. As video production becomes increasingly critical to the growth, development and success of managing a successful non-profit, we seek intern candidates that are leaders who are passionate about non-profit management and posses skills in video production and editing. Successful non-profits are built on powerful ideas that inspire hope. These ideas are manifested in the programs and the management of the organization. By gaining a working understanding of how to successfully manage a nonprofit organization, the intern begins to learn its core principals, which allows the intern to begin to take a leadership role in the organization. In addition, this knowledge is invaluable in the creation of videos that effectively promote and bring this work to the world. These videos are essential to the marketing and fund-raising efforts in any successful non-profit. We are looking for individuals with the ability to lead, manage teams, work independently, communicate effectively on the phone, in person and in writing and interact in a fast-paced business environment. We are looking for idealists and leaders who can put their thoughts and insights into action; positive, enthusiastic individuals who want to make a difference in the world and are committed to upholding the legacy and tradition of theater in the belief that theater can change a life and make the world a better place for everyone. The interns' primary responsibility is to manage the daily administrative operations of the organization and to take a leadership role in programming initiatives. There will be opportunities to work closely with the senior staff: in administrating over workshops for actors and community programs that serve Youth-at-Risk and homeless children. Under ATW supervision, interns will be accountable for projects in the management of ATW's studio rental business, administration, team management, marketing, development, sales, fund-raising, video production, event planning, and graphic design. For international applicants, English proficiency is required. In addition, Interns may also work on a combination of logging, editing, and production of on-going video projects that depend on ATW's current schedule and on the intern's skill level. Interns will work under the direction of a project manager. We seek applicants with training and experience logging footage, editing in Final Cut Pro, http streaming, digital shooting, lighting, sound and web design and development. Interns and Volunteers consistently report they gain tremendously from filming and reviewing footage of ATW classes and workshops and have benefited as if they had actually taken the classes themselves. In summary, we seek professional, detail-oriented individuals who are positive and curious, with a desire to learn and engage in a process. The Actors Theatre Workshop is an award-winning non-profit theater, educational institution and community center in NYC founded by award-winning actor, director, writer and producer, Thurman E. Scott, an acclaimed master teacher of acting and creative process with over 30 years of professional experience. Stella Adler declared, \" Thurman E. Scott is the inheritor of the Stanislavsky legacy and of my legacy. His work advances acting technique for the next generation.\" Internships are available for 4 to 18 months in duration and are 40 hrs per week. This is a non-paid training program. Application instructions: To be considered, candidates must complete an application online, followed by interviews. For more information and to complete an application go to: http://www.ActorsTheatreWorkshop.com and click on Internships. For questions, email us at Outreach@ActorsTheatreWorkshop.com or call 212.947.1386 x 0.
10001.title: Non-Profit Management/Video Internship for NYC Theater/Community Center

We are looking for individuals with the ability to lead, manage teams, work independently, communicate effectively on the phone, in person and in writing and interact in a fast-paced business environment. We are looking for leaders who can put their thoughts and insights into action; positive, enthusiastic individuals who want to make a difference in the world and are committed to upholding the legacy and tradition of theater in the belief that theater can change a life and make the world a better place for everyone. The interns' primary responsibility is to manage the daily administrative operations of the organization and to take a leadership role in programming initiatives. There will be opportunities to work closely with the senior staff: in administrating over workshops for actors and community programs that serve Youth-at-Risk. Under ATW supervision, interns will be accountable for projects in the management of ATW's studio rental business, administration, team management, marketing, development, sales, fund-raising, video production, event planning, and graphic design. For international applicants, only candidates with exceptional skills in speaking and writing in English will be considered. Only a limited number of part-time internships (24 to 30 hours per week) will be considered from qualified and serious applicants. Part-time internships are 3 to 18 months. This is a non-paid internship training program. To be considered, please apply ASAP. Go to http://www.actorstheatreworkshop.com to find out more and fill out an online application for this position! 10001.description: One of New York City's largest and most comprehensive social services agencies, BRC serves men and women who are homeless, or at risk of becoming so, most of whom suffer from mental illness, substance addiction, or a combination. BRC gives our clients the knowledge and skills to stay sober and healthy and the sense of responsibility and value to find and maintain a home--in other words, the means to achieve permanent independence. BRC helps these neediest New Yorkers overcome the challenges of addiction, physical and mental illness, and poverty, and improves life in the community. Outreach is BRC's program for homeless individuals living on the streets and in other unstable situations. It is the most extensive outreach program in New York City covering specific Manhattan based locations, i.e. Grand Central Station, Penn Station and Port Authority Bus Terminal, 5 days per week in vans and on foot. Outreach staff and volunteers engages homeless individuals with the goal of assessing each individual's situation and needs and providing each client with an accessible doorway to services they need. Clients are afforded referral, transportation and placement at the resource deemed most beneficial to the individual, and each is treated with respect, professionalism and informed guidance. The Outreach Team encounters many individuals that are reluctant to use services or have found the available resources unmanageable and overwhelming. These clients are provided with counseling, information and advocacy in pursuing services, rights and resources. Every individual engaged is given the opportunity to access the services most suited to their needs. Working with Outreach staff, volunteers will help refer clients to assessment shelters, drop-in centers, drug and alcohol treatment, psychiatric and medical facilities, job training centers and entitlement offices. Normally a staff-only position, volunteers are needed to help us continue in our Outreach efforts. All teams will be midtown Manhattan based specifically at the Port Authority Bus Terminal on either Wednesday of Thursday evenings from 7pm to 9:30pm. This is the perfect opportunity for friends or co-workers who want to get involved together because teams will be comprised of a minimum of three individuals per shift, with a maximum of four each. For more information or you would like to speak to someone directly, please contact Rick Akin, Director of Volunteer Services at BRC, at (212) 803-5720.

10001.description: We seek student video editors/shooters or those entering the industry who wish to make a meaningful commitment to established non-profit professional theatre and acting conservatory. Develop your skills and creativity under the guidance of our renowned Artistic Director and Founder, Thurman E. Scott. The project goal is to bring the power of our classes and programs to the public. Your work will have a lasting impact on our theatre and community. Founded over two decades ago The Actors Theatre Workshop (ATW) is an award winning non-profit theatre and community center serving as a laboratory for creative development. We offer professional acting training and community programs including Builders of the New World, a theatre and education program for homeless children. ATW has a library of over 1000 hours of unedited footage of Mr. Scott teaching his original creative process. We are now bringing this powerful material, currently available only to the students in ATW's Master Class, to a broader audience. We will create instructional documentaries to distribute on our website and other media. This valuable training material for actors and directors will bring powerful, effective theatre principles and techniques to people from all walks of life seeking to develop creatively and personally. Video Apprentices will serve as videographers in Mr. Scott's Master Class in which he teaches his original acting and creative process to professional actors. By participating in this unique professional scholarship program, members will receive an unparalleled learning experience through exposure to ground-breaking creative work and illuminating ideas. We seek applicants with training and experience in Final Cut Pro, http streaming, digital shooting, cataloging of footage, working with a web developer, and lighting and sound. Apprentices will work from pre- through post-production under the direction of a project manager and Mr. Scott. Members of the one or two year program will video-tape the two Master Classes each week, and spend 10 hours per week editing. We seek professional, curious, detail-oriented individuals with the desire and ability to engage in ATW's creative process. Thurman E. Scott is an award-winning actor, director, writer, producer, and master teacher of acting and creative process with over 30 years of professional experience. Stella Adler declared, \" Thurman E. Scott is the inheritor of the Stanislavsky legacy and of my legacy. His work advances acting technique for the next generation.\" Please complete an application in the \"Volunteer\" section at http://www.ActorsTheatreWorkshop.com. Please specify the Video Apprentice Program. Email us at Outreach@ActorsTheatreWorkshop.com or call 212-947-1386 ext. 0 with questions.

10002.description: The 2017 Art Festival, co-produced by the Institute of Prophetic Activist Art and Dixon Place (Lower East Side), will take place the weekend of March 3-5, 2017. This event will showcase arts-advocacy events and performances oriented around human rights themes. Our current line-up of artist-activists include Movement of the People Dance Company , Poetic People Power , Ari Gold , Ray of Hope Project, and more! We are especially excited to extend this invitation to NYC Service Volunteers, because of the unique chance to engage with artists and advocacy organizations at a professional, reputable venue. Throughout the weekend of March 3-5, volunteers will sign-up for 2-hour shifts, will receive a t-shirt, and will have access to events and performances on the day(s) they volunteer. We appreciate you considering this opportunity. Please feel free to share it with friends and family as well! We are also more than happy to field any questions you may have, so do not hesitate to reach out to HumanRightsArtFestival@gmail.com. We look forward to seeing you and your community at the 2017 International Human Rights Art Festival!
10002.title: Volunteer for the 2017 International Human Rights Art Festival

10002.description: Reading Empowers was formed with the mission of improving literacy among young children. Our goal is to instill an interest in reading, at a young age, and our hope is that this will develop into a lifelong love and passion. This upcoming school semester (Spring 2017), we will be hosting Saturday morning reading sessions at P.S. 1 and P.S. 124 in Lower Manhattan. We are looking for volunteers to join us on our mission! We will be reading to students in 1st, 2nd, and 3rd Grade. P.S. 1 and P.S. 124 are both located in Chinatown at 8 Henry Street and 40 Division Street, repsectively, in LES Manhattan. Below are the dates for the Spring 2017 semester. February 11 March 4 March 18 April 1 April 22 April 29 Each session is about two hours, during which volunteers and students are broken up into groups, with each group consisting of 2-3 volunteers and 6-8 students. The two hour sessions consist of reading, writing, and an arts and crafts activity with the students. Reading Empowers is a non-profit organization in the state of New York and recognized as a tax-exempt 501(c)(3) organization by the IRS. Please feel free to visit our website http://www.readingempowers.org/ Requirements Volunteers must be 18 or older New volunteers must pass the background check with our vendor, Go Pass. There is a $60 background check fee that will be reimbursed to you after you volunteer with us for 60% of all the sessions in one full school year ~ 8-9 sessions We are looking for consistent commitment for this school year, which is roughly two Saturdays per month To get involved please fill out our online application at: www.readingempowers.org/application
10002.title: Read to 1st, 2nd or 3rd Graders in a public school in Lower Manhattan!

10002.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
10002.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 188 The Island School, Manhattan)

10002.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. 10002.description: Join New York Common Pantry's program Nourish in it's fight to end hunger in the senior community! Nourish is funded by New York State Department of Health for the Commodity Supplemental Food Program (CSFP) and helps provide over 14,000 seniors a month with nutritious food packages. To give out these free groceries to low income seniors, we need your help at any of the 3 senior centers we partner with located in Chinatown, Lower East Side, and Washington Heights. We are looking for volunteers who are available during weekdays. Please email me directly at sgonzalez@nycommonpantry.org for more information on the senior centers where we need your assistance.
10002.title: Manhattan Volunteers Needed!

10002.description: Global Potential (GP) transforms youth from underserved communities through education, service learning and cultural exchange into globally competitive leaders of positive change in their lives and communities. GP is an 16-month transformative after-school and summer program that works with 500 youth a year in New York City. The GP program includes 14.5 months of workshops locally and 1.5 months of international service learning and cultural exchange in the Dominican Republic, Haiti, and Nicaragua. GP vision is that as youth develop, communities develop. Major objectives: We are seeking a highly motivated, focused, outgoing individual to coordinate our annual Gala fundraising efforts. The Gala Fundraising Coordinator will be integral in the sustainability of GP’s transformative leadership program. You will play an integral role in ensuring Global Potential's short-term fundraising goal of raising $100K (25% of GP’s annual budget). This is an opportunity for a motivated self-starter interested in helping to implement our fundraising strategy focusing on the annual Gala Concert taking place on March 17th at the Skirball Center for the Performing Arts . You will be coordinating fundraising efforts while receiving support and guidance from the Chief Development Officer. Responsibilities include: Facilitating fundraising campaigns Outreaching to corporate sponsor Assisting in the production of fundraising and promotional materials Managing organization's member and donor database Managing the tracking of the ticket sales with our theater partner Opportunities include: Providing creative fundraising ideas Attending events in the community to engage new members and donors Becoming familiar with the inner workings of a non-profit organization Skills and Knowledge: Experience in fundraising project Self-motivated, detail-oriented, enthusiastic personality Ability to work independently and creatively, as well as part of a team Solid writing, communication, organizational and time management skills Strong computer skills (PC or MAC): Microsoft Office, Internet, Google Drive Knowledge of Salesforce a plus Commitment: 4 months or more / 10-15 hours per week Start date: i mmediately
10002.title: Gala Fundraising Coordinator

10002.description: Putting together heart inspiring videos of 1 min and 3 mins long for a Free Environmental Summer Camp out of South Bronx and Lower east Side. Video clips and images have been gathered from various hand-held devices, ready for editing. Helpful Description of our Free Environmental Summer Camp from the South Bronx: The campers and their families will gain hard skills learned from adaptive rock climbing, hiking, and camping. They will also gain valuable skills such as communication, discernment, critical thinking and foresight to help them thrive in the challenging environment of the South Bronx. Our program helps the campers to take this shared sacred state in the outdoors back to NYC to empower our urban communities. We also run a 6 week long Summer Camp in the Lower East Side in the Children's Magical Garden.
10002.title: Creating heart inspiring videos of 1-3 mins long for Free Environmental Summer Camp

10002.description: Chess Tutors are needed at our Seward Park Library in Manhattan. Tutors should be willing to work with a small group of youth or teens and adults who wish to learn the basics of chess. Saturdays, 1pm - 3pm. Once a week. Six month commitment necessary.
10002.title: Chess Tutor

10002.description: ABOUT THE MATERIALS CENTER: The Materials Center at Manny Cantor Center is a community resource that houses a large collection of \"found\" materials, gathered and donated by New York City residents and businesses. These materials are objects from our everyday lives that are often discarded, but could be repurposed or transformed into something new, encouraging creativity, problem solving, and action. We believe that these materials can enhance and enrich children’s learning, creative expression, and symbolic development. The Materials Center is made possible through a partnership with Teaching Beyond the Square. ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY: You'll be helping to organize and sort materials! Responsibilities will include weighing-in donations, sifting through donated materials, sorting them into the areas/shelves/containers, prepping materials, and straightening up the areas to look more beautiful. This opportunity requires no prior knowledge. We will share with you what you need to get started. It is a great way to relax too. We have half hour and hour shifts to sign-up for (you can choose as many or as little as you want), but even if you can only stop by for 15 minutes you can make a difference! This is also a fun opportunity for families to do together.
10002.title: Sorting in our Materials Center (Mondays)!

10002.description: Key Responsibilities: Set tables with numbers, cutlery, napkins, condiments and water prior to meals Ensure cleanliness of tables and room both before, during and after meals Serve meals to seniors once they are seated Collect tickets from seniors in exchange for their meal Qualifications Needed: This is a customer service position, so best for people that are friendly and personable Strong verbal communications skills Professional demeanor Some experience in food service is a plus Some experience interacting with seniors is a plus Time Commitment: Shifts available M-F 11:00am-1:00pm Training/Support/Supervisor: Program Supervisor: Food Handler Training: You will receive hands on training during your first shift and in subsequent shifts, if necessary Support: Program Supervisor available to answer questions and provide instructions when needed Benefits: Gain knowledge of working in a Community Center and with older adults, while giving back to your community Volunteer meet-ups, which will include learning opportunities, social and networking events and more Tracking of your volunteer hours for your company, school or affiliated group Discounted membership to Manny Cantor Center Fitness Center (must volunteer 12 hours per month to be eligible) Next Steps: Fill out our application: http://mannycantor.org/volunteer/application/ For more information visit: http://mannycantor.org/volunteer/

Broadway, New York, NY 10002 Key Responsibilities: Chop, peel and prepare food for cooking Ensure cleanliness of all dishes, cutlery, equipment, etc. Qualifications Needed: Basic kitchen skills is required Some experience volunteering or working in a kitchen is a plus Some experience in food service is a plus Understand and practice good hygiene Time Commitment: Shifts available M-F, 7am-2:30pm Minimum 2 hour shift, once/week Training/Support/Supervisor: Program Supervisor: Executive Chef Training: You will receive hands on training during your first two shifts Assessment: You and your supervisor will discuss the best role for you following your training shifts Support: Ongoing two-way feedback from program supervisor and volunteer manager, additional trainings and professional development opportunities may be available. 10002.description: Youth Ambassador Program is funded by the U.S. Department of State's Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs and administered by Global Potential. YAP program builds relationships and creates networks among Haitian youth leaders, training youth in the concepts and practices of Social Entrepreneurship; introducing youth to leaders in nonprofit and change-making organizations in the US; and learning about US families, culture, geography, and socio-economic realities YAP consists of three phases: Phase 1, YAP Fellows participate in monthly workshops. These workshops are based on a 4-module curriculum of community service, leadership development, civic education and participatory democracy; Phase 2, YAP Fellows participate in a 3-week immersive experience in the U.S., visiting New York City, Washington D.C.; Phase 3, YAP Leaders are given both individual and group support and coaching for 7 months to develop projects that will impact their local communities, based on their passions and abilities. Duties and Responsibilities: Ensure that all files and data are organized properly Input information of YAP participants into the database (salesforce & Google Drive) Manage the Youth Ambassador Program Facebook pages and Google Drive Make phone calls when needed to YAP partners and participants Support in the recruitment of YAP Participants Participate in the Monthly conference calls with the International Executive Councils Translate Documents from English to Haitian Creole and vice versa. Take notes and minutes during Conference calls, partner meetings, Youth monthly workshop Follow up with tasks assigned to the YAP Youth Update Youth, Staff and Partner Contact Information Follow up with YAP participants Help identifying new partners and communities Update the YAP Timeline and summarize weekly meeting notes Maintain support, confidentiality, and professionalism necessary to create a safe atmosphere of sharing, understanding, tolerance and mutual support. Qualifications: Currently in High School; Seniors Prefered; Must be able to commit for a minimum of 6 months, flexible schedule; Must be able to speak and write Haitian Creole or French; Proficiency in using social media platforms including Facebook, Google Hangout, Twitter and Instagram Be familiar with Google Spreadsheets, Google Doc, Google Hangout, and Salesforce (or be willing to receive basic training for use of these systems); Detailed oriented, responsible, organized, sociable with excellent communication skills; Strong listening and communication skills; Practical problem-solving skills and ability to suggest options and alternatives; and Sensitivity to persons of different educational, economic, cultural or ethnic backgrounds.

10002.description: Bike New York offers free bike education classes in all five boroughs from April to October, and they are all taught with help from our wonderful volunteers. Training only takes an hour, and the volunteer commitment is totally up to you. Learn how to teach someone to ride and you'll change someone's life!

GP can provide training if applicant has other database experience Trailhead is a prerequisite. Takes Initiative and interest in problem solving Steadfast commitment to collaboration and teamwork

10002.description: Global Potential's mission is to empower youth and communities around the world to energize each other through education, international service learning, social entrepreneurship and cultural exchange. Each year, Global Potential trains 500 youth aged between 15 to 23. These youth have high potential and self-vision to become leaders, change makers and social entrepreneurs in their urban and rural low-income communities around the world. Most GP participants are first generation immigrant youth and originate from dozens of countries. Global Potential's holistic model positively transforms the lives of urban youth.They shape the future and become leaders and entrepreneurs in business, community development, education and politics. For more information please visit www.global-potential.org The College and Career Access Coordinator will be responsible for facilitating college and career readiness workshops with GP youth (high school juniors and seniors), compiling opportunities for youth in transition (scholarships, gap year programs, internships), and coordinating youth's participation in college and career events. Responsibilities include: Engage with GP Alumni to support them in their role as peer mentors Compile resources for postsecondary opportunities, including college applications, scholarships, internships, and gap year programs Provide coaching in writing resumes and personal statements Assist the Program Manager in preparing deliverables to the program funder Gather and maintain data in our Salesforce database system Coordinate college and career events with GP partner organization and high schools, including Q & A panels with GP Alumni Collaborate with Program Coordinators to plan and facilitate GP workshops Experience with serving undocumented youth in preparation for college (i.e. access to scholarships, outsourcing to organizations like the Door for applying for residency, having a roster of translators-specifically for our African youth). Requirements for this position: Experience in compiling college and career opportunities for high school youth Minimum of 3 months, preferably 6 months commitment. Minimum of 10-15 hours per week Available to work in the office at least one day/week Flexible to work offsite at GP's partner high schools Experience with Salesforce or any other database management system is not required but preferred; GP will provide training No language requirements; Spanish, Haitian Creole, or French preferred Currently attending College in New York City; College Degree in any discipline preferred. This is a pilot program so there is an opportunity to bring one's own creativity and ideas to further develop the program. This position reports to and works collaboratively with the Program Manager. We are looking for an immediate start. If interested in this role, please send your resume to hr@global-potential.org indicating the title, ' College and Career Access Coordinator', in the subject line.
