MJHS Hospice Volunteer opportunities include: Providing support and companionship to patients and their families Participating in leisure activities such as reading, listening to music, playing games with patients Supporting or organizing group activities for patients Listening compassionately to patients and their families Providing office or clerical support for our hospice team Complementary therapies Requirements for all categories of volunteers: 18 years or older 15 hours of training (4 hours training for clerical/office volunteers) Background Check (no charge to applicant) Medical Clearance (no charge to applicant) 3-4 hours per week 1 year commitment Required skills for patient visits: discretion, patience, compassion and dedication Preferred clerical and office support skills include: receptionist skills, computer skills, organizational skills and filing For more information on how to become a MJHS Hospice Volunteer please call: Bronx: Tiara Moultrie, Coordinator of Volunteer Services; (347) 988-4043 or tmoultri@mjhs.org
10466.title: Be Part of Someone's Legacy--Become a Hospice Volunteer in the Bronx!

10466.description: Artsmith is a new nonprofit providing arts programming to children in the Bronx, NY. We are looking for committed and vibrant individuals to help us execute our fundraising and marketing events. Events include: Family art programs Art shows/exhibits Annual gala Seminars/workshops Commumity art fair Volunteer opportunities span a wide range depending on event and include, but are not limited to: Setting up and breaking down events Working concessions or other event activities Photo/Video Procuring guests/speakers Promoting events Creating sponsorship packages Other duties as assigned Some opportunities may be good for groups. Please contact us to discuss ways in which you can help.
10466.title: Event Planning/Fundraising Volunteers

11550.description: Not-for-profit agency is seeking a highly motivated, energetic and creative volunteer to work alongside the Program Manager in finding speakers and programs that would be of interest to guests coming to Long Island’s largest Soup Kitchen, the Mary Brennan INN (located in Hempstead). Past workshops have included topics such as yoga, medication, sports talk, art and financial budgeting. We are looking to offer a wide-variety of programs at different times of the day. The volunteer candidate must be friendly, professional, computer literate, organized and excellent communication skills.
11550.title: Enrichment Activities Coordinator

11550.description: Not-for-profit agency is seeking a highly skilled person to work in the administrative office, alongside our Grants Coordinator and Director of Development, in the area of grant research, documentation and reporting. Volunteer must be knowledgeable and great at writing and/or researching grants (grant funding from corporations, financial institutions, private and family foundations, as well as NY state contracts). We will train you on web research using the Foundation Center tools and our internal database program. If you have a general understanding of how grant funding works for non-profit agencies, we’d like to meet you. Please contact Dorian Stern, Director of Development, at dstern@the-inn.org to arrange an appointment to meet and discuss the opportunity.
11550.title: Grant Writer/Researcher

11550.description: Not-for-profit agency is seeking highly skilled fast paced, energetic volunteers that are pleasant, caring, and courteous to work in Long Island's largest Soup Kitchen, as a Volunteer Coordinator. Volunteer Coordinator will assist staff in ensuring that all volunteers are assigned to specific tasks and that each area of the soup kitchen is sufficiently covered. Volunteer Coordinators must be flexible in assisting wherever they are needed and must work with the Managers to maintain safe mealtime standards in accordance with the agency's policies and procedures. Volunteer Coordinators must follow directions and work well on a team, be punctual, dependable, friendly, respectful and a good communicator. They must also have the ability to respond to emergency situations while maintaining composure and demonstrating appropriate professionalism and restraint at all times. Volunteer Coordinators must have the physical stamina to stand for long periods of time. Volunteer Coordinators are needed for each day of the week, Mon-Fri, during the hours of 8:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m.
11550.title: Volunteer Coordinator

11550.description: The Center for Transformative Change (CTC) serves as a consultative referral center for guests of the Mary Brennan INN Soup Kitchen. The center is seeking a Receptionist to meet, greet and check-in guests who are requesting services; monitor incoming phone calls and file away guest folders. The ideal volunteer must be a people person, team player and friendly, professional, able to communicate well, multi-task, be organized, and be flexible in assisting wherever they are needed. We are looking for receptionists to fill the days and hours below: Monday through Thursday - 11:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.
11550.title: Receptionist - Center for Transformative Change

11550.description: Long Island's largest Soup Kitchen, the Mary Brennan INN, is seeking a Receptionist to meet and greet volunteers and donors; monitor incoming phone calls and accept and record donations. The ideal volunteer must be a people person, team player and friendly, professional, able to communicate well, multi-task, be organized, and be flexible in assisting wherever they are needed. We are looking for receptionists to fill the hours below: Tuesdays & Thursdays from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Mon, Wed & Fri from 2 p.m. to 5 p.m.
11550.title: Receptionist - Mary Brennan INN Soup Kitchen

11550.description: The INN is seeking volunteers for the Mary Brennan INN, Long Islands largest soup kitchen. Duties include, but are not limited to, preparing and serving a meal, sorting items, stacking shelves, organizing and cleaning. Volunteers must be friendly and flexible.
11550.title: Soup Kitchen Volunteer

11550.description: The INN is seeking volunteers with backgrounds in Social Work or Health & Human Services for its new Center for Transformative Change (CTC). The CTC is located adjacent to the existing Mary Brennan INN, the largest soup kitchen on Long Island, and is designed to serve as a consultative referral center for guests of the Mary Brennan INN. Guests will be referred for services and programs that meet their needs for issues such as housing, educational program, employment, health care, etc. Volunteers with Spanish language skills are also needed. The CTC is expected to open January 2016. Currently seeking volunteers on Tuesdays and Thursdays: 9:00-12:00PM / Wednesdays: 12:30-3:00PM
11550.title: New Program Opportunity

11550.description: The INN is a not-for-profit organization that addresses the needs of hungry and homeless Long Islanders. We are currently seeking volunteers who are willing to assist in our clothing boutique to (1) help sort through clothing donations and stock/re-stock the boutique; and (2) volunteers who are friendly and can assist guests in choosing clothing from the boutique. Various times available. Affluent in Spanish is not a requirement but a plus. For more information about The INN go to www.the-inn.org
11550.title: Clothing Boutique Volunteers

11550.description: The Mental Health Association of Nassau County’s Compeer program is expanding its program to serve youth. Compeer matches caring adult volunteers with youth ages 5-17 who are in the recovery process toward better Mental Health. Mentors spend an hour per week providing friendship, support and a positive role model through community-based activities enjoyable to both the Mentor and the youth. We are currently accepting applications for referrals and volunteers. If you are interested in volunteering or know a child that can benefit from the program please call Rhea Spina at 516-489-2322 x 1260.
11550.title: Compeer Youth Program - Making a Difference in a Child's Life
11550.org: Mental Health Association of Nassau County, Inc.

11550.description: Food Not Bombs Mission Statement:Food Not Bombs recovers and shares free vegan or vegetarian food with the public without restriction in over 1,000 cities around the world to protest war, poverty and the destruction of the environment. Each group is independent and invites everyone to participate in making decisions for their local chapter using the consensus process. Food Not Bombs is dedicated to taking nonviolent direct action to change society so no one is forced to stand in line to eat at a soup kitchen expressing a commitment to the fact that food is a right and not a privilege. With over a billion people going hungry each day how can we spend another dollar on war? Hello Neighbor,I'm a volunteer with Long Island Food Not Bombs (LIFNB.com).We have Free Food Shares (Free Food, Clothing, Books, Baby Items, Household Items, Art, etc.) throughout Long Island and Brooklyn. Depends what donations we get from stores, churches, neighbors and volunteers. Usually there are fruits, vegetables, milk, dairy, bread, cakes, pies, canned and dry goods, pet food, etc. We also have clothes, household & baby items, books, art, etc. depending what is brought to the Food Shares that day.Ask for Volunteer Jon or Rose if you have something to share. Say hello for me. Thank you, Volunteer Dennis A new release video: We start at 13:55: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fixP0UR_G_UCraigslist Post:Free \"Long Island Food Not Bombs\" Food SharesEvery Sunday at 2 PM, West Columbia Street & Station Plaza, Hempstead, NY 11550Every Tuesday at 7 PM, East 6th Street & Fairground Avenue, Huntington NY 11746Every Thursday at 7 PM, Horseblock Road & Woodycrest Drive, Farmingville, NY 11738Every Saturday at 12 PM, noon, 1556 Straight Path, Wyandanch, NY 11798Every Saturday at 3 PM, Lafayette Ave & Marcy Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11216All outdoors. Rain or Shine. No umbrellas or strollers by tables.Come Share With Your Community.Free Food, Clothing, Books, Baby Items, Household Items, Art, etc.Whatever is brought by our Volunteers, You (if you can) and Your Neighbors in Your Community.A Community is its Neighbors, not the towns they are in.Get there a few minutes before start time. Help us unload our Volunteers vehicles and set up tables.Bring empty bags, food, clothing, household items, baby items, books, etc to \"Share with Your Community\".See Volunteers if you do bring items to Share, or you want to volunteer to hand food and items out. Say hello for me, Dennis. Nothing to bring? Then bring yourselves.We'll help you get food and items you need. You don't need to bring any type of papers or ID to our Food Shares.Everyone is welcome to get Free Food, Clothing, Household Items, Baby Items, Books, Art, etc. Depends what is brought by our volunteers and other neighbors to share.We average 8,000 pounds of food and merchandise each Food Share.Just please be polite with your neighbors when we Share.We will not tolerate any type of racial slurs or bigotry.Please thank and help our Volunteers by taking recyclable cardboard (boxes to take home your food and items). Put out on your recycle day for pick up.More info go to our website: LIFNB.com Start Sharing:1) Pass this on to family, friends and neighbors in your community. 2) Copy flyers at LIFNB.com or this Craigslist post. Hand them out. Schools, Libraries, Senior Centers, Churches, Stores, etc.3) Maybe you are an owner, manager or employee of a store, supermarket, distributor, wholesaler, farm, or manufacturer. Do you have soon to be expired food, drinks and/or merchandise you will be throwing out?Help us help you save money. Less carting fees. Great Community Relations.Call the Hotline (631) 223-4370 - 10 AM - 2 PM.4) Next time you are in a store where you shop. Ask the owner or manager if they would like to donate soon to be expired food, drinks and/or merchandise they will be throwing out shortly. We'll pick up and they save money on carting fees and help the community. Give our Hotline Number (631) 223-4370 - 10 AM - 2 PM.5) Share on Facebook:\"Friend\" - Li FNB\"Like\" - Long Island Food Not Bombs6) Become one of our volunteers. Come and join us.No Food Shares in your area, volunteers will help you start one.We are not affiliated with any religion, church or political party. Community churches do donate food and items to our Food Shares.\"Long Island Food Not Bombs\" is the largest \"Food Not Bombs\" in the World.We do all this with no government funding, all volunteers. Volunteer to help us obtain funding.We are always in need of Plastic Folding Tables for our Food Shares. Donate when you can at: http://www.LIFNB.comThank you, Volunteer Dennis Peace
11550.title: Hempstead Food Share - LIFNB

11550.description: EAC Network Senior Respite is a not-for-profit program helping older adults and their caregivers in Nassau County. You choose days,times and areas where you can visit a homebound older adult. You will visit once a week for 2-6 hours to socialize and enjoy purposeful activities, such as talking, walking, arts and crafts, playing cards. You are not expected to provide personal care. This visit allows the family member caring for the homebound person to get out for a regular break. We offer free training and we pay a wage of $9.00 an hour if you are interested; not necessary if you are not.
11550.title: Visit an older adult

11550.description: Not-for-profit agency is seeking volunteers to join their Speakers Bureau. Volunteers will speak to community groups, schools, religious organizations and companies about issues of hunger and homelessness on Long Island, the services the agency provides and how others can get involved. All volunteers will receive the training and support required to successfully speak to the public on their behalf. Candidates must be comfortable with public speaking, have the ability to speak passionately and confidently to large and diverse audiences, be friendly, flexible, and able to work with the public tactfully, courteously and effectively. For further information please contact Cynthia Sucich, Director of Communications, at (516) 486-8506ext. 115.
11550.title: Speakers Bureau Volunteers

11550.description: Not-for-profit agency is seeking an office volunteer with Microsoft Office and Internet knowledge. Candidate should be friendly, dependable and able to work in a fast-paced environment. Duties include: data entry, internet research, follow-up phone calls, mail merges, and filing. Flexible schedule. For further information please contact Cynthia Sucich, Director of Communications, at (516) 486-8506 ext. 115.
11550.title: Office Volunteer

11550.description: This position requires a people person. *The ideal volunteer will assist staff and volunteers in the main dining area during the meal period. *Assisting Hispanic speaking guests in making their needs known. *The Bi-lingual volunteer will also address the guests during the pre-meal announcements. *This volunteer position also involves assisting the on grounds social worker in the area of translation with Hispanic speaking guests, when necessary. For more information about The INN go to www.the-inn.org
11550.title: Bi-Lingual Interpreter

11550.description: The Players is an improvisational theater troupe performs vignettes that show audiences what it's like to live with a psychiatric disability, how the illness itself, the lack of support services and public attitudes impact on individuals with mental illnesses and those around them. The cast remains in character and responds to questions after each performance while a skilled mental health facilitator moderates the discussion. The Players perform at no cost at different locations such as PTAs meetings, schools, religious groups and civic and community organizations.
11550.title: Mental Health Players
11550.org: Mental Health Association of Nassau County, Inc.

11550.description: Use the power of friendship to help people with mental illnesses live happier, more productive lives. Compeer volunteers spend about an hour a week with a new friend who is matched by gender, age, location and mutual interests. Orientation and supervision provided.
11550.title: Compeer - Making friends, changing lives
11550.org: Mental Health Association of Nassau County, Inc.

10464.description: One World Arts, Inc is searching for a part-time administrative assistant to handle the day-to-day communications for the director and employees in the organization. Answer calls; take messages, schedules meetings and rehearsals. Attend meetings and take notes. Create and maintain office documents such as letters, invoices, financial reports, data sheets; filing and maintain files current. Prepare drafts of press releases and create flyers. Enter data and maintain mailing lists. Respond to email inquiries and follow up on calls. Outreach to prospective presenters and vendors. Must know Mac computers and software as well as Microsoft Office. Knowledge of maintaining Social media helpful. Bi-lingual - Spanish, a big plus.
10464.title: Administrative Assistant - Part time

10464.description: GallopNYC uses therapeutic horsemanship to help riders walk, talk, connect, focus, behave and learn, inspiring each one to live life as fully, productively and independently as possible. Volunteers are needed to assist our riders on horse back. Volunteers lead horses or walk alongside them during lessons. Classes are conducted by a trained instructor. We have a great team of volunteers and we really love what we do. One of our riders said \"When I ride my horse I feel free.\" We love making that free feeling possible -- plus we see very concrete achievements in our riders' abilities. Our riders have a wide range of disabilities, but all of them enjoy riding and are a joy to to work with. The horses are nice too! We conduct lessons seven days a week at four different locations and could use your help! Email us today and we will provide you with the dates of upcoming orientation sessions for new volunteers.. Experience with horses is helpful but not at all necessary. Please contact us for more info on how to become a volunteer at: volunteer@gallopnyc.org Or visit our website at: http://gallopnyc.org/how-to-help/volunteer/
10464.title: Volunteer With a Therapeutic Horsemanship Program in the Bronx (Pelham Bay Park)

10465.description: Purpose Lead seniors in weekly arts and crafts activities that allow them to explore their creative side. Responsibilities Prepare weekly arts & crafts lessons for seniors Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills Experience teaching arts & crafts is a must Experience working with seniors is helpful, but not required Comfortable leading individuals with varying ability through activities Patience Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
10465.title: Art Instructor - JASA Throggs Neck Senior Center

10462.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
10462.title: Bronx, NY: Autism Volunteer

11554.description: Make a REAL DIFFERENCE by assisting an Individual with a Disability in a weekly Exercise and/or Socialization Program! We provide Group Fitness Training and Socialization Programs to Individuals with ALL type of Abilities. Locations in Nassau and Suffolk Counties. Clean and friendly environment. Great for Students, Seniors or anyone wanting to simply GIVE BACK. Flexible hours and days avilable. THANK YOU!
11554.title: Assist an Individual with a Disability in a weekly Exercise and/or Socialization Program.

10460.description: We are looking for volunteers who are passionate about youth leadership and development. Volunteers will provide coaching for elementary school students who are struggling academically especially in English Language arts.
10460.title: Academic Support Volunteer, IS190
10460.org: The Children's Aid Society - New York, NY

10461.description: We are seeking an energetic, creative and dedicated Program Coordinator Intern to assist in overseeing and managing the operationg of our Theater Programs! Duties will include: Providing support and assistance to Teaching Artists Performing program evaluation of Theater Programs Coordinating Theater performances and events Maintaing records and databse of theater students After 3 months of internship, opportunity to be paid at $20-25.00 hourly. Interested? Email hrm@iraiseinc.org today!
10461.title: Program Coordinator Intern, Theater Programs

10461.description: We are looking for a talented social media manager to create and maintain a strong online presence for our non-profit art center. Your role will be to implement online marketing strategies through social media accounts. If you are a tech-savvy professional with an interest in marketing our art programs and events through online channels, we would like to meet you. As a social media manager, you will develop original content and suggest creative ways to attract more students and promote our presence within a growing cultural community. Duties Research audience preferences and discover current trends Create engaging text, image and video content Design posts to sustain reader’s curiosity and create buzz around new programs and events Measure web traffic and monitor SEO Stay up-to-date with changes in all social platforms Train organizational team members to use social media in a cohesive and beneficial way Facilitate online conversations with audience and respond to queries This is ideal for an individual that has a sincere and dedicated interest in helping a small non-profit art organization grow. If you are interested, please email your resume and a brief cover letter to w2acorg@gmail.com or call (718) 684-4589 to schedule an interview.
10461.title: Volunteer Social Media Manager

10461.description: ArTech is a place for artists of all kinds and abilities to create and express themselves through a variety of mediums. In addition to traditional styles such as painting, weaving, and photography, ArTech lives up to its name by introducing innovative technology such as virtual reality, 360-degree video recording, Eyegaze , drawing tablets, and more. Seeking artists who would like to showcase their original art work; drawing, painting, arts and crafts, jewelry making, sculpture, etc... In additional to having work on display, artists will be asked to demonstrate and discuss artistic process to a small group of approx. 6 or 8 people and then work side by side with them in a hands on workshop.
10461.title: Artists: Show Your Work at ArTech Bronx, NY

10461.description: Bronx Real PROS offers recovery-oriented and rehabilitation services for individuals 18 years and older who are living with mental illness. Participants develop personalized recovery plans to realize life role goals and integrate into the community. As a Greeter at Bronx Real PROS, you will sit at the desk in the lobby, greeting people who enter the building, directing them to the right floor in case they have a question about the program location, reach out to staff to confirm a client’s appointment location.
10461.title: Greeter - Bronx (Westchester  Square)
10461.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10461.description: Bronx Real PROS offers recovery-oriented and rehabilitation services for individuals 18 years and older who are living with mental illness. Participants develop personalized recovery plans to realize life role goals and integrate into the community. As a Music Group Leader, you will have the opportunity to develop and lead a music class. This could mean a number of different things, not limited to music therapy with instruments, a drum circle, or a music appreciation class to learn about different genres and artists.
10461.title: Music Group Leader - Bronx (Westchester Square)
10461.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10461.description: Bronx Real PROS offers recovery-oriented and rehabilitation services for individuals 18 years and older who are living with mental illness. Participants develop personalized recovery plans to realize life role goals and integrate into the community. As a GED Tutor at Bronx Real PROS, you will teach our adult clients one on one or in groups with individuals seeking to pass their G.E.D. exam. Progam is open 9am-4pm, M-F. Time comittment and hours are flexible within the hours of program operations.
10461.title: GED Tutor- Bronx
10461.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10461.description: Bronx Real PROS offers recovery-oriented and rehabilitation services for individuals 18 years and older who are living with mental illness. Participants develop personalized recovery plans to realize life role goals and integrate into the community. As a Healthy Lifestyle and Nutrition Coach, you will lead a group of participants in how to live a healthy life, by first choosing affordable foods to eat. You can also introduce new and healthy recipes with fresh ingredients or go grocery shopping and cook with our Bronx Real PROS clients.
10461.title: Healthy Lifestyle and Nutrition Coach- Bronx
10461.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10461.description: Supervising the visits between parents and the children in our foster care and preventive services program.
10461.title: Assist our caseworkers - Supervise a family visit!

10461.description: Help Leake & Watts look after children while their parents receive services and attend classes with our agency. Activities include arts and crafts. There’s an 8 week commitment necessary. Parenting sessions run every Tuesday evening from May through June.
10461.title: Childcare Supervisor

10461.description: Lead some of our kids in exercises designed to teach the ins and outs of robotic engineering using Legos. Background in robotics and engineering required.
10461.title: Robotics = FUN! - Lead Lego Robitics Seminars for our children

10461.description: Teach courses pertaining to various elements of financial literacy to some of our parents and older children throughout our different programs. Topics should include budget creation and management, how to open up a bank account etc, but will also have room for various other types of lessons.
10461.title: Money Matters- Teach Financial Literacy

10461.description: Become a Mentor today with Leake & Watts, a community based, non-profit organization in New York City, committed to addressing a myriad of challenges that confront individuals and families dealing with poverty, disabilities, and a lack of access to education and basic services.
10461.title: Mentor a Teen

10461.description: After school tutors are needed to work with our teens in our Foster Boarding Home program. The subject to be worked on is Algebra 1. Volunteers MUST be able to commit to at least two hours every week to work with our students. The goal is to prepare them for their New York State Regents exam, so consistency is key.
10461.title: Regents Prep for Algebra 1

10461.description: Our Caseworkers need the assistance of people skilled with clerical work, or who have previous experience as a receptionist. We could also benefit from someone who can help us archive our case files. It's also a great opportunity for professional development, and a chance to spruce up your resume!
10461.title: Be an Office Assistant!

10504.description: We welcome all volunteers of every age, especially for help with book signings, charity events and in the future literacy and music programs in Westchester Library's; music outreach in NY schools in underserved areas. We will be more than happy to write letters of recommendation for volunteers that give our Foundation help.
10504.title: Volunteers

10507.description: Protect our environment and the special world in which we live. Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New York citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Together we can protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. Want to know more? Please join our weekly Introductory Conference Call. The next one is on Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. It is a live call, about an hour long, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. Please register for the call at this link so that we can follow up with you: https://citizensclimatelobby.org/join-weekly-intro-call/ We look forward to working with you!
10507.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Westchester County NY

10507.description: We are actively seeking volunteer Puppy Raisers to care for our adorable, purpose-bred dogs during the first eighteen months of their lives. Raisers teach puppies house manners and basic obedience while socializing them to the everyday world, thus laying the foundation for success in guide dog training. Guiding Eyes provides extensive support including weekly obedience classes, free veterinary care and local assistance. To find out more about our Puppy Raising Program please visit our website: www.guidingeyes.org or call us at 1-866 GEB LABS (1-866 432 5227).
10507.title: Do something extraordinary – raise a future guide dog in Westchester County, NY!

10469.description: Volunteer with Behind the Book (www.behindthebook.org), a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to love reading. Through our innovative programs, accomplished authors lead workshops in high-needs classrooms, where they guide students in creating their own writing and art projects based on the theme of the author's book. No experience or training is necessary to work with pre-K-12 students. As a writing, research or art coach, you'll engage and encourage their progress on a project. This workshop needs your support at an elementary school in the Bronx: Program CIMA0215 Tuesday, March 7th, 2017 8:15 - 9:15 AM Research/Writing Coach This 10th-grade class read Marc Aronson’s Sugar Changed the World to learn the interesting cultural history of sugar. The author will lead two classroom workshops tracing the history of the product from its use in religious ceremonies to its role in the slave trade. With the support of coaches, students will embark on their own research project and report. For details about other Behind the Book programs around the city, visit http://www.behindthebook.org/current-volunteer-opportunities/ To join our team and receive announcements of new volunteer opportunities, please complete our brief questionnaire at http://www.behindthebook.org/join-us/volunteer/
10469.title: Inspire Bronx, NYC public school students to love reading

10469.description: By delivering free tax preparation to community college students and their parents, NHS of North Bronx hopes to help them access tax credits and refunds which can be used towards tuition, thereby increasing their chances of staying in school and securing gainful employment. The Tax Preparer will provide basic tax return preparation for eligible taxpayers at NHS of North Bronx tax sites in neighborhoods around the Bronx and Manhattan. S/he will establish the greatest degree of public trust, providing free high-quality service and upholding the highest of ethical standards. No previous tax preparation experience necessary; all training will be provided. This is a great opportunity for candidates interested in finance, auditing or accounting and who enjoy making a positive impact on others.
10469.title: VITA Tax Preparer

10469.description: I'RAISE Offers an exciting and rewarding opporunity to individuals seeking to become a role model and make a positive impact on younger youth. This exciting opportunity includes one on one mentoring, group mentoring and/or mentoring. Mentors work with mentees on developing goals for their life that will help them make social, emotional and educational gains! Ideal candidates include college students. students who need internship experience/volunteer experience, retired professionals or individuals who simply want to make a difference! If you are seeking an opportunity to invest in a youth and make a positive difference.
10469.title: Big Brother/Big Sister Mentor

10469.description: Purpose Lead a weekly class to increase seniors’ knowledge of computers and internet applications. Responsibilities Create weekly lessons for a small group of seniors with varied computer abilities Guide seniors step by step through Microsoft office, navigating the internet and composing emails Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Additional tasks may include assistance with cell phones and iPads Skills Have a good general knowledge of computer operations including internet applications and Microsoft Office. Experience working with seniors is helpful, but not required Patience Strong communication skills Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
10469.title: Computer Coach - JASA Sue Ginsburg Senior Center

07470.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07470.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07470.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07470.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07470.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation. And mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some well needed smiles.
07470.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice

07470.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07470.title: Hospice Volunteer

07470.description: The Browse N Shop is a community thrift store run by the Wayne PTO. All proceeds go towards scholarships from Wayne Hills and Wayne Valley students. The store has been in the same location since 1978 and over the years we've added shelves and racks as donations came in but its become a hodge podge. Next year we will be 60(!) and would love to have a more cohesive, welcoming look. Some challenges include our location (basement), small windows (basement) and concrete walls (basement). Unfortunately we lack a real budget and can't make structural changes but we have wonderful volunteers and open minds. Contact us for more information. We are a laid back, happy store and look forward to meeting others with similar outlooks!
07470.title: Redecorating Thrift Store
07470.org: Wayne PTO Browse N Shop Thrift Store

07470.description: The Browse N Shop is a community thrift store run by the Wayne PTO. All proceeds go towards scholarships from Wayne Hills and Wayne Valley students. We need help organizing the store and helping with sales on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Volunteers can volunteer for as little as an hour weekly. We are open from 10am-6pm although we need the most help around lunchtime. Contact us for more information. We are a laid back, happy store and look forward to meeting others with similar outlooks!
07470.title: Thrift Store Organization
07470.org: Wayne PTO Browse N Shop Thrift Store

07470.description: Games Galore and More is a team of volunteers who assist the staff of a long-term care senior facility with fun activities while engaging residents in meaningful and friendly conversation, board and card games and reading to the residents. This is a wonderful opportunity to brighten the life of someone who may normally not have the opportunity to connect with others outside of their families and the organization's staff. This is the perfect project for individuals, families, friends and loved ones. Volunteer today and let the games begin! You are welcome to bring you own games or use the games at the facility. Also, calling all musicians who would like to perform informally for the residents. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07470.title: Games Galore in Wayne

07470.description: Sebastien has just moved into a sheltered apartment and is feeling very proud and independent. He is 21 years old and full of energy and a love of fun. He is particularly fond of ice hockey both on TV and going to games. Music is another favorite and he has over 5000 songs on his ipod. Seby is in need of a young volunteer with similar interests and energywho will be a good role model of how to manage oneself out in the community.
07470.title: Sebastian LOVES ice hockey and ice cream.

07470.description: Calling all book lovers! Are you looking for the perfect opportunity to combine your love of literature with a way to give back? Read along with some seniors with Book Buddies in Wayne. It's a great opportunity to socialize with some lovely seniors and do good--all at once. The seniors in this wing of a long-term care facility have Alzheimer's disease, and reading aloud to them helps stimulate and socialize them. Sign up today! This project is BYOB--your own book, that is. The ideal book is short and visual. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07470.title: Book Buddies in Wayne

07470.description: We are in great need of male volunteers to serve this population and be positive adult role models to the boys in our program. Please consider giving just a few hours of your time each week to make a lifelong difference to a child. Court Appointed Special Advocates are volunteers who are appointed by the Family Court to advocate in the best interest of young adults and youth in foster care. CASA volunteers are trained to be a voice for children who are in the foster care system due to abuse or neglect. Unfortunately boys make up a larger percentage of the children in care and stay longer than girls. Passaic County CASA supervises and provides support for volunteers as we work towards the common goal of improving the lives of foster children. Currently, over 500 children are waiting for a volunteer to speak up for them and to ensure that they don't fall between the cracks of the system. Visit www.passaiccountycasa.org for more information
07470.title: Male Advocate for Boys in foster care
07470.org: CASA for Children of Passaic County

07470.description: Court Appointed Special Advocates are volunteers who advocate for the best interest of a child in foster care. CASA volunteers are trained to be a voice for children who are in the foster care system due to abuse or neglect. These children are caught in the tangle of the legal system and need someone to speak up for them. Volunteers visit their assigned child twice per month, review records, interview invovled parties and attend court hearings as well as write reports to submit to the Judge. Passaic County CASA supervises and provides support for volunteers as we work towards the common goal of improving the lives of foster children. Currently, over 500 children are waiting for a volunteer to speak up for them and to ensure that they don't fall between the cracks of the system.
07470.title: Child Advocate/Mentor
07470.org: CASA for Children of Passaic County

07470.description: Help adults with disabilities experience the works of the Great Masters by introducing them to a masterpiece and leading a related art project. This is a brand new program at our adult day program in Wayne. Volunteers are a part of the planning process and then will be asked to lead a lesson 1-3 times a month or provide one-on-one help to participants during the lesson. This program takes place on the second, third, and fourth Wednesday of every month 9:30am-11:30am. Volunteers are not required to attend every session.
07470.title: Art appreciation

07470.description: Substance abuse is growing and knows no boundaries. Our main purpose is to educate the community about the dangers and arm them with the tools needed to avoid making dangerous choices. From children to young adults and senior citizens; we have a different message for each group. Please help us to educate the community and reduce substance abuse in our lifetime. Support our organization while networking for your own group or using your skills to shine while helping us to fight Alcohol, Tobacco and other Drug abuse in Wayne. Support us with your specific talent or join in and we'll help you find a way to participate! Call 973-694-1800 x 3244 or write: alliance@waynetownship.com to join us. Please considering following us on FACEBOOK, too! Needs: We are currently searching for a Volunteer Coordinator to be an ambassador to our new volunteers and to help bring our message to the local Senior Citizen Groups. Office: filing, typing, direct mail assistance, photography, press releases, fundraising. Events: hand out flyers and help convey our message to the community. Event Photographer News Release: Print and video Internet promotion/social media Apply for funding and solicit sponsors Search out new grants and sponsors Seacrh out new educational programs and find funding
07470.title: Volunteer Ambassador, Public Relations Volunteer: Educate the Community-Wipe Out Substance Abuse
07470.org: Wayne Alliance for the Prevention of Substance Abuse

07470.description: Passaic County CASA (Court Appointed Special Advocates) is seeking members for the Board of Trustees who has a sincere desire to help our kids, combined with the talent to do so! The ideal candidates will have a business, medical, legal or fundraising background. If you have the desire to actively become involved in a cause that will become one of the most worthwhile causes that you will associate yourself with throughout your life, please contact us. Board members must commit to attending meetings on the 4th Wednesday of the month.
07470.title: Board of Trustee Member
07470.org: CASA for Children of Passaic County

07470.description: Court Appointed Special Advocates are volunteers who are appointed by the Family Court to advocate in the best interest of a child in foster care. CASA volunteers are trained to be a voice for children who are in the foster care system due to abuse or neglect. These children are caught in the tangle of the legal system and need someone to speak up for them. Volunteers make recommendations for the benefit of the child in terms of placement and services. Passaic County CASA supervises and provides support for volunteers as we work towards the common goal of improving the lives of foster children. Currently, over 500 children are waiting for a volunteer to speak up for them and to ensure that they don't fall between the cracks of the system.
07470.title: Child Advocate for Children in Foster Care
07470.org: CASA for Children of Passaic County

07470.description: Who we are: Passaic County CASA (Court Appointed Special Advocates) provides advocacy for children in the Passaic County, NJ foster care system- currently over 500 children are waiting for a volunteer to speak up for them and to ensure that they don't fall between the cracks of the system. The Role: CASA volunteers are trained to advocate for children who are in the foster care system due to abuse or neglect. These children are caught in the tangle of the legal system and need someone to speak up for them. CASA volunteers are responsible for recommending the best interests of their assigned child in the court process and facilitating with professionals. Please join us!
07470.title: Court Appointed Special Advocate
07470.org: CASA for Children of Passaic County

07450.description: Swim one on one with a chidl/adult with mental and/or physical challenges. Teach swim skills, socialization and recreation with class participants. Classes meet on mondays/wednesdays and fridays 4:30-5:15pm. You may pick one day a week or more and classes run all year. You do not have to commit to all year and can switch days each week if you need to.
07450.title: Special Swim Assistant

07450.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE Provide excellent and enthusiastic customer service to enhance the blood donor experience. Engage with blood donors to make the donation experience fulfilling and set the stage for a long-term commitment to regular blood donations. Understand the American Red Cross core mission, vision and values and represents these values through the delivery of excellent customer service. OPEN TIME DAYS Variable; Blood drives are 5 hours long REQUIRED TRAINING - Orientation to the American Red Cross - Donor Ambassador Training
07450.title: Assist with Blood Drives in our Community!: Blood Services- Donor Ambassador
07450.org: American Red Cross - New Jersey Region

07450.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE Assist the Red Cross in delivering its mission of alleviating human suffering caused by disasters as a member of the Disaster Action Team. Meet the immediate needs of disaster clients such as food, clothing, shelter and other services which may be needed. OPEN TIME DAYS Actively sign up for on-call shifts each month. ｠Choose your availability, three shifts per month minimum. REQUIRED TRAINING Training is free. ｠Minimum training includes General Volunteer Orientation, Disaster Cycle Services: An Overview, Disaster Action Team Fundamentals and FEMA IS-100.b, Introduction to Incident Command System. ｠
07450.title: alleviate human suffering caused by disasters, disaster action team: DAT (Disaster Action Team) Trai
07450.org: American Red Cross - New Jersey Region

07450.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE Join the Disaster Action Team and become a Trainee to assist Red Cross in delivering its mission by alleviating human suffering caused by disasters OPEN TIME DAYS When the DAT Candidate completes required training and becomes a DAT Trainee, chooses availability on an availability and rotation schedule (day, night, weekends), minimum of three shifts per month. REQUIRED TRAINING • Orientation to the American Red Cross • Disaster Services: An Overview (required)
07450.title: Become a Disaster Action Team candidate to respond to local disasters and assist those affected in y
07450.org: American Red Cross - New Jersey Region

07450.title: Prepare or deliver food to clients during a disaster: Mass Care Feeding-Trainee
07450.org: American Red Cross - New Jersey Region

07450.title: Meet client needs at a Red Cross shelter: Mass Care Shelter Worker-Trainee
07450.org: American Red Cross - New Jersey Region

07450.title: Support community partnership for disaster response: Community Partnerships Information Specialist
07450.org: American Red Cross - New Jersey Region

07450.title: Learn how to build community and business partnerships to support disaster response: Community Partn
07450.org: American Red Cross - New Jersey Region

07450.org: American Red Cross - New Jersey Region

07450.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE Become a volunteer in Disaster Cycle Services. Respond to community and larger disasters, support response as a member of a regional task group OPEN TIME DAYS Local response｠- Disaster Action Team (DAT)- on call weekdays, weekends and holidays; allowances can be made to account for volunteers' work schedules.｠Three shifts a month required. Regional and state deployment - requires｠a minimum of｠one week. Deployment outside of NJ｠- requires a minimum of two weeks Regional Task Group｠- attend meetings as scheduled and work with the group as needed REQUIRED TRAINING Orientation to the American Red Cross is required. Disaster training is required, provided free of charge and is web-based and/or instructor-led in a classroom.｠ Initial basic courses include: Disaster Services: An Overview Disaster Action Team Fundamentals Shelter Fundamentals Feeding Fundamentals Casework and Recovery Planning Fundamentals Disaster Assessment Fundamentals Other courses are required for specific response roles.｠

Note some exercises may be scheduled during evenings and/or weekends. 07450.title: Join the North Jersey Region's Disaster Exercise Team: Exercise-Evaluation Team: Trainee
07450.org: American Red Cross - New Jersey Region

11561.description: MJHS Hospice provides a specialized program of care and services for end-of-life patients. MJHS Hospice provides care for pediatric and adult patients in homes, nursing homes, assisted living communities, inpatient facilities and hospitals. MJHS Hospice Volunteer opportunities include: Providing support and companionship to patients and their families Participating in leisure activities such as reading, listening to music, playing games with patients Supporting or organizing group activities for patients Listening compassionately to patients and their families Providing office or clerical support for our hospice team Complementary therapies Requirements for all categories of volunteers: 18 years or older 15 hours of training (4 hours training for clerical/office volunteers) Background Check (no charge to applicant) Medical Clearance (no charge to applicant) 3-4 hours per week 1 year commitment Required skills for patient visits: discretion, patience, compassion and dedication Preferred clerical and office support skills include: receptionist skills, computer skills, organizational skills and filing For more information on how to become a MJHS Hospice Volunteer please call: Queens and Nassau: Mical White-Huffstead, Volunteer Coordinator; 718-490-1900 or MHUFFSTE@MJHS.ORG
11561.title: Be Part of Someone's Legacy--Become a Hospice Volunteer!

10185.description: CALLING ALL ARTISTS! Painters, sculptors, illustrators, designers, et.al. The Arts @ Henson-Parks, Inc. would like to partner with local artists interested in showcasing their talents and crafts, while teaching art to local youths, and those who consider themselves \"youthful\". We will be conducting POP-UP Art Workshops one weekend day per month, starting in October 2016, in various locations around New York City and surrounding boroughs. We would promote your work and in return you would teach a workshop. The workshops are 2-4 hours for 1 day per month, usually a Saturday. We are open to what many would consider \"transitional\" mediums, as well as experimenting with various mediums, cultural themes, and the uncommon. Our mission is educational + recreational. If you are interested in a POP-UP pARTnership, we are interested in you! Equipment and instructional tools would be provided. Own/public transporation required. Please add TheArtsAtHensonParks@Yahoo.com to your contact list so that our reply is not treated as spam. #pARTnersInART #ArtED #pARTicipate
10185.title: Calling all ARTISTS! Showcase your work~ teach a pop-up ART class to youth.

10185.description: Social Media Manager / Content Editor maintains and curates our presence in the digital social sphere and develops innovative ways to interact with potential supporters and volunteers through new media. Maintains Social Media support staff’s adherence to all social media best practices and may also contribute own content.
10185.title: SOCIAL MEDIA MANAGER/ CONTENT EDITOR

10185.description: The Arts @ Henson-Parks, Inc. is looking for a volunteer to assist us with social media marketing, specifically with Twitter and Facebook, and all Google for Non-Profits platforms and applications. We are seeking an individual with writing skills (by trade or hobby), a great sense of brand marketing in relation to social media, and an engagement in Arts/ Culture / Kids. We are looking for someone to help coordinate our presence on various platforms by maintaining our multi-posts and enhancing our profile as a viable resource of community-based art education and recreation. But equally important are skills in search engine optimization (SEO), Google Ad Words application, and all the benefits of being a google nonprofit. For more information about our organization, visit our website: http://www.theartsathensonparks.com. Please add our email address theartsathensonparks@yahoo.com so that our reply to your inquiry is not treated as spam.
10185.title: Social Media Coordinator - Twitter, Instagram, Facebook

10185.description: The Arts @ Henson-Parks, Inc. is currently looking for individuals well-grounded in digital photography and videography to instruct kids ages 7-18y, grades 3-12, in the basics of digital photography and editing as part of our program called \"The Pupil Project\". Weekly instruction will include educational and recreational projects that tie-in to an end-of-program showcase. Volunteering is ongoing, conducted in multi-week sessions, throughout Queens, Brooklyn, the Bronx and Manhattan. It entails a commitment of 1 days per week, 2 hours per day afterschool between the hours of 3-6pm during the school year starting Fall 2016. Equipment and instructional tools are provided. Own/public transporation required. #ThePupilProject #RedCameraCrew #pARTicipate For more information on the program visit our website: http://www.theartsathensonparks.com/programs/ .
10185.title: Photographers & Videographers -  Instruction to NYC Students after school

07501.description: Volunteers play an important role in the facilities' operation with meal preparation and service. As you are serving meals please interact with guests in conversation and clear their tables as needed. Volunteers will be deployed for the following tasks: Food Servers (2-3) Beverage Servers (1-2) Greeter (1-2) General Help (3) NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07501.title: Hunger Helpers in Paterson

07501.description: We are looking for volunteers 55 Plus to assist struggling first grade readers in a Paterson public school reading program. The volunteer will tutor the students twice a week to help them get to their reading grade level. The volunteer will meet on designated days to complete lessons provided by the coordinator. The volunteer must have a background check and fingerprinting, be fluent in English and have excellent reading skills. You must commit to two days a week (Mon/Wed or Tues/Thurs) from 3-5 pm. For additional information contact Stan at 973-784-4900, x202 or gabays@norwescap.org
07501.title: Become a Paterson Reader! Can you help tutor 1st Grade Readers!
07501.org: Skylands RSVP & Volunteer Resource Center sponsored by NORWESCAP

07501.description: St. Paul's Community Development Corporation (SPCDC) has partnered with the Paterson Public School District to facilitate the Full-Service Community School model which educates, nurtures and advocates comprehensive academic, social and health services for students, students' family members and community members that will result in improved educational outcomes for children. Through this partnership, St. Paul's Community Development Corporation (SPCDC) is committed to providing its students with the 21st century skills necessary to succeed in secondary and post-secondary education and to encourage positive attributes in order to achieve academic success in a safe and nurturing environment. We are seeking enthusiastic volunteers with all areas of skills, talents, and ideas to lead after-school clubs for grades K-5. Expertise is requested in the following areas for potential clubs: Arts & Crafts Fitness Newspaper & Culture Photography Books Dance & Music Science Drama Lego Creations Writing Math Tutoring Mentoring
07501.title: Full Service Community School Volunteer

07501.description: SPCDC requires the support of volunteers to help package 75-100 grocery bags per day for distribution to families in need. Individuals or groups are able to sign up for an available date or multiple dates (pending availability). This is a great way to engage with your community and help ensure that families have access to healthy and nutritious meals.
07501.title: Food Pantry Volunteer

07501.description: The St. Paul's Community Development Corporation -- Emergency Men's Shelter is in need of individuals or groups interested in preparing and serving meals to our homeless residents. Interested parties will schedule an available date, set the menu, prepare and serve the meal on the date in question. This is a wonderful activity for families or groups (including youth groups, Girl Scouts/Boy Scouts, sororities/fraternities, as well as other community and civic organizations). For available dates, please call 973-710-3900 ext 422.
07501.title: Emergency Men's Shelter -- Dinner Server

07501.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
07501.title: Paterson Area>>>Advice Counselor

07503.description: Licensed clinician needed to help with general issues.
07503.title: Licensed Clinician

07503.description: Volunteers needed to help with fundraising.
07503.title: Fundraising Help

07503.description: Volunteers needed to help with grant writing.
07503.title: Grant Writer

07509.description: CUMAC is the largest food distribution program in Passaic County, feeding over 2,600 low income individuals and families every month. Volunteers are needed to give vital assistance, sorting and bagging up fresh fruit and vegetables in CUMAC's warehouse. If the fresh produce is not available, volunteers will help sort canned goods. Volunteers should wear closed toed shoes and clothes they don't mind getting dirty. It is important to dress in layers as the warehouse doors are often open and it can get chilly. CUMAC has its own parking lot which volunteers are welcome to use. There is a tunnel entrance to the lot on your left just before the black train overpass. Please drive slowly as workers will be on the other side. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07509.title: Marketplace in Paterson

07508.description: My name is Michelle and I am a Host Family Coordinator with AnB Education. We are a Non-Profit Organization looking for willing host families in your area. We wanted to reach out with this opportunity to host an international exchange student in your local community. Every year thousands of host families across the United States welcome International Exchange Students, AnB Education is grateful to be working with hundreds of host families across the country. An exchange student not only attends school, but becomes immersed in our world. Host families welcome a new sons, daughters, sisters and brothers from across the world. To us Host Families, you, are an essential part of helping create a better world! Through the personal relationships, language and cultural immersion we can help teach tomorrow’s leaders today. Students provide for all their own financial needs, and host families are supported with a generous monthly reimbursement. Our International students need . . . -A caring and friendly host family who is willing to provide quiet space for studying, access to TV and internet, and access to laundry facilities. - A home where English is the primary language spoken -A private bedroom (not in the basement please) and a shared or private bathroom in a safe and clean environment. -Breakfast and dinner meals with host family during the week. (The student would buy their lunch at school) and 3 meals during the weekend. (Most international students like to share meals with their American hosts every day. They benefit from speaking English in relaxed, natural situations outside of their English courses. ) http://www.anbeducation.com/become-a-host-family.html
07508.title: Help Change the Life of an International Student, by Becoming a Host Family!

07508.description: \"We have absolutely loved having an exchange student. We have learned so much about another culture and have enjoyed introducing our student to American traditions. 07508.description: If you like to shop, Personal Shopping in Prospect Park is just the project for you! New Hope Community Ministries serves over 100 families a month through their mentoring and free grocery program. Volunteers are needed to interact with families by helping them sign in, \"shopping\" with them in the food pantry, and help monitor their grocery tab during the process. Join us by shopping with and getting to know a family and make a difference in their life! NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!

10954.description: Help Save Lives! Join the New York Blood Center Volunteer Team in the Hudson Valley area. Educate others about the importance of donating blood and enhance the donor experience at a blood drive. Greet and register donors, provide for donor safety by escorting and monitoring donors post donation. All volunteers are required to complete a volunteer application, a criminal background check and attend a 2 hour training/orientation session. Flexible assignments to choose from right in your own community.
10954.title: Ambassador Volunteer - Rockland Cnty

10954.description: Got an Hour? Looking for volunteers to help in the program between 9 am and 4 pm. If you have any special talents, (play the piano, art projects, other skills), is a plus. No prior experience necessary. Population are adults with dementia-related memory loss and/or physically frail seniors.
10954.title: Adult Day Care Volunteer
10954.org: Meals on Wheels Programs and Services of Rockland

10954.description: Got an Hour? Homebound Meal Deliveries: One hour, once a week, deliver meals to Rockland’s homebound residents. Deliveries are made with your own vehicle any Monday-Friday, between the hours of 10 a.m. to 12 p.m.. You can also volunteer on a less frequent basis; you can become a substitute driver, holiday or snow driver. Individuals or families welcome. Children are encouraged to accompany adults.
10954.title: Got an Hour? Homebound Deliveries in Rockland County
10954.org: Meals on Wheels Programs and Services of Rockland

10954.description: Commissary Assistance: assist with meal preparation for all our programs in our commissary located in Nanuet. Volunteer opportunities exist Monday through Friday, 7:00a.m to 11:00a.m. Individuals or families are welcome. Must be over 12 years of age.
10954.title: Food Service Volunteer
10954.org: Meals on Wheels Programs and Services of Rockland

07112.description: Teach/Coach/Chaperone STEM classes for middle school students at Chancellor Avenue School in Newark, NJ. Subjects of interest include Bridge Building, Solar cars, Wind Turbine, etc. JerseySTEM is a network co-op of parents, professionals, students and educators whose goal is to promote excellence in Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (\"STEM\") education. We are dedicated to partnering with local schools and other organizations to create and enhance STEM-oriented educational opportunities as part of students' paths towards college and career readiness, and to develop effective STEM programs and initiatives that engage students and educators. JerseySTEM is also committed to bridging the gender gap in STEM education and sharing STEM-related opportunities with underprivileged students and communities.
07112.title: Citizen Educator

07112.description: The Marketing & Communications Volunteers will focus on increasing and diversifying the program's development capacity as well as build and/or expand Wynona's House's visibility and brand in the community. Duties Include: Assist with, coordinate, develop, and implement special events, direct mail appeals, and other development initiatives. Assist with timely dissemination of promotional and outreach materials to donors, including solicitation letters, action alerts, email promotions, holiday programs, among others. Identify new donors and cultivate existing donors. Provide Marketing Reports for analysis and strategic planning Prepare marketing reports for the CEO and COO. Enhance, update and maintain WH's existing media presence including written materials (quarterly eNewsletter), website, social media (Facebook and Twitter) and video. Support information dissemination and training for any member of the public including Wynona's House volunteers Work with our webmaster (Intelligent Design) to update the WH website as discussed and when needed to ensure current content Assist with designing flyers, graphics, e-vites and other marketing material for major events Collaborate with staff on new ideas, directions, and venues for marketing and communications - including occasional phone or conference calls Work on other projects as assigned This is a part-time, volunteer position with flexible hours, some remote work possible, 5-20 hours per week preferred.
07112.title: Marketing & Communications Volunteer

07112.description: Facility & Maintenace Volunteers are needed to help maintain our builidng, the home of the Essex County Child Advocacy Center, also known as Wynona's House. The Facility & Maintenance Department is dedicated to creating and maintaining an environment that is child-friendly and ensures safety and security. Additionally, the department works hard to ensure that the facility is a great place for our team to work and help our children. Duties will be based upon your intersts, skills and experience and may include: changing light bulbs, replacing soiled carpet tiles, painting, moving furnishings, special projects, light snow removal, helping to maintain the parking lot, inventorying furnishings and other small projects. All volunteers must pass a thorough background check and attend introductory training. Great opportunitie for retirees! Part-time volunteer opportunity with flexible hours Monday-Friday. A few hours a week would be very helpful.
07112.title: Facility and Maintenance Volunteers

07112.description: Our goal is to help child victims of abuse and neglect heal, recover and flourish. We envision a community where children are safe, families are strong and victims become children again. You can help! The volunteer Development and Fundraising Specialists will work with senior staff to secure funding for programs and special projects. Tasks will include researching and identifying funding sources and opportunities, drafting communications, maintaining donor databases and files, assisting with campaigns online and direct mail, assisting with special events, galas and annual conference. Experience with eTapestry donor database helpful but not required. Days and hours are flexible. Opportunity to work from home for some tasks. Great way to help children who have been neglected or abused. All volunteers must pass a thorough background check and complete introductory training.
07112.title: Development and Fundraising Specialist

07112.description: We are currently seeking a club facilitator for the Girls Who Code Club at the Chancellor Avenue School in Newark, NJ and Summit, NJ . Girls Who Code Clubs is an after school/weekend program providing access to computer science education for 6th-12th grade girls nationwide. Why Volunteer? Expose girls to a comprehensive and unique CS education Empower young women in CS and help transform tech into a better, more inclusive industry Develop powerful leadership skills while positively impacting your community Interact with large tech companies and industry leaders through field trips and guest speakers Join a community of professionals and students who share your passion for gender parity Qualifications: Proficient in at least one backend programming language. Immediate knowledge of data structures and algorithms. Some experience working with youth preferred but not required. Ability to pass a background screening. Commitment to volunteer 2-3 hours a week. Apply at https://girlswhocode.com/volunteer/
07112.title: Girls Who Code Coach- Week day Evenings (4pm-6pm)

07112.description: JerseySTEM is bringing free-of-charge Science, Technology, Engineerig and Math programs for middle schoolers in Chancellor Avenue School in Newark, NJ with focus on Girls. We are looking for a volunteer to coordinate between the volunteer JerseySTEM coaches and the School staff. Classes will be offered 2 days a week 4:30PM-6:00pm and will be taught by professionals who volunteer their time. Admnistrative includes ensuring all coaches are background checks enrollment by school is succesful, lettres and emails to sponsors,... Technical coordination involves managing supplies needed for the apprenticeships.
07112.title: AfterSchool program coordinator for Newark Middle School

07112.description: Assist therapists with variety of non-therapeutic duties. Acts as an opportunity for volunteers to observe actual therapy treatment sessions. Excellent area for volunteers looking to explore potential career choice in therapy related fields. Responsibilities include organizing/straightening closets/shelves in treatment rooms. Clean/returns toys to proper locations. Assists therapists with set-up/clean-up of activities. Performs necessary office/clerical tasks including copying, filing and organizational tasks. Assists therapist with engaging patients in play activities.

Understand the American Red Cross core mission, vision and values and represents these values through the delivery of excellent customer service. OPEN TIME DAYS Variable; Blood drives are 5 hours long REQUIRED TRAINING - Orientation to the American Red Cross - Donor Ambassador Training
