10023.org: NYC Dept. for the Aging Bill Payer Program

10023.description: Purpose Teach seniors the benefits of expressing themselves through the art of creative writing. Responsibilities Prepare weekly lessons for seniors to learn about creative writing Prepare assignments for seniors to practice creative writing Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills Experience teaching creative writing Experience working with seniors is helpful, but not required Patience Other Class meets on Thursday afternoons Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
10023.title: Writing Workshop Leader - JASA Club 76

10023.description: Purpose Help to ensure seniors are receiving warm, nutritious meals in a timely, orderly manner by assisting with set-up, serving and clean-up for weekday lunches. Responsibilities * Set tables before lunch * Portion food and serve meal to seniors * Clean up tables * Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills * Ability to work independently and as part of a team * Friendly personality * Ability to stand on feet for extended periods of time * Ability to lift up to 5 pounds and push a cart Other * Interest in nutrition * Minimum commitment of one day a week, Fridays * Ongoing opportunity for several months * Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
10023.title: Lunch Service Volunteer - JASA Club 76 Senior Center

10602.description: Help provide free pet food to economically challenged elderly, disabled, and veterans who can no longer afford to feed their pets. Hudson Valley Pet Food Pantry urgently needs volunteers to assist at Saturday pet food drives at local pet food stores and supermarkets, and other activities such as pantry stocking and food distribution, varying dates and times. No experience necessary. More experienced volunteers will accompany you and familiarize you with the group's activities. Help keep pets out of shelters, and help financially vulnerable people keep their best friend. EMAIL: hvpetfoodpantry@aol.com
10602.title: Help Feed Hungry Pets

10603.description: Volunteers are needed for Compeer, an award-winning program of Westchester Jewish Community Services that matches trained volunteers with individuals in mental health treatment who are in need of companionship. Compeer was founded in 1973 in Rochester, NY, and now has programs throughout the U.S. and Australia. Compeer volunteers receive support and guidance from program staff, and are invited to social events with their Compeer friends throughout the year. Volunteers commit to four or more hours per month for at least a year. Typically, volunteers and their Compeer friends go on outings to restaurants, movies, parks, libraries, museums and more. Compeer gives volunteers the opportunity to make a significant difference in the lives of people who are often isolated and lonely. For more information, please contact Laura Stein, MSW, Compeer Coordinator, at (914) 761-0600 X 208 or Lstein@wjcs.com.
10603.title: Make a Friend, Change a Life
10603.org: Compeer of Westchester Jewish Community Services

07932.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07932.title: Companionship Volunteer for Hospice

07932.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07932.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07932.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07932.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07932.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation. And mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some well needed smiles.
07932.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice

07932.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation. And mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some well needed smiles.
07932.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice

07932.description: Do you like to help organize events? Help us at any one of our upcoming events: Comedy Night, Wine and Food Pairing Benefit Night, Golf Event and/or Halloween Trick or Trot. Put your creative skills to work, and help us to make our events successful to help those in need!
07932.title: Special Events Coordinator

07932.description: RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties is a comprehensive community service organization sponsored by JFS MetroWest designed to mobilize members of the community who are 55+ to give back to their own neighborhoods in Essex and Hudson counties through volunteer services. For potential volunteers, RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties provides a single location where they can review a number of local volunteer opportunities and receive the help of a trained Volunteer Coordinator. This assistance ensures that volunteers are placed in a position that matches their skills, desired time commitment and interests. RSVP has a need throughout Essex County for Senior Companion Volunteers. Each volunteer is matched one-on-one with a homebound senior living in their own home or a managed care facility. Volunteers visit the same senior once a week or once every other week for an hour. Volunteer provide companionship, friendship and a listening ear to someone who is often isolated and overlooked. Senior Companions make a real difference in the lives of the people they visit. To learn more, please contact the RSVP Director Stephanie Grove at 973-637-1766 or sgrove@jfsmetrowest.org.
07932.title: Senior Companion

07932.description: The Retired & Senior Volunteer Program Center (RSVP) Center of Essex and Hudson Counties is a comprehensive community service organization through JFS MetroWest NJ designed to mobilize members of the community who are 55 and older in giving back to their own neighborhoods through volunteer service within Essex and Hudson Counties. For potential volunteers, RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties provides a single location where they can review a number of local volunteer opportunities and receive the help of a trained Volunteer Coordinator. This assistance ensures that volunteers are placed in a position that matches their skills, desired time commitment and interests. RSVP also provides volunteers with supplemental insurance while volunteering, annual volunteer recognition events and connection to a nationwide network of volunteers. We are currently placing volunteers in opportunities where they can assist childen, people with developmental disabilities, domestic violence victims, aging adults, hungry families, etc. Our placements occur throughout local hospitals, non profits, daycares, food pantries, public agencies, and many more. Contact us for a full listing of opportunities.
07932.title: RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties

07932.description: Help older adults live as independently and safely as possible in their own homes by offering assistance and companionship. Friend advocates can assist with reading mail, bill paying, filing paperwork and obtaining public benefits and access to community services. All volunteers receive training and ongoing supervision and support from professional Friend Advocate staff.
07932.title: Friend Advocate Program

06831.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
06831.title: Greenwich, CT: Autism Volunteer

10020.description: WE Day is coming to Radio City Music Hall in New York for the first time, and we are looking for dynamic and engaging volunteers to help make this unique event possible! WE Day is the celebration of the WE Movement, an ocean of people coming together to create impact. Watch the WE Day video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eqtzsIEn-lg Why join us as a volunteer? Meet new people Earn volunteer hours Gain skills and experience in the realm of live events Witness inspirational speakers and performers Be a part of an amazing movement empowering young people to make a difference There are opportunities for youth, adults, families, friends and co-workers Event Details: WE Day New York Welcome - Thursday, April 6, 2017, 7:30 am - 2:30 pm WE Day New York Welcome: Friends & Family - Thursday, April 6, 2017, 4:30 pm - 9:15 pm Learn More: For more information on the roles available or to register, please visit WE.org/volunteer. You can also contact our amazing team at wedayvolunteers@we.org.
10020.title: Volunteer @ WE Day New York - Make a difference and inspire!

10020.description: The Greenberg Manhattan West Counseling Center offers mental health services to children, teenagers and adults. Treatment includes assessment and short and long term psychotherapy using multiple and flexible treatment modalities including individual, couple family and group treatment as well as evidence based psychotherapies. As a Client Companion for Greenberg Manhattan West Counseling Center, you will be a friend to one of the clients using their mental health services. This client lives in Midtown, and is looking for a lively and active volunteer in their 40s or 50s to accompany her on walks, bike rides, visits to the park, and to live music performances.
10020.title: Client Companion - Manhattan (Midtown West)
10020.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10020.description: You can make a BIG difference in the life of a child. Become a BIG Brother/BIG Sister with The Jewish Board. Help a child become happier, more fulfilled, and better able to face the challenges of childhood or adolescence. The Big Brother Big Sister Program (BBBS) matches volunteers with children, ages 7-16 years old, who could benefit from an additional positive role model in their lives, positively impacting the well-being of the child. These children come from single parent families, special family circumstances, and/or are receiving services from The Jewish Board. Volunteers must be 21 years or older, available to spend between once a week and once a month with the child and make a minimum of a year commitment. We create and support matches that are positive, safe, and well suited to your and the child’s needs. Our Bigs come from all different backgrounds, and so do our Littles. Our professional staff carefully screens Bigs and Littles to make the best match possible based on common interests, personalities and location. Your commitment has a powerful impact on the life of a child.
10020.title: Big Brother Big Sister Program
10020.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10020.description: On Taproot Foundation pro bono projects, pro bono Financial Consultants work with the nonprofit client to uncover crucial data about operational costs and answers pressing questions like \"Should we open a new site?\", \"Which of our services best balances mission and expense?\", or \"What is our minimum efficient scale?\". The Consultant provides insight into actual costs, and uncovers opportunities for growth or increased efficiency. A successful pro bono Financial Consultant: Has 3 years of post-MBA experience providing strategic financial analysis, either as an internal financial specialist or as a consultant working on similar projects Has at least Management or Consultant-level experience A Service Grant project requires a 3-5 hour commitment each week over the course of approximately 6 months. This opportunity is flexible enough to work around the schedule of a full-time job. Taproot Foundation makes it easy to make a difference. We’re a nonprofit organization that makes business talent available to organizations that are working to improve society. Our goal is to ensure that one day all organizations with promising solutions will be equipped to successfully take on urgent social challenges. To date, we have engaged close to 7,700 professionals on close to 2,300 pro bono projects benefiting education, health, environment, social service, and arts initiatives. Now it’s your turn to join the movement and Make It Matter.
10020.title: Financial Consultants Needed – Pro Bono Financial Analysis Projects

10605.description: Teen Leaders is a service learning corp based out of the White Plains YMCA. The purpose of Teen Leaders is to give youth the opportunity to learn the skills needed to be a leader in their community. Meeting weekly on Wednesday, participants in the program participate in leadership and team building exercises along with their peers. Service is also a big part of the Teen Leaders program, with service being required to participate in the program. Leaders can volunteer on their own or participate in organized group volunteer opportunities such as conducting material drives, working at special events or serving at other nonprofit programs. Teen Leaders programs can be found at several of our locations, including White Plains, Somers and Putnam Valley.
10605.title: Teen Leaders - Service Corp
10605.org: YMCA of Central and Northern Westchester

10605.description: Do you like working with children? Are you studying to be a teacher, child psychologist or other direct service position? The White Plains YMCA is currently looking for volunteers to help staff our Childwatch service. Childwatch is a free babysitting service that the White Plains YMCA offers its members throughout the week and on weekends. For many of our families it is difficult to find time to exercise while finding a baby sitter to watch the kids. This program allows us to take this pressure off of these families and to provide a safe and enriching environment for their children. Childwatch is available for children ages 2 and up, Mondays through Fridays from 5:30PM to 8:30PM and weekends from 8:30AM to 2:30PM. Parents using Childwatch need to be on site to use this service. Childwatch volunteers are responsible for monitoring children in our Childwatch center and ensuring that they are securely checked in and checked out of the facility. This is not necessarily a direct service position. While Childwatch volunteers are welcome to engage the children in play, the most important responsibility is to ensure that check-in/check-out procedures are followed. For older children, volunteers can provide homework help or other similar services. This is a great role for young adults studying to be teachers, interested in working in an education facility or other similar direct service roles. Please note that this is a walk-in service so usage of the service may fluctuate. Childwatch volunteers may be engaged in other parts of the facility if children are not using the service. All volunteers must consent to a background check before they are permitted to volunteer at the YMCA.
10605.title: Childwatch Volunteer
10605.org: YMCA of Central and Northern Westchester

10605.description: Varied openings available for Volunteers and Interns at the National office of the March of Dimes in White Plains, NY Most openings need knowledge of basic computer skills..
10605.title: Varied openings available for Volunteers and Interns

07939.description: In need of volunteers in areas of varied expertise for the Veterans Fundraising Event to be held on Saturday May 13 at the Long Hill Community Center. Prior to the event we are in need of help with brand recognition and development, marketing, ticket sales, website technical assistance and sponsorship attainment. The day of the Event - help will be needed for: set up, decorating, and admission/registration. Anyone with any experience in any of these areas that has a passion for helping veterans should contact FriendsforVets Chairperson: Mary Lynn McKiernan at: marylynn.friendsforvets@gmail.com
07939.title: FriendsforVets Fundraising Event

10021.description: Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, widely recognized as one of New York's premiere human services providers, is a 122-year-old settlement hours that provides an extensive array of effective and integrated services which significantly improve the lives of 20,000 people in need each year on the East Side of Manhattan. We are seeking volunteers to assist older adults improve their skill in using technology in two settings: Computer Practice Lab for All Levels (Group Setting) Mondays, 3:00-4:30, 1/23/17 - 3/20/17 Individual Technology Help for All Levels (One-on-One Setting , Wednesdays, 1:00-3:00, Ongoing
10021.title: Help Older Adults With Technology Skills

10021.description: Lenox Hill Neighboirhood House, widely recognized as one of New York's premier human services providers, is a 122-year-old settlement house that provides an extensive array of effective and integrated services which significantly improve the lives of 20,000 people in need each year, ages 3 to 103, on the East Side of Manhattan. Our English as a Second Language program provides high quality, interactive instruction to a diverse student body. We seek to increase students' language skills, confidence in speaking and comprehension of English. Volunteers are needed to teach beginner level English classes to adult learners. Volunteers willl teach one class per week on Monday, Tuesday, Thursday or Friday, 9:30-12:00. Classes run January 17, 2017 - March 24, 2017 and are held at 331 East 70th Street in Manhattan. Training and supervision are provided but volunteers are responsible for preparing weekly lesson plans for their classes and writing brief summaries of student progress.
10021.title: English as a Second Language Instructor

10021.description: Friendly Visiting is a program that pairs kind neighbors with homebound seniors to provide company and friendship. We ask volunteers to commit to visit their senior match one time per week for a commitment of six months.
10021.title: Friendly Visiting

10021.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 2-4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
10021.title: New York, NY: Autism Volunteer (East 72nd Street)

10021.description: We are seeking early evening and overnight hosts for our homeless shelter. We are particularly interested in overnight hosts. Our shelter runs every week of the year, from Sunday-Thursday. The early evening host (6:30pm-8:30pm): Welcomes and checks-in the guests. Prepares the breakfast tray. Offers a light snack for those who missed dinner at the Drop-in Center. Makes sure that everyone has enough linens, blankets, and toiletries to be comfortable and cleans up the table and kitchen. The overnight host (8:30pm-7:00am): Organizes food clean-up with help from the guests. Makes sure breakfast is ready to go. Ensures the smooth operation of the shelter overnight, from 10:00pm lights-out to wake up, breakfast and departure in the morning. Leaves the kitchen and guest area clean and neat. Early and Overnight Hosts can volunteer by themselves or with a friend/partner/family member/etc. Our volunteers are committed to serving our shelter guests. Most hosts serve at least twice/month. Prospective hosts must attend an Open House orientation or contact us to arrange for an individual orientation. Open House Orientations are held on a monthly basis at 1:00 p.m., meeting at Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church. We rely on our volunteer hosts to keep the shelter open, so we need dependable volunteers to show up for and complete every shift they agree to fill. Volunteers must be 18 or older. Volunteers must also be able to lift 20 lbs for snack set-up.
10021.title: Volunteers needed at Upper East Side Homeless Shelter

10021.description: Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, widely recognized as one of New York's premiere human services providers, is a 123-year-old settlement house that provides an extensive array of effective and integrated services which significantly improve the lives of 20,000 people in need each year, ages 3 to 103 on Manhattan's East Side. We are seeking volunteers to staff the Reception/Information desk of our vibrant, busy Senior Center two Saturdays per month from 9am-12pm. Volunteers will be responsible for checking in senior center members for meals and activities, answering in-person and phone inquiries, signing members up for trips and other light clerical tasks.
10021.title: Senior Center Receptionist

10021.title: Homeless Shelter Hosts

10021.description: The Carter Burden Center for the Aging (CBCA) is dedicated to supporting the efforts of older people to remain in their homes living independently, safely, and with dignity. Volunteers are an integral component of the Carter Burden Center's 40+ years of success. No matter your age, experience or schedule, CBCA can accommodate your needs to ensure that you have a meaningful and effective volunteer experience. Everyday seniors gather to socialize and enjoy a hot meal at the Carter Burden Luncheon Club & Senior Program located in the Upper East Side and at the Carter Burden Leonard/Covello Senior Program in East Harlem. The Carter Burden Center for the Aging prides itself on serving restaurant-style meals made in our own kitchens and served on-site to our participants. Volunteers work both in the kitchen and dining room in food preparation, meal distribution, and cleaning capacities. Volunteer hours are from 10:30am to 1:00pm.
10021.title: Meal Service
10021.org: The Carter Burden Center for the Aging

10021.description: The Carter Burden Center for the Aging (CBCA) is dedicated to supporting the efforts of older people to remain in their homes living independently, safely, and with dignity. Volunteers are an integral component of the Carter Burden Center's 40+ years of success. No matter your age, experience or schedule, CBCA can accommodate your needs to ensure that you have a meaningful and effective volunteer experience. Meals-On-Wheels deliver thousands of meals a year to our homebound seniors. The Carter Burden Luncheon Club & Senior Program is looking for eager and passionate volunteers to deliver meals to our Upper East Side senior clients. It's a great opportunity to check up on the senior and converse with them. You're not just delivering a meal, but also a smile! Volunteer hours are from 10:30am to 12:30pm.
10021.title: Meal Delivery
10021.org: The Carter Burden Center for the Aging

10021.description: Purpose Assist with registering seniors for lunch, class and events. Responsibilities * Greet senior center members * Assist with sign in and selling tickets for lunch * Assist with registering seniors for trips * Additional clerical assistance as needed Skills * Ability to work independently and as part of a team * Good organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks * Strong communication skills * Patience Other * Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week during business hours * Ongoing opportunity * Must be available 10 AM - 2 PM on a weekday * Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
10021.title: Registrar - JASA Club 76

11212.description: Grow Brooklyn is a nonprofit organization dedicated to preserving the assets and maintaining the financial security of New York residents. It is with this mission that we recognized the opportunity over 15 years ago to start a VITA program for the underserved Brooklyn residents. As Brooklyn’s largest noncommercial tax provider, we have grown to cover most of central Brooklyn along with southern Brooklyn. This is, in large part, thanks to our volunteer tax preparers. Volunteer Tax Preparers will be tasked with completing high quality tax returns for low- and middle-income Brooklynites. Our ideal tax preparer would have a high interest and motivation for building on their tax preparation experience. They should also have a passion for helping the members of our community who need it most. Most of all, our volunteers should be able to practice patience, good customer service skills, and have a great sense of humor! This is a great opportunity to build valuable work experience, meet new friends, and help people who need it. Benefits Wide ranging benefits include learning new skills or building on valuable professional experience with active work duties. We have served as professional references for many of our volunteers. Build a sense of achievement for directly positively affecting your fellow Brooklyn residents by providing them top quality tax service without the predatory service fees associated with retail tax providers. If that isn’t enough for you to sign up, we’ll also provide snacks. General Requirements All volunteers are welcome. An interest or previous experience with taxes is preferred so college accounting students as well as current and retired tax professionals tend to make up most of our volunteer pool. If you don't have any tax experience, no problem! We proide training. Training All tax preparers must pass the IRS Volunteer Basic Certification via the Link and Learn training module online. Advanced Certification is also welcome. Upon completion of Link and Learn, volunteers would then be provided hands on training session to prepare them for the tax season.
11212.title: VITA Volunteer Tax Preparer

11212.description: Make a difference in the life of a young person. Our YMI is a mentoring program for high school and middle school youths, especially young men in the Brownsville area. We are currently seeking mentors ages 21 and over with knowledge and/or experience in youth development and leadership to serve as mentors to our youths. Meetings would be held at our Seth Low Community Center (137 Belmont Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11212). Start and End Dates: December to August 2017. Time Commitment: An hour and a half per week meetings with mentees.
11212.title: Young Male Initiative (YMI) Mentorship Program

11212.description: The community and Brooklyn Public Library needs you. If you are a leader, having leadership experience, and can work with minimal supervision, becoming an executive on our Friends Group Board will be excellent for you. STATUS Instructors create their schedule, but must work for approximately 5 hours per week , unless told otherwise Position Description : Instructors are creative, crafty, or have a specific niche. They will work alongside BkMSCC staff members to help create tasks, request inventory, and assist in programing . Class sizes vary, with a minimum enrollment of 8 to 10 students preferred, and generally a maximum of 20 students (approximately a 10-1 student to teacher ratio maintained). Specific dutie s include, but are not limited to: * Participate in instructor meetings and training sessions. * Work closely with the Youth Programs assistant director to understand the process of program planning. * Develop an itinerary/ lesson plan that involves hands-on/minds-on learning. * I nstruct session in a student-centered environment while ensuring participant safety and well-being. * Submit all paperwork in a timely fashion (itinerary, budget, supply requests, and incident/injury reports). * Read, review, and follow guidelines outlined in the Instructor Handbook. * Enjoy working with students of ALL ages who are excited and inte rested in learning. * Maintain a positive work atmosphere by behaving and communicating in a manner that is successful in getting along with students, staff, partnering organizations, parents, and the public. * Data ent ry, volunteer hours tracking * Photographing sessions * Class promotion * organization * Strong communication skills (verbal and written). * Strong attention to detail. * Able to listen and communicate effectively with students of diverse backgrounds. * Dependable and punctual. * Self-directed and willing to take initiative. * Computer literate (familia r with Microsoft Office suite, google docs) Volunteer Benefits * Training and experience with managerial, back-end, and administrative procedures. * Opportunity to meet new people and help enhance Brooklyn neighborhoods. * Networking and community building opportunities. * Gain an awesome reference working with the Brooklyn Public Library and BkMSCC. LOCATIONS Pick preference or multiple: schools, library in ENY or Brownsville, office
11212.title: Adult & Youth Instructor (Art, life skills, development +)

11212.description: BkMSCC is seeking motivated educators , humanitarians, and those who want to help other. Those d edicated, ambitious, and committed to student success and education reform. Qualified candidates must demonstrate records of achievement, high degrees of personal responsibility, and the drive to do whatever it takes to ensure that every child achieves academic success. This individual must be committed to excellence, led by example, and see collaboration as a key component of success. Position Description You are the backbone of Brooklyn Multi-Service Community Center, Corp. You will help perfect our programs. This position is ideal for candidates that wish to fully pursue a crede ntialed lead teaching position, activism, and other community based programs. Becoming an educational associate serves as an internship for candidates who wish to develop their expertise through observation and experience in preparation for a meaningful and successful teaching career. QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS Applicants must possess strong communication and administrative skills; an understanding of arts education; the capacity to multi-task and to work independently; along with the ability to problem solve. Ideal candidates must also have a strong knowledge of photography-its history, techniques, and aesthetics. A familiarity with computer programs such as Microsoft Office and Photoshop are required. Must have excellent customer service skills and thrive in a high-energy, fast-paced environment. BENEFITS I nterns are also invited to attend private openings and artist talks. Part of programing. Compensation * Modest honorarium awarded to intern upon completion of internship * School credit/letter of recommendation Required education: * High school or equivalent
11212.title: Community and Instructional Programs

11212.description: ABOUT Great opportunity for a creative, ambitious college student or recent graduate looking to gain professional experience in all aspects of the event planning industry. Must be personable, detail-oriented, and comfortable working in a fast-paced work environment. STATUS Hours are flexible, but we prefer to set a definitive schedule with a minimum commitment of 15-20 hours per week. Can work virtually REPORTS TO Event Coordinator and or Board ACADEMIC CREDIT If intern wishes to receive academic credit for the internship, it will be the intern’s responsibility to make arrangements with his or her school. BkMSCC will provide the necessary job description and performance review upon request. POSITION SUMMARY The Intern serves as a key member of the Brooklyn Multi-Service Community Center, Corp. (BkMSCC) team. Upon completion of the internship, candidates leave with a foundation of knowledge for producing successful events and ideally have the tools with which to tackle producing an event of their own. Duties will include but are not limited to the following: Assist in all aspects of event coordination including planning, design, marketing, fundraising, and sponsorship Perform responsibilities as assigned at BkMSCC events (some evenings and weekends necessary) Meeting preparation: scheduling and coordination of appropriate materials for client and new business meetings Research new event spaces, restaurants, and resources related to our industry Office reception: answering phones, receiving deliveries, ordering supplies Mailings and list management: compiling and updating mailing lists, tracking RSVPs for events, and coordinating large mailings Being creative, collaborative, and having fun! Qualifications: Good writing and communication skills Strong computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Strong organizational skills and exceptional attention to detail Internet research Ability to handle multiple tasks Availability to work occasional evenings and weekends Interest in pop culture, food, arts, travel, health and wellness, and nonprofit fundraising Required education: High school or equivalent
11212.title: Event Planner

11212.description: As a newly formed Non-Profit we will be providing workshops and classes to the community. We are looking for volunteers who will be able to assist with administrative tasks like attendance monitoring and taking. Filing paperwork and making phone calls. Running small groups and facilitating outreach programs when necessary.
11212.title: Administrative Assistant

11212.description: The Volunteer Services Department at the Brookdale Hospital and Medical Center is seeking volunteers to participate in their Volunteer Child Life Program. The volunteers will assist the Child Life Specialist in providing a safe and developmentally appropriate environment for the children in the hospital. Volunteers are trained by a certified Child Life Speacialist in child development and hospital policies so they feel confident working with the children. Child Life volunteers work directly with the children and their families by bringing toys, games, crafts, movies, music or other resources to the children's room. Volunteers also bring childen to the playroom where they can play games and hold arts and crafts activities. We are seeking compassionate, caring individuals who enjoy working with children.
11212.title: Child Life Volunteer
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: TheBrookdaleUniversityHospitalandMedicalCenter’s Department of Volunteer Services, in conjunction with the Department of Pediatric Cardiology and the Live Light Live Right Program is launching a new program called \" Let’s Share\" Volunteer Program to assist the LLLR staff in training and educating the local community about health risks related to childhood obesity, poor food choices and lack of physical activity. Live Light Live Right (\"LLLR\"), an award winning childhood obesity program supported by the Robin Hood Foundation, treats children using a scientifically proven treatment model that transforms lives and achieves remarkable health outcomes.
11212.title: Let's Share Volunteer Program - Pediatric Obesity Community Education
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: The Brookdale University Hospital and Medical Center is seeking a bright, energetic individual to assist with External Affairs. The individual will possess excellent communications and computer skills, including graphics and web design. Candidate will be exposed to community affairs, public affairs, and health care administration.
11212.title: Community Affairs Intern
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: Surgical Advocate Volunteers provide an important link for communication and support to family members of surgical patients to obtain non-medical information regarding the status of the patient.
11212.title: Surgical Advocate Volunteer
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: Volunteer Greeters are trained to provide a warm and welcoming atmosphere for patients and visitors at The Brookdale University Hospital and Medicla Center, and will provide diretion to locations throughout the hospital. Greeters work collaboratively with hopsital and medical staff to help maintain our commitment to ALWAYS provide the highest personalized quality care and service excellence.
11212.title: GREETER PROGRAM
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: Volunteers provide health literacy assistance and education to our outpatient population in an effort to teach basic health literacy skills to enable compliance with appropriate understanding of medication labels, assistance with managing multiple medications and maintaining a medical journal.
11212.title: Pharmacy Partners Volunteer Program
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: The purpose of this volunteer program is provide assistance to patients being treated in the Emergency Department, their family members/escorts. Volunteers will interact with family members/escorts of those patients keeping them appraised of the patients' progress. Volunteers will provide only non-medical information. Other duties will include: * Escorting patients and or family members to treatment areas. *Providing general information to persons waiting in the Emergency Department, * Assisting medical staff with patients as needed.
11212.title: EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT CARING LINKS PROGRAM
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: To help improve the care of the dying patient by providing Comfort and Friendly Visiting, Advocacy between Hospital staff and patient/family, respect religious, spiritual and cultural values of patients at end of life.
11212.title: CARE-ing Doula
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: A hospital stay for a child can be a lonely, frightening experience. Reading books and telling stories can brighten a young persons hospital stay and stimulate the imagination. Volunteer are needed to read to pediatric patients at Brookdale University Hospital and Medical Center. You must be 18 years of age, and have a good command of the English language. Experience with children is highly preferred. Volunteers are required to commit to a minimum two hour shift one day per week and a total of 150 hours. To find out more about our reading program, or to inquire about other exciting volunteer opportunities, please call the Volunteer Services Department at Brookdale University Hospital and Medical Center at (718) 240-5277between 9:00am- 5:30pm, Monday through Friday.
11212.title: Bedtime Storybook Reader
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: Several volunteer opportunities exist in the hospital and/or nursing home. These include: Clerical, Surgical Advocate, Emergency Room, Pediatric Storybook Reading, Elderly Friendly Visiting, Pastoral Care, Book Cart, Recreation Therapy, plus more..
11212.title: VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNTITIES
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11213.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynpubliclibrary.org/support/volunteer/adult-literacy-volunteer-tutor.
11213.title: Literacy Volunteer Tutor Inforamtion Session
11213.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11213.description: Love soccer? Want to share the joy of the game with underserved kids in central Brooklyn? Empower youth and their families to get active in a neighborhood without many options. Got a few spare hours on the weekend from March to June? Have fun, play ball, make a difference. Our program started in 2009 just to get kids active. Now, we want to build a league. Kids love it, but don't know the game. Help us create teams! We're also seeking LEAD COACHES, who can set up schedules and organize volunteers and parents. Great experience. Recommendation letters given. SCHEDULE - APRIL 1-JUNE 30 SATURDAYS, 12:45 PM - 3 PM SUNDAYS, 3:45 PM - 6 PM INFO: No coaching experience needed. Just love of the game and able to collaborate with others. Of course, we'd love it if you have experience... Practices are co-ed, and players range from 3 to 11 years old and are at beginner to intermediate level. If youi're self-motivated, love kids and are good with them, can handle the unexpected, and just love this game and want to share it, you're for us. Looking for reliable and flexible players who can commit to at least 2 practices. This is a great community service opportunity for high school and college students. Yes, we do give letters and service hours. CAN YOU ONLY DO APRIL 1 OR APRIL 2 - help us do an open soccer day on the field. If you aren't able to coach, but still want to help, we need folks to: - advertise with flyers, post flyers, drop off flyers at schools and community areas for Crown Heights Fest - blast on social media - take attendance and register players - other administrative tasks Please send us information about you- a resume or some information on your backgrounds so we get to know you a little to soccer@seedsinthemiddle.org YOU CAN ALSO LIKE US ON FACEBOOK - Here's our pages: SEEDS IN THE MIDDLE BROOKLYN-CROWN HEIGHTS SOCCER Soccer for Harmony
11213.title: Soccer Players! Share joy of game with underserved kids, 4/1-6/30/17

11213.description: Looking for retired teachers who are interested in helping grades 1-3 students with home work to improve on the ELA/Math Exam.
11213.title: Home work Helper

11213.description: We are a not for profit agency in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn who is looking for a secretary or Office Assistant. We are passionate about helping children/youths/ families, and seniors. We will accept part time/full time applicants. We are looking for someone to answer the phone, meet and greet clients/visitors, set up appointments, manage schedules, facillitate applicanst in filling out application for service(s), preparing the agenda for meetings, filing, making copies etc, contacting clients, and the overall running or smooth transition of the office. We need someone who is reliable, dependable, punctual, honest, and a people person. Someone who is passionte about helping children/youths, families, and seniors. Someone who is fluent in english, a second language is a plus but not a must, someone who is computer savvy, and loves to do research. Loves to plan events.
11213.title: Secretary

11213.description: Patient Portal Liaison Volunteership or Internship Objectives: To act as a point person for Patient Portal enrollment and information. Assignments: Visit admitted patients and provide information on the Patient Portal Assist patients with completing the enrollment process using hospital computers and tablets Provide documentation to the Director of Patient Relations on the number of patients visited and enrolled daily Education Level: Must have high school diploma or G.E.D. Some college-level educational experience preferred. Interns must be associated with a learning institution and working towards a degree, certificate, or diploma. Other Qualifications: Must be highly computer savvy; Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well with others; Ability to maintain patience with others while giving instruction; Strong critical thinking skills
11213.title: Patient Portal Liaison

11213.description: Objectives: To act as a liaison between patients and their families and other hospital staff. Assignments: Assist patients and their families with navigating hospital processes Provide books and reading materials to patients Provide support to the Patient Relations Department Refer patient and family concerns to the Patient Relations staff, when appropriate Education Level: Must have high school diploma or G.E.D. Some college-level educational experience preferred. Interns must be affiliated with an institution of learning and working towards a degree, certificate, or diploma. Other Qualifications: Strong communication/people skills; Strong ability to multitask; Ability to interact with a diverse population; Ability to understand hospital policies and procedures
11213.title: Patient Liaison - Internship or Volunteership

11213.description: Do you live or work in Crown Heights? We are looking for kind, patient, firendly volunteers who are interested in getting to know their frail and/or hombound older neighbors. Become a Friendly Visitor and spend a few hours a week walking and/or visiting with an isolated older neighbor who will benefit from your company!
11213.title: Crown Heights needs Friendly Visitors!

11210.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
11210.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS K315, Brooklyn)

11210.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. This is a part-time 14-hours per week, unpaid telecommuting internship. The internship is 4-months and responsible for leading public and political outreach in the state and district assigned to. Key Responsibilities: - Must be available Mondays 4:30-6:00 PM PST for The Borgen Project’s national conference call. - Meet with members of Congress and/or Congressional staffers in your State and District. - Represent The Borgen Project at various business, political and community events. - Assist with fundraising. Create a personal fundraising campaign and meet targets. - Mobilize individuals to contact their members of Congress in support of key poverty-reduction legislation. - As needed, speak to groups, classes and organizations. - Write letters of support for key programs to political leaders, media and other groups. Qualifications: - Outstanding writing skills. - Self-starter who can produce great results with limited supervision. - Strong oral communication skills and ability to lead meetings and give speeches.
11210.title: Political Affairs Internship

11210.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. This is a 12-week, part-time, unpaid internship. The selected candidate will be able to work from home and set their own schedule, but must meet weekly deadlines. Articles submitted will appear on BORGEN Magazine or The Borgen Project Blog. Key Responsibilities: - Interview sources and research topics in-depth. - Write 2 well-researched articles per week. - Communicate with editors and supervisors. - Assist with fundraising. Create a personal fundraising campaign and meet targets. - Attend national conference call and/or training every Monday at 4 - 5:30 PM PST. Qualifications: Strong journalism writing skills. Must be able to work independently and meet deadlines with very little supervision. Experience writing for newspapers is helpful, but not required.
11210.title: Journalism Internship

11210.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. This is a 12-week, part-time, unpaid internship. The selected candidate will be able to work from home and pick their own schedule, but must meet weekly deadlines. Articles submitted will appear on BORGEN Magazine or The Borgen Project Blog. Key Responsibilities: - Write 2 articles per week. - Research topics. - Assist with advocacy efforts. - Assist with fundraising. Create a personal fundraising campaign and meet targets. - Attend national conference call and/or training every Monday at 4 - 5:30 PM PST. Qualifications: Strong research and writing skills. Must be able to work independently and meet deadlines with very little supervision. Experience writing SEO friendly content is helpful, but not required.
11210.title: Writer Internship

11210.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis. The Borgen Project is hiring an HR Intern who will work remotely. This human resources role will focus on national recruitment and updating job postings. Key Responsibilities: - Update job postings (80% of internship). - Inform groups and classes of openings. - Take on various tasks as needed. - Everyone who is part of the organization assists the team with fundraising, 25-hours of this position is dedicated to creating and implementing a personal fundraising campaign. - Assist with advocacy efforts. Details: This is an unpaid internship, although college credit is available. The HR internship is 16-hours per week for 12-weeks. Must meet weekly deadlines and be available Monday evenings 5-6PM PST for meetings and national conference calls.
11210.title: HR Internship

11210.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis. The Borgen Project is hiring a Public Relations/Marketing Intern who will work remotely. This public relations intern will be involved in a variety of aspects of marketing and communications. Key Responsibilities: - Create a branding campaign. - Conduct an informal focus group and gather feedback for market research. - Pitch story ideas to print, broadcast and digital media. - Create and implement a fundraising strategy. - Plan, market and present at an informational meeting. - Utilize social media and develop strategies for web-based messaging. - Assist with The Borgen Project's advocacy efforts. - Take on assignments as needed. Details: This is an unpaid internship, although college credit is available. The internship is 16-hours per week for 12-weeks. Must meet weekly deadlines and be available the first Monday evening of the month, at 5pm PST for meetings.
11210.title: Public Relations/Marketing Internship

11210.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis. You don’t need to be a lobbyist to help influence foreign policy. As a Regional Director, you’ll serve as a Borgen Project Ambassador in your city - mobilizing your friends, family and colleagues to contact Congress in support of key poverty reduction legislation. This is an unpaid, volunteer position. Key Responsibilities: - Attend one (30-60 minute) national conference call per month: 5PM PDT 6PM MDT 7PM CDT 8PM EDT - Meet with local congressional leaders and lobby for legislation that improves living conditions for the world’s poor. - Mobilize people in your community to contact their congressional leaders to support poverty reduction legislation. - Manage and implement fundraising campaigns. - Build a network of people engaged in the cause. - Serve as The Borgen Project’s ambassador in your city. Qualifications: - Basic understanding of U.S. Politics and international development. - Highly organized with the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks while managing their work time efficiently. - Strong team player that loves to bring new ideas to the table. - Ability to demonstrate frequent independent judgment with decisiveness. - Excellent overall communication skills: oral, written, presentation.
11210.title: Regional Director

11210.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis. This is a great entry-level volunteer position for someone looking to be part of The Borgen Project. Advocates can operate from anywhere in the U.S. This is an unpaid, volunteer position. Key Responsibilities: - Attend one (30-60 minute) national conference call per month: 5PM PDT 6PM MDT 7PM CDT 8PM EDT - Serve as an ambassador for the world’s poor. Build awareness of the issues and ways people can help. - Manage and implement fundraising campaigns. - Represent The Borgen Project in your city - attend events and engage people in the cause. - Contact congressional leaders in support of key poverty-reduction programs. Qualifications: - Excellent overall communication skills: oral, written, presentation. - Ability to self-manage and prioritize assignments.
11210.title: Advocate

11211.description: Dear Volunteer, This is an incredibly opportunity to participate in a live music event, while supporting a movement for change in the war on cancer. Sound Affects is a newly formed charity that has established a innovative crowdfunding model to support the advancement of cancer biotechnologies. We reach the crowd through partnerships with independent musical artists who help us raise awareness and funds for our cancer-fighting campaigns. (www.soundaffects.org) On Sunday, March 12, Sound Affects will launch \"Music Beats Cancer\" at the Music Hall of Williamsburg in Brooklyn, NY. The event will feature a mash up of performances from independent musical artists who support Sound Affects mission. See details here:http://soundaffects.org/events/ We seek volunteers to assist us the following ways: 1. Help promote event through social media and street flyers 2. Help set up banners and merchandise day of event 3. Assist with VIP checkin 4. Support sales of merchandise 5. Have fun! We really appreciate your interest and consideration! Sincerely, Mona Jhaveri Executive Director
11211.title: Music Beats Cancer

11211.description: Bring your experience in fundraising and communications to help secure philanthropic support for a legal services non-profit. Established in 1968, Brooklyn Legal Services Corporation A (Brooklyn A), advances social and economic justice and community empowerment through innovative, collaborative, neighborhood-based legal representation and advocacy. We assist individuals, families, community-based organizations, and coalitions in sustaining and developing vibrant, healthy communities. The Development and Communications volunteer will work as a part of the Development and Communications Team which consists of the Director and two AmeriCorps VISTA volunteers. You will assist in executing the annual Development Plan. This is an excellent opportunity to utilize your skills in fundraising, communications and non-profit management. Responsibilities of the Development and Communications Volunteer: Manage the data entry within DonorPerfect fundraising database. This includes donor records, the mailing list, and preparing gift acknowledgments following development department guidelines. Develop resources to retain existing donors, recapture lapsed donors, develop new donors, and increase gift size. Help develop and execute a communication program to support and develop the image and fundraising efforts of Brooklyn A. This includes but is not limited to generating online content that engages audience segments and leads to measurable action. Manage the development, distribution, and maintenance of all print and electronic collateral including, but not limited to, newsletters, brochures, special events and Brooklyn A’s website. Support the grant proposal development and submission process - ensuring that proposals, reports and other documents are well written, strategic, and submitted on schedule; Assist in creating and executing a strategy for a large sustained base of individual giving. Assist with the planning and executing the Annual Partnership Awards Benefit and subsequent events planned. Knowledge, Skills, Qualifications (Required): College degree and prior work experience is preferred; Strong interpersonal communication skills and be motivated; Self-starter able to work independently and as a team player; Strong writing, organization and multi-tasking skills; as well as creativity; Outgoing personality and comfortable with public speaking and interacting with diverse populations; The ability to multi-task, handling logistics and follow through on multiple projects at the same time. Adaptable to changing environments and multiple deadlines; Excellent Microsoft Office skills including Word, Excel, PowerPoint required; Experience working in small, grassroots, community nonprofit organizations is a plus; Demonstrated leadership and organization skills. Application Process: Please send a cover letter, resume, short writing sample (no more than 3-pages), and 3 references, as soon as possible to sferrell@bka.org with \"Development & Communications Volunteer\" in the Subject Line. The position is expected to be filled immediately. No phone calls, please. We strongly encourage people of color, of diverse gender identities, women and non-LGBT persons to apply.
11211.title: Experienced Development and Communications Volunteer

11211.description: We are looking for a volunteer chef or someone who really enjoys cooking, to teach a small group of 10 people to prepare healthy low cost meals to individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Time commitment: Once a week or 2 or 3 times a month depending upon your availability. You will cook at an industrial Kitchen located in Williamsburg Brooklyn.
11211.title: Volunteer Chef to prepare healthy, low cost meals

11211.description: Purpose Regular exercise is an essential part of a healthy lifestyle. Lead a weekly zumba class for seniors to help keep them in shape. Responsibilities * Lead a group of seniors in a weekly zumba class * Create routines suitable for individuals with varied physical abilities * Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills * Relevant exercise certification * Experience leading seniors in exercises * Experience with group exercise classes * Patience and sense of humor * Comfortable leading a group of varying skill levels Other * Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week * Ongoing opportunity * Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11211.title: Zumba Instructor - JASA Cooper Park Senior Center

11211.description: Time's Up! is a 27-year-old grassroots non-profit environmental organization located in New York City. Time's Up! organizes hundreds of educational workshops, events, and campaigns to promote environmental sustainability. We are currently seeking an Assistant to the Director Intern. Applicants must be flexible, computer savy, and fluent in English, with excellent writing, proofreading, and organizational skills.The position involves working in several different locations in lower Manhattan and Brooklyn, assisting the director in a variety of activities, including setting up events, managing spaces, organizing committees and meetings, and communicating with other organizations and volunteers. Commitment is approximately 15-20 hours per week (flexible hours). Time's Up! has a unique structure in that it is operated 100% by volunteers and has an incredible track record of accomplishment. This is an excellent opportunity to learn how a grassroots organization can effect substantial change. Please see our website at: http://times-up.org/
11211.title: INTERN- Time's Up! Assistant to the Director

11211.description: Purpose Are you crafty? Lead seniors in weekly jewelry-making projects that allow them to express their creative side. Responsibilities * Prepare weekly jewelry-making lessons for seniors including making bracelets, necklaces and rings * Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills * Experience teaching arts & crafts * Experience working with seniors is helpful, but not required * Comfortable leading individuals with varying ability through activities * Patience Other * Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week * Ongoing opportunity * Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11211.title: Jewelry Instructor - JASA Cooper Park Senior Center

11211.description: Time's Up! is a 27-year-old nonprofit environmental organization located in downtown New York City and Williamsburg, Brooklyn. Time's Up! is currently seeking a Volunteer Coordinator. This position involves overseeing and updating our volunteer database and identifying/recruiting prospective qualified volunteersto fill open volunteer positions. This position requires excellent organizational, communication, and computer skills. Experience with Gmail and FileMaker Pro or other database experience is preferred. The Volunteer Coordinator may also help with designing and implementing HR policies. Check out our website http://www.times-up.org
11211.title: Time's Up! - Volunteer Coordinator
