11354.description: MJHS Hospice provides a specialized program of care and services for end-of-life patients. MJHS Hospice provides care for pediatric and adult patients in homes, nursing homes, assisted living communities, inpatient facilities and hospitals. MJHS Hospice Volunteer opportunities include: Providing support and companionship to patients and their families Participating in leisure activities such as reading, listening to music, playing games with patients Supporting or organizing group activities for patients Listening compassionately to patients and their families Providing office or clerical support for our hospice team Complementary therapies Requirements for all categories of volunteers: 18 years or older 15 hours of training (4 hours training for clerical/office volunteers) Background Check (no charge to applicant) Medical Clearance (no charge to applicant) 3-4 hours per week 1 year commitment Required skills for patient visits: discretion, patience, compassion and dedication Preferred clerical and office support skills include: receptionist skills, computer skills, organizational skills and filing For more information on how to become a MJHS Hospice Volunteer please call: Queens and Nassau: Mical White-Huffstead, Volunteer Coordinator; 718-490-1900 or MHUFFSTE@MJHS.ORG
11354.title: Be Part of Someone's Legacy--Become a Hospice Volunteer in Queens!

11354.description: Looking for warm compassionate persons to provide companionship and emotonal support to terminally ill patients. Patient care volunteers visit patients in Nursing homes, assisted living or in patient's own homes. All Volunteers will be provided training, supervision and support. Hospice volunteers: Visit patients in their homes and in facilities offering companionship and a chance to reminisce Read books, newspapers and other favorites to people when they aren’t able themselves Contribute to volunteer newsletter keeping volunteers and staff in tune with the Hospice Volunteer Program’s activities Assist with small errands for the patient and family to supplement the care received at home Share their talents and gifts... Play Music, create photo albums Provide patient the opportunity to tell his/her life story through the use of video, (if patient or caregiver has one available), audio and/or the written word. Office Volunteers assist office staff with basic tasks such as copying and filing, helping with web research, spreadsheets and more.
11354.title: Queens Patient Care Volunteer
11354.org: Caring Hospice Services of New York

07017.description: We are a nonprofit organization located in East Orange NJ that is committed to serving the LGBT community and specifically those that are homeless and are in need of safe and secure shelter. We are a team of dedicated individuals from various professions and who are in desperate need of continued attention to our funding sources by way of Grant Writers. We are looking for a powerful, passionate person that shares our vision for providing safe housing for our young LGBT adults in Essex County. This person should be great at communication, writing and can commit to being on top of grant proposals. Go to http://www.EssexLGBThousing.org to find out more about this cause and the organization.
07017.title: Grant Writing Volunteer for LGBT Homeless Shelter
07017.org: HBP RAIN Foundation dba Essex County RAIN Foundation

07017.description: We Essex County RAIN (Reaching Adults In Need) Foundation, a group of passionate people with a goal helping Essex County young adults get off the streets and in safe housing. We want them to succeed in life as we offer services to help stabilize them on their walk to becoming more self-sufficient. We need help with board development, fundraising, graphic & web design, copy writing, community relations, process development, volunteer recruitment, and more. Have you worked in transitional housing? Are you good at organizing, planning and supporting small organizations with big visions to help the community? Then this foundation is the organization for you!
07017.title: Help us Help LGBT Homeless in Essex County
07017.org: HBP RAIN Foundation dba Essex County RAIN Foundation

07017.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
07017.title: East Orange>>>Advice Counselor

07016.description: Reports to: Young Athletes program Coach Time Commitment & Training: This individual must be able to commit to the full duration of the event as scheduled. If unable to commit, please do not select this position. General Description Assist the Program Director in maintaining the flow and integrity of Young Athlete Program. Orientation will be provided on-site day of the event. Duties & Responsibilities Possible positions include: Serve as a Young Athlete escort through the various sport/motor stations Check in athletes and/or volunteers Work specifically with a sport/motor station as directed by Program Director Skills & Qualifications Excellent verbal communication is a must, as well as ensuring professional and friendly service, including the ability to multitask and respond quickly to changes in schedules and plans. Physical Requirements The usual and customary methods of performing the job's functions require the following physical demands: occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling. Generally the job requires 70% walking, 25% standing, and 5% sitting. Must be able to stand and walk the majority of the volunteer shift. Questions regarding this position should be directed to: Amy Simmons | Volunteer Director | volunteer@sonj.org
07016.title: Special Olympics New Jersey - Young Athlete Program Cranford

07016.description: Sue Rock Originals Everyone is a domestic violence non-profit that supports people with textile training and needlearts skills - We need help organizing our Donations Warehouse. Able bodied, active individuals are needed to help move and arrange our Donations Warehouse. Volunteer opportunity is possible in two ways. 1. Volunteer will drive in our van to the warehouse location and assist in moving boxes, bags and crates to help in organizing donations. OR 2. Volunteer will come with their own vehicle and drive with us to the warehouse location and assist in moving boxes, bags and crates to help in organizing donations. REQUIREMENTS Able to lift and carry 50 pounds. Able to work with others easily. Able to stand, walk, bend and take instruction. If driving - Driver's license and vehicle

07012.description: Good day, Today's Learning Center is private school with almost 40 years experience in the process of converting to REACH Charter School of Clifton for 2016-2017. The board is scheduled to hold an initial meeting in late February contingent on intial approval from the NJDOE. More information: www.todayslearningcenter.org and www.facebook.com/reachcharter Below is a brief summary of our application: For almost 40 years, our unique mission has been to: 1) Educate the Whole Child Engaging Curriculum -Field Trips -Swimming -Music -Art -Violin -Theater After-school programs: gardening, Rotary Interact, sports, dance, tutoring & more 2) Develop Strong Parent/Community Engagement PTO, frequent communication, monthly family events and performances 3) Provide Individualized Student Support Student Support Team works with teachers to use student portfolios to create personalized learning programs 4) Integrate Technology to Support All Areas of Study Each student has a device, Smartboard access, online learning programs We will remain in our exceptional facility with access to: -500-seat theater -Swimming pool -Gymnasium -Playground -Baseball/Sports Field -Library/Media Center -Large Cafeteria Over half of our diverse student body resides in Clifton and Passaic with one-third qualifying for free/reduced lunch. Last year our school scored in the 89th percentile on a national standardized test. We find that many local families are unable to pay our already low tuition. Converting to REACH Charter School will offer Clifton and Passaic families a choice and allow us to serve more children in the community AT NO ADDITIONAL COST TO TAXPAYERS OR FAMILIES. We are looking for applicants qualified in ANY of the following areas: School leadership, administration, and governance; Curriculum, instruction, and assessment; Performance management; Parent and community engagement; Professional development; General operations; Facilities management; Financial management; and Fundraising and development; If you are qualified and interested in making a difference in the lives of families and children, then please email me for further information.
07012.title: Charter School seeking Board Member
07012.org: The Learning Center for Exceptional Children, Inc.

07012.description: Hi! We are a small private school in desparate need of a sports coach for an after-school program. We have a beautiful 7-acre facility with swimming pool, baseball field, soccer/football field, basketball gymnasium, weight room, and fitness studio. Our kids already love soccer, but they are itching to play any kind of sport. If you have skill in any sport and would like to help kids learn, then please contact us! Thank you!
07012.title: After-school sports coach
07012.org: The Learning Center for Exceptional Children, Inc.

07012.description: Hi! We are a small private school in need of an assistant to help with our brand new basketball program. No experience necessary, but it is helpful. We have two coaches, so you would be working with small groups of students and during scrimmages. The program is on Tuesday 3:15-4:15. Thank you!
07012.title: After-school Basketball Coach
07012.org: The Learning Center for Exceptional Children, Inc.

07012.description: Calling all artists (or helpers)! We need your help to enrich the life for our students who can't get enough art instruction. If you have artisitc ablitiy and would like to share it with our students after school, then please contact me. You would be working with older students, regular and special education, on more advanced art techniques (oil painting, sketching, drawing, etc.) We need someone on Mondays 3:15-4:15 to work with about 10 students. Supplies would be paid for by parents. Thank you.
07012.title: Art Enrichment after-school
07012.org: The Learning Center for Exceptional Children, Inc.

07012.description: Good day! We desperately need tutors for our after-school program to work with children, from Kindergarten through 7th grade. No experience necessary, we will be able to assist you. We would like to provide more individual help to all our students. If you are free any weekday from 3:15-5:00, please contact me. Thank you!
07012.title: Tutoring after-school
07012.org: The Learning Center for Exceptional Children, Inc.

07012.description: Hi! We are a small private school in need of an assistant to help with our brand new basketball program. No experience necessary, but it is helpful. You would be working with one group of students. The program is on Tuesday 3:15-4:15. Thank you!
07012.title: After-school basketball coach
07012.org: The Learning Center for Exceptional Children, Inc.

07012.description: Hi! We are a small private school in desparate need of a sports coach for an after-school program. We have a beautiful 7-acre facility with swimming pool, baseball field, soccer/football field, basketball gymnasium, weight room, and fitness studio. Our kids already love soccer, but they are itching to play any kind of sport. If you have skill in any sport and would like to help kids learn, then please contact us! Thank you!
07012.title: After-school Sports Coach
07012.org: The Learning Center for Exceptional Children, Inc.

07012.description: Good day! We need your help with our after-school yoga program. It is a diverse, multi-age group of regular and special education students. Our amazing instructor has requested someone who can assist her by working with a couple of our students during the class. Classes are on Wednesdays 3:15-4:15. No experience necessary. Thank you!
07012.title: Yoga after-school
07012.org: The Learning Center for Exceptional Children, Inc.

07012.description: Good day, We need a librarian to help improve our school! Responsiblities would include reading to students, maintaining our library/media center, assisting with research, and maintaining our listening center. Distribution of books to students would also be needed. If you have any time and would like to fill this very important role, then please contact us! Hours are flexible. Thank you
07012.title: School librarian
07012.org: The Learning Center for Exceptional Children, Inc.

07012.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
07012.title: Clifton>>>Advice Counselor

07012.description: Help plan special needs community awareness event
07012.title: Special Needs Resource Center

07011.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07011.title: Companionship Volunteer for Hospice

07011.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07011.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07011.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07011.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07011.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation. And mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some well needed smiles.
07011.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice

07011.description: St. Peter's Haven Food Pantry serves over 1,000 Passaic County families and individuals in need by providing them with supplementary groceries every month. V olunteers are needed to unload the food donation truck and under the supervision of St. Peter's staff, organize items on shelves and tables. Volunteers will also make up shopping bags for families to pick up on future dates.
07011.title: Marketplace in Clifton

11798.description: Do you want to educate, motivate and have a blast all while volunteering to promote healthy living and well-being? There is an opportunity waiting for your encouraging voice and energetic personality. You would get the chance to offer your services of Yoga, Tai chi, Pilate's, Floor Exercise Routines, Nutrition Information or Aromatherapy for those living with mental illness or substance abuse issues. This is a great opportunity to teach those who suffer from substance abuse, other coping mechanisms and ways to reduce stress naturally. It is also a great way to build experience in your field.
11798.title: Health and Wellness Professional Volunteer

11798.description: Food Not Bombs Mission Statement:Food Not Bombs recovers and shares free vegan or vegetarian food with the public without restriction in over 1,000 cities around the world to protest war, poverty and the destruction of the environment. Each group is independent and invites everyone to participate in making decisions for their local chapter using the consensus process. Food Not Bombs is dedicated to taking nonviolent direct action to change society so no one is forced to stand in line to eat at a soup kitchen expressing a commitment to the fact that food is a right and not a privilege. With over a billion people going hungry each day how can we spend another dollar on war? Hello Neighbor,I'm a volunteer with Long Island Food Not Bombs (LIFNB.com).We have Free Food Shares (Free Food, Clothing, Books, Baby Items, Household Items, Art, etc.) throughout Long Island and Brooklyn. Depends what donations we get from stores, churches, neighbors and volunteers. Usually there are fruits, vegetables, milk, dairy, bread, cakes, pies, canned and dry goods, pet food, etc. We also have clothes, household & baby items, books, art, etc. depending what is brought to the Food Shares that day.Ask for Volunteer Jon or Rose if you have something to share. Say hello for me. Thank you, Volunteer Dennis A new release video: We start at 13:55: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fixP0UR_G_UCraigslist Post:Free \"Long Island Food Not Bombs\" Food SharesEvery Sunday at 2 PM, West Columbia Street & Station Plaza, Hempstead, NY 11550Every Tuesday at 7 PM, East 6th Street & Fairground Avenue, Huntington NY 11746Every Thursday at 7 PM, Horseblock Road & Woodycrest Drive, Farmingville, NY 11738Every Saturday at 12 PM, noon, 1556 Straight Path, Wyandanch, NY 11798Every Saturday at 3 PM, Lafayette Ave & Marcy Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11216All outdoors. Rain or Shine. No umbrellas or strollers by tables.Come Share With Your Community.Free Food, Clothing, Books, Baby Items, Household Items, Art, etc.Whatever is brought by our Volunteers, You (if you can) and Your Neighbors in Your Community.A Community is its Neighbors, not the towns they are in.Get there a few minutes before start time. Help us unload our Volunteers vehicles and set up tables.Bring empty bags, food, clothing, household items, baby items, books, etc to \"Share with Your Community\".See Volunteers if you do bring items to Share, or you want to volunteer to hand food and items out. Say hello for me, Dennis. Nothing to bring? Then bring yourselves.We'll help you get food and items you need. You don't need to bring any type of papers or ID to our Food Shares.Everyone is welcome to get Free Food, Clothing, Household Items, Baby Items, Books, Art, etc. Depends what is brought by our volunteers and other neighbors to share.We average 8,000 pounds of food and merchandise each Food Share.Just please be polite with your neighbors when we Share.We will not tolerate any type of racial slurs or bigotry.Please thank and help our Volunteers by taking recyclable cardboard (boxes to take home your food and items). Put out on your recycle day for pick up.More info go to our website: LIFNB.com Start Sharing:1) Pass this on to family, friends and neighbors in your community. 2) Copy flyers at LIFNB.com or this Craigslist post. Hand them out. Schools, Libraries, Senior Centers, Churches, Stores, etc.3) Maybe you are an owner, manager or employee of a store, supermarket, distributor, wholesaler, farm, or manufacturer. Do you have soon to be expired food, drinks and/or merchandise you will be throwing out?Help us help you save money. Less carting fees. Great Community Relations.Call the Hotline (631) 223-4370 - 10 AM - 2 PM.4) Next time you are in a store where you shop. Ask the owner or manager if they would like to donate soon to be expired food, drinks and/or merchandise they will be throwing out shortly. We'll pick up and they save money on carting fees and help the community. Give our Hotline Number (631) 223-4370 - 10 AM - 2 PM.5) Share on Facebook:\"Friend\" - Li FNB\"Like\" - Long Island Food Not Bombs6) Become one of our volunteers. Come and join us.No Food Shares in your area, volunteers will help you start one.We are not affiliated with any religion, church or political party. Community churches do donate food and items to our Food Shares.\"Long Island Food Not Bombs\" is the largest \"Food Not Bombs\" in the World.We do all this with no government funding, all volunteers. Volunteer to help us obtain funding.We are always in need of Plastic Folding Tables for our Food Shares. Donate when you can at: http://www.LIFNB.comThank you, Volunteer Dennis Peace
11798.title: Wyandanch Food Share - LIFNB

08512.description: Homeside Hospice is looking for volunteers to provide Music Therapy to our patients in assisted living and in nursing homes in Middlesex County. If you are a Music Therapist, you can provide a loving experience for patients in lifes final journey. As a volunteer you will provide essential, quality of life services to patients. Your efforts will provide the sort of care and help that a loving friend provides and help insure that the Hospice promise is fulfilled. Music Therapy Students Welcome!
08512.title: Music Therapy Volunteers needed in Middlesex County

08512.description: Palliative Support Volunteers to meet the special needs of terminally ill hospice patients. Volunteers provide companionship, respite, emotional and spiritual support for patients and families. Volunteers add a special dimension to Embracing HospiceCare’s work. With a warm smile, a tender touch, a listening ear, a heartfelt willingness to help you can make that difference. Palliative Support Volunteer must be 18 years of age or older. If you are under 18 you can volunteer with a parent with you. Please include your phone number.
08512.title: Palliative Support Volunteers

08512.description: We are looking for volunteers to assist with our Intergrative Hospice Therapies. If you hold certifications or licenses in any of the following therapies we would love to have you as a part of our hospice team. Aromatherapy Imagery Work Music Therapy Palliative Massage Reiki Relaxation Training Integrative Therapies will be utilizied with our hospice patients that are experiencing acute pain, anxiety, physical discomfort, agitation and restlessness. We also offer mileage reimbursement! Pleae include your phone number.
08512.title: Become a Professional Volunteer

08512.description: If you have a dog that has gone through a pet therapy program and is a certified pet therapy dog we would love to you both as a part of our team. Our pets visit patients in Assisted Living Facilities, Nursing Homes and Private Residences. We also offer mileage reimbursement! Please call Ralph at 732-974-2545 or include your phone number with this email.
08512.title: Pet Therapy

08512.description: We are searching for volunteers to provide assistance in our Embracing HospiceCare offices located in both Wall and Cranbury New Jersey. The duties can include and are not limited to filing, typing, preparing bulk mailings, answer phones, data entry, run errands, represent Embracing HospiceCare at community functions and assembling training manuals. Volunteers are needed in Ocean, Monmouth, Middlesex and Mercer counties. We also offer mileage reimbursement! Please call Ralph at 732-974-2545 or include your phone number with this email.
08512.title: Musicians/Singers needed for Hospice Volunteers

11432.description: King Manor Museum is looking for volunteers to give tours to its visitors! As a tour guide, you will conduct half-hour tours for drop-in visitors and provide information on the museum's period furnishings and on the legacy of the King family. King Manor is the historic home of Rufus King, an author and signer of the Constitution who went on to become New York's first Senator, a presidential candidate in 1816, and an outspoken opponent of slavery. After Rufus's death, his son John King lived in the family home while undertaking his political career as a Governor of New York and an abolitionist. We are specicially looking for volunteers who are available noon-2pm on Mondays, Tuesdays, and/or Wednesdays. Training will be provided. This is a great opportunity for students in museum studies programs or anyone who is interested in learning about the museum field or gaining public speaking skills.
11432.title: Volunteer Tour Guide

11433.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
11433.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 48 William Wordsworth, Queens)

11433.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
11433.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 40 Q Samuel Huntington, Queens)

11430.description: Be a helping hand along the way! Travelers Aid at JFK International Airport is seeking volunteers to welcome passengers and provide information regarding a variety of travel-related services. This is an excellent opportunity to be a welcoming ambassador for travelers from all over the world, improve your communication skills and gain experience assisting and working with people. Volunteers are placed at key locations throughout the airport. Shifts are available 7 days a week from 10-2 and 2-6. We require one four hour shift per week. In addition to the satisfaction of helping travelers, volunteers also receive transportation (local subway and bus fare) and meal reimbursement! Please contact us at (718) 656-4870 to arrange a tour of our program! Visit and like Travelers Aid JFK Airport at facebook.com/travelersaidjfk or visit our website at www.travelersaid.org/jfk/.
11430.title: Travelers Aid JFK Volunteer

11434.description: Grace Episcopal Church of Jamaica is currently focusing efforts on a program to empower the Youth within the Jamaica Queens environment. The program will include initiatives that will play a supporting role in upskilling inner city youths, and will prepare them for a successful and productive future. The youth empowerment program will include leadership & financial education workshops, career talks, health and wellness seminars, skill building workshops, and a scholarship program. The Church is currently looking for a Program Director to assist church members in developing the program framework, operations plan and overseeing/supporting the youth empowerment committee.
11434.title: Youth Program Director

11434.description: The Police Athletic League of New York City seeks dedicated and skilled volunteers to support a broad range of creative arts activities; including art (visual, drawing, painting, sketching, sculpting) that promotes creativity, self-expression, teamwork, discipline, commitment, and fun learning for PAL teens. For nearly 100 years, PAL has provided safe and supportive afterschool and evening programming for elementary aged youth and teens. If you're looking for a great opportunity to volunteer please sign-up today!
11434.title: Art Specialist Volunteer

11434.description: The Arts @ Henson-Parks, Inc. is excited to bring The Pupil Project to after school programs, and for great reason to schools challenged in offering expanded arts education. Students in grades 3-12 in Queens, Brooklyn, Bronx and Manhattan benefit greatly from participation in our arts program The Pupil Project. It is a mobile educational initiative providing hands on instruction in digital photography, filmmaking and basic photo editing. Our program encourages participants to organically explore their surroundings and capture what they see. Program Coordinators assist with the structure of our program delivery inside the classroom, working closely with the Photography Instructor in teaching kids grades 3-12 digital photography, videography, and basic editing. Also assisting in acquiring required materials and proper data collection (weekly attendance, permission slips, etc). THe Coordinators manage equipment distribution and collection, assist with instruction, and creating fun, relevant activities in relation to material learned. Reports to the Program Manager. *Volunteer opportunity to salaried position, contingent on funding.
11434.title: Program Coordinator/ Assist Instructor - "The Pupil Project" Afterschool Photography Program

07642.description: Bergen SWAN has to clean house! We need organized, logical minds and strong backs to help us make better sense of our files and documents from over the years. If you have some office administrative experience and want to help out an environmental cause, this would be ideal for you. Call Lori Charkey if you're interested. Thanks!
07642.title: Help Get our Environmental Group Organized!
07642.org: Bergen Save the Watershed Action Network (Bergen SWAN)

07643.description: Education Coach Internship Description: Under the direction of the MFSC Staff, Homework coaches will work with children from K-12 to provide academic support. Homework Coaches will be coaching a group of 5 children similar in age. The coaches’ primary responsibility is to ensure that the children have completed their work accurately as well as assisting them when needed. This is a part-time volunteer position. Homework coaches should have previous experience working with children; however relevant coursework will be considered. This position is a good fit for an aspiring teacher or youth worker with a background in working with kids. Internship Requirements: Interns must be flexible, may require some nights and Saturdays Internship is Unpaid Interns are able to create their own schedule, including hours per week and monthly commitment Currently enrolled in college or currently has Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree, preferably with relevant coursework and or previous work with children Comfortable with children and all/most subject areas from Elementary to High school Strong communication, organizational, and professional demeanor MFSC will work with College/University if credits/hours are required; however, this requirement is not necessary for an internship position with the MFSC
07643.title: Education Coach

07643.description: Internship Description: Interns are responsible for supporting office staff with implementing new programs for the MFSC Interns have the responsibility to assist with developing and creating future and ongoing programs to better MFSC Partner with staff to create activities and calendars for year round programs (i.e. creating flyers for each upcoming program). Interns also have the responsibility to oversee programs at the MFSC to make sure they run properly. Internship Requirements: Interns must be flexible, may require some nights and Saturdays Internship is Unpaid Interns are able to create their own schedule, including hours per week and monthly commitment MFSC will work with College/University if credits/community service hours are required; however, this requirement is not necessary for an internship position with the MFSC
07643.title: Program Coordinator Assistant Internship

07643.description: Internship Description Interns are responsible for working with the community to highlight strengths and identify challenges where resources need to be leveraged and developed to better support and serve youth, and families. Assist staff with promotional materials, advertising FSC programs, managing social media sites and representing FSC at information fairs, etc. Responsible for community resource development by integrating into the community and building mutually beneficial relationships with parents, faith communities, businesses, advocates, and key stakeholders (i.e. schools, service providers, local and county government, and other agencies). Review and implement new methods for attracting, training, and retaining volunteer staff. Pursue and build new relationships and partnerships in the community. Develop and maintain a complete list of resources and services available. Educate staff and families about resources. Internship Requirements Interns must be flexible, may require some nights and Saturdays Internship is Unpaid Interns are able to create their own schedule, including hours per week and monthly commitment MFSC will work with College/University if credits/hours are required; however, this requirement is not necessary for an internship position with the MFSC
07643.title: Marketing Intern

07646.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07646.title: Companionship Volunteer for Hospice

07646.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Reiki practitioners to volunteer their time to those in their community. Reiki can assist with pain management, anxiety, emotional release and much more and is a wonderfil modality to use during end of life care. Hospice training is provided.
07646.title: Reiki Volunteer for Hospice

07646.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07646.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07646.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation. And mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some well needed smiles.
07646.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice

07901.description: Reports to: Young Athletes program Coach Time Commitment & Training: This individual must be able to commit to the full duration of the event as scheduled. If unable to commit, please do not select this position. General Description Assist the Program Director in maintaining the flow and integrity of Young Athlete Program. Orientation will be provided on-site day of the event. Duties & Responsibilities Possible positions include: Serve as a Young Athlete escort through the various sport/motor stations Check in athletes and/or volunteers Work specifically with a sport/motor station as directed by Program Director Skills & Qualifications Excellent verbal communication is a must, as well as ensuring professional and friendly service, including the ability to multitask and respond quickly to changes in schedules and plans. Physical Requirements The usual and customary methods of performing the job's functions require the following physical demands: occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling. Generally the job requires 70% walking, 25% standing, and 5% sitting. Must be able to stand and walk the majority of the volunteer shift. Questions regarding this position should be directed to: Amy Simmons | Volunteer Director | volunteer@sonj.org
07901.title: Special Olympics New Jersey - Young Athlete Program Summit

07901.description: We are currently seeking a club facilitator for the Girls Who Code Club in Summit, NJ . Girls Who Code Clubs is an after school/weekend program providing access to computer science education for 6th-12th grade girls nationwide. You will team up with another coach to support the girls. Why Volunteer? Expose girls to a comprehensive and unique CS education Empower young women in CS and help transform tech into a better, more inclusive industry Develop powerful leadership skills while positively impacting your community Interact with large tech companies and industry leaders through field trips and guest speakers Join a community of professionals and students who share your passion for gender parity Qualifications: Proficient in at least one backend programming language. Immediate knowledge of data structures and algorithms. Some experience working with youth preferred but not required. Ability to pass a background screening. Commitment to volunteer 2-3 hours a week. Apply at https://girlswhocode.com/volunteer/
07901.title: Girls Who Code Coach- Weekends

07901.description: JerseySTEM is seeking somebody to help create a amateur/ham radio program for kids in the area. Will also prepare a curriculum. JerseySTEM is a network co-op of parents, professionals, students and educators whose goal is to promote excellence in Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (\"STEM\") education. We are dedicated to partnering with local schools and other organizations to create and enhance STEM-oriented educational opportunities as part of students' paths towards college and career readiness, and to develop effective STEM programs and initiatives that engage students and educators. JerseySTEM is also committed to bridging the gender gap in STEM education and sharing STEM-related opportunities with underprivileged students and communities.

07901.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE Become a volunteer in Disaster Cycle Services. Respond to community and larger disasters, support response as a member of a regional task group OPEN TIME DAYS Local response｠- Disaster Action Team (DAT)- on call weekdays, weekends and holidays; allowances can be made to account for volunteers' work schedules.｠Three shifts a month required. Regional and state deployment - requires｠a minimum of｠one week. Deployment outside of NJ｠- requires a minimum of two weeks Regional Task Group｠- attend meetings as scheduled and work with the group as needed REQUIRED TRAINING Orientation to the American Red Cross is required. Disaster training is required, provided free of charge and is web-based and/or instructor-led in a classroom.｠ Initial basic courses include: Disaster Services: An Overview Disaster Action Team Fundamentals Shelter Fundamentals Feeding Fundamentals Casework and Recovery Planning Fundamentals Disaster Assessment Fundamentals Other courses are required for specific response roles.｠
07901.title: Respond to disasters: Disaster Responder Trainee
07901.org: American Red Cross - New Jersey Region

If you want to participate on the team for creating exercise documents, conducting/controlling/evaluating exercises in our regi OPEN TIME DAYS 3-5 hours per month, plus 6-10 hours per quarter on exercises. Note some exercises may be scheduled during evenings and/or weekends. REQUIRED TRAINING Orientation to American Red Cross  Disaster Services: An Overview Disaster Services Basic Courses (Online) Fundamental Series
07901.title: Join the North Jersey Region's Disaster Exercise Team: Exercise-Evaluation Team: Trainee

07901.description: Are You a caring person looking for a meaningful experience? Do You think you could provide companionship for a patient, such as reading, journaling, playing cards, sharing hobbies, and relieving family members and friends? Do You have a special skill that can be used to provide comfort such as Pet Therapist, Massage Therapist, Beautician, or do you play a musical instrument? Could You support family members by sitting with and providing company to the patient so that the caregiver can take a much-needed break? Kindred Hospice Volunteers provide friendly visits to patients with life-limiting illnesses so they can live out their days as fully and as comfortably as possible. Volunteer work is flexible and based on your availability; we are grateful for as much time as you can give! Currently serving patients wherever they call home in Mercer, Middlesex, Monmouth, Morris, Ocean, Somerset, Ocean & Union Counties. Free screening and training is provided. Please contact Elaine Carlsen, Volunteer Coordinator at Elaine.Carlsen@gentiva.com or call 888-556-8880!
07901.title: Compassionate Visitors Needed in Summit area
07901.org: Kindred Hospice

07901.description: We are looking for mentors to coach talented, motivated Newark and Jersey City area students through their four years at high school. Mentored youth have significantly better chances for high school graduation and college acceptance, thereby significantly increasing life's opportunities. You can make a huge difference in someone's life's outcome!!
07901.title: Mentor an urban high school student - Make a difference for a lifetime!
07901.org: Student/Partner Alliance

07901.description: Work on a team of 2-4 volunteers to respond to 9-1-1 emergency medical calls. Learn to operate an ambulance as well as the equipment carried in it. Provide community education in health and safety topics. All training and uniforms are provided.
07901.title: Emergency Medical Technician
07901.org: Summit Volunteer First Aid Squad

07649.description: Patients on Hospice really appreciate music! Won't you share you gifts and talents with others? Music therapy is beneficial to all persons who have functional deficits in physical, psychological, cognitive or social functioning. Research results and clinical experiences attest to the viability of music therapy even in those who are resistive to other treatment approaches. Music is a form of sensory stimulation, which provokes responses due to the familiarity, predictability, and feelings of security associated with it.
07649.title: Music Therapy for Hospice

07649.description: Ascend Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy for our hospice patients. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation. And mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some well needed smiles.
07649.title: Pet Therapy for Hospice

07649.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers
07649.title: Hospice Volunteer

07869.description: Want to learn new skills, serve your community and help build a house all at the same time? Volunteer at the Morris Habitat ReStore! The Morris Habitat ReStore is a successful retail outlet that provides new and gently-used building materials and home furnishings. Volunteers are vital in keeping the ReStore operating! All proceeds from the ReStore help build decent affordable housing. Volunteer areas are: Administrative Support: General knowledge of computers to help set-up and/or maintain record-keeping files, tracking volunteer hours, answer phones. Good computer skills, including experience with Word and Excel. Warehouse Support: Help with pricing and appraising, floor assistance or furniture repairs ReStore Truck Helper: Assist on our box truck to pick up donations to bring back to the ReStore. Cashier: Ring up customers Customer Service Support: Assist customers shopping with current sales and answer general questions ReStore Collections Team: Research items to determine value, monitoring and updating our store, speaking to potential donors, helping to ship and photograph items. We are also looking for individual subject area experts such as Art, Coins and valuables. Contact Stephanie Sayki for more information Stephanie.sayki@morrishabitat.org
07869.title: ReStore Warehouse Support

07869.description: About our Building Program Our sites are opened to volunteers Monday-Saturday from 8:30am-4pm. All are welcome, no special skills are needed! All we ask for is a smile and a willingness to help. Construction volunteers do everything from pouring footings to roofing and final interior finishes. General Information : 1. We build most Mondays through Saturdays at sites in and around Morris County. Current Active Sites: Dover, Budd Lake, and West Milford. More site starting this Spring. 2. Our construction day is 8:30 AM to 4:00 PM. Unless otherwise advised, volunteers should bring a bag lunch. Lunch is 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM. 3.Construction volunteers must be 16 years of age to be present on an active build site. Youth volunteers ages 16 or 17 years old must be accompanied by an adult chaperone. Chaperones must be 21 years of age. One adult chaperone is required for every 5 youth. What to Expect: 1. A Site Supervisor is in charge of the work and volunteers each work day. 2. All are welcomed-No special skills are needed! 3. All we ask for is a smile and a willingness to help. We will send you home tired, dirty and happy! Contact Stephanie Sayki on how to sign up for a day: Stephanie Sayki-stephanie.sayki@morrishabitat.org
07869.title: General Construction-New Builds and Home Repair

07869.description: Seniors, 55 . The Randolph & Paterson offices of a national organization involved in building homes in partnership with low-income families is looking for volunteers to help in many capacities. Opportunities include: Office assistant, thrift shop (various positions), construction volunteer, committee member, site supervisor, special events/ fundraising, volunteer coordinator. Hours are flexible and vary by job.
07869.title: Help Families Build the Dream of Home Ownership
07869.org: Skylands RSVP & Volunteer Resource Center sponsored by NORWESCAP

07080.description: Contact us for more information on working with hospice patients close to where you live. We provide FREE volunteer training for you along with free TB and Rubella/Rubeola testing. Your pet will need to be a certified pet therapy animal. You and your pet will bring joy and love to the lives of our patients and will receive so much love and joy in return!
07080.title: Share your pet's unconditional love with hospice patients!

07081.description: Trinitas Children's Therapy Services is looking for responsible individuals to volunteer at its Springfield-based outpatient pediatric therapy center. Volunteers would be responsible for assisting therapists during recreation and therapeutic programs, organizing and cleaning materials and equipment and possibly performing a few light office duties (chart organization, filing, etc.). This is an excellent opportunity for high school or college students interested in allied health professions to gain valuable experience and obtain required observational hours or for any individuals who want to help kids succeed in life. Trinitas Children's Therapy Services is an affiliate of Trinitas Regional Medical Center and a leading provider of school and center based occupational, physical and speech therapy services for children of all ages. Our Springfield office hours are 8:00 AM - 8:00 PM Monday through Friday. Recreation programs (when volunteers are most needed) tend to run after school and in the early evenings.
07081.title: Children's Therapy Service

07083.description: Girls on the Run is also looking for coaches! Imagine the satisfaction and reward of helping not just one girl but 15 gain a stronger sense of identity, greater self-acceptance, a healthier body, and an understanding of what it means to be part of a team in just a couple of hours a week. Coaches are provided with training, a comprehensive, well-researched curriculum, and teaching materials that are being used by Girls On The Run in communities around the nation. Our coaches come from a wide variety of backgrounds: parents, teachers, guidance counselors, and other community members who value health and physical fitness. We inspire girls to be joyful, healthy and confident using a fun, experience-based curriculum which creatively integrates running. Our teams meet twice a week for ten weeks in the fall and spring. With almost 100 sites in Burlington, Essex, Mercer, Morris, and Union counties, you're sure to find an opportunity in your area. Our fall season kicks off the second week of September. Email gabrielle@girlsontherunnj.org for more information about how to get involved. No running or coaching experience is required! You can follow Girls on the Run on Facebook at www.facebook.com/GOTRNJ
07083.title: Girls on the Run New Jersey East is looking for coaches!
07083.org: Girls on the Run of New Jersey East

07083.description: The Theater Project is currently interviewing candidates for its board of trustees. We are looking for those who believe in the power of live theater and its' ability to awaken thought and evoke passion. If you'd like to contribute to the growth of a very successful professional company, we are seeking board members who can help us to diversify and fund raise.
07083.title: Board members - The Theater Project is committed to an inclusive hiring and volunteer recruitment po

07083.description: requires organized individuals who can adopt one of our many outreach programs and work through email, telephone, and with other volunteers to promote and advertise events such as YOUNG PLAYWRIGHTS COMPETITION, BILINGUAL CHILDREN'S PRESENTATIONS, audio described programming for the blind and events focused on audience development and fund raising
07083.title: project managers for theater -The Theater Project is committed to an inclusive hiring and volunteer

07086.description: Protect our environment and the special world in which we live. Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New Jersey citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Together we can protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. Want to know more? Please join our weekly Introductory Conference Call. The next one is on Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. It is a live call, about an hour long, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. Please register for the call at this link so that we can follow up with you: https://citizensclimatelobby.org/join-weekly-intro-call/ We look forward to working with you!
07086.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Weehawken NJ

07086.description: Do you have wisdom to share? Are you 60 or better and enjoy offering guidance to younger generations? Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the Elder Wisdom Circle has more than 600 Elders (aged 60 to 105) across North America. The EWC program and our Elders have been featured on ABC, BBC, CBS, FOX, NPR and in such publications as Glamour, the LA Times, Ladies Home Journal, Real Simple, Time & USA Today. We are one of the largest providers of personal advice, with hundreds of thousands of readers. We are looking for seniors in your area to help expand our national reach. Please visit our site at www.ElderWisdomCircle.org and then the 'Offer Advice' tab on the top of the homepage. All advice providers must be 60 or better, no exceptions. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
07086.title: Union City>>>Advice Counselor

07087.description: Use your skills to help the immigrant community and experience the joy of helping someone change their life. We are looking for committed volunteers to teach Spanish speaking students. Volunteers teach one, three-hour class a week for ten weeks. All classes are on Sundays. Previous teaching experience is not necessary, but commitment, ability and a desire to teach are key. Our teachers have included those with experience, those undergoing teacher training and those who have no experience at all. Some classes require Spanish speakers, but some do not. Comite En Union para Salvadorenos (CEUS) is a 501 (c)3 non-profit organization based in Union City, NJ that was founded by Central American refugees to help immigrants create a better life for themselves. The classes are now offered at Centro Comunitario CEUS, our community center 15 minutes from Manhattan. Our website is www.ceusnj.org. CEUS has organized ESL classes for 23 years.
07087.title: Teach English to immigrants - change your world and theirs!

11726.description: From time to time we need volunteers to assist with mailings - folding letters, stuffing envelopes and labeling envelopes.
11726.title: Office Work

11726.description: BBCC a 501c3 serving patients affected by breast and gynecological cancers in Babylon Township is looking for volunteers to help us update our contact database.
11726.title: Data Entry

11726.description: Volunteer to be on a committee such as our annual Chefs for A Cause fundraiser being held at the Venetian Yacht Club, our annual Golf Outing our perhaps our Bowling event. Several opportunities available. Duties can be varied: PR, decorating, raffle/giveaways,program, liason with restaurants/distributors. Also looking for someone who can type, and a photographer is always needed.
11726.title: Fund raising committee

10075.description: We are always looking for new volunteers to join our NYC chapter of the Action Corps. This is a rewarding volunteer opportunity that allows the individuals to cultivate their leadership skills and creativity, all while fighting global poverty and hunger. Action Corps is a national, volunteer-led, grassroots effort to fight poverty, hunger, and injustice around the world. We make it our mission to educate the community on global campaigns and initiatives that many times are life changing to those with a voice. We have worked on the Green Climate Fund, the refugee crisis, American poultry works, women cocoa farmers, food aid reform, and many many others. We table at local events and concerts, plan our own events, and send communications and requests to legislators and corporations insisting upon better practices and reform. We’re not a stiff group; we try to have fun, but still take our work and efforts very seriously.
10075.title: Volunteer with Action Corps NYC

08861.description: Assists in meeting the nutritional needs of hospitalized pateints by providing social interaction during mealtime and feeding those patients unable to feed themselves. To set up dietary trays for patients. Visits patients. To help with opening food packages, pouring liquids, and cutting food. Keep a patient feeding log.
08861.title: Golden Spoon: Assist staff with patient feeding

08861.description: Volunteer will manage the inventory of in-kind donations, assemble and organize activity packets, puzzle packets and other items used for distribution to patients, and maintain the donation database. Volunteer will also assist with patient experience initiatives as needed.
08861.title: In-Kind Donation Assistant Volunteer

08861.description: Provide comfort to families in the surgical waiting room. Answer telephone in waiting area to assist with communication for patients and guest/family/doctors/staff. Set up beverage and light snack service cart for waiting families. Maintain waiting area. Be warm helpful, warm and understanding to waiting families.
08861.title: Surgical Waiting Area Volunteer

08861.description: Provide comfort to families in the surgical waiting room. Answer telephone in waiting area to assist with communication for patients and guest/family/doctors/staff. Set up beverage and light snack service cart for waiting families. Maintain waiting area. Be warm helpful, warm and understanding to waiting families.
08861.title: Surgical Waiting Area Volunteer

08861.description: Visits patients on all nursing units to offer reading material. Bring reading materials to outpatient waiting areas.
08861.title: Book Cart Volunteer

08861.description: Volunter will provide clerical support for designated departments. Task include; answering telephones, filing, sorting, copying, faxing, data entry and other clerical task as needed.
08861.title: Clerical Assistant Volunteer

08861.description: Assists staff by running errands. Volunteers deliver various items throughout the medical center. For example, inter-departmental mail, pharmacy orders, lab orders, drop off mail to departments outside of the medical center, charts, flowers and gifts, medical records, and patient supplies.
08861.title: Volunteer Courier

08861.description: The ED Liaison will provide rounding and facilitate communication between patients and providers in the emergency department acting as a customer service liaison between emergency department staff and patients. The ED Liaison communicates with patients about the patient care process and addresses any needs or concerns that patients or families may have during their stay providing information about wait times, delays, or directions within the facility.
08861.title: Emergency Department Patient Liaison

08861.description: M.A.C. Mobile Activity Cart volunteers will round the medical center visiting waiting areas, the emergency room and Pediatrics department to offer activity packets to youth guest making their wait time in the clinical areas easier. (M.A.C.) Mobile Activity Cart rounds may last 1-3 hours depending on patient/guest volume.
08861.title: Mobile Activity Cart M.A.C Volunteer

08861.description: The Hospitality Specialist will provide excellent customer service to patients and guest to ensure that all guest are comfortable and answer any questions they may have. Centrally located on the concourse the specialist will addresses any needs or concerns that guest or their families may have during their visit or redirect them to the proper department. The specialist will provide directions, escort guest to their destination, serve as a liaison to fulfill request from staff (in patient care areas) for patients (i.e.... books, newspapers, bibles, magazines, activity packs etc.)and provide service that exceeds the guest expectations.
08861.title: Hospitaltiy Specialist

08861.description: Provide rounding on out-patient waiting areas to serve as a point of contact, and act as the medical centers eyes and ears to ensure that all guest are comfortable and answer any questions visitors may have. The specialist will facilitate communication between out-patient guest and the department they are receiving services from. The specialist will addresses any needs or concerns that guest or their families may have during their visit providing information about wait times, delays, and directions within the facility.
08861.title: Service Excellence Specialist

08861.description: Visits patient floors and spends time with patients deemed either a falls risk, or in need of a little extra TLC. Bedside Buddies can service all designated in-patient adult areas (they are not stationed in one place) and carry a \"buddy kit\" stocked with games they can play with the patient, small projects, or simply to sit and chat for a while.
08861.title: Bedside Buddy Patient Visitor

08861.description: To provide patients the opportunity to interact with trained and certified dogs during their hospitalization to improve thieir emotional and social status.
08861.title: Pet Therapy (Perth Amboy)

08861.description: To welcome medical center visitors (outpatient) and provide directions and/or personally escort visitors to their destinations. To reinforce the medical centers misson to provide exceptional customer service.
08861.title: Medical Center Greeter

08861.description: A patient with a terminal illness could benefit from compassionate visits from a Spanish speaking visitor. Visits can be scheduled according to your availabilty and are usually 1-2 hours in length once a week. Become a part of the Kindred Hospice team; a very special group of compassionate people who dedicate their time to a truly noble cause. Free training is provided. Contact Elaine.Carlsen@gentiva.com or call 888-556-8880 today.
08861.title: Spanish Speaking Visitor Needed

08861.description: Catholic Charities Connections Program is actively recruiting volunteers to work as mentors with children ages 5-17. Mentors offer support, guidance, and education as a youth goes through a difficult time, faces new challenges or opportunities, or takes on an important task. A mentor is a person who is willing to share their life-long expertise to provide support to the youth. Mentors can play an important role as the youth develops mentally and emotionally to help a youth understand their goals and personal needs. Mentors must be a minimum of 18 years of age. Prospective mentors will undergo an intensive screening process consisting of: application and informal autobiography, personal interview, reference checks, criminal background check, driving record check and program orientation. The program serves youth in Middlesex County. Mentoring is the process of sharing personal knowledge and skills with a young person.
08861.title: Mentor Disadvantaged Youth

Members of the Elder Wisdom Circle are seniors who share their wisdom with young advice seekers from across the world. Via the Internet, Elders answer advice requests at their own convenience, offering young readers personalized and free advice on a wide range of topics - love and relationships, family and child-rearing, career and self-improvement, and more. Volunteers must complete an application and screening process.
07308.title: Jersey City Area>>>>>Advice Counselor

08904.description: Churches Accomplishing Long-Term Recovery (CALTR) is currently doing Sandy restoration work in upper Monmouth County, NJ. We welcome skilled and unskilled as well as those who are unemployed/underemployed. This is a great way to share your skills or to mentor those who are learning (and a great way to pick up new skill sets). Availability during weekdays is helpful. Our Project Manager is at the shore Mondays, Tuesdays and Wednesdays. You can meet us at the church in Highland Park or at the work site. 18 and older preferred, though we do special occasional Days of Service where youth groups are welcome. We also do occasional Saturdays for groups who cannot do weekdays.
08904.title: SuperStorm Sandy Rebuilding at the Jersey Shore
08904.org: CLASSIS OF NEW BRUNSWICK COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION

08904.description: We are looking for volunteers to help us distribute fresh produce to those in need this summer, as well as volunteers to help us pick up food deliveries in New Brunswick, stock our shelves, and take part in our regular distributions of non-perishable foods. There are lots of ways you can help -- even if you just have just an hour a month to give. Contact us or learn more on our website: http://sites.google.com/site/hpfoodpantry/ Volunteers are needed on Tuesday mornings, Wednesday mornings and evenings, Thursday mornings, Thursday evenings, Friday late afternoons, and Saturday mornings. Mostly we prefer volunteers who will commit to a regular schedule of volunteering at the same time every month, but one-time or occasional volunteers are allowed on Wednesday evenings and Friday afternoons. Wednesday evenings are the only time that we can allow volunteers who are younger than 18. It's a great group of people -- come lend a hand and meet some of them!
08904.title: Highland Park Food Pantry

08901.description: Reports to: Young Athletes program Coach Time Commitment & Training: This individual must be able to commit to the full duration of the event as scheduled. If unable to commit, please do not select this position. General Description Assist the Program Director in maintaining the flow and integrity of Young Athlete Program. Orientation will be provided on-site day of the event. Duties & Responsibilities Possible positions include: Serve as a Young Athlete escort through the various sport/motor stations Check in athletes and/or volunteers Work specifically with a sport/motor station as directed by Program Director Skills & Qualifications Excellent verbal communication is a must, as well as ensuring professional and friendly service, including the ability to multitask and respond quickly to changes in schedules and plans. Physical Requirements The usual and customary methods of performing the job's functions require the following physical demands: occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling. Generally the job requires 70% walking, 25% standing, and 5% sitting. Must be able to stand and walk the majority of the volunteer shift. Questions regarding this position should be directed to: Amy Simmons | Volunteer Director | volunteer@sonj.org
08901.title: Special Olympics New Jersey - Young Athlete Program New Brunswick

08901.description: Become a Spring Seasons of Service Project Coordinator with Jersey Cares this April! Come participate in a 10-week leadership program and build your leadership, communication and project management skills. Project Coordinators (PC's), volunteer in a leadership capacity at our volunteer opportunities and provide organization and a team atmosphere for every volunteer experience. Typical PC responsibilities include learning about Jersey Cares partner agencies and their volunteer project, coordinating project activities with Jersey Cares staff and participating volunteers, providing direction necessary to complete project activities at the site, communicating with stakeholders about the successes and/or challenges of the project, working with Jersey Cares staff, other PCs, volunteers and partner agencies to further develop relationships and to ensure success on future projects and maintaining volunteer information on the Jersey Cares web-based database. READ MORE: https://www.jerseycares.org/JC_Project_Coordinator SIGN UP HERE: https://www.jerseycares.org/HOC__Volunteer_Opportunity_Details_Page?id=a0CA000000n5sjXMAQ Contact: Gabriella Fernandes Programs Manager, Leadership Development Gabriella@jerseycares.org (973) 533-1993, ext. 20
08901.title: Spring Season of Service - Be a Leader

08901.description: Every year more than half a million abused and neglected children are in need of safe, permanent, nurturing homes. Too many spend years moving from one temporary home to another. They have no family to call their own. They are more likely than other children to face homelessness, unemployment, even prison as adults. That's why CASA (Court Appointed Special Advocates) is important. CASA was created to make sure the abuse and neglect these children originally suffered in the home doesn't continue as abuse and neglect at the hands of the system. As trained advocates, CASA volunteers get to know children in foster care and talk with their caregivers, schools, therapists, and other professionals, in order to gather information about their wellbeing and advocate for them in court. CASA volunteers advocate for the appropriate services to be offered to the children and their families and assist the Court in determining the appropriate permanent plan for each child. No special skills are required and you will receive all the training you need through CASA for Children in Middlesex County. Please note that we primarily serve children originating from Middlesex County, New Jersey, and that travel to other counties is possible.
08901.title: Stand Up for a Child in Need!

We encourage these exceptional community leaders to make a commitment at one specific program usually once or twice monthly for the span of six months. 08901.description: Reach Your Potential USA is starting a new program which will work to reduce biases and discrimination against individuals with disabilities in the workplace. The program will involve providing businesses throughout New Jersey with training and resources to make their employees more aware of what is like to live with various types of disabilities and how to be more welcoming to employees with disabilities. We are seeking volunteers to assist with developing and running the program. Volunteers must have access to reliable transportation and be willing to attend meetings in New Brunswick, NJ.
08901.title: Volunteers needed for Disability Awareness Program in NJ

08901.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New Jersey citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
08901.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Central NJ

Volunteering just six hours per week will earn you a 25% discount on all products the Co-op sells. We'll schedule a shift time which fits your needs while still benefiting the Co-op. 08901.description: To offer 1:1 assistance to boys and girls ages 3-10 years old who are participating in an adapted swim program. You do not need any special training or certification. You must be 15 years old to volunteer.

08901.description: Catholic Charities Connections Program is actively recruiting volunteers to work as mentors with children ages 5-17. Mentors offer support, guidance, and education as a youth goes through a difficult time, faces new challenges or opportunities, or takes on an important task. A mentor is a person who is willing to share their life-long expertise to provide support to the youth. Mentors can play an important role as the youth develops mentally and emotionally to help a youth understand their goals and personal needs. Mentors must be a minimum of 18 years of age. Prospective mentors will undergo an intensive screening process consisting of: application and informal autobiography, personal interview, reference checks, criminal background check, driving record check and program orientation. The program serves youth in Middlesex County. Mentoring is the process of sharing personal knowledge and skills with a young person.
08901.title: Adult Mentoring

08903.description: Child Placement Review Boards review children that have been placed in out of home placements such as foster care or residential placements due to an abuse and neglect case that has been filed againt one or both parents. The boards receive information from the Department of Child Protection and Permanency fomerly the division of Youth and Family Services With the reading material and meeting with Foster parents, parents and any other interested parties they collectively make recommendations to the Judge as to what is best for the child. The recommendation is very helpful to the Judge in proceeding with the case and has an important impact on the families.
08903.title: Assist children in out of home placements become a Child Placement Review Board Volunteer
08903.org: Superior Court New Jersey Middlesex Vicinage

08903.description: Juvenile Conference Committee Superior Court of NJ Middlesex County is seeking volunteers to become members of the the Juvenile Conference Committee. The Juvenile Conference Committee meets in the evening once a month. We would like citizens from the community to sit on this board as volunteers and help guide the children. They make recommendations to the Judge as to how the complaint should be handled within the community. The goals are to involve community members in the court process and to prevent young offenders from future delinquency. Child Placement Review Board Superior Court of NJ is seeking Middlesex County Residents to volunteers and become members of the Child Placement Review Board. There are two 45 day review boards located at 120 New Street in New Brunswick, Family Court House. Residents of Middlesex will monitor the cases of all children who are placed outside their home by the Division of Youth & Family Services. Review case files, discuss cases with team, and make recommendations. Division of Youth and Family Services (DFYS) workers are at the meetings to clarify any questions pertaining to the cases. The Volunteers in Probation Program is staffed with volunteers from the community who mentor adults on probation. Each volunteer will be assigned to supervise an adult on probation. You will meet once a week with the probationer to make sure they are fulfilling the requirements of their probation & to maintain regular contact with the supervising probation officer. Volunteers address issues in the court order that include employment,education and counseling. Only probationers with minor or non-violent offenses are allowed to participate in the program .
08903.title: VOLUNTEERS MAKE A DIFFERENCE
08903.org: Superior Court New Jersey Middlesex Vicinage
